text: Verily the lightning could snatch away their eyes. When it flashes forth they walk in its flare. When darkness returns they stand still. And if the Lord wills so He could take away their hearing and sight; surely God is all-powerful.

column6:

TQA92,QA92,TLQ01,'But you still kill one another, and you turn a section of your people from their homes, assisting one another against them with guilt and oppression. Yet when they are brought to you as captives you ransom them, although forbidden it was to drive them away. Do you, then, believe a part of the Book and reject a part? There is no other award for them who so act but disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement the severest of punishment; for God is not heedless of all that you do.'

TQA95,QA95,TLQ01,And they say: Our hearts are enfolded in covers." In fact God has cursed them for their unbelief; and only a little do they believe.

text: '"We have taken the colouring of God; and whose shade is better than God''s? Him alone we worship."'

text: Or do you claim that Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and their offspring were Jews or Christians? Say: "Have you more knowledge than God?" Who is more wicked than he who conceals the testimony he received from God? God is not unaware of all you do.

text: Those to whom We have sent down the Book know this even as they know their sons. Yet a section among them conceals the truth knowingly.

column5: so be not among those who are sceptics.'

text: Each has a goal to which he turns. So strive towards piety and excel the others: God will bring you all together wheresoever you be. God has power over everything.
Wherever you come from turn towards the Holy Mosque: This in truth is from your Lord. God is not negligent of all you do.
'Whichever place you come from turn towards the Holy Mosque
column5: and wherever you are
column6: turn your faces towards it so that people may have no cause for argument against you
column7: except such among them as are wicked. But do not fear them
column8: fear Me that I may accomplish My favours on you
column9: and you may find the right way perchance.'

text: 'Even as We sent a messenger from among you to convey Our messages to you and cleanse you
column5: and teach you the Book and the wisdom
column6: and what you did not know;'

text: 'So
column5: therefore
column6: remember Me
column7: and I shall remember you; and give thanks and do not be ungrateful.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: seek courage in fortitude and prayer
column6: for God is with those who are patient and persevere.'

text: 'Do not say that those who are killed in the way of God
column5: are dead
column6: for indeed they are alive
column7: even though you are not aware.'

text: 'Be sure We shall try you with something of fear and hunger and loss of wealth and life and the fruits (of your labour); but give tidings of happiness to those who have patience
'Who say when assailed by adversity: "Surely we are for God
column5: and to Him we shall return."'

text: 'On such men are the blessings of God and His mercy
column5: for they are indeed on the right path.'

text: 'Truly Safa and Marwa are the symbols of God. Whoever goes on pilgrimage to the House (of God)
column5: or on a holy visit
column6: is not guilty of wrong if he walk around them; and he who does good of his own accord will find appreciation with God who knows everything.'

text: 'They who conceal Our signs and the guidance We have sent them and have made clear in the Book
column5: are condemned of God and are condemned by those who are worthy of condemning.'

text: 'But those who repent and reform and proclaim (the truth)
column5: are forgiven
column6: for I am forgiving and merciful.'

text: 'But those who deny
column5: and die disbelieving
column6: bear the condemnation of God and the angels and that of all men

text: 'Under which they will live
column5: and their suffering will neither decrease nor be respite for them.'

text: 'Your God is one God; there is no god other than He
column5: the compassionate
column6: ever-merciful.'

text: 'Creation of the heavens and the earth
column5: alternation of night and day
column6: and sailing of ships across the ocean with what is useful to man
column7: and the rain that God sends from the sky enlivening the earth that was dead
column8: and the scattering of beasts of all kinds upon it
column9: and the changing of the winds
column10: and the clouds which remain obedient between earth and sky
column11: are surely signs for the wise.'

text: 'And yet there are men who take others as compeers of God
column5: and bestow on them love due to God; but the love of the faithful for God is more intense. If only the wicked could see now the agony that they will behold (on the Day of Resurrection)
column6: they will know that to God belongs the power entirely''. And the punishment of God is severe.'

text: 'When those who were followed will disclaim those who followed them
column5: and see the torment all ties between them shall be severed

text: 'And the followers will say: "Could we live but once again we would leave them as they have abandoned us now." God will show them thus their deeds
column5: and fill them with remorse; but never shall they find release from the Fire.'

text: 'O men
column5: eat only the things of the earth that are lawful and good. Do not walk in the footsteps of Satan
column6: your acknowledged enemy.'

text: 'He will ask you to indulge in evil
column5: indecency
column6: and to speak lies of God you cannot even conceive.'

text: 'When it is said to them: "Follow what God has revealed
column5: they reply: No
column6: we shall follow only what our fathers had practiced
column7:
-- even though their fathers had no wisdom or guidance!'
TQA178,QA178,TLQ01,'The semblance of the infidels is that of a man who shouts to one that cannot hear more than a call and a cry. They are deaf, dumb and blind, and they fail to understand.'
TQA179,QA179,TLQ01,'O believers, eat what is good of the food We have given you, and be grateful to God, if indeed you are obedient to Him.'
TQA180,QA180,TLQ01,'Forbidden to you are carrion and blood, and the flesh of the swine, and that which has been consecrated (or killed) in the name of any other than God. If one is obliged by necessity to eat it without intending to transgress, or reverting to it, he is not guilty of sin; for God is forgiving and kind.'
TQA181,QA181,TLQ01,'Those who conceal any part of the Scriptures that God has revealed, and thus make a little profit thereby, take nothing but fire as food; and God will not turn to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor nourish them for growth; and their doom will be painful.'
TQA182,QA182,TLQ01,'They are those who bartered away good guidance for error, and pardon for punishment: How great is their striving for the Fire'
TQA183,QA183,TLQ01,That is because God has revealed the Book containing the truth; but those who are at variance about it have gone astray in their contrariness.
TQA184,QA184,TLQ01,'Piety does not lie in turning your face to East or West: Piety lies in believing in God, the Last Day and the angels, the Scriptures and the prophets, and disbursing your wealth out of love for God among your kin and the orphans, the wayfarers and mendicants, freeing the slaves, observing your devotional obligations, and in paying the zakat and fulfilling a pledge you have given, and being patient in hardship, adversity, and times of peril. These are the men who affirm the truth, and they are those who follow the straight path.'
TQA185,QA185,TLQ01,'O believers, ordained for you is retribution for the murdered, (whether) a free man (is guilty) of (the murder of) a free man, or a slave of a slave, or a woman of a woman. But he who is pardoned some of it by his brother should be dealt with equity, and recompense (for blood) paid with a grace. This is a concession from your Lord and a kindness. He who transgresses in spite of it shall suffer painful punishment.'
TQA186,QA186,TLQ01,'In retribution there is life (and preservation). O men of sense, you may haply take heed for yourselves.'
TQA187,QA187,TLQ01,'It is ordained that when any one of you nears death, and he owns goods and chattels, he should bequeath them equitably to his parents and next of kin. This is binding on those who are upright and fear God.'
TQA188,QA188,TLQ01,'And any one who changes the will, having heard it, shall be guilty and accountable; for God hears all and knows everything.'
TQA189,QA189,TLQ01,'He who suspects wrong or partiality on the part of the testator and brings about a settlement, does not incure any guilt, for God is verily forgiving and merciful.'
TQA190,QA190,TLQ01,'O believers, fasting is enjoined on you as it was on those before you, so that you might become righteous.'
TQA191,QA191,TLQ01,'Fast a (fixed) number of days, but if someone is ill or is travelling (he should complete) the number of days (he had missed); and those who find it hard to fast should expiate by feeding a poor person. For the good they do with a little hardship is better for men. And if you fast it is good for you, if you knew.'
TQA192,QA192,TLQ01,'Ramadan is the month in which the Qur''an was revealed as guidance to man and clear proof of the guidance, and criterion (of falsehood and truth). So when you see the new moon you should fast the whole month; but a person who is ill or travelling (and fails to do so) should fast on other days, as God wishes ease and not hardship for you, so that you complete the (fixed) number (of fasts), and give glory to God for the guidance, and be grateful.'
TQA193,QA193,TLQ01,'When My devotees enquire of you about Me, I am near, and answer the call of every supplicant when he calls. It behoves them to hearken to Me and believe in Me that they may follow the right path.'
TQA194,QA194,TLQ01,'You are allowed to sleep with your wives on the nights of the fast: They are your dress as you are theirs. God is aware you were cheating yourselves, so He turned to you and pardoned you. So now you may have intercourse with them, and seek what God has ordained for you. Eat and drink until the white thread of dawn appears clear from the dark line, then fast until the night falls; and abstain from your wives (when you have decided) to stay in the mosques for assiduous devotion. These are the bounds fixed by God, so keep well within them. So does God make His signs clear to men that they may take heed for themselves.'
TQA195,QA195,TLQ01,'And do not consume each other''s wealth in vain, nor offer it to men in authority with intent of usurping unlawfully and knowingly a part of the wealth of others.'
TQA196,QA196,TLQ01,'They ask you of the new moons. Say: These are periods set for men (to reckon) time
column8: and for pilgrimage." Piety does not lie in entering the house through the back door
column9: for the pious man is he who follows the straight path. Enter the house through the main gate
column10: and obey God. You may haply find success.'

text: 'Fight those in the way of God who fight you
column5: but do not be aggressive: God does not like aggressors.'

text: 'And fight those (who fight you) wheresoever you find them
column5: and expel them from the place they had turned you out from. Oppression is worse than killing. Do not fight them by the Holy Mosque unless they fight you there. If they do
column6: then slay them: Such is the requital for unbelievers.'

text: 'But if they desist
column5: God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Fight them till sedition comes to end
column5: and the law of God (prevails). If they desist
column6: then cease to be hostile
column7: except against those who oppress.'

text: '(Fighting during) the holy month (if the sanctity) of the holy month (is violated) is (just) retribution. So if you are oppressed
column5: oppress those who oppress you to the same degree
column6: and fear God
column7: and know that God is with those who are pious and follow the right path.'

text: 'Spend in the way of God
column5: and do not seek destruction at your own hands. So do good for God loves those who do good.'

text: 'Perform the pilgrimage and holy visit (''Umra
column5: to Makkah) in the service of God. But if you are prevented
column6: send an offering which you can afford as sacrifice
column7: and do not shave your heads until the offering has reached the place of sacrifice. But if you are sick or have ailment of the scalp (preventing the shaving of hair)
column8: then offer expiation by fasting or else giving alms or a sacrificial offering. When you have security
column9: then those of you who wish to perform the holy visit along with the pilgrimage
column10: should make a sacrifice according to their means. But he who has nothing
column11: should fast for three days during the pilgrimage and seven on return
column12: completing ten. This applies to him whose family does not live near the Holy Mosque. Have fear of God
column13: and remember that God is severe in punishment.'

text: 'Known are the months of pilgrimage. If one resolves to perform the pilgrimage in these months
column5: let him not indulge in concupiscence
column6: sin or quarrel. And the good you do shall be known to God. Provide for the journey
column7: and the best of provisions is piety. O men of understanding
column8: obey Me.'

text: 'It is no sin to seek the favours of your Lord (by trading). When you start from ''Arafat in a concourse
column5: remember God at the monument that is sacred (al-Mash''ar al-haram)
column6: and remember Him as He has shown you the way
column7: for in the olden days you we''re a people astray.'

text: 'Then move with the crowd impetuously
column5: and pray God to forgive you your sins. God is surely forgiving and kind.'

text: 'When you have finished the rites and ceremonies
column5: remember God as you do your fathers
column6: in fact with a greater devotion. There are some who say: "Give us
column7: O Lord
column8: in the world;" but they will forego their share in the life to come.'

text: 'But some there are who pray: "Give us of good in the world
column5: O Lord
column6: and give us of good in the life to come
column7: and suffer us not to suffer the torment of Hell."'

text: They are those who will surely have their share of whatsoever they have earned; for God is swift at the reckoning.
'Remember God during the stated days; but if a person comes away after two days
column5: it will not be a sin; and if one tarries
column6: he will not transgress
column7: if he keep away from evil. Follow the law of God
column8: and remember that you will have to gather before Him in the end.'

text: 'There is a man who talks well of the world to your pleasing
column5: and makes God witness to what is in his heart
column6: yet he is the most contentious;'

text: 'For when his back is turned he goes about spreading disorder in the land
column5: destroying fields and flocks; but God does not love disorder.'

text: 'Whenever he is told: "Obey God
column5:
his arrogance leads him to more sin; and sufficient for him shall be Hell: How evil a place of wide expanse!'
TQA214,QA214,TLQ01,And there is a man who is willing to sell even his soul to win the favour of God; and God is compassionate to His creatures.
TQA215,QA215,TLQ01,'O believers, come to full submission to God. Do not follow in the footsteps of Satan your acknowledged foe.'
TQA216,QA216,TLQ01,'If you falter even after Our signs have reached you, then do not forget that God is all-powerful and all-wise.'
TQA217,QA217,TLQ01,'Are they waiting for God to appear in the balconies of clouds with a host of angels, and the matter to be settled? But all things rest with God in the end.'
TQA218,QA218,TLQ01,'Ask the children of Israel how many a clear sign We had given them. But if one changes the favour of God after having received it, then remember, God is severe in revenge.'
TQA219,QA219,TLQ01,'Enamoured are the unbelievers of the life of this world, and scoff at the faithful. But those who keep from evil and follow the straight path will have a higher place than they on the Day of Reckoning; for God gives in measure without number whomsoever He will.'
TQA220,QA220,TLQ01,'Men belonged to a single community, and God sent them messengers to give them happy tidings and warnings, and sent the Book with them containing the truth to judge between them in matters of dispute; but only those who received it differed after receiving clear proofs, on account of waywardness (and jealousies) among them. Then God by His dispensation showed those who believed the way to the truth about which they were differing; for God shows whom He please the path that is straight.'
TQA221,QA221,TLQ01,'Do you think you will find your way to Paradise even though you have not known what the others before you have gone through? They had suffered affliction and loss, and were shaken and tossed about so that even the Apostle had to cry out with his followers: When will the help of God arrive?" Remember
column6: the help of God is ever at hand.'

text: 'They ask you of what they should give in charity. Tell them: "What you can spare of your wealth as should benefit the parents
column5: the relatives
column6: the orphans
column7: the needy
column8: the wayfarers
column9: for God is not unaware of the good deeds that you do."'

text: 'Enjoined on you is fighting
column5: and this you abhor. You may dislike a thing yet it may be good for you; or a thing may haply please you but may be bad for you. Only God has knowledge
column6: and you do not know.'

text: 'They ask you of war in the holy month. Tell them: "To fight in that month is a great sin. But a greater sin in the eyes of God is to hinder people from the way of God
column5: and not to believe in Him
column6: and to bar access to the Holy Mosque and turn people out of its precincts; and oppression is worse than killing. They will always seek war against you till they turn you away from your faith
column7: if they can. But those of you who turn back on their faith and die disbelieving will have wasted their deeds in this world and the next. They are inmates of Hell
column8: and shall there abide for ever.'

text: 'Surely those who believe
column5: and those who leave their homes and fight in the way of God
column6: may hope for His benevolence
column7: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'They ask you of (intoxicants
column5: ) wine and gambling. Tell them: "There is great enervation though profit in them for men; but their enervation is greater than benefit. And they ask you what they should give. Tell them: "The utmost you can spare." So does God reveal His signs: You may haply reflect'

text: 'On this world and the next. And they ask you about the orphans. Tell them: "Improving their lot is much better; and if you take interest in their affairs
column5: they are your brethren; and God is aware who are corrupt and who are honest; and if He had pleased He could surely have imposed on you hardship
column6: for God is all-powerful and all-wise.'

text: 'Do not marry idolatrous women unless they join the faith. A maid servant who is a believer is better than an idolatress even though you may like her. And do not marry your daughters to idolaters until they accept the faith. A servant who is a believer is better than an idolater even though you may like him. They invite you to Hell
column5: but God calls you to Paradise and pardon by His grace. And He makes His signs manifest that men may haply take heed.'

text: 'They ask you about menstruation. Tell them: "This is a period of stress. So keep away from women in this state till they are relieved of it. When they are free of it
column5: you may go to them as God has enjoined. For God loves those who seek pardon
column6: and those who are clean."'

text: 'Women are like fields for you; so seed them as you intend
column5: but plan the future in advance. And fear God
column6: and remember
column7: you have to face Him in the end. So convey glad tidings to those who believe.'

text: 'Do not implicate God in your oaths to avoid doing good and being pious and keeping peace among men
column5: for God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'God will not call you to account for that which is senseless in your oaths
column5: but only for what is in your hearts; for God is forgiving and forbearing.'

text: 'Those who swear to keep away from their wives (with intent of divorcing them) have four months of grace; then if they reconcile (during this period)
column5: surely God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'And if they are bent on divorce
column5: God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'Women who are divorced have to wait for three monthly periods
column5: and if they believe in God and the Last Day they must not hide unlawfully what God has formed within their wombs. Their husbands would do well to take them back in that case
column6: if they wish to be reconciled. Women also have recognised rights as men have
column7: though men have an edge over them. But God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'Divorce is (revokable) two times (after pronouncement)
column5: after which (there are two ways open for husbands)
column6: either (to) keep (the wives) honourably
column7: or part with them in a decent way. You are not allowed to take away the least of what you have given your wives
column8: unless both of you fear that you would not be able to keep within the limits set by God. If you fear you cannot maintain the bounds fixed by God
column9: there will be no blame on either if the woman redeems herself. Do not exceed the limits of God
column10: for those who exceed the bounds set by God are transgressors.'

text: 'If a man divorces her again (a third time)
column5: she becomes unlawful for him (and he cannot remarry her) until she has married another man. Then if he divorces her there is no harm if the two unite again if they think they will keep within the bounds set by God and made clear for those who understand.'

text: 'When you have divorced your wives
column5: and they have reached the end of the period of waiting
column6: then keep them honourably (by revoking the divorce)
column7: or let them go with honour
column8: and do not detain them with the intent of harassing lest you should transgress. He who does so will wrong himself. Do not mock the decrees of God
column9: and remember the favours God has bestowed on you
column10: and revealed to you the Book and the Law to warn you of the consequences of doing wrong. Have fear of God
column11: and remember
column12: God is cognisant of everything.'

text: 'When you have divorced your wives and they have completed the fixed term (of waiting)
column5: do not stop them from marrying other men if it is agreed between them honourably. This warning is for those among you who believe in God and the Last Day. This is both proper and right for you
column6: for God knows and you do not know.'

text: 'The mothers should suckle their babies for a period of two years for those (fathers) who wish that they should complete the suckling
column5: in which case they should feed them and clothe them in a befitting way; but no soul should be compelled beyond capacity
column6: neither the mother made to suffer for the child nor the father for his offspring. The same holds good for the heir of the father (if he dies). If they wish to wean the child by mutual consent there is no harm. And if you wish to engage a wet nurse you may do so if you pay her an agreed amount as is customary. But fear God
column7: and remember that God sees all that you do.'

text: 'Wives of men who die among you should wait (after their husbands death) for four months and ten days; and when the term is over there is no sin if they do what they like with themselves honourably
column5: for God is aware of all that you do.'

text: 'There is no harm in proposing in secret to (any of) these women
column5: or keeping the intention to yourself: God is aware that you will keep them in mind. Yet do not make a promise in secret
column6: unless you speak in a manner that is proper; and do not resolve upon marriage till the fixed term of waiting is over. Remember that God knows what is in your hearts; so be fearful of Him
column7: and remember that God is forgiving and forbearing.'

text: 'There is no sin in divorcing your wives before the consummation of marriage or settling the dowry; but then provide adequately for them
column5: the affluent according to their means
column6: the poor in accordance with theirs as is befitting. This is surely the duty of those who do good.'

text: 'And if you divorce them before the consummation of marriage
column5: but after settling the dowry
column6: then half the settled dowry must be paid
column7: unless the woman forgoes it
column8: or the person who holds the bond of marriage pays the full amount. And if the man pays the whole
column9: it is nearer to piety. But do not forget to be good to each other
column10: and remember that God sees all that you do.'

text: 'Be wakeful of your service of prayer
column5: and the midmost service; and honour God by standing before Him in devotion.'

text: 'If you fear (war or danger)
column5: pray while standing or on horseback; but when you have safety again remember God
column6: for He taught you what you did not know.'

text: 'Those among you about to die leaving wives behind
column5: should bequeath a year''s maintenance and lodging for them
column6: without expelling them from home. But if they leave (of their own accord)
column7: you will not be blamed for what they do with themselves in their own rights. God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: Making a fair provision for women who are divorced is the duty of those who are God-fearing and pious.
So does God pronounce His decrees that you may understand.
'Have you never thought of men who went out of their homes as a measure of safety against death
column5: and they were thousands
column6: to whom God said: "Die
column7:
then restored them to life? Indeed God bestows His blessings on men; only most men are not grateful.'
TQA251,QA251,TLQ01,'Fight in the way of God, and remember that God hears all and knows everything.'
TQA252,QA252,TLQ01,'Who will give a goodly loan to God which He might double many times? For God withholds and enlarges, and to Him you will return.'
TQA253,QA253,TLQ01,'Have you thought of the elders of Israel after Moses, and how they said to their apostle: Set up a king for us
column8: then we shall fight in the way of God?" He replied: "This too is possible that when commanded to fight you may not fight at all." They said: "How is it we should not fight in the way of God when we have been driven from our homes and deprived of our Sons?" But when they were ordered to fight they turned away
column9: except for a few; yet God knows the sinners.'

text: 'And when their prophet said to them: "God has raised Saul king over you
column5: they said: How can he be king over us when we have greater right to kingship than he
column6: for he does not even possess abundant wealth?" "God has chosen him in preference to you
column7: said the prophet and given him much more wisdom and prowess; and God gives authority to whomsoever He will: God is infinite and all-wise."'

text: 'Their prophet said to them: "The sign of his kingship will be that you will come to have a heart full of peace and tranquility from your Lord and the legacy left by Moses'' and Aaron''s family supported by angels. This shall be a token for you if you really believe."'
'When Saul led his armies
column5: he said: "God will test you by a stream. Whoever drinks its water will not be of me; but those who do not drink shall be on my side. The only exception will be those who scoop up a palmful of water with their hands." And but for a few they all drank of its water. When they had crossed it
column6: and those who believed with him
column7: they said: "We have no strength to combat Goliath and his forces today. But those who believed they have to face their Lord
column8: said: "Many a time has a small band defeated a large horde by the will of God. God is with those who are patient (and persevere)."'

text: 'And when they were facing Goliath and his hordes they prayed: "O Lord
column5: give us endurance and steady our steps
column6: and help us against the deniers of truth."'

text: 'By the will of God they defeated them
column5: and David killed Goliath
column6: and God gave him kingship and wisdom
column7: and taught him whatsoever He pleased. If God did not make men deter one another this earth would indeed be depraved. But gracious is God to the people of the world.'

text: 'These are the messages of God. We recite them to you in all truth
column5: as indeed you are one of the apostles.'

text: 'Of all these apostles We have favoured some over the others. God has addressed some of them
column5: and the stations of some have been exalted over the others. And to Jesus
column6: son of Mary
column7: We gave tokens
column8: and reinforced him with divine grace. If God had so willed those who came after them would never have contended when clear signs had come to them. But dissensions arose
column9: some believed
column10: some denied. And if God had willed they would never have fought among themselves. But God does whatsoever He please.'

text: 'O believers
column5: expend of what We have given you before the day arrives on which there will be no barter
column6: and no friendship or intercession matter
column7: and those who are disbelievers will be sinners.'

text: 'God: There is no god but He
column5: the living
column6: eternal
column7: self-subsisting
column8: ever sustaining. Neither does somnolence affect Him nor sleep. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth: and who can intercede with Him except by His leave? Known to Him is all that is present before men and what is hidden (in time past and time future)
column9: and not even a little of His knowledge can they grasp except what He will. His seat extends over heavens and the earth
column10: and He tires not protecting them: He alone is all high and supreme.'

text: 'There is no compulsion in matter of faith. Distinct is the way of guidance now from error. He who turns away from the forces of evil and believes in God
column5: will surely hold fast to a handle that is strong and unbreakable
column6: for God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'God is the friend of those who believe
column5: and leads them out of darkness into light; but the patrons of infidels are idols and devils who lead them from light into darkness. They are the residents of Hell
column6: and will there for ever abide.'

text: 'Have you thought of the man who argued with Abraham about his Lord because God had given him a kingdom? When Abraham said: "My Lord is the giver of life and death
column5: he replied: I am the giver of life and death." And Abraham said: "God makes the sun rise from the East; so you make it rise from the West
column6:
and dumbfounded was the infidel. God does not guide those who are unjust.'
TQA266,QA266,TLQ01,'Or take the man who passed by a town which lay destroyed upside down. He said: How can God restore this city now that it is destroyed?" So God made him die for a hundred years
column7: then brought him back to life
column8: and inquired: "How long did you stay in this state?" "A day or less than a day
column9: he replied. No
column10: He said, you were dead a hundred years
column11: yet look at your victuals
column12: they have not decomposed; and look at your ass! We shall make you a warning for men. And regard the bones
column13: how We raise them and clothe them with flesh." When this became clear to him
column14: the man said: "Indeed God has power over all things."'

text: 'Remember
column5: when Abraham said: "O Lord
column6: show me how you raise the dead
column7: He said: What! Do you not believe?" "I do
column8: answered Abraham. I only ask for my heart''s assurance." (The Lord) said: "Trap four birds and tame them
column9: then put each of them on a (separate) hill
column10: and call them
column11: and they will come flying to you. Know that God is all-powerful and all-wise."'

text: 'The semblance of those who expend their wealth in the way of God is that of a grain of corn from which grow seven ears
column5: each ear containing a hundred grains. Truly God increases for whomsoever He will
column6: for God is infinite and all-wise.'

text: 'Those who spend in the way of God
column5: and having spent do not boast or give pain (by word or deed)
column6: will get their reward from their Lord
column7: and will neither have fear nor regret.'

text: 'Saying a word that is kind
column5: and forgiving is better than charity that hurts. (Do not forget that) God is affluent and kind.'

text: 'O believers
column5: do not nullify your charity by giving to oblige and flaunting (your favours) like a man who spends of his wealth only to show off
column6: but does not believe in God and the Last Day. His semblance is that of a rock covered with earth which is washed away by rain exposing the hard rock bare. So they gain nothing from their earnings. God does not guide a people who do not believe.'

text: 'But the semblance of those who expend their wealth to please God with firm and resolute hearts
column5: is like a garden on a height on which the rain falls and it yields its fruits twice as much; and even if the rain does not fall the dew will suffice. For God sees all that you do.'

text: 'Does any of you wish to have an orchard full of date-palm trees and vines
column5: and streams of running water and fruits of all kinds
column6: and then old age should overtake him while his children are small
column7: and a scorching whirlwind should smite and burn it down? Thus God makes His signs clear to you that you may reflect.'

text: 'O believers
column5: give in charity what is good of the things you have earned
column6: and of what you produce from the earth; and do not choose to give what is bad as alms
column7: that is
column8: things you would not like to accept yourself except with some condescension. Remember that God is affluent and praiseworthy.'

text: 'Satan threatens you with want
column5: and orders you (to commit) shameful acts. But God promises His pardon and grace
column6: for God is bounteous and all-knowing.'

text: He gives wisdom to whomsoever He please; and those who are bestowed wisdom get good in abundance. Yet none remembers this save men of wisdom.
'Whatsoever you give away in alms or vow as offering
column5: is all known to God; but the wicked will have none to help them.'

text: 'If you give alms openly
column5: it is well; but if you do it secretly and give to the poor
column6: that is better. This will absolve you of some of your sins; and God is cognisant of all you do.'

text: 'It is not for you to guide them: God guides whom He will. Whatever you spend you will do so for yourself
column5: for you will do so to seek the way that leads to God; and what you spend in charity you will get back in full
column6: and no wrong will be done to you.'

text: '(Give to) the needy who are engaged in the service of God who are not able to move about in the land
column5: whom the ignorant consider to be affluent as they refrain from asking. You can know them from their faces for they do not ask of men importunately. God is surely cognisant of good things that you spend.'

text: 'Those who spend of their wealth in the way of God
column5: day and night
column6: in secret or openly
column7: have their reward with their Lord
column8: and have nothing to fear or regret.'

text: 'Those who live on usury will not rise (on Doomsday) but like a man possessed of the devil and demented. This because they say that trading is like usury. But trade has been sanctioned and usury forbidden by God. Those who are warned by their Lord and desist will keep (what they have taken of interest) already
column5: and the matter will rest with God. But those who revert to it again are the residents of Hell where they will abide for ever.'

text: 'God takes away (gain) from usury
column5: but adds (profit) to charity; and God does not love the ungrateful and sinners.'

text: 'Those who believe and do good deeds
column5: and fulfil their devotional obligations and pay the zakat
column6: have their reward with their Lord
column7: and will have neither fear nor regret.'

text: 'O believers
column5: fear God and forego the interest that is owing
column6: if you really believe.'

text: 'If you do not
column5: beware of war on the part of God and His Apostle. But if you repent
column6: you shall keep your principal. Oppress none and no one will oppress you.'

text: 'If a debtor is in want
column5: give him time until his circumstances improve; but if you forego (the debt) as charity
column6: that will be to your good
column7: if you really understand.'

text: 'Have fear of the day when you go back to God. Then each will be paid back in full his reward
column5: and no one will be wronged.'

text: 'O believers
column5: when you negotiate a debt for a fixed term
column6: draw up an agreement in writing
column7: though better it would be to have a scribe write it faithfully down; and no scribe should refuse to write as God has taught him
column8: and write what the borrower dictates
column9: and have fear of God
column10: his Lord
column11: and not leave out a thing. If the borrower is deficient of mind or infirm
column12: or unable to explain
column13: let the guardian explain judiciously; and have two of your men to act as witnesses; but if two men are not available
column14: then a man and two women you approve
column15: so that in case one of them is confused the other may prompt her. When the witnesses are summoned they should not refuse (to come). But do not neglect to draw up a contract
column17: with the time fixed for paying back the debt. This is more equitable in the eyes of God
column18: and better as evidence and best for avoiding doubt. But if it is a deal about some merchandise requiring transaction face to face
column19: there is no harm if no (contract is drawn up) in writing. Have witnesses to the deal
column20: (and make sure) that the scribe or the witness is not harmed. If he is
column21: it would surely be sinful on your part. And have fear of God
column23: and God is aware of everything.'

text: 'If you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe
column5: pledge your goods (against the Loan); and if one trusts the other
column6: then let him who is trusted deliver the thing entrusted
column7: and have fear of God
column8: his Lord. Do not suppress any evidence
column9: for he who conceals evidence is sinful of heart; and God is aware of all you do.'

text: 'To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth; and whether you reveal what is in your heart or conceal it
column5: you will have to account for it to God who will pardon whom He please and punish whom He will
column6: for God has the power over all things.'

text: 'The Prophet believes in what has been revealed to him by his Lord
column5: and so do the faithful. Each one believes in God and His angels
column6: His Books and the prophets
column7: and We make no distinction between the apostles. For they say: "We hear and obey
column8: and we seek Your forgiveness
column9: O Lord
column10: for to You we shall journey in the end."'

text: 'God does not burden a soul beyond capacity. Each will enjoy what (good) he earns
column5: as indeed each will suffer from (the wrong) he does. Punish us not
column6: O Lord
column7: if we fail to remember or lapse into error. Burden us not
column8: O Lord
column9: with a burden as You did those before us. Impose not upon us a burden
column10: O Lord
column11: we cannot carry. Overlook our trespasses and forgive us
column12: and have mercy upon us; You are our Lord and Master
column13: help us against the clan of unbelievers.'

text: ALIF LAM MIM.
'God: there is no god but He
column5: the living
column6: eternal
column7: self-subsisting
column8: ever sustaining.'

text: 'He has verily revealed to you this Book
column5: in truth and confirmation of the Books revealed before
column6: as indeed He had revealed the Torah and the Gospel'

text: 'Before this as guidance for men
column5: and has sent the criterion (of falsehood and truth). As for those who deny the signs of God
column6: the punishment is severe; for God is all powerful and great His requital.'

text: There is nothing in the earth and the heavens that is hidden from God.
'He shapes you in the womb of the mother as He wills. There is no god but He
column5: the all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'He has sent down this Book which contains some verses that are categorical and basic to the Book
column5: and others allegorical. But those who are twisted of mind look for verses metaphorical
column6: seeking deviation and giving to them interpretations of their own; but none knows their meaning except God; and those who are steeped in knowledge affirm: "We believe in them as all of them are from the Lord." But only those who have wisdom understand.'

text: '"Let us not go astray
column5: O Lord
column6: having guided us already. Bestow on us Your blessings for You are the benevolent.'

text: 'You will gather mankind together
column5: O Lord
column6: on a day that is certain to come
column7: and God does not fail in His promise.'

text: 'As for those who deny
column5: neither their wealth nor their children will help them in the least against God. They shall be but faggots for (the fire of) Hell

text: 'Like the people of the Pharaoh
column5: and those before them
column6: who rejected Our signs
column7: and were punished for their sins by God; and the punishment of God is severe.'

text: So tell the disbelievers: "You will surely be subdued and driven to Hell: How bad a preparation!"
'There was a token for you in the two armies which clashed (in the battle of Badr)
column5: one fighting for God
column6: the other of unbelievers who saw with their own eyes the faithful to be two times as many as they
column7: for God reinforces with His help whomsoever He will. In this is a lesson for those who have eyes.'

text: 'Enamoured are the people of the lust of (earthly) pleasures
column5: of women and of children and hoarded heaps of gold and silver
column6: well-bred horses
column7: and tilled land and cattle
column8: all (vain) goods and chattels of the life of this world
column9: while the best of abodes is with God.'

text: 'Say: "Shall I tell you of (things) even better? With the Lord are gardens with running streams of water for those who keep from evil and follow the straight path
column5: where they will live unchanged with the purest of companions and blessings of God." And under God''s eyes are devotees'

text: 'who say: "O Lord
column5: we believe; forgive our trespasses and save us the torment of Hell."'

text: 'They are the patient
column5: the sincere and devout
column6: full of charity
column7: who pray for forgiveness in the hours of dawn.'

text: 'God is witness there is no god but He
column5: and so are the angels and men full of learning. He is the upholder of justice. There is no god but He
column6: the mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'The true way with God is peace; and the people of the Book did not differ until knowledge (of this revelation) had come to them
column5: out of mutual opposition. But those who deny the signs of God (should remember) He is swift in the reckoning.'

text: 'Even then if they argue
column5: tell them: "I have bowed in submission to God
column6: and so have my followers." And tell the people of the Book and the Arabs: "Do you submit?" If they do
column7: they will find the right path; if they turn away
column8: your duty is to deliver the message. And God keeps an eye on His votaries.'

text: 'To those who deny the signs of God
column5: and slay the apostles unjustly
column6: and slay the upholders of justice
column7: give news of painful punishment.'

text: 'Their good deeds will be wasted in this world and in the next
column5: and none will they have to help them.'

text: 'Have you not seen the people who have received a part of Revelation who are called to the Book of God that it may judge (in their disputes) between them? But some
column5: being averse turn away

text: 'For they say: "The Fire will not touch us for more than a few days." They have been deceived by the lies they have themselves fabricated
column5: and stray from their faith.'

text: 'How shall it be when We gather them together on a day that is certain to come
column5: when each will receive his reward without (favour or) wrong?'

text: 'Say: "O Lord of all dominions
column5: You give whom it pleases You the kingdom
column6: and You take away the power from whosoever You will; You exalt whom You please and debase whom You will. All goodness is Yours (entirely). Indeed You have the power over all things.'

text: 'You make the night succeed the day
column5: the day succeed the night
column6: raise the living from the dead
column7: the dead from the living
column8: and give whomsoever You please
column9: and in measure without number."'

text: 'Those who believe should not take unbelievers as their friends in preference to those who believe -- and whoever does so should have no (expectations) of God -- unless to safeguard yourselves against them. But God commands you to beware of Him
column5: for to God you will journey in the end.'

text: 'Say: "Whether you conceal or reveal whatsoever is in your hearts it is all known to God
column5: as is known to Him all that is in the heavens and the earth; and God has the power over all things."'

text: 'On the day when every man will find whatever of good he has earned and of evil
column5: and is confronted with it
column6: he shall wish that a distance appeared between him and that day -- (that it were far away). God bids you beware of Him
column7: though compassionate is God to His votaries.'

text: Say: "If you love God then follow me that God may love you and forgive your faults; for God is forgiving and kind."
Say: "Obey God and His Messenger;" and if they refuse (then remember) God does not love disbelievers.
'God had chosen Adam and Noah and the families of Abraham and ''Imran in preference to others.'
They were descendants of one another; and God hears all and knows everything.
'Remember
column5: when the wife of ''Imran prayed: "O Lord
column6: I offer what I carry in my womb in dedication to Your service
column7: accept it
column8: for You hear all and know everything."'

text: 'And when she had given birth to the child
column5: she said: "O Lord
column6: I have delivered but a girl." -- But God knew better what she had delivered: A boy could not be as that girl was. "I have named her Mary
column7: (she said), and I give her into Your keeping. Preserve her and her children from Satan the ostracized."'

text: 'Her Lord accepted her graciously
column5: and she grew up with excellence
column6: and was given into the care of Zachariah. Whenever Zachariah came to see her in the chamber
column7: he found her provided with food
column8: and he asked: "Where has this come from
column9: O Mary?" And she said: "From God who gives food in abundance to whomsoever He will."'

text: 'Then prayed Zachariah to his Lord: "O Lord
column5: bestow on me offspring
column6: virtuous and good
column7: for You answer all prayers."'

text: 'Then the angels said to him as he stood in the chamber at prayer: "God sends you good tidings of John who will confirm a thing from God and be noble
column5: continent
column6: and a prophet
column7: and one of those who are upright and do good."'

text: '"How can I have a son
column5: O Lord
column6: he said, for I am old and my wife is barren?" "Thus
column7: came the answer, God does as He wills."'

text: 'And Zachariah said: "Give me a token
column5: O Lord." "The token will be
column6: was the reply, that you will speak to no man for three days except by signs; and remember your Lord much
column7: and pray at evening and sunrise."'

text: 'The angels said: "O Mary
column5: indeed God has favoured you and made you immaculate
column6: and chosen you from all the women of the world.'

text: 'So adore your Lord
column5: O Mary
column6: and pay homage and bow with those who bow in prayer."'

text: 'This is news of the Unknown that We send you
column5: for you were not there when they cast lots with quills (to determine) who should take care of Mary
column6: nor when they disputed it.'

text: 'When the angels said: "O Mary
column5: God gives you news of a thing from Him
column6: for rejoicing
column7: (news of one) whose name will be Messiah
column8: Jesus
column9: son of Mary
column10: illustrious in this world and the next
column11: and one among the honoured

text: 'Who will speak to the people when in the cradle and when in the prime of life
column5: and will be among the upright and doers of good."'

text: 'She said: "How can I have a son
column5: O Lord
column6: when no man has touched me?" He said: "That is how God creates what He wills. When He decrees a thing
column7: He says ''Be''
column8: and it is.'

text: 'He will teach him the Law and the judgement
column5: and the Torah and the Gospel

text: 'And he will be Apostle to the children of Israel
column5: (saying:) ''I have come to you with a prodigy from your Lord that I will fashion the state of destiny out of mire for you
column6: and breathe (a new spirit) into it
column7: and (you) will rise by the will of God. I will heal the blind and the leper
column8: and infuse life into the dead
column9: by the leave of God. I will tell you what you devour and what you hoard in your homes. In this will be a portent for you if you do believe.'

text: 'I (have come to) confirm the truth of the Torah which was sent down before me
column5: and make certain things lawful which have been forbidden until now; and I come to you with a sign from your Lord; so be fearful of God and follow me.'

text: 'Surely God is my Lord
column5: and your Lord
column6: so worship Him; and this is the right path.'

text: 'When Jesus perceived their unbelief he asked: "Who will help me in the way of God?" "We
column5: the disciples answered, shall be the helpers of God. We believe in God; and you be our witness that we submit and obey.'

text: '"O Lord
column5: we believe in Your revelations and follow this Apostle. Enroll us among the witnesses."'

text: 'But they (the unbelievers) contrived a plot
column5: and God did the like; and God''s plan is the best.'

text: 'When God said: "O Jesus
column5: I will take you to Myself and exalt you
column6: and rid you of the infidels
column7: and hold those who follow you above those who disbelieve till the Day of Resurrection. You have then to come back to Me when I will judge between you in what you were at variance."'

text: Those who are infidels will surely receive severe punishment both in this world and the next; and none will they have to help (or save) them.
But those who believe and do good deeds shall be given their recompense in full; but God does not love the unjust.
These verses that We read to you are signs and reminder full of wisdom.
For God the likeness of Jesus is as that of Adam whom He fashioned out of dust and said "Be" and he was.
'This is the truth from your Lord
column5: so do not be in doubt.'

text: 'Tell those who dispute this with you even after the knowledge that has reached you: "Come
column5: let us gather our sons and your sons
column6: our women and your women
column7: ourselves and yourselves
column8: and pray and solicit God to condemn those who lie."'

text: 'And this verily is the true account. There is no god but God
column5: and God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: If they turn away (remember) God knows the mischief-mongers.
'Tell them: "O people of the Book
column5: let us come to an agreement on that which is common between us
column6: that we worship no one but God
column7: and make none His compeer
column8: and that none of us take any others for lord apart from God." If they turn away you tell them: "Bear witness that we submit to Him."'

text: 'O people of the Book
column5: why dispute about Abraham? The Torah and the Gospel were sent down after him: Do you not understand?'

text: 'Remember you are those who disputed the things you knew; so wherefore dispute about things you do not know? And God has the knowledge
column5: while you do not know.'

text: 'Neither was Abraham a Jew nor a Christian
column5: but upright and obedient
column6: and not an idolater.'

text: 'Of all men the nearest to Abraham are those who follow him
column5: and then this Prophet and the faithful; and God is the protector of all believers.'

text: 'Some among the people of the Book wish to lead you astray
column5: yet they lead none astray but themselves
column6: though they do not realise.'

text: 'O people of the Book
column5: why do you disbelieve the signs of God having witnessed them yourselves?'

text: 'O people of the Book
column5: why do you mix the false with the true
column6: and hide the truth knowingly?'

text: 'A section of the people of the Book say: "Believe in the morning what has been revealed to the faithful
column5: and deny in the evening; they might perhaps turn back;'

text: '"And do not believe those who do not belong to your faith." Say: "True guidance is the guidance of God -- that any may be given the like of what has been given you." Will they argue with you before your Lord? Say: "God''s is the bounty. He gives whomsoever He please
column5: for He is infinite and all-wise."'

text: 'He may choose whom He likes for His favours
column5: for great is His bounty.'

text: 'There are some among the people of the Book who return a whole treasure entrusted to them; yet some there are who do not give back a dinar until you demand and insist
column5: because they say: "It is not a sin for us to (usurp) the rights of the Arabs." Yet they lie against God
column6: and they know it.'

text: 'But certainly whoever keeps his promise and follows the right path (will be blessed)
column5: for God loves those who shun evil and follow the right course.'

text: 'Those who trade on the promises of God
column5: and who purchase a little gain from their oaths
column6: will have no share in the life to come. God will not address or even regard them on the Day of Resurrection
column7: nor perfect them
column8: and their suffering will be painful.'

text: 'Among them is a section which distorts in reading the Scripture in a way that though it sounds like the Scripture
column5: in fact it is not; yet they say it is from God
column6: when they know it is not; and they lie about God
column7: and knowingly.'

text: 'It is not for a mortal to whom God reveals the Book and the judgement and the prophethood to say to the people: "Be my votaries instead of God''s
column5: but (to say): Become learned in divine law
column6: by virtue of teaching and studying the Book."'

text: He will surely not bid you make the angels and the prophets your lords. Would he order you disbelief after you have submitted (and accepted the law of God)?
'Remember when God covenanted the prophets (and said): "If after I have given you the Law and the judgement there comes an apostle to you who confirms the truth already with you
column5: you will surely believe him and help him;" and asked: "Do you accept and agree to the terms of My covenant?" They said: "We accept." "Then you be witness
column6: said God, and I shall be witness with you.'

text: Then any one who turns away will be a transgressor."
'Do they seek another way than God''s? But whosoever is in the heavens and the earth is submissive to God and obedient (to Him)
column5: by choice or constraint
column6: and will be returned to Him.'

text: 'Say: "We believe in God
column5: and in what has been revealed to us
column6: and in what had been sent down to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and their offspring
column7: and what had been revealed to Moses and to Jesus and to all other prophets by their Lord. We make no distinction between them
column8: and we submit to Him and obey."'

text: 'And whoever seeks a way other than submission to God
column5: it will not be accepted from him
column6: and he will be a loser in the world to come.'

text: 'How can God show the way to those who
column5: having come to faith
column6: turned away
column7: even though they had borne witness that the Messenger was true
column8: and the clear signs had reached them? God does not show the unrighteous the way.'

text: For such the requital is the curse of God and the angels and of men.
'They shall live under it
column5: and none of their agony decrease nor be respite for them.'

text: 'But those who repent and reform
column5: God is surely forgiving and merciful.'

text: 'Those who deny
column5: having once come to faith
column6: and persist in denial
column7: will not have their repentance accepted
column8: for they have gone astray.'

text: 'From those who deny and die disbelieving will never be accepted an earthful of gold if proferred by them as ransom. For them is grievous punishment
column5: and none will help them.'

text: You will never come to piety unless you spend of things you love; and whatever you spend is known to God.
'To the children of Israel was lawful all food except what Israel forbade himself before the Torah was revealed. Say: "Bring the Torah and recite it
column5: if what you say is true."'

text: 'And anyone who fabricates lies about God even after this
column5: is wicked indeed.'

text: 'Say: "God has veritably spoken the truth. So now follow the way of Abraham the upright
column5: who was not of idolaters."'

text: 'The first House of God to be set up for men was at Bakkah the blessed
column5: a guidance for the people of the world.'

text: 'It contains clear signs
column5: and the spot where Abraham had stood. And anyone who enters it will find security. And whosoever can afford should visit the House on a pilgrimage as duty to God. Whosoever denies
column6: should remember that God is independent of the peoples of the world.'

text: 'Say: "O people of the Book
column5: why do you reject the word of God when God is a witness to all that you do?"'

text: 'Then say: "O people of the Book
column5: why do you turn the believers away from the path of God
column6: looking for obliquities in the way when you are witness to it? And God is aware of all that you do."'

text: 'O believers
column5: if you follow what some of the people of the Book say
column6: it will turn you into unbelievers even after you have come to belief.'

text: 'And how can you disbelieve? To you are being recited the messages of God
column5: and His prophet is among you. And whosoever holds fast to God shall verily be guided to the path that is straight.'

text: 'O believers
column5: fear God as He should be feared
column6: and do not die but submitting (to Him).'

text: 'Hold on firmly together to the rope of God
column5: and be not divided among yourselves
column6: and remember the favours God bestowed on you when you were one another''s foe and He reconciled your hearts
column7: and you turned into brethren through His grace. You had stood on the edge of a pit of fire and He saved you from it
column8: thus revealing to you His clear signs that you may find the right way perchance.'

text: 'So let there be a body among you who may call to the good
column5: enjoin what is esteemed and forbid what is odious. They are those who will be successful.'

text: So be not like those who became disunited and differed among themselves after clear proofs had come to them. For them is great suffering.
'On the Day when some faces would be bright
column5: and some others will be black (with despair)
column6: those with black faces (will be told): "Having come to the faith you denied it; now taste therefore the penalty for you disbelieved."'

text: 'And those with bright faces shall be under God''s grace and enjoy it for ever.'
These are the commandments of God We recite to you verily; God does not wish injustice to the creatures of the world.
'For to God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth
column5: and to God do all things return.'

text: 'Of all the communities raised among men you are the best
column5: enjoining the good
column6: forbidding the wrong
column7: and believing in God. If the people of the Book had come to believe it was best for them; but only some believe
column8: and transgressors are many.'

text: 'They will do you no harm but annoyance; and if they fight you they will only turn their backs
column5: then no help will reach them.'

text: 'Degraded they shall live wheresoever they be unless they make an alliance with God and alliance with men
column5: for they have incurred the anger of God
column6: and misery overhangs them. That is because they denied the signs of God and killed the prophets unjustly
column7: and rebelled
column8: and went beyond the limit.'

text: 'Yet all of them are not alike. Among the people of the Book is a section upright
column5: who recite the scriptures in the hours of the night and bow in adoration and pray

text: 'And believe in God and the Last Day
column5: and enjoin what is good and forbid what is wrong
column6: and who hasten to give in charity: they are among the upright and the doers of good.'

text: And the good they do will not go unaccepted; for God is aware of those who keep away from evil.
'As for those who disbelieve
column5: neither wealth nor children will avail them in the least against God. They are the residents of Hell where they will live for ever.'

text: 'What they spend in the life of this world is like a frosty wind which smites and destroys the crops of a people who had wronged themselves. God did not wrong them
column5: they wronged themselves.'

text: 'O believers
column5: do not make others except your own people your confidants. They will spare no effort to ruin you: They surely desire your annihilation. Hate is on their tongues
column6: and what they hide in their hearts is worse. We have shown you the signs if you have sense.'

text: 'Just think! You hold them as your friends but they do not
column5: even though you believe in all the Scriptures. When they meet you they say: "We believe;" but when they are alone they bite their fingers in rage. Say: "Die of your rage. God is aware of the secrets of the hearts."'

text: 'If good comes your way
column5: they are vexed; but if evil befalls you they are pleased and rejoice; yet if you are patient and guard yourselves against evil
column6: their cunning will not harm you in the least
column7: for whatsoever they do is well within the reach of God.'

text: 'Remember when you set forth in the morning from your house assigning the faithful positions for the battle
column5: God heard everything and knew all.'

text: When two of your bands were about to lose heart God befriended them; and in Him should the faithful place their trust.

'Indeed if you are patient and take heed for yourselves

text: 'And God did not do so but as good tidings for you

column6: the all-mighty and all-wise --'

text: 'In order that He may cut off a part of unbelievers or overthrow them
column5: and they turn back in frustration.'

text: 'You have no say in the matter if He pardon them or punish them
column5: for they are unjust.'

text: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth: He may pardon whom He please and punish whom He will. Yet God is forgiving and kind.
'O you who believe
column5: do not practice usury
column6: charging doubled and redoubled (interest); but have fear of God: you may well attain your goal.'

text: Keep away from the Fire prepared for the infidels;
'Obey God and the Prophet
column5: that you may be treated with mercy.'

text: 'And hasten for the pardon of your Lord
column5: and for Paradise extending over the heavens and the earth
column6: laid out for those who take heed for themselves and fear God

text: 'Who expend both in joy and tribulation
column5: who suppress their anger and pardon their fellowmen; and God loves those who are upright and do good

text: 'And those who
column5: if they commit a shameful act or some wrong against themselves
column6: remember God and seek forgiveness for their sins: For who can forgive except God? They should not be perverse about their doings
column7: knowingly.'

text: 'Their recompense is pardon by their Lord
column5: and gardens with streams of running water where they will abide for ever. How fair is the recompense of those who act!'

text: There have been many dispensations before you; so travel in the land and see what befell those who denied the truth.
'This is a clear declaration for mankind
column5: and a guidance and a warning for those who preserve themselves from evil.'

text: 'So do not lose heart or be grieved
column5: for you will surely prevail if you are believers.'

text: 'If you have been wounded they too have suffered a wound. We cause this alternation of night and day in the affairs of men so that God may know those who believe
column5: taking some as witness (of truth) from your ranks
column6: for God does not like those who are unjust.'

text: This is so that God may try the faithful and destroy the unbelievers.
Do you think you will go to Paradise while God does not know who among you strive and persist?
You had wished to know death before you faced it (in battle); so now you have seen it before your own eyes.

Muhammad is only a messenger; and many a messenger has gone before him. So what if he dies or is killed! Will you turn back and go away in haste? But he who turns back and goes away in haste will do no harm to God. But God will reward those who give thanks (and are grateful).
'No one can die before his appointed term except in accordance with the law of God. And to him who desires a reward in this world
column5: We shall give it; and to him who desires a reward in the life to come
column6: We shall do that. We shall certainly reward those who are grateful.'

text: 'Many a seeker after God has fought in the way of God by the side of many an apostle
column5: undaunted (by disaster)
column6: and did not disgrace themselves; -- verily God loves those who are steadfast.'

text: 'Nor did they say aught but: "O our Lord
column5: forgive us our sins and excesses in our acts
column6: and steady our steps
column7: and help us against unbelieving people."'

text: 'So God rewarded them in this world
column5: and a better reward awaits them in the next; for God loves those who do good.'

text: 'O believers
column5: if you listen to the infidels they will make you turn your backs
column6: and you will be the losers.'

text: 'But God is your protector
column5: and He is the best of helpers.'

text: 'We shall strike terror into the hearts of unbelievers for ascribing compeers to God for which He has sent down no sanction. Hell is their residence
column5: the evil abode of the unjust.'

text: 'The promise made to you by God was verified when you destroyed (the foe) by His leave
column5: until you were unmanned and disputed the order
column6: and thus disobeyed (the Apostle) even after He had brought you in sight of (victory) you longed for. Some of you desired this world
column7: and some of you the next. Then He put you to flight before (them) in order to try you. But (now) He has forgiven you
column8: for surely God is kind to the faithful.'

text: 'Remember
column5: as you were rushing up (the hill) without turning back to look
column6: though the Prophet was calling you from the rear
column7: He requited you with anguish for an anguish that you do not fret for missed opportunity and what befell you
column8: for God is aware of all that you do

text: 'Then after affliction He Sent you a drowsiness as comes after security
column5: overwhelming some among you
column6: and making some anxious for themselves
column7: and made them think thoughts of pagan ignorance; and they said: "Have we a say in any affair?" Say: "All affairs rest with God." They hide in their hearts what they do not disclose to you. They say: "If we had a say in the affair we would not have been killed in this place." Tell them: "Even had you stayed at home
column8: those of you who were ordained to fight would have gone to their place of (eternal) rest. God had to try them to bring out what they concealed in their breasts
column9: and to bring out the secrets of their hearts
column10: for God knows your innermost thoughts.'

text: 'All those among you who turned their backs on the day the two armies clashed (at ''Uhud) were surely induced by Satan to fail in their duty because of their sinful deeds. But God has already forgiven them
column5: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not be like those who deny
column6: and say of their brethren (who died) travelling in the land or fighting: "Had they stayed with us here they would not have died or been killed." This happened so that God may fill their hearts with grief. God is the giver of life and death and sees all that you do.'

text: 'If you are killed in the cause of God or you die
column5: the forgiveness and mercy of God are better than all that you amass.'

text: 'And if you die or are killed
column5: even so it is to God that you will return.'

text: 'It was through God''s mercy that you dealt with them gently; for had you been stern and hard of heart they would surely have broken away from you. So pardon them and pray that forgiveness be theirs
column5: and seek their counsel in all affairs
column6: And when you have come to a decision place your trust in God alone
column7: for He loves those who place their trust in Him.'

text: 'If God is there to help you none will overcome you; and if He forsake you
column5: who will help you other than Him? So only in God should the faithful place their trust.'

text: It is not for a prophet to be false; and whoever is false will indeed bring his falsehood with him on the Day of Reckoning when each will receive his reward without favour or wrong.
'Is a man who has followed the pleasure of God the same as he who has incurred His wrath
column5: whose abode is surely Hell
column6: a dreadful place?'

text: 'There are different ranks with God
column5: And God sees everything you do.'

text: 'God has favoured the faithful by sending an apostle to them from among themselves
column5: who recites to them His messages
column6: and reforms and teaches them the Law and the judgement
column7: for they were clearly in error before.'

text: 'How is it that when misfortune befell you
column5: you said: "Where has this come from?" -- even though you had inflicted disaster twice as great on (the enemy). Say: "This has come from your own selves." Surely God has power over all things.'

text: 'What you suffered on the day the two armies had met was by God''s dispensation
column5: so that He may distinguish the faithful

text: 'And may distinguish the hypocrites who were told: "Fight in the way of God
column5: or defend yourselves
column6: and who had replied: If we knew of the fight we would have followed you." They were nearer unbelief than faith on that day
column7: and they said with their tongues what was not in their hearts; but God is aware of what they hide.'

text: 'To those who sit at home and say of their brothers: "They would never have been killed had they listened to us
column5: say: "Drive away death from your midst if what you say is true."'

text: 'Never think that those who are killed in the way of God are dead. They are alive
column5: getting succour from their Lord

text: 'Rejoicing at what God has given them of His grace
column5: and happy for those who are trying to overtake them but have not joined them yet
column6: and who will have no fear or regret.'

text: They rejoice at the kindness and mercy of God; and God does not suffer the wages of the faithful to go waste.
'Those who obeyed the call of God and His Messenger
column5: even after they were wounded
column6: and took heed for themselves
column7: shall indeed have an ample reward

text: 'Those who were told: "They have gathered an army
column5: beware
column6: and their faith increased and they said: God is sufficient for us
column7: and the best of protectors
column8:
'
TQA467,QA467,TLQ01,'And returned with God''s favour and grace without harm, for they attended the pleasure of God; and great is the benevolence of God.'
TQA468,QA468,TLQ01,'It is no one but Satan who frightens you with his allies. But do not fear him, fear Me, if indeed you are believers.'
TQA469,QA469,TLQ01,'And do not be grieved by those who rush into disbelief. They do no harm to God; and God will not give them any share in the life to come, and their torment shall be great.'
TQA470,QA470,TLQ01,'Those who barter unbelief for faith, will not harm God in the least, and the punishment for them will be painful.'
TQA471,QA471,TLQ01,'The unbelievers must not think that the respite We give them augurs well. We do so that they sink deeper into sin, and suffer an ignominious doom.'

TQA474,QA474,TLQ01,'God has indeed heard the words of those who said: God is a pauper whereas we are rich." We shall make a note of their words
column9: and the murders of the prophets they committed unjustly
column10: and say to them: "Now taste the agony of burning."'

text: 'This is (requital) for the deeds you had committed
column5: for God is not unjust to any of His creatures.'

text: 'To those who say: "God has ordained that we should not believe an apostle who does not bring burnt offerings
column5: say: Many an apostle had come to you before me with manifest proofs
column6: even with what you mention; then why did you kill them if you were men of truth?"'

text: 'If they call you a liar (remember) so had other apostles been called before you

text: 'Every soul will know the taste of death. You will get your recompense in full on the Day of Resurrection; and he who is spared the Fire and finds his way to Paradise will meet his desire. As for the life of this world
column5: it is nothing but a merchandise of vanity.'

text: 'You will
column5: nonetheless
column6: be tried with your wealth and life
column7: and will hear many untoward things from the followers of former Books and the infidels. But if you endure with patience and follow the straight path

text: 'And remember when God took a promise from the people of the Book to make its (truth) known to mankind
column5: and not keep back any part of it
column6: they set aside (the pledge)
column7: and sold it away for a little gain but how wretched the bargain that they made!'

text: 'Think not that those who exult at what they have done
column5: and who love to be praised for what they have not done

column7: for grievous indeed will be their doom.'

text: 'For God''s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth
column5: and God''s is the power over all things.'

text: 'In the creation of the heavens and the earth
column5: the alternation of night and day
column6: are signs for the wise.'

text: 'Those who honour God in meditation
column5: standing or sitting or lying on their sides
column6: who reflect and contemplate on the creation of the heavens and the earth
column7: (and say) "Not in vain have You made them. All praise be to You
column8: O Lord
column9: preserve us from the torment of Hell.'

text: 'Whoever
column5: O Lord
column6: should be cast into Hell shall be verily disgraced; and the sinners shall have none to help (or save) them.'

text: 'We have heard
column5: O our Lord
column6: the crier call inviting us to faith (and announcing): ''Believe in your Lord.'' O our Lord
column7: to faith we have come
column8: so forgive our trespasses
column9: deliver us from sin
column10: and grant us (the glory of) death with the just.'

text: 'Give us what You promised
column5: O Lord
column6: through Your prophets; and put us not to shame on the Day of Reckoning
column7: for never do You go back on Your promise."'

text: 'The Lord heard their prayer and answered: "I suffer not the good deeds of any to go waste
column5: be he a man or a woman: The one of you is of the other. And those who were deprived of their homes or banished in My cause
column6: and who fought and were killed
column7: I shall blot out their sins and admit them indeed into gardens with rippling streams." -- A recompense from God
