text: Be not deceived by the comings and goings of unbelievers in the land.
'Their commerce is but short-lived
column5: and then their abode shall be Hell: And what an evil abode!'

text: 'But those who are pious and obedient to their Lord
column5: will have gardens with streams of running water where they will abide as guests of God; and what is with God is best for the pious.'

text: 'Certainly among the people of the Book are some who believe in God and in what has been revealed to you and had been revealed to them; and they bow in humility before God
column5: and do not trade for paltry gain the signs of God. Their reward is verily with their Lord; and swift is the reckoning of God!'

text: 'So you who believe
column5: have endurance in suffering
column6: be patient and persevere
column7: strengthen each other and be firm
column8: and be pious and fear God that you may find success.'

text: 'O MEN
column5: FEAR your Lord who created you from a single cell
column6: and from it created its mate
column7: and from the two of them dispersed men and women (male and female) in multitudes. So fear God in whose name you ask of one another (the bond of) relationships. God surely keeps watch over you.'

text: 'Give to the orphans their possessions
column5: and do not replace things of your own which are bad with things which are good among theirs
column6: and do not intermix their goods with your own and make use of them
column7: for this is a grievous crime.'

text: 'If you fear you cannot be equitable to orphan girls (in your charge
column5: or misuse their persons)
column6: then marry women who are lawful for you
column7: two
column8: three
column9: or four; but if you fear you cannot treat so many with equity
column10: marry only one
column11: or a maid or captive. This is better than being iniquitous.'

text: 'Give to women their dowers willingly
column5: but if they forego part of it themselves
column6: then use it to your advantage.'

text: 'Do not entrust (their) property God has given you to maintain (On trust)
column5: to those who are immature; but feed them and clothe them from it
column6: and speak to them with kindness.'

text: 'And test (and try) the orphans until they are of marriageable age. If you find they have acquired sound judgement
column5: then hand over their property to them; but devour not their wealth
column6: nor use it up hastily out of fear that soon they will grow up (and demand it). And (the guardian) who is rich should abstain from spending much (of their wealth); and he who is poor should use only as much as is fair. And when you give back their possessions have this witnessed
column7: (and remember) that God is sufficient to take all account.'

text: Men have a share in what the parents and relatives leave behind at death; and women have a share in what the parents and relatives leave behind. Be it large or small a legal share is fixed.
'And when the relatives and orphans and the needy collect at the time of the division (of property) provide for them too
column5: and talk kindly to them.'

text: 'Let people fear the day when they leave small children behind them unprovided
column5: and how concerned they would be for them. So fear God and say the right things to them.'

text: 'Those who devour the possessions of the orphans unjustly devour only fire
column5: and will surely burn in Hell.'

text: 'As for the children
column5: God decrees that the share of the male is equivalent to that of two females. If they consist of women only
column6: and of them more than two
column7: they will get two-thirds of the inheritance; but in case there is one
column8: she will inherit one half. The parents will each inherit a sixth of the estate if it happens the deceased has left a child; but if he has left no children
column9: and his parents are his heirs
column10: then the mother will inherit one-third; but if he has left brothers
column11: the mother will inherit one-sixth after payment of legacies and debts. Of parents and children you do not know who are more useful to you. These are the decrees of God who knows all and is wise.'

text: 'Your share in the property the wives leave behind is half if they die without an issue
column5: but in case they have left children
column6: then your share is one-fourth after the payment of legacies and debts; and your wife shall inherit one-fourth of what you leave at death if you die childless
column7: if not
column8: she will get one-eighth of what you leave behind after payment of legacies and debts. If a man or a woman should die without leaving either children or parents behind but have brother and sister
column9: they shall each inherit one-sixth. In case there are more
column10: they will share one-third of the estate after payment of legacies and debts without prejudice to others. This is the decree of God who knows all and is kind.'

text: 'These are the limits set by God
column5: and those who follow the commandments of God and the Prophet
column6: will indeed be admitted to gardens with streams of water running by
column7: where they will for ever abide; and this will be success supreme.'

text: 'Those who disobey God and the Prophet and exceed the bounds of law
column5: will be taken to Hell and abide there for ever and shall suffer despicable punishment.'

text: 'If any of your women is guilty of unnatural offence
column5: bring four of your witnesses to give evidence; if they testify against them
column6: retain them in the houses until death overtakes them or God provides some other way for them.'

text: 'If two (men) among you are guilty of such acts then punish both of them. But if they repent and reform
column5: let them be
column6: for God accepts repentance and is merciful.'

text: 'God does accept repentance
column5: but only of those who are guilty of an evil out of ignorance yet quickly repent
column6: and God turns to them again
column7: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: But (He does not accept) the repentance of those who continue indulging in evil until death draws near and they say: "We now repent;" nor of those who die disbelieving. For them We have a grievous retribution in wait.
'O believers
column5: you are not allowed to take perforce the women (of dead relatives) into your heritage
column6: or tyrannise over them in order to deprive them of what you have given them
column7: unless they are guilty of open adultery. Live with them with tolerance and justice even if you do not care for them. For it may well be you may not like a thing
column8: yet God may have endued it with much goodness.'

text: 'If you want to take another wife in place of the one you are married to
column5: then even if you have given her a talent of gold
column6: do not take back a thing. Would you take it away by slandering and using unjust means?'

text: 'How could you do that having slept with one another
column5: and when they had taken a solemn pledge from you?'

text: 'And do not wed the women your fathers had wed. What happened in the past is now past: It was lewd and abhorrent
column5: and only the way of evil.'

text: 'Unlawful are your mothers and daughters and your sisters to you
column5: and the sisters of your fathers and your mothers
column6: and the daughters of your brothers and sisters
column7: and foster mothers
column8: foster sisters
column9: and the mothers of your wives
column10: and the daughters of the wives you have slept with who are under your charge; but in case you have not slept with them there is no offence (if you marry their daughters); and the wives of your own begotten sons; and marrying two sisters is unlawful. What happened in the past (is now past): God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Also forbidden are married women unless they are captives (of war). Such is the decree of God. Lawful for you are women besides these if you seek them with your wealth for wedlock and not for debauchery. Then give those of these women you have enjoyed
column5: the agreed dower. It will not be sinful if you agree to something (else) by mutual consent after having settled the dowry. God is certainly all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'If one of you cannot afford to marry a believing gentlewoman (let him marry) a maid who is a believer. God is aware of your faith: The one of you is of the other; so marry them with the consent of their people
column5: and give them an appropriate dowry. They are women (seeking) wedlock
column6: and not lechery
column7: nor secretly looking for paramours. But if they are married and guilty of adultery
column8: inflict on them half the punishment (enjoined) for gentlewomen. This is for those who are afraid of doing wrong. In case they can wait
column9: it is better for them. God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'God wishes to make it clear to you and guide you through the example of earlier people
column5: and to forgive you
column6: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'God likes to turn to you
column5: but those who are lost in the pleasures of the flesh wish to turn you astray
column6: far away.'

text: 'God would like to lighten your burden
column5: for man was created weak.'

text: 'O believers
column5: you should not usurp unjustly the wealth of each other
column6: but trade by mutual consent; and do not destroy yourselves. God is merciful to you.'

text: 'If someone does so through oppression or injustice
column5: We shall cast him into Hell: This is how (the Law of) God works inevitably.'

text: 'If you keep away from the deadly sins that have been forbidden
column5: We shall efface your faults
column6: and lead you to a place of honour.'

text: 'Do not covet what God has favoured some with more than He has some others. Men have a share in what they earn

text: 'For each We have appointed heirs to what parents and relatives leave behind. And to those you have given your pledge in marriage give their share
column5: for God is witness to everything.'

text: 'Men are the support of women as God gives some more means than others
column5: and because they spend of their wealth (to provide for them). So women who are virtuous are obedient to God and guard the hidden as God has guarded it. As for women you feel are averse
column6: talk to them suasively; then leave them alone in bed (without molesting them) and go to bed with them (when they are willing). If they open out to you
column7: do not seek an excuse for blaming them. Surely God is sublime and great.'

text: 'If you fear a breach between them
column5: appoint one arbiter from the people of the man and one from the people of the woman. If they wish to have a settlement then God will reconcile them
column6: for God is all-knowing and cognisant.'

text: 'Pay homage to God
column5: and make none His compeer
column6: and be good to your parents and relatives
column7: the orphans and the needy and the neighbours who are your relatives
column8: and the neighbours who are strangers
column9: and the friend by your side
column10: the traveller and your servants and subordinates. God does not surely love those who are arrogant and boastful

text: 'Who are miserly and bid others to be so

text: 'Those who spend of their wealth to show off and do not believe in God and the Last Day
column5: take Satan as companion
column6: and how evil a companion (have they)!'

text: 'Would something have befallen them if they had believed in God and the Last Day
column5: and spent of what has been given them by God? God is fully aware of all they do.'

text: 'God does not wrong any one
column5: not even the equal of an atom; and if men do good He multiplies it by two

text: How shall it be when We call witnesses from each and every people and call you as witness over them?
'On that day those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Prophet
column5: shall wish they were levelled with the dust
column6: and shall not be able to conceal a thing from God.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not perform your service of prayer when you are intoxicated until you are sure of what you are saying
column6: nor when in a state of seminal pollution
column7: until you have taken a bath
column8: except when you are travelling. But in case you are ill or are travelling
column9: or you have relieved yourself of nature''s call
column10: or cohabited with a woman
column11: and cannot find water
column12: then take wholesome dust and pass it over your face and hands: God is benign and forgiving.'

text: 'Have you not seen the people who were given a share of the Book
column5: but who purchased only error
column6: and wish that you also go astray?'

text: 'But God knows your enemies well: and sufficient is God to protect you
column5: and sufficient is God for all help.'

text: 'Some among the Jews distort the words out of context and say (in place of the right words): "We have heard and do not obey;" and
column5: "hear without hearing

column9:
it would have been better for them and more appropriate. But God has disgraced them for their lack of belief; and so only a few of them believe.'

text: They are the ones who were cursed by God; and those who are cursed by God will have none to protect them.

text: 'Are they so envious of others for what God has given them of His bounty? So We had given the Book and the Law to Abraham''s family
column5: and given them great dominion.'

text: 'Then some of them believed in it
column5: and some turned away from it; yet sufficient is Hell
column6: the flaming Fire!'

text: 'And those who disbelieve Our revelations shall be cast into Hell; and when their skin is burnt up and singed

column6: with fairest of companions and coolest of shades.'

text: 'God enjoins that you render to the owners what is held in trust with you
column5: and that when you judge among the people do so equitably. Noble are the counsels of God
column6: and God hears all and sees everything.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: obey God and the Prophet and those in authority among you; and if you are at variance over something
column6: refer it to God and the Messenger
column7: if you believe in God and the Last Day. This is good for you and the best of settlement.'

text: 'Have you never seen those who aver they believe in what has been revealed to you and had been to others before you
column5: yet desire to turn for judgement to evil powers
column6: even though they have been commanded to disbelieve in them? Satan only wishes to lead them astray
column7: far away.'

text: 'When they are told: "Come to that which God has revealed
column5: and to the Prophet
column6:
you should see the hypocrites, how they hesitate and turn their faces away.'
TQA555,QA555,TLQ01,How shall it be when they suffer misfortunes for their own misdeeds? Then they will come to you swearing by God and saying: We wish for nothing but good and amity."

text: 'The secrets of the hearts of these people are well known to God. So leave them alone
column5: and counsel them and speak to them eloquent words that would touch their very souls.'

text: 'We have sent no apostle but that he should be obeyed by the will of God. If they had come to you after wronging themselves and asked forgiveness of God
column5: and you had also asked forgiveness for them
column6: they would surely have found God forgiving and merciful.'

text: 'Indeed
column5: by your Lord

text: 'If We had commanded them to lay down their lives and to go forth from their homes

text: 'And We would have bestowed on them a great reward of Our own
And led them to the path that is straight.

column5: the prophets
column6: the sincere and the trustful
column7: the martyrs and the upright; and how excellent a company are they!'

text: 'This is a favour from God; and sufficient is God
column5: the all-knowing.'

text: 'O believers
column5: take precautions
column6: and advance in detachments

text: 'Someone among you will surely lag behind

text: 'But if success comes to you from God he will say

text: 'Those who barter the life of this world for the next should fight in the way of God. And We shall bestow on him who fights in the way of God
column5: whether he is killed or is victorious

text: 'What has come upon you that you fight not in the cause of God and for the oppressed
column5: men

text: 'Those who believe fight in the way of God; and those who do not

text: 'Death will overtake you wheresoever you be

text: What comes to you of good is verily from God; and what comes to you of ill is from your own self (your actions). We have sent you as apostle to all mankind; and God is sufficient as witness.
He who obeys the Apostle obeys God; and if some turn away (remember) We have not sent you as warden over them.
'They say: "We obey;" but when they leave your company
column5: a section of them discuss at night other things than you had said; but God takes note of what they discuss. So turn aside from them and trust in God; and God is sufficient as protector.'

text: 'Do they not ponder over the Qur''an? Had it been the word of any other but God they would surely have found a good deal of variation in it.'
'And when any tidings of peace or war come to them they spread the news around. Had they gone to the Prophet or those in authority among them

column6: And but for the favour of God and His mercy you would certainly have followed Satan

text: 'So fight on in the way of God (irrespective of the others). You cannot compel any one except your own self; but urge the believers to fight. It may well be that God will keep back the might of the infidels
column5: for God''s might is greater
column6: and severe His punishment.'

text: He who intercedes in a good cause will surely have a share in the recompense; and he who abets an evil act will share the burden thereof; for God (equates and) is watchful of all things.
'When you are greeted with a greeting
column5: then greet with one fairer
column6: or repeat the same greeting. For God takes account of all things.'

text: 'God: There is no god but He. He will gather you together on the Day of Resurrection which is certain to come; and whose word is truer than God''s?'

How is it that you are divided in two factions about the hypocrites? God has routed them for what they were doing. Do you wish to guide him to the path whom God has allowed to go astray? As for him whom God allows to go astray you will not find a way.
'They wish you to become disbelievers as they are
column5: so that you should become like them. Therefore hold them not as friends until they go out of their homes in the way of God. If they do not
column6: seize them wherever they are and do away with them. Do not make them your friends or allies

text: 'Except those who take refuge with a people allied to you
column5: or those who
column6: weary of fighting you or their people
column7: come over to you. If God had so willed He would surely have given them power over you
column8: and they would have fought you. If they keep aloof and do not fight
column9: and offer peace
column10: God has left you no reason to fight them.'

text: 'You will also find persons who
column5: while wishing to live in peace with you as well as with their own people
column6: turn to civil war the moment they are called to it. If they do not keep away from you
column7: nor offer you peace nor restrain their hands
column8: seize them and kill them wherever they are. We have given you a clear sanction against them.'

text: 'It is not for a believer to take a believer''s life except by mistake; and he who kills a believer by mistake should free a slave who is a believer
column5: and pay blood-money to the victim''s family unless they forego it as an act of charity. If he belonged to a community hostile to you but was himself a believer
column6: then a slave who is a believer should be freed. In case he belonged to a people with whom you have a treaty
column7: then give blood-money to his family and free a believing slave. But he who has no means (to do so) should fast for a period of two months continuously to have his sins forgiven by God
column8: and God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'Any one who kills a believer intentionally will be cast into Hell to abide there for ever
column5: and suffer God''s anger and damnation. For him a greater punishment awaits.'

text: 'O believers
column5: when you go out on a journey in the way of God
column6: be discreet and do not say to anyone who greets you in peace: "You are not a believer." You desire the gain of earthly life
column7: but there are prizes in plenty with God. You were also like him (an unbeliever) in the past
column8: but God has been gracious to you. So be careful and discreet
column9: for God is aware of what you do.'

text: 'The faithful who sit idle
column5: other than those who are disabled
column6: are not equal to those who fight in the way of God with their wealth and lives. God has exalted those in rank who fight for the faith with their wealth and souls over those who sit idle. Though God''s promise of good is for all
column7: He has granted His favour of the highest reward to those who struggle in preference to those who sit at home.'

text: 'For them are higher ranks with God
column5: and forgiveness and grace; and God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'As for those whose souls are taken by the angels (at death) while in a state of unbelief
column5: they will be asked by the angels: "What (state) were you in?" They will answer: "We were oppressed in the land." And the angels will say: "Was not God''s earth large enough for you to migrate?" Their abode will be Hell
column6: and what an evil destination!'

text: 'But those who are helpless
column5: men
column6: women and children
column7: who can neither contrive a plan nor do they know the way

text: May well hope for the mercy of God; and God is full of mercy and grace.
'Whosoever leaves his country in duty to God will find many places of refuge
column5: and abundance on the earth. And he who leaves his home and becomes an emigre in the way of God and His Messenger
column6: and death overtake him
column7: is sure to receive his reward from God; for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'When you travel in the land there is no sin if you curtail your service of prayer if you fear the unbelievers may harass you
column5: for indeed your open enemies are the infidels.'

text: 'When you are among them
column5: and have to lead the service of prayer
column6: let one group stand up with you
column7: but let them keep their arms. After they have paid their homage they should go to the rear
column8: and let the group which has not done so yet offer their service of prayer with you
column9: remaining cautious and armed
column10: The infidels wish to find you neglectful of your arms and provisions
column11: to attack you unawares. It will not be a sin if you put aside your arms when you are troubled by rain
column12: or you are ill; but take full precautions. God has reserved for infidels a despicable punishment'

text: 'If you are late in performing your service of prayer honour God by remembering Him
column5: standing or sitting or lying on your sides. And when you have security perform your act of prayer befittingly; and praying at fixed hours is prescribed for the faithful.'

text: 'And do not be chary of pursuing them. If you suffer
column5: they shall also suffer like you. But while you have hope (of success) from God
column6: they have none. Surely God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'We have sent down to you the Book containing the truth
column5: in whose light you should judge among the people as God has shown you
column6: and do not be a contender for deceivers.'

text: 'And seek God''s forgiveness
column5: for God is surely forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Do not argue for those who harbour deceit in their hearts
column5: for God does not love the treacherous and the iniquitous.'

text: 'They try to hide from (men)
column5: but they cannot hide from God who is with them at night when they discuss such matters as He does not approve; but what they do is well within the compass of God.'

text: 'Well
column5: you are those who pleaded for them in the life of this world; but who will plead for them on the Day of Resurrection or be their security?'

text: 'He who does evil or acts against his own interests (by disbelieving)
column5: then prays for God''s forgiveness
column6: will find God compassionate and merciful.'

text: He who earns the wages of sin does so for himself; and God is aware of everything and is wise.
'He who commits a mistake or iniquity and ascribes it to one who is innocent
column5: is guilty of calumny and brazen sin.'

text: 'But for the mercy of God and His grace you would certainly have been misled by a section of them; yet they could not mislead you but themselves alone
column5: and could do you no harm
column6: for God has revealed to you the Book and the Law
column7: and taught you what you did not know. Great have been the blessings of God on you.'

text: 'Their confidential counsels are seldom for the good
column5: save of those who talk of charity or goodness or peace among men. Whosoever does so for the pleasure of God
column6: We shall give him an ample reward.'

text: 'And he who opposes the Prophet even after the way has become clear to him
column5: and follows a path other than the way of believers
column6: We shall lead him to what he has chosen for himself
column7: and shall take him to Hell: How evil a journey''s end.'

text: 'God does not forgive that compeers be ascribed to Him
column5: and absolves all else whatsoever He will. And he who associates compeers with God has indeed wandered far astray.'

text: In His place they invoke only females (the pagan deities); and instead of Him they invoke Satan the obstinate rebel
'Who was condemned by God and who said: "I shall take from Thy creatures my determinate share
'And mislead them and tempt them
column5: and order them to slit the ears of animals; and order them to alter God''s creation." He who holds Satan as friend in place of God will assuredly be damned to perdition.'

text: 'Whatever the promises he makes
column5: whatever the desires he enkindles
column6: and whatever the hopes Satan rouses in them
column7: are no more than delusion.'

text: For such the abode is only Hell from which they will find no escape.

'But those who believe and do good deeds We shall admit into gardens with streams of running water where they will abide for ever. True is the promise of God; and whose word could be truer than God''s?'
'It is neither dependent on your wishes
column5: nor the wishes of the people of the Book
column6: (but) whosoever does ill will be punished for it
column7: and will find no protector or friend apart from God;'

text: 'But he who performs good deeds
column5: whether man or a woman
column6: and is a believer
column7: will surely enter Paradise
column8: and none shall be deprived even of an iota of his reward.'

text: 'Whose way is better than that of the man who has submitted to God
column5: and does good
column6: and who follows the creed of Abraham the upright? And God chose Abraham as friend.'

text: And all that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God; and everything is well within the compass of God.

'And they ask you for judgement about women. Tell them: "God has given you instructions about them. You also read them in the Book concerning orphaned women (in your charge) to whom you deny their ordained rights and yet wish to take them in marriage
column5: as well as in respect of helpless children
column6: that you should be just in the matter of orphans." The good you do is known to God.'

text: 'If a woman fears aversion from her husband
column5: or ill treatment
column6: there is no harm if they make a peaceful settlement; and peace is an excellent thing. But men keep self-interest uppermost. Yet if you do good and fear God
column7: God is cognisant of all that you do.'

text: 'Howsoever you may try you will never be able to treat your wives equally. But do not incline (to one) exclusively and leave (the other) suspended (as it were). Yet if you do the right thing and are just
column5: God is verily forgiving and kind.'

text: 'If both (decide to) separate
column5: God in His largesse will provide for them; for God is infinite and all wise.'

text: 'All that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God. We had commanded those who received the Book before you
column5: and have commanded you too
column6: to obey the laws of God. Even if you deny
column7: surely all that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God; and God is self-sufficient and praise-worthy.'

text: For all that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God; and God is sufficient as guardian.
'He could take you away if He will
column5: O men
column6: and replace you with others: God has the power to do so.'

text: Whosoever desires a reward of this world (should remember) that with God are rewards of this world and the next; and God hears all and sees everything.
'O you who believe
column5: be custodians of justice (and) witnesses for God
column6: even though against yourselves or your parents or your relatives. Whether a man be rich or poor
column7: God is his greater well-wisher than you. So follow not the behests of lust lest you swerve from justice; and if you prevaricate or avoid (giving evidence)
column8: God is cognisant of all that you do.'

text: 'O believers
column5: believe in God and His Messenger and the Book He has revealed to His Apostle
column6: and the Books revealed before. But he who believes not in God and His angels and the Books and the prophets and the Last Day
column7: has wandered far away.'

text: 'Those who accept the faith
column5: then disbelieve
column6: then return to it
column7: and deny once again and increase in disbelief
column8: will not be forgiven by God or be guided by Him.'

text: Give tidings to the hypocrites that painful is their doom.
Do those who take unbelievers as their friends in preference to the faithful seek power from them? But all power belongs to God.
'You have been commanded in the Book that whensoever you hear God''s messages denied or derided
column5: do not sit in that company until they begin talking of other things
column6: or you will be no different from them. Indeed God will put the hypocrites and infidels together in Hell.'

text: 'Those who wait to see what befalls you
column5: say in ease success comes to you from God: "Were we not with you?" But if fortune favours the infidels
column6: they say: "Did we not overpower you
column7: and yet protected you against the believers?" But God will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection; and God will never give the unbelievers a way over the faithful.'

text: 'The hypocrites try to deceive God
column5: but He (leads them to) deceive themselves. When they stand up for performing the service of prayer they do so indolently
column6: only for show
column7: and remember God but little

text: 'Wavering between the two
column5: neither with these nor with those. For them who are not given the guidance by God
column6: you will never find a way.'

text: 'O believers
column5: do not hold unbelievers as friends in preference to the faithful. Do you want to proffer a clear proof of your own guilt before God?'

text: 'The hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of Hell
column5: and you will find none to help them.'

text: 'But those who repent and amend
column5: and hold firmly to God
column6: and are sincere and wholly obedient to God
column7: are surely with the faithful; and God will bestow on the faithful a great reward.'

text: Why should God punish you if you acknowledge the truth and believe? God is responsive to gratitude and is cognisant.
'God does not like ill (of others) spoken about
column5: except by him who has been wronged. For God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'Whether you do some good openly or in secret
column5: or forgive an ill done to you
column6: (know) that God is forgiving and all-powerful.'

text: 'Those who believe not in God and His apostles
column5: and desire to differentiate between God and His messengers
column6: and say: "We believe in some and not in the others
column7:
and wish to find a way (between affirmation and denial),'
TQA644,QA644,TLQ01,Are verily the real unbelievers. And We have reserved for unbelievers an ignominious punishment.
TQA645,QA645,TLQ01,'But those who believe in God and His apostles and make no distinction among any of them, will be given by Him their recompense; for God is forgiving and kind.'
TQA646,QA646,TLQ01,'The people of the Book demand of you to bring for them a book from heaven. But of Moses they had asked a bigger thing, and demanded: Show us God face to face." They were struck by lightning then as punishment for their wickedness. Even then they made the calf
column8: when clear signs had reached them. Still We forgave them and gave Moses clear authority.'

text: 'We exalted them on the Mount
column5: and they gave a solemn pledge
column6: and We said to them: "Enter the gates submissively

column8:
and took a solemn pledge from them.'

column10: Jesus
column11: son of Mary
column12: who was an apostle of God;" but they neither killed nor crucified him

column14: for surely they did not kill him

There is not one among the people of the Book who will not believe in it before his death; and he will be a witness over them on the Day of Resurrection.
'Because of the wickedness of some among the Jews
column5: and because they obstructed people from the way of God
column6: We forbade them many things which were lawful for them;'

text: 'And because they practised usury although it had been forbidden them; and for using others'' wealth unjustly. For those who are unbelievers among them We have reserved a painful punishment.'
'But to the learned among them
column5: and the believers who affirm what has been revealed to you and was revealed to those before you
column6: and to those who fulfil their devotional obligations
column7: who pay the zakat and believe in God and the Last Day
column8: We shall give a great reward.'

text: 'We have sent revelations to you as We sent revelations to Noah and the prophets (who came) after him; and We sent revelations to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob
column5: and their offspring
column6: and to Jesus and Job
column7: and to Jonah and Aaron and Solomon
column8: and to David We gave the Book of Psalms

text: 'And to many an apostle We have mentioned before
column5: and to many other apostles We have not mentioned to you; and to Moses God spoke directly.'

text: All these apostles of good news and admonition were sent so that after the apostles men may have no argument against God. God is all-powerful and all-wise.
'God is Himself witness to what has been revealed to you
column5: and revealed with His knowledge
column6: and the angels are witness; and God is sufficient as witness.'

text: 'Those who denied and turned away from the path of God
column5: have wandered far astray.'

text: 'Those who deny and transgress will not be forgiven by God
column5: nor be shown the way'

text: 'Except to Hell
column5: where they will abide for ever; and this is how (the law of God) works inevitably.'

text: 'O men
column5: the Apostle has now come to you
column6: bringing the truth from your Lord; so believe for your own good; but if you deny (then remember) that all that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God; and God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'O people of the Book
column5: do not be fanatical in your faith
column6: and say nothing but the truth about God. The Messiah who is Jesus
column7: son of Mary
column8: was only an apostle of God
column9: and a command of His which He sent to Mary
column10: as a mercy from Him. So believe in God and His apostles
column11: and do not call Him ''Trinity''. Abstain from this for your own good; for God is only one God
column12: and far from His glory is it to beget a son. All that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him; and sufficient is God for all help.'

text: 'The Christ will never disdain to be a votary of God
column5: nor will the angels close to Him. And those who disdain to serve Him and are proud (should remember) that they will all go back to Him in the end.'

text: 'Then those who believed and earned good deeds will be given their recompense in full
column5: and even more out of grace. But those who disdain and who boast will receive a painful punishment. They will find none except God to help them or save them.'

text: 'O men
column5: you have received infallible proof from your Lord
column6: and We have sent down a beacon light to you.'

text: 'So those who believe in God and hold fast to Him shall indeed be received into His mercy and His grace
column5: and be guided to Him the straight path.'

text: 'They ask you for judgement about ''Kalalah'' (a man who dies childless). Say: "God has given a decision in the matter of inheritance." If a man dies and leaves no child behind but have a sister
column5: she will get a half of what he owned
column6: as he would have done the whole of what she possessed if she had died a childless person. In ease he has two sisters then they will get two-thirds of the heritage. But if he has both brothers and sisters
column7: the male will inherit a share equal to that of two females. God makes this manifest to you lest you wander astray
column8: for God has knowledge of everything.'

text: 'O YOU WHO believe
column5: fulfil your obligations. Made lawful (as food) for you are animals except those mentioned (here); but unlawful during Pilgrimage is game. God ordains whatsoever He wills.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not violate the (sanctity of) offerings to God
column6: nor the rites of the holy month
column7: nor sacrificial cattle with garlands (that are brought to the Ka''bah)
column8: nor of the people who flock to the Holy House seeking the bounties of their Lord
column9: and His pleasure. Hunt when you have laid aside the robe of the pilgrim. And do not let your hatred of a people who had barred you from the Holy Mosque lead you to aggression. But help one another in goodness and piety
column10: and do not assist in crime and rebellion
column11: and fear God. Surely God is severe in punishment.'

text: 'Forbidden you is carrion and blood
column5: and the flesh of the swine
column6: and whatsoever has been killed in the name of some other than God
column7: and whatever has been strangled
column8: or killed by a blow or a fall
column9: or by goring
column10: or that which has been mauled by wild beasts unless slaughtered while still alive; and that which has been slaughtered at altars is forbidden
column11: and also dividing the meat by casting lots with arrows. All this is sinful. Today the unbelievers have lost every hope of (despoiling) your creed; so do not fear them
column12: fear Me. Today I have perfected your system of belief and bestowed My favours upon you in full
column13: and have chosen submission (al-Islam) as the creed for you. If one of you is driven by hunger (to eat the forbidden) without the evil intent of sinning
column14: then God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'They ask you what is lawful for them. Say: "All things are lawful for you that are clean
column5: and what the trained hunting animals take for you as you have trained then
column6: in the light of God''s teachings
column7: but read over them the name of God
column8: and fear (straying from the path of) God
column9: for God is swift in the reckoning."'

text: 'On this day all things that are clean have been made lawful for you; and made lawful for you is the food of the people of the Book
column5: as your food is made lawful for them. And lawful are the chaste Muslim women
column6: and the women of the people of the Book who are chaste
column7: (for marriage) and not fornication or liaison
column8: if you give them their dowries. Useless shall be rendered the acts of those who turn back on their faith
column9: and they will be among the losers in the life to come.'

text: 'O believers
column5: when you stand up for the service of prayer wash your faces and hands up to elbows
column6: and also wipe your heads
column7: and wash your feet up to the ankles. If you are in a state of seminal pollution
column8: then bathe and purify yourself well. But in case you are ill or are travelling
column9: or you have satisfied the call of nature
column10: or have slept with a woman
column11: and you cannot find water
column12: then take wholesome dust and pass it over your face and your hands
column13: for God does not wish to impose any hardship on you. He wishes to purify you
column14: and grace you with His favours in full so that you may be grateful.'

text: 'Remember the favours He bestowed on you
column5: and the covenant He cemented with you
column6: when you said: "We have heard and obey." Have fear of God
column7: for He knows the secrets of your heart.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: stand up as witnesses for God in all fairness
column6: and do not let the hatred of a people deviate you from justice. Be just: This is closest to piety; and beware of God. Surely God is aware of all you do.'

text: God has made a promise of forgiveness and the highest reward to those who believe and perform good deeds.
But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations are the people of Hell.
'O believers
column5: remember the favours God bestowed on you when a people raised their hands against you and He restrained their hands. So fear God; and the faithful should place their trust in God.'

text: 'God covenanted the people of Israel and raised twelve leaders among them
column5: and said: "I shall verily be with you. If you fulfil your devotional obligations
column6: pay the zakat and believe in My apostles and support them
column7: and give a goodly loan to God
column8: I shall certainly absolve you of your evil
column9: and admit you to gardens with streams of running water. But whosoever among you denies after this
column10: will have wandered away from the right path."'

text: 'When they dishonoured their pledge We condemned them
column5: and hardened their hearts. So they distort the words of the Scripture out of context
column6: and have forgotten some of what they were warned against. You will always hear of treachery on their part except that of a few. But forbear and forgive them
column7: for God loves those who do good.'

text: 'We had taken the pledge of those also who call themselves Christians. But they too forgot to take advantage of the warning they were given. So We have caused enmity and hatred among them to last till the Day of Resurrection
column5: when God will inform them of what they were doing.'

text: 'O people of the Book
column5: Our Apostle has come to you
column6: announcing many things of the Scriptures that you have suppressed
column7: passing over some others. To you has come light and a clear Book from God'

text: 'Through which God will lead those who follow His pleasure to the path of peace
column5: and guide them out of darkness into light by His will
column6: and to the path that is straight.'

text: 'Verily they are unbelievers who say: "The Messiah
column5: son of Mary
column6: is God." You ask them: "Who could prevail against God if He had chosen to destroy the Messiah
column7: son of Mary
column8: and his mother
column9: and the rest of mankind?" For God''s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever lies between them. He creates what He please
column10: for God has the power over all things.'

text: 'Say the Jews and the Christians: "We are sons of God and beloved of Him." Say: "Why does He punish you then for your sins? No: You are only mortals
column5: of His creation." He can punish whom He please and pardon whom He will
column6: for God''s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them
column7: and everything will go back to Him.'

text: 'O you people of the Book
column5: Our Apostle has come to you when apostles had ceased to come long ago
column6: lest you said: "There did not come to us any messenger of good news or of warnings." So now there has reached you a bearer of good tidings and of warnings; for God has the power over all things.'

text: 'Remember when Moses said to his people: "O my people
column5: remember the favours that God bestowed on you when He appointed apostles from among you
column6: and made you kings and gave you what had never been given to any one in the world.'

text: 'Enter then
column5: my people
column6: the Holy Land that God has ordained for you
column7: and do not turn back
column8: or you will suffer."'

text: 'They said: "O Moses
column5: in that land live a people who are formidable; we shall never go there until they leave. We shall enter when they go away."'

text: 'Then two of the men who feared (God)
column5: and to whom God was gracious
column6: said to them: "Charge and rush the gate. If you enter
column7: you will surely be victorious. And place your trust in God if you truly believe."'

text: 'They said: "O Moses
column5: we shall never
column6: never enter so long as they are there. Go you and your Lord to fight them; we stay here."'

text: 'Said (Moses): "O Lord
column5: I have control over none but myself and my brother; so distinguish between us and these
column6: the wicked people."'

text: '(And God) said: "Then verily this land is forbidden them for forty years
column5: and they shall wander perplexed over the earth. So do not grieve for these
column6: the wicked people."'

text: 'Narrate to them exactly the tale of the two sons of Adam. When each of them offered a sacrifice (to God)
column5: that of one was accepted
column6: and that of the other was not. Said (the one): "I will murder you
column7: and the other replied: God only accepts from those who are upright and preserve themselves from evil.'

text: 'If you raise your hand to kill me
column5: I will raise not mine to kill you
column6: for I fear God
column7: the Lord of all the worlds;'

text: 'I would rather you suffered the punishment for sinning against me
column5: and for your own sin
column6: and became an inmate of Hell. And that is the requital for the unjust."'

text: 'Then the other was induced by his passion to murder his brother
column5: and he killed him
column6: and became one of the damned.'

text: 'Then God sent a raven which scratched the ground in order to show him how to hide the nakedness of his brother. "Alas
column5: the woe
column6: said he, that I could not be even like the raven and hide the nakedness of my brother
column7:
and was filled with remorse.'
TQA701,QA701,TLQ01,'That is why We decreed for the children of Israel that whosoever kills a human being, except (as punishment) for murder or for spreading corruption in the land, it shall be like killing all humanity; and whosoever saves a life, saves the entire human race. Our apostles brought clear proofs to them; but even after that most of them committed excesses in the land.'
TQA702,QA702,TLQ01,'The punishment for those who wage war against God and His Prophet, and perpetrate disorders in the land, is to kill or hang them, or have a hand on one side and a foot on the other cut off, or banish them from the land. Such is their disgrace in the world, and in the Hereafter their doom shall be dreadful.'
TQA703,QA703,TLQ01,But those who repent before they are subdued should know that God is forgiving and kind.
TQA704,QA704,TLQ01,'O you who believe, follow the path shown to you by God, and seek the way of proximity to Him, and struggle in His way: you may have success.'
TQA705,QA705,TLQ01,'As for unbelievers, if they possess the riches of the whole earth, and two times more, and offer it as ransom for release from the torments of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and their punishment will surely be painful.'
TQA706,QA706,TLQ01,'They would like to escape from the Fire, but will never succeed, and their suffering will be constant'
TQA707,QA707,TLQ01,'As for the thief, whether man or woman, cut his hand as punishment from God for what he had done; and God is all mighty and all wise.'
TQA708,QA708,TLQ01,'But those who repent after a crime and reform, shall be forgiven by God, for God is forgiving and kind.'
TQA709,QA709,TLQ01,'Do you not know that God''s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He will, and pardons whom He please, for God has the power over all things.'
TQA710,QA710,TLQ01,'Be not grieved, O Apostle, by those who hasten to outrace others in denial, and say with their tongues: We believe
column8: but do not believe in their hearts. And those of the Jews who listen to tell lies, and spy on behalf of others who do not come to you, and who distort the words (of the Torah) out of context, and say: If you are given (what we say is true) accept it; but if you are not given it
column9: beware." You cannot intercede with God for him whom God would not show the way. These are the people whose hearts God does not wish to purify. For them is ignominy in this world and punishment untold in the next --'

text: 'Eavesdropping for telling lies
column5: earning through unlawful means! So
column6: if they come to you
column7: judge between them or decline. And if you decline
column8: they can do you no harm; but if you judge
column9: you should do so with justice
column10: for God loves those who are just.'

text: But why should they make you a judge when the Torah is with them which contains the Law of God? Even then they turn away. They are those who will never believe.
'We sent down the Torah which contains guidance and light
column5: in accordance with which the prophets who were obedient (to God) gave instructions to the Jews
column6: as did the rabbis and priests
column7: for they were the custodians and witnesses of God''s writ. So
column8: therefore
column9: do not fear men
column10: fear Me
column11: and barter not My messages away for a paltry gain. Those who do not judge by God''s revelations are infidels indeed.'

text: 'And there (in the Torah) We had ordained for them a life for a life
column5: and an eye for an eye
column6: and a nose for a nose
column7: and an ear for an ear
column8: and a tooth for a tooth
column9: and for wounds retribution
column10: though he who forgoes it out of charity
column11: atones for his sins. And those who do not judge by God''s revelations are unjust.'

text: 'Later
column5: in the train (of the prophets)
column6: We sent Jesus
column7: son of Mary
column8: confirming the Torah which had been (Sent down) before him
column9: and gave him the Gospel containing guidance and light
column10: which corroborated the earlier Torah
column11: a guidance and warning for those who preserve themselves from evil and follow the straight path.'

text: Let the people of the Gospel judge by what has been revealed in it by God. And those who do not judge in accordance with what God has revealed are transgressors.
'And to you We have revealed the Book containing the truth
column5: confirming the earlier revelations
column6: and preserving them (from change and corruption). So judge between them by what has been revealed by God
column7: and do not follow their whims
column8: side-stepping the truth that has reached you. To each of you We have given a law and a way and a pattern of life. If God had pleased He could surely have made you one people (professing one faith). But He wished to try and test you by that which He gave you. So try to excel in good deeds. To Him will you all return in the end
column9: when He will tell you of what you were at variance.'

text: 'Judge between them in the light of what has been revealed by God
column5: and do not follow their whims
column6: and beware of them lest they lead you away from the guidance sent down to you by God. If they turn away
column7: then know that God is sure to punish them for some of their sins; and many of them are transgressors.'

text: Do they seek a judgement of the days of pagan ignorance? But who could be a better judge than God for those who are firm in their faith?
'O believers
column5: do not hold Jews and Christians as your allies. They are allies of one another; and anyone who makes them his friends is surely one of them; and God does not guide the unjust.'

text: 'You will notice that those whose hearts are afflicted with sickness (of doubt) only hasten to join them and say: "We fear lest misfortune should surround us." It may well be that God may soon send (you) success
column5: or other command of His. Then will they be repentant of what they had concealed in their hearts.'

text: 'Then the believers will say: "Are these the people who had sworn by God on solemn oath and said: "We are surely with you?" Wasted have been all their deeds
column5: and losers they remain.'

text: 'O believers
column5: any one of you who turns back on his faith (should remember) that God could verily bring (in your place) another people whom He would love as they would love Him
column6: gentle with believers
column7: unbending with infidels
column8: who would strive in the way of God
column9: unafraid of blame by any slanderer. Such is the favour of God which He bestows on whomsoever He will. God is infinite and all-knowing.'

text: 'Your only friends are God and His Messenger
column5: and those who believe and are steadfast in devotion
column6: who pay the zakat and bow in homage (before God).'

text: 'And those who take God and His Prophet and the faithful as their friends are indeed men of God
column5: who will surely be victorious.'

text: 'O believers
column5: do not make friends with those who mock and make a sport of your faith
column6: who were given the Book before you
column7: and with unbelievers; and fear God if you truly believe;'

text: '(Nor make friends with) those who
column5: when you call (the faithful) to prayer
column6: make mock of it and jest
column7: because they do not understand.'

text: 'Say to them: "O people of the Book
column5: what reason have you for disliking us other than that we believe in God and what has been sent down to us
column6: and was sent down before
column7: and because most of you are disobedient?"'

text: 'Say: "Shall I inform you who will receive the worst chastisement from God? They who were condemned by God
column5: and on whom fell His wrath
column6: and those who were turned to apes and swine
column7: and those who worship the powers of evil. They are in the worse gradation
column8: and farthest away from the right path."'

text: When they come to you they say: "We believe;" but unbelieving they came and unbelieving go; and God is aware of what they conceal in their hearts.
'You will see among them many who rush into sin and wickedness
column5: and devour unlawful gain. How evil are the things they do!'

text: Why do not their rabbis and priests prohibit them from talking of sinful things and from devouring unlawful gain? Evil are the acts they commit!
'The Jews say: "Bound are the hands of God." Tied be their own hands
column5: and damned may they be for saying what they say! In fact
column6: both His hands are open wide: He spends of His bounty in any way He please. But what your Lord has revealed to you will only increase their rebellion and unbelief. So We have caused enmity and hatred among them (which will last) till the Day of Resurrection. As often as they ignite the fires of war they are extinguished by God. Yet they rush around to spread corruption in the land; but God does not love those who are corrupt.'

text: 'If the people of the Book had believed and feared
column5: We would surely have absolved them of their sins
column6: and admitted them to gardens of delight.'

text: 'And if they had followed the teachings of the Torah and the Gospel
column5: and what has been sent down to them by their Lord
column6: they would surely have enjoyed (blessings) from the heavens above and the earth below their feet.'

text: 'Some among them are moderate
column5: but evil is what most of them do! O Prophet
column6: announce what has reached you from your Lord
column7: for if you do not
column8: you will not have delivered His message. God will preserve you from (the mischief of) men; for God does not guide those who do not believe.'

text: 'Say to them: "O people of the Book
column5: you have no ground (for argument) until you follow the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you by your Lord." But what has been revealed to you by your Lord will surely increase rebellion and unbelief in many; so do not grieve for those who do not believe.'

text: 'All those who believe
column5: and the Jews and the Sabians and the Christians
column6: in fact any one who believes in God and the Last Day
column7: and performs good deeds
column8: will have nothing to fear or regret.'

text: 'We had taken a solemn pledge from the children of Israel
column5: and sent messengers to them; but whenever an apostle came to them bringing what did not suit their mood
column6: they called one imposter
column7: another they slew

text: And imagined that no trials would befall them; and they turned deaf and blind (to the truth). But God still turned to them; yet many of them turned blind and deaf again; but God sees everything they do.
'They are surely infidels who say: "God is the Christ
column5: son of Mary." But the Christ had only said: "O children of Israel
column6: worship God who is my Lord and your Lord." Whosoever associates a compeer with God
column7: will have Paradise denied to him by God
column8: and his abode shall be Hell; and the sinners will have none to help them.'

text: 'Disbelievers are they surely who say: "God is the third of the trinity;" but there is no god other than God the one. And if they do not desist from saying what they say
column5: then indeed those among them who persist in disbelief will suffer painful punishment.'

text: Why do they not turn to God and ask His forgiveness? God is forgiving and kind.
'The Christ
column5: son of Mary
column6: was but an apostle
column7: and many apostles had (come and) gone before him; and his mother was a woman of truth. They both ate the (same) food (as men). Behold
column8: how We show men clear signs
column9: and behold
column10: how they wander astray!'

text: 'Tell them: "Leaving God aside
column5: will you worship something that has no power over your loss or gain?" But God is all-hearing and all-knowing.'

text: 'Tell them: "O people of the Book
column5: do not overstep the bounds of truth in your beliefs
column6: and follow not the wishes of a people who had erred before
column7: and led many others astray
column8: and wandered away from the right path."'

text: 'Cursed were disbelievers among the children of Israel by David and Jesus
column5: son of Mary
column6: because they rebelled and transgressed the bounds.'

text: They did not restrain one another from the wicked things they used to do; and vile were the things that they were doing!
'You can see among them many allying themselves with the infidels. Vile it was what they sent ahead of them
column5: so that God''s indignation came upon them; and torment will they suffer an eternity.'

text: 'If they had believed in God and the Prophet and what had been revealed to him
column5: they would never have held them as allies; and many among them are transgressors.'

text: 'You will find the Jews and idolaters most excessive in hatred of those who believe; and the closest in love to the faithful are the people who say: "We are the followers of Christ
column5:
because there are priests and monks among them, and they are not arrogant.'
TQA752,QA752,TLQ01,'For when they listen to what has been revealed to this Apostle, you can see their eyes brim over with tears at the truth which they recognise, and say: O Lord
column6: we believe; put us down among those who bear witness (to the truth).'

text: And why should we not believe in God and what has come down to us of the truth? And we hope to be admitted by our Lord among those who are upright and do good?"
'God will reward them for saying so with gardens where streams flow by
column5: where they will live for ever. This is the recompense of those who do good.'

text: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations are residents of Hell.
'O believers
column5: do not forbid the good things God has made lawful for you; and do not transgress. God does not love transgressors.'

text: 'Eat what is lawful and good of the provisions God has bestowed on you
column5: and fear God in whom you believe.'

text: 'God does not punish you but for what you swear in earnest. The expiation (for breaking an oath) is feeding ten persons who are poor
column5: with food that you give your own families
column6: or clothing them
column7: or freeing a slave. But he who cannot do so should fast for three days. This is the expiation for an oath when you have sworn it. So abide by your oaths. Thus God makes His commandments clear to you: You may perhaps be grateful.'

text: 'O believers
column5: this wine and gambling
column6: these idols
column7: and these arrows you use for divination
column8: are all acts of Satan; so keep away from them. You may haply prosper.'

text: 'Satan only wishes to create among you enmity and hatred through wine and gambling
column5: and to divert you from the remembrance of God and prayer. Will you therefore not desist?'

text: 'Obey God and the Prophet
column5: and beware. If you turn away
column6: remember
column7: that the duty of Our Apostle is to give you a clear warning.'

text: 'Those who believe and perform good deeds will not be held guilty for what they have eaten (in the past) if they fear God and believe
column5: and do good things and are conscious (of God) and believe
column6: and still fear and do good
column7: for God loves those who do good.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: God will surely try you with the game that you take with your hands or your lances
column6: in order to know who fear Him unseen. Whosoever transgress after this will suffer grievous punishment.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not kill game when you are on pilgrimage. And anyone among you who does so on purpose should offer livestock of equivalent value
column6: determined by two honourable persons among you
column7: (as atonement)
column8: to be brought to the Ka''bah as an offering; or else expiate by giving food to the poor
column9: or its equivalent in fasting
column10: so that he may realise the gravity of his deed. God has forgiven what has happened in the past; but any one who does so again will be punished by God. And God is severe in requital.'

text: 'Lawful is all game of the water for you
column5: and eating of it as food
column6: so that you and the travellers may benefit by it. But unlawful is game of the jungle when you are on pilgrimage. Fear God before whom you have to gather in the end.'

text: 'God has made the Ka''bah
column5: the Sacred House
column6: a means of support for mankind
column7: as also the holy month
column8: the sacrificial offerings
column9: and consecrated cattle
column10: so that you may understand that known to God is all that is in the heavens and the earth
column11: and God has knowledge of everything.'

text: 'Know that the punishment of God is severe
column5: but that God is also forgiving and kind.'

text: It is for the Prophet to convey the message: God knows what you reveal and what you hide.
'Tell them: "The unclean and the pure are not equal
column5: even though the abundance of the unclean may be pleasing to you." So fear God
column6: O men of wisdom; you may haply find success.'

text: 'O believers
column5: do not ask about things which
column6: if made known to you
column7: may vex you. But if you ask about them when the Qur''an is being revealed they will be unfolded to you. God has overlooked (your failings) in this (respect)
column8: for God is forgiving and forbearing.'

text: 'Such things were asked by a people before you
column5: but they disbelieved them afterwards.'

text: 'God has not sanctioned Baheerah or Sa''ibah
column5: Waseelah or Ham. The unbelievers fabricate lies of God
column6: for many of them are devoid of sense.'

text: 'When you say to them: "Come to what God has revealed
column5: and the Prophet
column6: they say: Sufficient to us is the faith that our fathers had followed
column7:
even though their fathers had no knowledge or guidance.'
TQA774,QA774,TLQ01,'O you who believe, on you rests (the responsibility) for your own selves. If you follow the right path those who have gone astray will not be able to do you harm. To God have all of you to return, when He will tell you what you were doing.'
TQA775,QA775,TLQ01,'O you who believe, let two honest men among you be witness when you dictate your last will and testament as (the hour of) death draws near; and if death approaches while you are on a journey, two men other than yours. Detain them after the service of prayer, and if you doubt their word make them swear by God that: We shall not take a bribe even though it be offered by a near relative
column8: nor hide the testimony of God
column9: for then we shall surely be sinful."'

text: 'If it transpires they have concealed the truth
column5: two of those who are immediately concerned should take their place and swear by God: "Our testimony is truer than theirs. We have stated no more (than the truth)
column6: or else we shall be unjust"'

text: 'It is thus likely that men will bear witness rightly
column5: or else fear that their oaths may be disproved by oaths given after them. So fear God
column6: and do not forget that God does not guide the iniquitous.'

text: The day God will gather the apostles and ask: "What answer was made to you?" They will say: "We know not. You alone know the secrets unknown."
'And when God will say: "O Jesus
column5: son of Mary
column6: remember the favours I bestowed on you and your mother
column7: and reinforced you with divine grace that you spoke to men when in the cradle
column8: and when in the prime of life; when I taught you the law and the judgement and the Torah and the Gospel; when you formed the state of your people''s destiny out of mire and you breathed (a new spirit) into it
column9: and they rose by My leave; when you healed the blind by My leave
column10: and the leper; when you put life into the dead by My will; and when I held back the children of Israel from you when you brought to them My signs
column11: and the disbelievers among them said: "Surely these are nothing but pure magic."'

text: 'And when I inspired the disciples (through Jesus) to believe in Me and My apostle
column5: they said: "We believe
column6: and You bear witness that we submit"'

text: 'When the disciples said: "O Jesus
column5: son of Mary
column6: could your Lord send down for us a table laid with food?" he said: "Fear God
column7: if indeed you believe."'

text: 'They said: "We should like to eat of it to reassure our hearts and to know that it''s the truth you have told us
column5: and that we should be witness to it."'

text: 'Said Jesus
column5: son of Mary. "O God
column6: our Lord
column7: send down a table well laid out with food from the skies so that this day may be a day of feast for the earlier among us and the later
column8: and a token from You. Give us our (daily) bread
column9: for You are the best of all givers of food."'

text: 'And said God: "I shall send it down to you; but if any of you disbelieve after this
column5: I shall inflict such punishment on him as I never shall inflict on any other creature."'

text: 'And when God will ask: "O Jesus
column5: son of Mary
column6: did you say to mankind: ''Worship me and my mother as two deities apart from God?'' (Jesus) will answer: "Halleluja. Could I say what I knew I had no right (to say)? Had I said it You would surely have known
column7: for You know what is in my heart though I know not what You have. You alone know the secrets unknown.'

text: 'I said nought to them but what You commanded me: Worship God
column5: my Lord and your Lord. And so long as I dwelt with them I was witness over their actions. And after my life had been done
column6: You were their keeper; and You are a witness over all things.'

text: 'If You punish them
column5: indeed they are Your creatures; if You pardon them
column6: indeed You are mighty and wise."'

text: 'God will say: ''This is the day when the truthful shall profit by their truthfulness. For them will be gardens with streams running by
column5: where they will for ever abide." God will accept them
column6: and they will be gratified in (obeying) Him. This will surely be happiness supreme.'

text: 'To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth
column5: and His the power over everything.'

text: 'ALL PRAISE BE to God who created the heavens and the earth
column5: and ordained darkness and light. Yet the unbelievers make the others equal of their Lord.'

text: 'It is He who created you from clay then determined a term (of life) for you
column5: and a term (is fixed) with Him. Even then you doubt.'

text: 'He is God in the heavens and the earth. He knows what you hide and bring out into the open
column5: and knows what you earn (of good and evil).'

text: Yet no sign of their Lord comes to them but they turn away from it.
So they disbelieved the truth when it came to them; but they will soon come to know the reality of what they had ridiculed.
'Do they not see how many generations We laid low before them
column5: whom We had firmly established in the land as We have not established you
column6: and showered abundant rain on them
column7: and made rivers lap at their feet
column8: yet whom We destroyed for their sins
column9: and raised new generations after them?'

text: 'Even if We had sent you a transcript on paper which they could feel with their hands
column5: the unbelievers would have said: "This is nothing but clear sorcery."'

text: 'They say: "How is it no angel was sent down to him?" Had We sent an angel down the matter would have come to end
column5: and they would have had no respite.'

text: 'Even if We had sent down an angel as messenger he would have appeared in the garb of a man and filled them with confusion
column5: like the one they are filled with.'

text: Surely the apostles have been mocked before you; but what they had mocked rebounded on the mockers themselves.
Say: "Travel in the land and see what happened to those who disbelieved."

And ask: "To whom belongs what is in the heavens and the earth?" Say: "To God." He has prescribed grace for Himself. He will gather you on the Day of Resurrection which is certain to come. Only they who are lost of soul will not come to believe.
Whatsoever dwells in the night and day belongs to Him. He is all-hearing and all-knowing.
'Say: "Should I find some other protector besides God the Creator of the heavens and the earth
column5: who nourishes all and is nourished by none? Say: "I am commanded to be the first to submit to Him
column6: and not be an idolater."'

text: 'Say: "If I disobey my Lord
column5: I fear the punishment of a grievous Day."'

text: 'Whosoever is spared that Day will surely have mercy shown to him
column5: and this will be a clear triumph.'

text: 'If God sends you harm
column5: there is no one but He who can take it away; and if He bring you good
column6: surely He has power over everything.'

text: 'It is He who prevails over His creatures
column5: and He is all-wise and aware.'

text: 'Ask: "Of all things what is most vital as evidence?" Say: "God (who) is witness between you and me that this Qur''an has been revealed to me that I may warn you on its strength
column5: and those whom it reaches. Do you really bear witness there are other gods with God?" Tell them: "I bear no such Witness." Say: "Verily He is the only God
column6: and I am clear of what you associate (with Him)."'

text: Those to whom We have given the Book know it distinctly as they know their sons; but those who are lost of soul do not believe.
And who is more wicked than he who invents lies about God or denies His revelations? Surely the wicked will not succeed.
The day We shall gather all of them together and say to those who ascribe (partners to God): "Where are the compeers who you claimed (were equal to God)?"
'Then their excuse will be but to say: "By God our Lord
column5: we were not idolaters."'

text: 'You will see how they will lie against themselves
column5: and all their slanderings will be vain.'

text: 'There are some among them who listen to you; but We have put a covering on their hearts so that they fail to understand it

column6: the unbelievers say: "This is nothing but fables of antiquity."'

text: 'And they forbid others from (believing in) it
column5: and themselves keep away from it. But they ruin none but themselves

text: 'If you should see them when they are stood before the Fire
column5: they will say: "Ah would that we were sent back (to the world)! We shall not deny the signs of our Lord
column6: and be among those who believe."'

text: 'But no. What they were hiding has now become clear to them. If they were sent back they would surely return to what had been forbidden them
column5: for surely they are liars.'

text: 'They say: "There is no other life but that of this world
column5: and we will not be raised (from the dead)."'

text: 'If you see them when they are put before their Lord

column6: by our Lord." He will say: "Then taste the agony of punishment for what you had denied."'

text: 'They are surely lost who call the meeting with God a lie. When the Hour comes upon them unawares

text: 'As for the life of this world
column5: it is nothing but a frolic and frivolity. The final abode is the best for those who are pious and fear God. Do you not comprehend?'

text: 'We know what they say distresses you. It is not you in fact they accuse of lies

text: Many an apostle has been accused of lies before you. Yet they bore with fortitude the falsehoods and the hurt until our help arrived. There is no changing the word of God: The news of (past) apostles has come to you already.
'If their aversion still weighs upon you
column5: seek out a tunnel (going deep) into the earth
column6: or a ladder reaching out to the skies
column7: and bring them a sign: (Even then they will not believe). If God had willed He would have brought them all to the right path. So be not like the pagans.'

text: 'Only they will respond who can hear. As for the dead
column5: raised they will be by God
column6: then to Him they will be returned.'

text: They say: "How is it no miracle was sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "God certainly has power to send down a miracle; but most men cannot understand."
'There is not a thing that moves on the earth
column5: no bird that flies on its wings
column6: but has a community of its own like yours. There is nothing that We have left out from recording. Then they will all be gathered before their Lord.'

text: 'Those who deny Our revelations are deaf
column5: dumb
column6: and lost in the dark. God sends whosoever He wills astray

text: 'Say: "Have you thought if the punishment of God or the Hour (of Doom) came upon you
column5: would you call to any other than God? Answer
column6: if you are men of truth."'

text: 'No: You will call to Him alone; and He will
column5: if He please
column6: remove (the distress) for which you had called Him; and forget those you associate as compeers (with Him)'

text: 'We have indeed sent (apostles) to many a people before you
column5: and inflicted upon them hardships and afflictions so that they might submit.'

text: 'Then why did they not submit when Our punishment came upon them? But their hearts were hardened
column5: and Satan made things they were doing look attractive to them.'

text: 'When they had become oblivious of what they were warned
column5: We opened wide the gates of everything to them; yet as they rejoiced at what they were given
column6: We caught them unawares
column7: and they were filled with despair.'

text: 'Thus were the wicked people rooted out of existence to the last. All praise be to God
column5: the Lord of all the worlds.'

text: 'Say: "Imagine if God takes away your hearing and sight
column5: and sets a seal on your hearts
column6: what deity other than God will restore them to you?" See how We inflect Our signs: Even then they turn aside.'

text: 'Say: "Imagine if the punishment of God were to come unawares
column5: or openly
column6: who will perish but the evil-doers?"'

text: We do not send apostles but to give good tidings and to warn. Then those who believe or reform will have neither fear nor regret.
But those who deny Our messages will be seized by nemesis for being disobedient.
'Tell them: "I do not say that I possess the treasures of God
column5: or have knowledge of the Unknown
column6: or that I am an angel. I only follow what is sent down to me." And say: "How can a blind man and a man who can see
column7: be alike? Will you not reflect?"'

text: 'Warn those who fear
column5: through this (Qur''an)
column6: that they will be gathered before their Lord
column7: and they will have none to protect or intercede for them apart from Him. They may haply take heed for themselves.'

text: 'Do not turn away those who supplicate their Lord morning and evening
column5: seeking His magnificence. You are not accountable for them in the least
column6: nor they for you at all. If you drive them away you will only be unjust.'

text: Thus do We try men through one another so that they may ask: "Are these the ones of all of us who have been favoured by God?" Does God not know who are the grateful?
'When those who believe in Our revelations come to you
column5: say to them: "Peace on you." Your Lord has prescribed grace for Himself
column6: so that in case one of you commits evil out of ignorance
column7: then feels repentant and reforms

text: Thus distinctly do We explain Our signs that the way of sinners may become distinct.

column5: I shall be lost and not be one of those who follow the right path."'

text: 'Tell them: "A clear proof has come to me from my Lord

column6: and is the best of judges."'

text: 'Say: "If what you wish to be hastened were in my power

text: 'He has the keys of the Unknown. No one but He has knowledge; He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls without His knowledge
column5: nor a grain in the darkest (recess) of the earth
column6: nor any thing green or seared that is not recorded in the open book (of nature).'

text: 'It is He indeed who sends you to death at night

text: 'He has power over His creatures

column6: Our messengers take away his soul

text: 'Then they are taken to God
column5: their real lord and master. His indeed is the judgement; and He is swift at reckoning.'

text: 'Ask: "Who is it who comes to your rescue in the darkness of the desert and the sea

text: This (Book) has been called by your people a falsehood though it is the truth. Say: "I am not a warden over you."

text: 'As for the heedful and devout

text: 'Leave those alone who have made a sport and frolic of their faith

text: 'Say: ''Should we call in place of God one who can neither help nor do us harm

text: 'Observe (your) devotional obligations and fear (God)
