text: 'It is He who created the heavens and the earth with a definite purpose. The day He will say "Be
column5: " it will be. His word is the truth
column6: His alone the power on the Day when the blast of the trumpet will be sounded. He knows the hidden and the visible. He is all-prudent and all-knowing.'

text: 'Remember when Abraham said to Azar
column5: his father: "Why do you take idols for God? I certainly find you and your people in error."'

text: 'Thus We showed to Abraham the visible and invisible world of the heavens and the earth
column5: that he could be among those who believe.'

text: 'When the night came with her covering of darkness he saw a star
column5: and (Azar
column6: his father) said: "This is my Lord." But when the star set
column7: (Abraham) said: "I love not those that wane."'

text: 'When (Azar) saw the moon rise all aglow
column5: he said: "This is my Lord." But even as the moon set
column6: (Abraham) said: "If my Lord had not shown me the way I would surely have gone astray."'

text: 'When (Azar) saw the sun rise all resplendent
column5: he said: "My Lord is surely this
column6: and the greatest of them all." But the sun also set
column7: and (Abraham) said: "O my people
column8: I am through with those you associate (with God).'

text: I have truly turned my face towards Him who created the heavens and the earth: I have chosen one way and am not an idolater."
'His people argued
column5: and he said: "Do you argue with me about God? He has guided me already
column6: and I fear not what you associate with Him
column7: unless my Lord wills
column8: for held within the knowledge of my Lord is everything. Will you not reflect?'

text: 'And why should I fear those you associate with Him when you fear not associating others with God for which He has sent down no sanction? Tell me
column5: whose way is the way of peace
column6: if you have the knowledge?'

text: 'They alone have peace who believe and do not intermix belief with denial
column5: and are guided on the right path."'

text: This is the argument We gave to Abraham against his people. We exalt whosoever We please in rank by degrees. Your Lord is wise and all-knowing.

column5: as We had guided Noah before them
column6: and of his descendants
column7: David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus We reward those who are upright and do good.'

column5: Elisha and Jonah and Lot; And We favoured them over the other people of the world

column5: and chose them
column6: and showed them the right path.'

column5: surely vain would have been all they did.'

column7: which you display

column11:

text: '"You have come before Us all alone

column7: you imagined

text: 'Indeed it is God who splits up the seed and the kernel

column5:

column6: you will surely become an idolater.'

text: 'Can he who was lifeless

text: And thus have We placed in every city the greatest of the sinners to contrive and deceive; yet they contrive against no one but themselves even though they do not know.

'Every time a sign comes to them they say: "We shall never believe till what God''s apostles had been given comes to us." God knows best where to direct His messages. A degradation will befall the sinners and chastisement from God for deceiving.'
'Thus God guides whomsoever He please by opening wide his breast to surrender; and Straitens the breasts of those He allows to go astray
column5: (who feel suffocated) as if they were ascending the skies. Thus will God punish those who do not believe.'

column5: my life and my death

column7: the creator and Lord of all the worlds.'

text: 'No equal has He
column5: I am commanded (to declare)
column6: and that I am the first to submit."'

text: 'Say: "Shall I search for another lord apart from God when He is the only Lord of all and everything?" Each soul earns (what it earns) for itself
column5: and no man shall bear another''s burden. You have to go back to your Lord in the end when He will tell you about the things you disputed.'

text: 'It is He who made you trustees on the earth
column5: and exalted some in rank over others in order to try you by what He has given you. Indeed your Lord''s retribution is swift
column6: yet He is forgiving and kind.'

text: Alif Lam Mim Sad.
'This Book has been sent down to you; so do not hesitate to warn (the unbelievers) through it
column5: and remind the faithful.'

text: 'Follow what has been revealed to you by your Lord
column5: and do not follow any other lord apart from Him. Yet little do you care to remember.'

text: Many a habitation have We laid low before: Our retribution came upon them in the night or in the midst of siesta at noon.

column5: (if they followed their teachings)
column6: and will question the apostles.'

text: 'We shall recount (their deeds) to them with knowledge

text: 'And the weighing will be just on that Day. Then those whose (deeds) are heavier in the balance will find fulfilment
And those whose (deeds) are lighter in the scale shall perish for violating Our signs.
'We settled you on the earth
column5: and provided means of livelihood for you in it; but little are the thanks you give.'

text: 'Verily We created you and gave you form and shape
column5: and ordered the angels to bow before Adam in homage; and they all bowed but Iblis who was not among those who bowed.'

text: '"What prevented you" (said God)
column5: "from bowing (before Adam) at My bidding?" "I am better than him
column6: said he. You created me from fire
column7: and him from clay."'

text: 'So God said: "Descend. You have no right to be insolent here. Go
column5: and away; you are one of the damned."'

text: '"Grant me respite
column5: said he, till the raising of the dead."'

text: And God said: "You have the respite."
'"Since You led me into error

text: 'And I shall come upon them from the front and behind
column5: right and left; and You will not find among them many who would give thanks."'

text: '"Begone
column5: said (God), contemptible and rejected! As for those who follow you
column6: I shall fill up Hell with all of you.'

text: 'And you
column5: O Adam
column6: and your spouse
column7: live in the Garden and eat your fill wheresoever you like

text: 'But Satan suggested (evil) to them
column5: in order to reveal their hidden parts of which they were not aware (till then)
column6: and said: "Your Lord has forbidden you (to go near) this tree that you may not become angels or immortal."'

text: Then he said to them on oath: "I am your sincere friend;"

And led them (to the tree) by deceit. When they tasted (the fruit) of the tree their disgrace became exposed to them; and they patched the leaves of the Garden to hide it. And the Lord said to them: "Did I not forbid you this tree? And I told you that Satan was your open enemy.
'They said: "O our Lord
column5: we have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us
column6: we shall certainly be lost."'

text: '"Go
column5: said God, one the antagonist of the other
column6: and live on the earth for a time ordained
column7: and fend for yourselves.'

text: 'You will live there
column5: and there will you die
column6: He said, and be raised from there (On the Day of Doom)."'

text: 'O sons of Adam
column5: We have revealed to you a dress that would both hide your nakedness and be an adornment
column6: but the raiment of piety is best. This is one of the tokens of God: You may haply reflect.'

text: 'O sons of Adam
column5: let not Satan beguile you as he did your parents out of Eden
column6: and made them disrobe to expose their disgrace to them. For he and his host can see you from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils the friends of those who do not believe

text: 'Who say when they commit shameful acts: "Our ancestors used to do so
column5: and God has enjoined us to do the same." Say to them: "God never enjoins a conduct that is shameful. You impute such lies to God as you do not know."'

text: 'Tell them: "My Lord has enjoined piety
column5: devotion in all acts of worship
column6: and calling upon Him with exclusive obedience. For you will be reverted back to what you were (when) created first."'

text: 'A Section (among them) were guided
column5: a section were bound to go astray
column6: (for) instead of God they took the devils as their friends; yet they think they are on the right path.'

text: 'O sons of Adam
column5: attire yourselves at every time of worship; eat and drink
column6: but do not be wasteful

text: 'Ask them: "Who forbids you attire that God has given to His creatures

text: 'Tell them: "My Lord has forbidden repugnant acts
column5: whether open or disguised
column6: sin and unjust oppression
column7: associating others with God
column8: of which He has sent down no authority
column9: and saying things of God of which you have no knowledge."'

text: 'A term is fixed for every people; and when their appointed time is come there will neither be a moment''s delay nor haste.'
'O sons of Adam
column5: when apostles come to you from among you
column6: who convey My messages
column7: then those who take heed and amend will have neither fear nor regret.'

text: 'But those who deny Our signs and disdain them
column5: shall belong to Hell
column6: where they will abide for ever.'

text: 'Who could be more wicked than he who imputes lies to God or denies His revelations? Such as these will receive what is declared in the Book
column5: and when Our angels come to draw out their souls and ask: "Where are they you worshipped other than God?" They will answer: "They have left us and fled;" and bear witness against themselves for being infidels.'

text: '"Enter then the Fire
column5: will God say, with the past generations of jinns and men." On entering each batch will condemn the other; and when all of them shall have entered one after the other
column6: the last to come will say of those who had come before them: "O our Lord

text: Then the former will say to the latter: "You have no privilege over us. So taste the punishment for what you had done."

column5: the gates of heaven shall not be opened
column6: nor will they enter Paradise
column7: not till the camel passes through the needle''s eye. That is how We requite the transgressors:'

text: For them is a flooring of Hell and a covering (of fire). That is how We requite the iniquitous.
'As for those who believe and do good
column5: We never burden a soul beyond capacity. They are men of Paradise where they will abide for ever.'

text: 'Whatever the rancour they may have in their hearts We shall (cleanse and) remove. Streams of running water shall ripple at their feet
column5: and they will say: "We are grateful to God for guiding us here. Never would we have been guided if God had not shown us the way. The apostles of our Lord had indeed brought the truth." And the cry shall resound: "This is Paradise you have inherited as meed for your deeds."'

text: 'And the inmates of Paradise will call to the residents of Hell: "We have found that the promise made to us by our Lord was true. Have you also found the promise of your Lord to be true?" They will answer: "Yes (it is so)." Then a crier will call from among them: "The curse of God be on the vile
'"Who obstruct those who follow the path of God and try to make it oblique
column5: who do not believe in the life to come."'

text: 'There will be a veil between them
column5: and on the wall will be the men (of al-A''raf) who will recognise everyone by their distinguishing marks
column6: and will call to the inmates of Paradise: "Peace on you
column7:
without having entered it themselves though hoping to do so.'
TQA1001,QA1001,TLQ01,'When their eyes fall on the inmates of Hell they will say: O Lord

text: 'Recognising them by their marks the men of al-A''raf will call (to the inmates of Hell): "Of what use was your amassing (of wealth) of which you were proud?"'
'(Then pointing to the inmates of Paradise
column5: they will say): "Are they not those of whom you had sworn and said: ''God will not have mercy on them?'' (And yet they have been told
column6: ) ''Enter Paradise where you will have no fear or regret.''"'

text: 'Those in Hell will call to the inmates of Paradise: "Pour a little water over us

text: Who made a sport and frolic of their faith and were lured by the life of the world. As they had forgotten the meeting of this Day so shall We neglect them today for having rejected Our signs.

column5: replete with knowledge
column6: and guidance and grace for men who believe.'

text: 'Are they waiting for the exposition of what it speaks of? The day that (Reality) is unravelled
column5: the people who had lost sight of it will say: "The apostles of our Lord had indeed brought the truth. Do we have any one to intercede for us? If only we could go back to the world
column6: we would act otherwise." Indeed they have caused themselves harm

text: 'Surely your Lord is God who created the heavens and the earth in six spans of time
column5: then assumed all power. He covers up the day with night which comes chasing it fast; and the sun and moon and the stars are subject to His command. It is His to create and enjoin. Blessed be God
column6: the Lord of all the worlds.'

text: Pray to your Lord in humility and unseen. He does not love the iniquitous.

column5: bringing heavy clouds which We drive towards a region lying dead
column6: and send down rain
column7: and raise all kinds of fruits. So shall We raise the dead that you may think and reflect.'

text: 'The soil that is good produces (rich) crops by the will of its Lord
column5: and that which is had yields only what is poor. So do We explain Our signs in different ways to people who give thanks.'

text: 'We sent Noah to his people
column5: and he said: "O people worship God; you have no other god but He; for I fear the retribution of the great Day may fall on you."'

text: The elders of his people replied: "We see clearly that you have gone astray."
'"I have not gone astray
column5: O my people
column6: he said, but have been sent by my Lord
column7: the creator of all the worlds.'

text: 'I bring to you the messages of my Lord
column5: and give you sincere advice
column6: for I know from God what you do not know.'

text: 'Do you wonder that a warning has come to you from your Lord through a man who is one of you
column5: and warns you to take heed for yourselves and fear God? You might be treated with mercy."'

text: 'But they called him a liar
column5: and We saved him and those with him in the Ark
column6: and drowned the others who rejected Our signs
column7: for they were a people purblind.'

text: 'And We sent Hud
column5: their brother
column6: to the people of ''Ad. He said: "O you people
column7: worship God
column8: for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"'

text: 'The chiefs of his people who were infidels replied: "We find you full of folly
column5: and a liar to boot."'

text: '"I am not a fool
column5: O people
column6: he answered, but have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds.'

text: I bring to you the messages of my Lord. I am your sincere friend.
'Do you wonder that a warning has come to you from your Lord through a man who is one of you and warns you? Remember
column5: He made you leaders after the people of Noah
column6: and gave you a greater increase in your stature. So think of the favours of God; you may haply be blessed."'

text: 'They answered: "Have you come to say to us that we should worship only one God
column5: abandoning those our ancestors had worshipped? If so
column6: bring on us what you threaten us with

text: 'He replied: "You have already been beset with punishment and the wrath of God. Why dispute with me about names invented by you and your ancestors for which no sanction was sent down? So wait (for what is to come)

text: 'Then We saved him and those on his side by Our grace

text: 'We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh. "O you people

column6: for you have no other god but He. Clear proof has come to you already from your Lord

text: 'Remember
column5: how you were made leaders after the people of ''Ad
column6: and were settled on the land so that you could construct on the plains palaces
column7: and carve dwellings out of mountains. So think of the favours of God

text: 'The chiefs among the people who were arrogant towards the weaker ones among them who believed

'Then they hamstrung the she-camel and rebelled against the command of their Lord
column5: and said: "Bring
column6: O Saleh
column7: on us the affliction you promise
column8: if you are one of the sent ones."'

text: 'Then they were seized by an earthquake
column5: and lay overturned on the ground in their homes in the morning.'

text: 'Saleh turned away from them and said: "O my people
column5: I conveyed to you the message of my Lord and warned you; but you do not like those who wish you well."'

text: 'And We sent Lot
column5: who said to his people: "Why do you commit this lecherous act which none in the world has committed before?'

text: In preference to women you satisfy your lust with men. Indeed you are a people who are guilty of excess."
'His people made no answer

text: And We rained down on them a shower (of Stones). So witness the end of sinners!
'Remember
column5: We sent to Midian their brother Shu''aib. "O you people
column6: he said, worship God
column7: for you have no other god but He. Clear proof has come to you from your Lord; so give in full measure and full weight; do not keep back from people what is theirs

text: 'Do not lie in ambush to intimidate and divert from the path of God those who believe in Him

text: 'If some of you believe what has been sent through me
column5: and some of you do not

text: 'The arrogant leaders of the people replied: "We shall drive you away from our land
column5: O Shu''aib
column6: and those who are with you
column7: unless you come back to your faith." But he remarked: "Even if we are disgusted with it?'

column5: and lay overturned on the ground in their homes in the morning.'

text: There is not a region to which We sent a prophet and did not inflict upon its people adversity and hardship so that they may submit.

column5: and they rose and prospered

text: 'But if the people of these regions had believed and feared God

text: Are the people of the region so secure that they lie asleep unaware as Our punishment overtakes them?

column5: are the people of the towns so unafraid that (even when) Our retribution comes upon them in the hours of the morning they remain engrossed in sport and play?'

text: Can they remain secure against the plan of God? Only they feel secure against the plan of God who are certain of being ruined.

column5: and put seals on their hearts that they may not hear (the voice of truth)?'

text: 'These were the (earlier) habitations whose accounts We have given to you. Their apostles came with clear proofs
column5: but they did not believe what they once denied. That is how God seals the hearts of those who do not believe.'

text: 'We did not find many of them faithful to their promises

text: 'So We sent Moses with miracles after (these apostles) to the Pharaoh and his nobles

text: 'Moses said: "O Pharaoh
column5: I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds;'

'He said: "If you have brought a sign then display it

text: 'At this Moses threw down his staff
column5: and lo
column6: it became a live serpent.'

text: 'And he drew forth his hand
column5: and behold
column6: it looked white to those who beheld it.'

text: The nobles of Pharaoh said: "He surely is a clever magician.

They said: "Put him and his brother off (awhile) and send out heralds to the cities
To bring all the wise magicians to you.

'"Yes
column5: said he, you will be among the honoured."'

text: 'So they said: "O Moses
column5: you may cast your spell first

text: '"You cast it first
column5:
answered Moses. When they cast their spell, they bewitched the eyes of the people and petrified them by conjuring up a great charm.'

text: 'Thus the truth was upheld
column5: and the falsehood that they practised was exposed.'

text: 'Thus there and then they were vanquished and overthrown
column5: humiliated.'

text: 'The sorcerers fell to the ground in homage
'And said: "We have come to believe in the Lord of all the worlds
The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

text: They answered: "We have (in any case) to go back to our Lord.

text: 'And the leaders of Pharaoh''s people said to him: "Would you allow Moses and his people to create disorder in the land and discard you and your gods?" He replied: "We shall now slay their sons and spare their women

text: We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with famine and dearth of everything that they might take heed.

text: 'They said: "Whatsoever the sign you have brought to deceive us
column5: we shall not believe in you."'

text: 'So We let loose on them floods and locusts
column5: and vermin
column6: frogs and blood -- how many different signs. But they still remained arrogant

text: 'Yet when punishment overtook them
column5: they said: "O Moses

text: But no sooner was the punishment withdrawn for a time to enable them to make good their promise than they broke it.

text: 'We then made the people who were weak (and oppressed) successors of the land to the East and the West which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the children of Israel was fulfilled

text: 'When We brought the children of Israel across the sea
column5: and they came to a people who were devoted to their idols
column6: they said: "O Moses

column8:
he replied.'

text: '"Do you want me to seek for you
column5: he said, a god other than God

text: '"Remember (the day) when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh who oppressed and afflicted you

text: 'We made an appointment of thirty nights with Moses (On Mount Sinai) to which We added ten more; so the term set by the Lord was completed in forty nights. Moses said to Aaron
column5: his brother: "Deputise for me among my people. Dispose rightly

text: 'When Moses arrived at the appointed time and his Lord spoke to him
column5: he said: "O Lord
column6: reveal Yourself to me that I may behold You." "You cannot behold Me

column8: it crumbled to a heap of dust
column9: and Moses fell unconscious. When he came to

text: 'Said (the Lord): "O Moses

text: 'And We wrote down on tablets admonitions and clear explanations of all things for Moses

column6: and command your people to observe the best in them. I will show you the abode of the wicked.'

text: 'I will turn those away from My signs who behave unjustly with arrogance in the land so that even though they see all the signs they will not believe in them; and if they see the path of rectitude
column5: will not take it to be a way; and if they see the way of error take it to be the (right) path. This is so for they have called Our messages lies

text: Vain are the acts of those who deny Our signs and the meeting in the Hereafter. Can they ever be rewarded for anything but what they did?
'In the absence of Moses his people prepared the image of a calf from their ornaments
column5: which gave out the mooing of a cow. Yet they did not see it could neither speak to them nor guide them to the right path. Even then they took it (for a deity) and did wrong.'

text: Then they were filled with remorse and saw that they had erred and said: "If our Lord does not forgive us we will surely be lost."
'When Moses returned to his people
column5: indignant and grieved
column6: he said: "How wickedly you behaved in my absence. Why must you hasten the decree of your Lord?" And he cast aside the tablets
column7: and pulled his brother by the hair. "O son of my mother
column8: said (Aaron), these people took advantage of my weakness and almost killed me. Do not let my enemies rejoice at my plight
column9: and do not put me down among transgressors."'

text: '(Moses) said: "O Lord
column5: forgive me and my brother
column6: and admit us to Your grace
column7: for You are the most compassionate of all."'

text: 'Surely those who have taken the calf (as a god) will suffer the anger of their Lord

text: 'Yet those who do wrong
column5: then repent and believe
column6: are forgiven
column7: for your Lord is forgiving and kind.'

text: When his anger subsided Moses picked up the tablets. Inscribed on them was guidance and grace for those who fear their Lord.
'Moses chose seventy of his people for the appointment (on Mount Sinai). When they arrived they were seized by a tremor. (Moses) said: "O Lord
column5: if You had so pleased You could have annihilated them and me before this. Will You destroy us for something the foolish among us have done? This is but a trial from You whereby You will lead whom You will astray and guide whom You please. You are our saviour
column6: so forgive us and have mercy on us
column7: for You are the best of forgivers.'

text: 'Enjoin for us good in the world
column5: and good in the world to come. We turn to You alone." And the Lord said: "I punish only those whom I will
column6: but My mercy enfolds everything. I shall enjoin it for those who take heed for themselves
column7: who pay the zakat and believe in My signs

text: 'Who follow the messenger
column5: the gentile Prophet
column6: described in the Torah and the Gospel
column7: who bids things noble and forbids things vile
column8: makes lawful what is clean
column9: and prohibits what is foul
