text: 'Say: "O men
column5: I am verily the apostle of God to you all. His whose kingdom extends over the heavens and the earth. There is no god but He
column6: the giver of life and death. So believe in God and the messenger
column7: the gentile Prophet
column8: sent by Him
column9: who believes in God and His messages. Obey him; you may haply be guided aright."'

text: 'Among the people of Moses is a section that shows the way to the truth
column5: and deals justly in accordance with it.'

text: 'We divided them into twelve (different) tribes. When his people asked for water
column5: We said to Moses: "Strike the rock with your staff;" and behold
column6: twelve springs of water gushed forth
column7: so that each of the tribes had a place of its own to drink; and We made the clouds spread shade over them and sent for them manna and quails (and said): "Eat of the good things We have provided for you." But (by disobeying) they did not harm Us
column8: they harmed themselves.'

text: 'And when it was said to them: "Live in this land and eat of its produce wheresoever you like
column5: and ask for remission of your sins
column6: but pass through the gates with submission (and not pride)
column7: We shall forgive your trespasses
column8: and give to those who are righteous abundance
column9:
'
TQA1116,QA1116,TLQ01,The wicked among them changed and perverted the word We had spoken to a word unpronounced; so We sent from heaven retribution on them for all their wickedness.
TQA1117,QA1117,TLQ01,'Enquire of them about the town situated by the sea where, when they did not keep the Sabbath, the fish came up to the surface of the water for them; but on days other than the Sabbath the fish did not come. We tried them in this way, for they were disobedient.'
TQA1118,QA1118,TLQ01,'When a Section of them said: Why do you admonish a people whom God is about to destroy or to punish severely?" They replied: "To clear ourselves of blame before your Lord
column10: and that they may fear God.'

text: 'But when they forgot to remember the warning
column5: We saved those who prohibited evil
column6: but inflicted on the wicked a dreadful punishment -- requital for their disobedience.'

text: 'When they persisted in doing what they had been forbidden
column5: We said to them: "Become (like) apes despised."'

text: 'And your Lord declared He would send men against them who would inflict dreadful suffering on them till the Day of Doom
column5: for your Lord is swift in retribution
column6: though He is certainly forgiving and kind.'

text: 'We dispersed them in groups over the earth
column5: some righteous
column6: some otherwise; and We tried them with good things and bad
column7: that they may haply turn back.'

text: 'Then after them a new generation inherited the Book. They took to the things of this base world
column5: and said: "We shall (surely) be forgiven this." Yet they will accept similar things if they came their way again. Had they not been covenanted in the Book to say nothing in the name of God but the truth? And they have read this in it. The abode of the life to come is better for those who fear God. Can they not comprehend?'

text: 'As for those who adhere to the Book and are firm in devotion
column5: We shall certainly not let the wages of those who are upright to go waste.'

text: 'The day We shook the mountain above them like an awning
column5: and they feared it would fall over them
column6: (We said): "Hold fast to what We have given you
column7: and bear in mind what is (said) therein so that you may take heed."'

text: 'When your Lord brings forth from their loins the offspring of the children of Adam
column5: He makes them witnesses over themselves
column6: (and asks): "Am I not your Lord?" ''Indeed
column7: '' they reply. ''We bear witness
column8: '' -- lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection: "We were not aware of this;"'

text: 'Or
column5: lest they should say: "It were our fathers who had ascribed compeers to God; we are only their offspring. Will You destroy us for the deeds of those who dealt in vanities?"'

text: That is how We explain Our signs distinctly so that they may come back (to the right path).
'Relate to them the plight of the man whom We gave Our signs
column5: but he passed them by
column6: so that Satan came after him
column7: and he went astray.'

text: 'We wished to exalt him
column5: but he loved baseness and followed his lust. His likeness is that of a dog who hangs out his tongue if you drive him away
column6: and still hangs it out if you leave him alone. Such is the case of the people who deny Our signs. Narrate this history to them; they may haply reflect.'

text: Evil is the case of those who deny Our signs and wrong themselves.
He alone is guided whom God shows the way; and whom He leads astray is surely lost.
'Many of the jinns and human beings have We destined for Hell
column5: who possess hearts but do not feel
column6: have eyes but do not see
column7: have ears but do not hear
column8: like cattle
column9: even worse than them. They are people unconcerned.'

text: 'All the names of God are beautiful
column5: so call Him by them; and leave those alone who act profanely towards His names: They will be retributed for their deeds.'

text: 'Yet there are among those We have created people who lead (others) to the truth
column5: and act justly in its light'

text: We shall punish those who deny Our revelations slowly in a way that they will not know.
I will just give them respite. My plan is certainly invincible.
Have they not bethought themselves their companion is not mad? He is only a plain admonisher.
'Have they not contemplated the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything created by God
column5: (to educe) that perhaps their own term is drawing to a close? In what lore after this would they then believe?'

text: 'Whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way
column5: for He leaves them to wander perplexed in their wickedness.'

text: 'They ask you about the Hour: "When is its determined time?" Say: "Only my Lord has the knowledge. No one can reveal it except He. Oppressive will it be for the heavens and the earth. When it comes
column5: it will come unawares." They ask you about it as if you were in the know. You tell them: "Only God has the knowledge." But most people do not know.'

text: 'Tell them: "I am not master of my own gain or loss but as God may please. If I had the knowledge of the Unknown I would have enjoyed abundance of the good
column5: and no evil would have touched me. I am only a bearer of warnings and bringer of happy news for those who believe."'

text: 'It is He who created you from a single cell
column5: and from it created its mate
column6: that you may live as companions. When the man covered the woman she conceived a light burden and carried it about. And when she was heavy (with child) they prayed together to their Lord: "If You bestow a healthy son on us we shall truly be grateful."'

text: 'But when they were given a healthy son
column5: they started ascribing to other powers a share in what God had bestowed on them. But God is above what they ascribe to Him.'

text: 'Do they associate those with Him who cannot create a thing
column5: and are themselves created

text: 'Who can neither help them
column5: nor help themselves?'

text: If you call them to guidance they will not follow you. It is all the same if you call them or hold your tongue.
'Those whom you invoke besides God are created beings like you. So call on them and let them answer your call
column5: if what you say is true.'

text: 'Do they have feet to walk on
column5: or hands to hold with
column6: or eyes to see and ears to hear with? Say to them: "Call your compeers
column7: and work out a plot against me
column8: and do not give me time.'

text: My saviour is God who has revealed this Book; and He protects those who are upright;
While those you beseech apart from Him cannot help you or even help themselves.
'When you call upon them for guidance
column5: they do not hear. When you think they are looking at you
column6: (in fact) they cannot see."'

text: 'Cultivate tolerance
column5: enjoin justice
column6: and avoid the fools.'

text: 'If you are instigated by the Devil to evil seek refuge in God
column5: for God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'Verily those who fear God think of Him when assailed by the instigations of Satan
column5: and lo! they begin to understand

text: 'Even though their (devilish) brothers would like them to continue in error
column5: and would not desist.'

text: 'And when you do not bring a (Qur''anic) verse to them
column5: they say: "Why don''t you make one up?" Say: "I follow only what my Lord reveals to me." These (revelations) are an evident proof from your Lord
column6: and a guidance and grace for those who believe.'

text: 'When the Qur''an is recited listen to it in silence. You may perhaps be blessed.'
'Meditate on your Lord inwardly with humility and trepidation
column5: reciting His Book softly
column6: morning and evening
column7: and be not negligent.'

text: 'Verily those who are in the presence of your Lord are never too proud to worship and celebrate His praises
column5: and bow in homage to Him''.'

text: 'THEY ASK YOU of (benefits accruing as) spoils of war. Tell them: "The benefits belong to God and His Messenger." So fulfil your duty to God and keep peace among yourselves. Obey God and the Prophet
column5: If you really believe.'

text: 'Only they are true believers whose hearts fill up with awe when the name of God is mentioned; and their faith is further strengthened when His messages are read out to them; and those who place their trust in their Lord
'Who are firm in devotion
column5: and spend of what We have given them

text: 'Are true believers. There are for them (high) ranks with their Lord
column5: and pardon and noble provision.'

text: 'As your Lord sent you from your home (to fight) for the true cause
column5: a section of the faithful were averse

text: 'Who argued with you about the matter even after it had become quite clear
column5: as if they were being pushed into (the arms of) death as they waited.'

text: 'Though God promised that one of two columns (would fall to you)
column5: you desired the one that was not armed. But God wished to confirm the truth by His words
column6: and wipe the unbelievers out to the last

text: 'So that Truth may be affirmed and falsehood negated
column5: even though the sinners be averse.'

text: 'Remember when you prayed to your Lord for help
column5: He heard you and said: "I shall send a thousand angels following behind you for your aid."'

text: 'He gave you the good news only to reassure your hearts
column5: for victory comes from God alone
column6: and certainly God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'A blanketing sleep came over you as a (measure of) security from Him
column5: and He sent down rain from the skies to cleanse you
column6: and to remove the plague of Satan
column7: and to strengthen your hearts and steady your steps.'

text: 'And the Lord said to the angels: "I am with you; go and strengthen the faithful. I shall fill the hearts of infidels with terror. So smite them on their necks and every joint
column5: (and incapacitate them)
column6:
'
TQA1173,QA1173,TLQ01,For they had opposed God and His Apostle; but whosoever opposes God and his Apostle (should know) that God is severe in retribution.
TQA1174,QA1174,TLQ01,'For you is this (punishment) to taste, for the infidels the torment of Hell.'
TQA1175,QA1175,TLQ01,'O believers, when you meet unbelievers on the field of battle, do not turn your backs to them.'
TQA1176,QA1176,TLQ01,'For any one who turns his back on that day, except to manoeuvre or rally to his side, will bring the wrath of God on himself, and have Hell as abode; and what an evil destination!'
TQA1177,QA1177,TLQ01,'It was not you who killed them, but God did so. You did not throw what you threw, (sand into the eyes of the enemy at Badr), but God, to bring out the best in the faithful by doing them a favour of His own. God is all-hearing and all-knowing.'
TQA1178,QA1178,TLQ01,'That was that, but remember God will make the plots of the unbelievers contemptible.'
TQA1179,QA1179,TLQ01,'You had asked for a judgement, so the judgement has come to you (In the form of victory for the faithful). So, if you desist it will be better for you. If you come back to it, We shall do the same, and your forces, however large, will not be of the least avail, for God is with those who believe.'
TQA1180,QA1180,TLQ01,'O believers, obey God and His Messenger, and do not turn away from him when you hear (him speak);'
TQA1181,QA1181,TLQ01,'And do not be like those who say: We have heard
column7:
but do not hear.'
TQA1182,QA1182,TLQ01,The worst of creatures in the eyes of God are those who are deaf and dumb and devoid of sense.
TQA1183,QA1183,TLQ01,If God had seen any good in them He would surely have made them hear. Now even if He makes them hear they will turn away (in obduracy).
TQA1184,QA1184,TLQ01,'O believers, respond to the call of God and His Prophet when he calls you to what will give you life (and preservation). Remember that God intervenes between man and his heart, and that you will be gathered before Him.'
TQA1185,QA1185,TLQ01,'Beware of sedition, which does not affect the oppressors alone among you, and know that the punishment of God is severe.'
TQA1186,QA1186,TLQ01,'Remember, when you were few and powerless in the land, afraid of despoliation at the hands of men. But then God sheltered and helped you to strength, and provided for you good things that you may perhaps be grateful.'
TQA1187,QA1187,TLQ01,'O you who believe, do not be faithless to God and His Apostle, nor violate your trusts knowingly.'
TQA1188,QA1188,TLQ01,'Know that your worldly possessions and your children are just a temptation, and that God has greater rewards with Him.'
TQA1189,QA1189,TLQ01,'O believers, if you follow the path shown by God, He will give you a standard (of right and wrong), and overlook your sins, and forgive you. God is abounding in benevolence.'
TQA1190,QA1190,TLQ01,'Remember, when the infidels contrived to make you a prisoner or to murder or expel you, they plotted, but God also planned; and God''s plan is the best.'
TQA1191,QA1191,TLQ01,'When Our messages were read out to them, they said: We have heard. We could certainly compose (writings) like them if we choose. They are but only tales of long ago."'

text: 'They had also said: "If this be the truth from you
column5: O God
column6: then rain down on us stones from the skies
column7: or inflict a grievous punishment upon us."'

text: 'But God would not choose to punish them while you are in their midst
column5: nor afflict them when they are seeking forgiveness.'

text: 'But what is there so special they have that God should not punish them when they obstruct people from the Holy Mosque
column5: though they are not its (appointed) guardians? Its guardians could be only those who are pious and devout. But most of them do not know.'

text: Their worship in the House of God has been no more than whistling and clapping. So they have to taste the punishment for disbelief.
'Those who disbelieve spend their possessions on turning men away from God. They will go on spending and rue it in the end
column5: and will be subdued. But those who remain disbelievers shall be gathered into Hell'

text: 'That God may separate the bad from the good
column5: and link the wicked together and cast them into Hell. These are verily the people who will lose.'

text: 'You tell the unbelievers in case they desist whatever has happened will be forgiven them. If they persist
column5: they should remember the fate of those who have gone before them.'

text: 'So
column5: fight them till all opposition ends
column6: and obedience is wholly God''s. If they desist then verily God sees all they do.'

text: 'But if they are obstinate
column5: know that God is your helper and protector: How excellent a helper
column6: and how excellent a protector is He!'

text: 'Know that one-fifth of what you acquire as booty (of war) is for God and His Apostle
column5: and for relatives and orphans
column6: the poor and wayfarers
column7: if you truly believe in God and what We revealed to Our votary on the day of victory over the infidels when the two armies clashed (at Badr). For God has the power to do any thing.'

text: '(That day) when you were at one end of the valley
column5: (the unbelievers) at the other
column6: and the caravan below you (on the lowland by the coast)
column7: you would surely have declined to fight if (the Makkans) had offered you battle. (But the battle did take place) that God may end the matter which had been accomplished
column8: so that he who had to die may perish after a clear demonstration
column9: and he who had to live may survive in the light of positive proof
column10: for God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'God showed (the Makkans) to be few in your dream
column5: for if He had shown them to be many you would surely have lost courage and disagreed about the (wisdom) of the battle. But God spared you this
column6: for He surely knows what is in the hearts of men.'

text: 'When you faced them He made (the enemy) seem few to you in numbers
column5: and made you appear fewer in their eyes
column6: (it was) so that God could accomplish what had been decreed; for all things rest with God.'

text: 'O believers
column5: when you meet an army
column6: stand firm
column7: and think of God a great deal that you may be blessed with success.'

text: 'Obey God and His Apostle
column5: and do not disagree among yourselves or you will be unmanned and lose courage. Persevere
column6: for God is with those who endure.'

text: 'Do not be like those who went out of their homes full of their own importance
column5: ostentatiously
column6: trying to hinder others from the way of God. But God encompasses all they do.'

text: 'Satan made their deeds look alluring to them
column5: and said: "None will prevail over you this day
column6: for I shall be near at hand." Yet when the two armies appeared face to face
column7: he turned back and fled
column8: saying: "I am not with you
column9: for I can see what you cannot perceive. I fear God
column10: for His punishment is severe."'

text: 'The hypocrites
column5: and those who had doubts in their hearts
column6: said: "Their faith has misled them." But whoever places his trust in God will find God mighty and wise.'

text: 'If you could only see the infidels as the angels draw away their souls and strike their faces and their backs
column5: (saying): "Taste the torment of burning'

text: 'For what you have brought upon yourselves." God is surely not unjust to His creatures
column5: (they are unjust to themselves).'

text: 'Their case is like that of Pharaoh''s people
column5: and of those before them
column6: who denied the revelations of God
column7: and were punished for their sins by God
column8: and God is all powerful and Severe His punishment.'

text: 'God does not withdraw a favour bestowed upon a people unless they change themselves
column5: for God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'This was the case with the people of Pharaoh and those before them
column5: who rejected the signs of their Lord and were destroyed for their sins
column6: and We drowned the people of Pharaoh as they were oppressors.'

text: 'Verily the worst of creatures in the sight of God are those who deny (the truth)
column5: and will not believe.'

text: 'As for those with whom you have made a treaty and who abrogate it every time
column5: and do not fear God

text: 'If you meet them in battle
column5: inflict on them such a defeat as would be a lesson for those who come after them
column6: and that they may be warned.'

text: 'If you apprehend treachery from a people (with whom you have a treaty)
column5: retaliate by breaking off (relations) with them
column6: for God does not like those who are treacherous.'

text: The infidels should not think that they can bypass (the law of God). Surely they cannot get away.
'Prepare against them whatever arms and cavalry you can muster
column5: that you may strike terror in (the hearts of) the enemies of God and your own
column6: and others besides them not known to you
column7: but known to God. Whatever you spend in the way of God will be paid back to you in full
column8: and no wrong will be done to you.'

text: 'But if they are inclined to peace
column5: make peace with them
column6: and have trust in God
column7: for He hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'If they try to cheat you
column5: God is surely sufficient for you. It is He who has strengthened you with His help and with believers'

text: 'Whose hearts He cemented with love. You could never have united their hearts even if you had spent whatever (wealth) is in the earth; but God united them with love
column5: for He is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'God is sufficient for you
column5: O Prophet
column6: and the faithful who follow you.'

text: 'O Prophet
column5: urge the faithful to fight. If there are twenty among you with determination they will vanquish two hundred; and if there are a hundred then they will vanquish a thousand unbelievers
column6: for they are people devoid of understanding.'

text: 'God has lightened your burden as He knows you are weak: So
column5: if there are a hundred men of firm determination among you
column6: they will vanquish two hundred; and if there are a thousand of you they will vanquish two thousand by the will of God
column7: for God is with those who are determined.'

text: 'No apostle should take captives until he has battled and subdued the country. You desire the vanities of this world
column5: but God wills (for you the reward) of the world to come; and God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'Had this not been decreed by God in advance
column5: you would have suffered a grievous punishment for what you took (as booty).'

text: 'But now use such of the spoils as are lawful and good
column5: and fear God
column6: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'O Prophet
column5: tell the captives you have taken: "If God finds some good in your hearts
column6: He will reward you with something better than was taken away from you
column7: and forgive your sins
column8: for God is forgiving and kind."'

text: 'If they try to deceive you
column5: remember they have deceived God before. So He gave you mastery over them
column6: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'Those who accepted the faith and set out of their homes
column5: and fought in the way of God wealth and soul
column6: and those who gave them shelter and helped them
column7: are friends of one another. You are not responsible for protecting those who embraced the faith but did not leave their homes
column8: until they do so. In ease they ask for your help in the name of faith
column9: you are duty bound to help them
column10: except against a people with whom you have a treaty; for God sees all that you do.'

text: Those who are infidels aid one another. Unless you do the same there will be discord in the land and anarchy.
'Those who accepted the faith and abandoned their homes
column5: and struggled in the cause of God
column6: and those who gave them shelter and helped them
column7: are veritably true believers. For them is forgiveness and noble sustenance.'

text: 'Those who accepted the faith and left their homes and fought by your side
column5: are your brothers; yet those who are related by blood are closer to one another according to the decree of God. Verily God knows everything.'

text: IMMUNITY is granted those idolaters by God and his Apostle with whom you have a treaty.
'(They can) move about for four months freely in the land
column5: but should know they cannot escape (the law of) God
column6: and that God can put the unbelievers to shame.'

text: 'A general proclamation is (made) this day of the Greater Pilgrimage on the part of God and His Apostle
column5: that God is not bound (by any contract) to idolaters
column6: nor is His Apostle. It is
column7: therefore
column8: better for you to repent. If you do not
column9: remember that you cannot elude (the grip of) God. So announce to those who deny the truth the news of painful punishment

text: 'Except those idolaters with whom you have a treaty
column5: who have not failed you in the least
column6: nor helped anyone against you. Fulfil your obligations to them during the term (of the treaty). God loves those who take heed for themselves.'

text: 'But when these months
column5: prohibited (for fighting)
column6: are over
column7: slay the idolaters wheresoever you find them
column8: and take them captive or besiege them
column9: and lie in wait for them at every likely place. But if they repent and fulfil their devotional obligations and pay the zakat
column10: then let them go their way
column11: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'If an idolater seeks protection
column5: then give him asylum that he may hear the word of God. Then escort him to a place of safety
column6: for they are people who do not know.'

text: 'How could there be a treaty between idolaters and God and His Apostle
column5: except those you covenanted by the Sacred Mosque? Therefore as long as they are honest with you be correct with them
column6: for God loves those who are godly.'

text: 'How (can they be trusted)? If they prevail against you they will neither observe pacts nor good faith with you. They flatter you with their tongues
column5: but their hearts are averse to you
column6: for most of them are iniquitous.'

text: 'They barter away the words of God for a petty price
column5: and obstruct (others) from His path. How evil indeed are the things they do!'

text: 'They have no regard for kinship or treaties with believers
column5: for they are transgressors.'

text: 'But if they repent and are firm in devotion and pay the zakat
column5: then they are your brothers in faith. We explain Our commands distinctly for those who understand.'

text: 'If they break their pledge after giving their word and revile your faith
column5: fight these specimens of faithlessness
column6: for surely their oaths have no sanctity: They may haply desist.'

text: 'Will you not fight those who broke their pledge and plotted to banish the Apostle
column5: and who were the first to attack you? Are you afraid of them? If you are believers you should fear God more.'

text: 'Fight them so that God may punish them at your hands
column5: and put them to shame
column6: and help you against them
column7: and heal the wounds of the hearts of believers

text: And remove the anger from their breasts; for God turns to whosoever desires. God is all-knowing and all-wise.
'Do you think you will get away before God knows who among you fought and did not take anyone but God
column5: His Apostle and the faithful
column6: as their friends? God is cognisant of all that you do.'

text: 'The idolaters have no right to visit the mosques of God while bearing testimony to their disbelief. Meaningless will be their acts
column5: and in Hell they will bide for ever

text: 'Only those who believe in God and the Last Day
column5: who fulfil their devotional obligations
column6: pay the zakat
column7: and fear no one but God
column8: can visit the mosques of God. They may hope to be among the guided.'

text: 'Do you think that giving a drink of water to the pilgrims and going on a visit to the Sacred Mosque
column5: is the same as believing in God and the Last Day
column6: and striving in the cause of God? In the eyes of God it is not the same; and God does not show the unrighteous the way.'

text: 'Those who accepted the faith and left their homes and fought in the way of God
column5: wealth and soul
column6: have a greater reward with God
column7: and will be successful.'

text: 'Their Lord announces to them news of His mercy
column5: acceptance
column6: and gardens of lasting bliss'

text: Which they will enjoy for ever. Indeed God has greater rewards with Him.
'O you who believe
column5: do not hold your fathers and brothers as friends if they hold disbelief more dear than faith; and those of you who do so are iniquitous.'

text: 'You tell them: "If your fathers and sons
column5: your brothers and wives and families and wealth
column6: or the business you fear may fail
column7: and the mansions that you love
column8: are dearer to you than God
column9: His Apostle
column10: and struggling in His cause
column11: then wait until God''s command arrives
column12: for God does not show transgressors the way."'

text: 'Indeed God has helped you on many occasions
column5: even during the battle of Hunain
column6: when you were elated with joy at your numbers which did not prove of the least avail
column7: so that the earth and its vast expanse became too narrow for you
column8: and you turned back and retreated.'

text: Then God sent down a sense of tranquility on His Apostle and the faithful; and sent down troops invisible to punish the infidels. This is the recompense of those who do not believe.
'Yet God may turn (even) after this to whomsoever He please
column5: for God is compassionate and kind.'

text: 'O believers
column5: the idolaters are unclean. So they should not approach the Holy Mosque after this year. In case you fear indigence (from the stoppage of business with them)
column6: then God will enrich you of His bounty if He will
column7: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'Fight those people of the Book who do not believe in God and the Last Day
column5: who do not prohibit what God and His Apostle have forbidden
column6: nor accept divine law
column7: until all of them pay protective tax in submission.'

text: The Jews say: "Ezra is the son of God;" the Christians say: "Christ is the son of God." That is what they say with their tongues following assertions made by unbelievers before them. May they be damned by God: How perverse are they!
'They consider their rabbis and monks and the Christ
column5: son of Mary
column6: to be gods apart from God
column7: even though they had been enjoined to worship only one God
column8: for there is no god but He. Too holy is He for what they ascribe to Him!'

text: 'They wish to extinguish the light of God by uttering blasphemies; but God will not have it so
column5: for He wills to perfect His light
column6: however the unbelievers be averse.'

text: 'It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the true faith in order to make it superior to other systems of belief
column5: even though the idolaters may not like it.'

text: 'O believers
column5: many rabbis and priests devour the possessions of others wrongfully
column6: and keep men away from the path of God. To those who accumulate gold and silver
column7: and do not spend in the way of God
column8: announce the news of painful punishment.'

text: 'On the day We shall heat up (their gold) on the fire of Hell and brand their foreheads
column5: sides and backs (and say to them): "It is this you stored up for yourselves; so now taste of what you had stored!"'

text: 'The number of months with God is twelve in accordance with God''s law since the day He created the heavens and the earth. Of these four are holy. This is the straight reckoning. So do not exceed yourselves during them; but fight the idolaters to the end as they fight you in like manner; and remember
column5: God is with those Who preserve themselves from evil and do the right.'

text: 'Intercalating a month is adding to unbelief. The unbelievers are misguided by this
column5: for they take the same month to be sacred one year and sacrilegious the next
column6: thus making the number of months sanctified by God accord with theirs in order to make what God has forbidden
column7: lawful. Attractive seem to them their evil deeds; but God does not show the unbelievers the way.'

text: 'What has happened to you
column5: O believers
column6: that when you are asked to set out in the cause of God your feet begin to drag? Do you find the life of the world so pleasing that you forget the life to come? Yet the profit of the life of this world is but meagre as compared to the life to come.'

text: 'Unless you go out (to strive)
column5: God will inflict grievous punishment on you
column6: and bring other people in your place
column7: and you will not be able to harm Him in the least
column8: for God has the power over all things.'

text: 'If you do not help (the Prophet
column5: remember) God had helped him when the infidels had forced him to leave (and he was) one of two. When both of them were in the cave
column6: he said to his companion: "Do not grieve
column7: for God is with us." Then God sent divine peace on him
column8: and invisible armies for his help
column9: and made the unbelievers'' purpose abject. Most exalted is God''s word
column10: for God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'O believers
column5: go out in the cause of God
column6: (whether) light or heavy
column7: and strive in the service of God
column8: wealth and soul. This is better for you if you understand.'

text: '(O Prophet)
column5: had the gain been close at hand
column6: and easy the journey
column7: they would surely have followed you; but hard was the journey and long the going. Even then they swear by God (and say): "If we had the strength we would surely have gone out with you." They are only ruining themselves
column8: for God is aware they lie.'

text: May God forgive you. Why did you allow them (to stay behind) without ascertaining who spoke the truth and who were liars?
'Those who believe in God and the Last Day
column5: do not ask your leave to be excused from fighting wealth and soul (in the cause of God)
column6: for God knows the pious and devout.'

text: 'Only they ask (for leave) who do not believe in God and the Last Day
column5: whose hearts are full of doubt; and doubting they waver (between gain and loss).'

text: 'If they had intended to go out (to fight) they would surely have made preparations. But God did not like their setting forth
column5: and they were held back and told: "Stay at home with those who stay behind."'

text: 'Had they gone out with you
column5: they would only have been a hindrance and let loose confusion among you to create discord; for there are some in your midst who spy for them. But God knows who are the wicked.'

text: 'They had tried to create disorder before and intrigued against you
column5: but truth came out in the end and God''s will prevailed
column6: even though they did not like it.'

text: 'And (many a one) there is among them who says: "Allow me (to stay back at home)
column5: and put me not on trial." Surely they have put themselves on trial already
column6: and Hell will enclose the unbelievers from all sides.'

text: 'If good comes your way they are vexed
column5: but if calamity befalls you
column6: they say: "We had taken precautions in advance;" and pleased
column7: turn away.'

text: 'Tell them: "Nothing can befall us except what God decrees. Our protector is He
column5: and in God should the faithful place their trust."'

text: 'Say: "Are you waiting for anything else but one of two good things for us
column5: (victory or martyrdom)? Yet what we are waiting for you is the punishment of God
column6: direct or through us. So keep waiting; we are waiting with you."'

text: 'Tell them: "You may spend (in the way of God)
column5: whether willingly or with reluctance
column6: it will not be accepted from you
column7: for you are reprobates."'

text: 'Nothing prevents the acceptance of what they spend except that they do not believe in God and His Apostle
column5: and come to worship but languidly and spend only grudgingly.'

text: Do not marvel at their wealth and children. God intends to punish them through these in the world; and their souls will depart in a state of disbelief.
'They swear by God they are with you
column5: though in fact they are not. They are only a frightened lot.'

text: 'If they find a place of shelter or a cave or hole to hide
column5: they will turn to it.'

text: 'There are some among them who blame you (of partiality) in distributing the offerings made in the name of God. In case they receive some of these they are pleased
column5: if not
column6: they are incensed.'

text: 'They should rather have been pleased with what God and His Prophet had given them
column5: and said: "God is sufficient for us; He will give us of His largesse as will His Apostle. We supplicate no one but God."'

text: 'Charities are meant for the indigent and needy
column5: and those who collect and distribute them
column6: and those whom you wish to win over
column7: and for redeeming slaves (and captives) and those who are burdened with debt
column8: and in the cause of God
column9: and the wayfarers: So does God ordain. God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'There are some among them who talk ill of the Prophet by saying: "He listens to everyone." Tell them: "He listens for your good
column5: and trusts in God and trusts the faithful
column6: and he is a blessing for those who believe. For those who offend the Apostle of God there is painful punishment."'

text: They swear by God to please you; but if they are believers it would have been worthier to have pleased God and His Apostle.
'Have they not realised that anyone who opposes God and His Prophet
column5: will abide in Hell for ever? And that is the worst disgrace.'

text: 'The hypocrites fear lest a Surah is revealed concerning them
column5: exposing what is in their hearts. Say to them: "Mock as much as you like; God will surely expose what you dread."'

text: 'But if you ask them
column5: they will say: "We were only gossiping and jesting." You ask them: "Were you jesting with God
column6: His revelations and His messengers?"'

text: 'Do not make excuses: You turned unbelievers after having come to faith. If We pardon a section of you (for being frivolous)
column5: We shall punish the other for being guilty (of deliberate sin).'

text: 'The hypocrites (are the same) whether men or women
column5: the one of them being of the other. They encourage what is bad and dissuade from the good
column6: and tighten their purses (when it comes to spending in the way of God). Of God they are oblivious; so He is oblivious of them. The hypocrites are indeed transgressors.'

text: 'God has reserved for hypocrites
column5: whether men or women
column6: and for unbelievers
column7: the fire of Hell
column8: where they will abide for ever. This is sufficient for them: They have God''s condemnation and lasting torment

text: 'Like those before you who were greater in strength
column5: had more wealth and children than you
column6: who enjoyed their lot in this world
column7: as you have enjoyed your share like them. You indulge in idle talk
column8: as they had indulged in vain discourse. Yet nothing of what they did remains in this world or will in the next
column9: and they are the losers.'

text: 'Has not the account of those before them come to them
column5: -- of the people of Noah and ''Ad and Thamud
column6: of Abraham and Midian
column7: and all the habitations that were destroyed? Their apostles had come to them with clear proofs; and God did not surely wrong them
column8: they wronged themselves.'

text: 'Those who believe
column5: men and women
column6: befriend one another
column7: and enjoin what is right and prohibit what is wrong. They observe their devotional obligations
column8: pay the zakat
column9: and obey God and His Apostle. God will be merciful to them
column10: for God is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'God has promised men and women who believe gardens with streams of running water where they will abide for ever
column5: and beautiful mansions in the Garden of Eden
column6: and the blessings of God above all. That will be happiness supreme.'

text: 'Strive
column5: O Prophet
column6: against the unbelievers and the hypocrites
column7: and deal with them firmly. Their final abode is Hell: And what a wretched destination!'

text: 'They swear by God: "We never said this." But they surely said words disbelieving the truth
column5: and they turned unbelievers after having come to faith
column6: and designed what they could not accomplish. They did it only out of vengeance for God and His Apostle had enriched them by their grace. So
column7: if they repent it is better for them. If they turn away then God would afflict them with painful punishment in this world and the next; and none will they have on the face of the earth to protect or help them.'

text: Some of them made a covenant with God: "If You give us in Your bounty we shall give alms and be upright."
'But when He gave them of His bounty they became greedy
column5: and then turned away.'

text: 'As a consequence of breaking their promise made to God
column5: and telling lies
column6: he filled their hearts with hypocrisy which will last till the day they come before Him.'

text: 'Have they not realised that God knows their secrets and their confidential talk
column5: and that God has the knowledge of unknown things?'

text: 'They who defame those of the believers who give alms willingly
column5: and deride those who have nothing besides what they earn by their labour (to give in charity)
column6: will be derided by God
column7: and will suffer painful punishment.'

text: 'Whether you plead forgiveness for them or not
column5: God will not forgive them
column6: even though you plead seventy times
column7: for they disbelieved in God and His Apostle; and God does not show transgressors the way.'

text: 'Those who were left behind rejoiced that they stayed at home against the wishes of God''s Apostle
column5: being averse to fighting in the way of God with their wealth and lives
column6: and said: "Do not go in this heat." Tell them: "The heat of Hell is far more intense." If only they had cared to instruct themselves!'

text: 'So let them laugh a little
column5: for weep they will
column6: more as retribution for what they have done.'

text: 'If you come back to them by (the grace of) God
column5: and they seek your permission to go (to fight)
column6: you should tell them: "You will never go out nor fight the enemy with me any more. You preferred to stay back on the first occasion
column7: so stay at home with those who stay behind."'

text: 'Do not invoke blessings on any of them who die
column5: nor stand to pray at their graves
column6: for they disbelieved in God and His Prophet
column7: and died transgressors.'

text: 'And let not their wealth and children astonish you. God wishes to punish them through these in the world
column5: and their souls will depart in a state of disbelief.'

text: 'Whenever a Surah is revealed (which says): "Believe in God and fight along with His Prophet
column5: the well-to-do among them ask for leave to stay at home, and say: Leave us with those who are left behind."'

text: 'They prefer to be with women who (are allowed to) stay at home during war
column5: and their hearts are sealed; so they fail to understand.'

text: 'But the Prophet and those who have embraced the faith with him
column5: and have fought wealth and soul (in the way of God)
column6: are blessed and will be successful.'

text: 'God has provision for them of gardens with Streams of running water
column5: where they will abide for ever. This will be the supreme triumph.'

text: 'Some Arabs of the desert came with ready excuses
column5: asking for leave to stay behind. But those who had lied to God and His Prophet stayed at home doing nothing. So the punishment for those who disbelieve among them will be painful.'

text: 'No blame will attach to the old and the sick
column5: or those without means to spend on good acts
column6: if they stay behind provided they are sincere to God and His Apostle; There is no way to blame those who are doers of good
column7: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Nor will they be blamed who came to you for transport
column5: to whom you said: "I cannot find any means of conveyance for you
column6:
and they went away in tears, grieving that they lacked the means to spend (on carriage).'
TQA1328,QA1328,TLQ01,'Blame will lie on those who are rich yet ask your leave to stay behind. They prefer to stay with women who stay at home, and God seals their hearts; so they do not understand.'
TQA1329,QA1329,TLQ01,When you come back they will offer excuses to you. Tell them: Make no excuses; we do not believe you. God has informed us about you; and God and His Apostle shall watch your conduct. Then you will be brought to Him who knows what is hidden and what is manifest. He will tell you of what you did."

text: 'They will beg you in the name of God
column5: on your return
column6: to forgive them; but you keep away from them: They are scum; their abode is Hell: Requital for what they had done.'

text: 'They will plead on oath that you accept them. Even if you accept them
column5: remember God does not accept people who are disobedient.'

text: 'The village Arabs are more obstinate in disbelief and hypocrisy
column5: and impervious to ordinances revealed to His Apostle by God; yet God is aware of everything and is wise.'

text: 'Some of these rustics take whatever they spend in the way of God as a penalty
column5: and wait for an adverse turn in your fortune. For them will be the adverse change
column6: as God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'Yet some Arabs of the desert believe in God and the Last Day
column5: and consider what they spend to be a means of bringing them nearer to God and the blessings of the Prophet. This is certainly a means of achieving nearness (to God)
column6: and God will admit them to His mercy
column7: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Those among the migrants (from Makkah) and helpers (in Madina) who were the first to believe
column5: and those who followed them in goodness
column6: have been accepted by God and they follow His way. For them He has gardens with streams of running water where they will abide for ever; and that is happiness supreme.'

text: 'Some of the Arabs of the desert around you are hypocrites
column5: and some of the people of Madina are stubborn in hypocrisy. You are not aware of them; We know them
column6: and will punish them twice
column7: and they will be sent to a harrowing doom.'

text: 'But there are others who admit their sins of mixing good deeds with evil. It may be that God will accept their repentance
column5: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Accept the offerings they make from their wealth in order to cleanse and purify them for progress
column5: and invoke blessings upon them. Your blessings will surely bring them peace
column6: for God hears all and knows everything.'

text: 'Do they not know that God accepts the repentance of His creatures and receives what they offer in charity
column5: and that He is forgiving and kind?'

text: 'Say to them: "Act. God will see your conduct
column5: and so will His Apostle and the faithful; for you will in the end go back to Him
column6: who knows the unknown and the known
column7: who will tell you of what you were doing."'

text: 'There are still some others whose affairs await the dispensation of God. He may punish or pardon them
column5: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'There are those who built a mosque on opposition and disbelief
column5: and to cause rifts among the faithful
column6: and to serve as an outpost for those who have warred against God and His Apostle before this. Yet they will surely swear: "We had only meant well." But God is witness that they are liars.'

text: Never set foot in that place. Only a mosque whose foundations have been laid from the very first on godliness is worthy of your visiting it. There you will find men who wish to be purified; and God loves those who are pure.
'Is the man who lays the foundations of his sanctum on his allegiance to God and the wish to seek His favour
column5: better
column6: or he who lays the foundations of his building on the edge of a bank eroded by water
column7: which will collapse with him into the fire of Hell? But God does not guide the people who are wilfully unjust.'

text: 'The edifice they have built will always fill their minds with perturbation (which will not cease) till their hearts are rent to pieces
column5: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'God has verily bought the souls and possessions of the faithful in exchange for a promise of Paradise. They fight in the cause of God
column5: and kill and are killed. This is a promise incumbent on Him
column6: as in the Torah
column7: so the Gospel and the Qur''an. And who is more true to his promise than God? So rejoice at the bargain you have made with Him; for this will be triumph supreme.'

text: 'To those who repent and pay homage
column5: give praise and are devout
column6: who kneel in prayer and bow in supplication
column7: who enjoin good deeds and prohibit the bad
column8: and keep to the limits set by God
column9: announce the news of rejoicing to the faithful.'

text: 'It is not worthy of the Prophet and those who believe to seek forgiveness for those who are idolaters
column5: even though they may be their relatives
column6: after they have come to know that they are destined for Hell.'

text: 'As for Abraham''s prayer for his father
column5: he was fulfilling a promise he had made to him. Yet when it became evident to him that (his father) was an enemy of God
column6: he broke away from him
column7: though Abraham was soft hearted and kind.'

text: 'God never leads men astray after guiding them
column5: until He makes quite clear to them what they should avoid
column6: for God indeed knows each and everything.'

text: 'Verily God''s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He alone is the giver of life and death; and none do you have besides God as friend and helper.'
'God was kind to the Prophet
column5: the emigrants
column6: and the helpers of the faithful who followed him in the hour of distress. When a section of them were about to lose courage He turned to them in His mercy
column7: for He is compassionate and kind.'

text: 'He has relented towards the three also (who had refused to go to the battle of the Ditch) whose case was left undecided
column5: and even the earth with all its expanse had become narrow for them
column6: and their lives were confined
column7: and they came to realise there was no refuge for them except in God. So He softened towards them that they may repent; for God surely accepts repentance and is merciful.'

text: 'O believers
column5: do not stray from the path of God
column6: and be with those who are truthful.'

text: 'It was not worthy of the people of Madina
column5: and the Arabs of the desert around them
column6: to abandon the Prophet of God
column7: and to care more for themselves than for him; for there is no hardship or thirst or hunger that they know in the service of God
column8: and no place they walk on where walking provokes the unbelievers
column9: and no harm they receive from the enemy
column10: but is put down as a good deed in their favour. Surely God does not let the recompense of those who do good to go waste.'

text: 'There is not a sum
column5: large or small
column6: that they spend
column7: not a piece of land that they traverse (in the service of God) which is not put down in their favour
column8: so that God could reward them for what they had done.'

text: 'It is not possible for all believers to go out (to fight). So a part of each section (of the population) should go (to fight) in order that the others may acquire understanding of law and divinity
column5: and warn their companions on return so that they may take heed for themselves.'

text: 'O believers
column5: fight the unbelievers around you
column6: and let them realise that you are firm: Remember
column7: God is with those who are pious and obedient to Him.'

text: 'When a Surah is revealed some of them remark: "Whose faith among you has it increased?" It does increase the faith of those who believe
column5: and they rejoice.'

text: 'But it adds disbelief to disbelief for those whose hearts are filled with doubt
column5: and they die disbelieving.'

text: Do they not know that they are tried every year once or twice? Even then they do not repent and take heed.
'Whenever a Surah is revealed they look at each other (so as to ask): "Is anyone looking at Us?" and then turn away. Indeed God has turned their hearts away (from the truth)
column5: for they cannot discern the law of heaven.'

text: 'To you has come an Apostle from among you. Any sorrow that befalls you weighs upon him; He is eager for your happiness
column5: full of concern for the faithful
column6: compassionate and kind.'

text: 'So
column5: if they turn away
column6: say to them: "God is sufficient for me. There is no God but He; I depend on Him alone
column7: the Lord of the glorious Throne."'

text: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the authoritative Book.

Are the people astonished that a man who is one of them was commanded by Us to warn them and to bring glad tidings to those who believe that they have a true precedence with their Lord? (Yet) the unbelievers say: "He is a clear sorcerer."
'Your Lord is God who created the heavens and the earth in six spans
column5: then assumed His power
column6: dispensing all affairs. None can intercede with Him except by His leave. He is God
column7: your Lord
column8: so worship Him. Will you not be warned?'

text: 'To Him will you all return: God''s promise is true. It is He who originates creation
column5: then will revert it
column6: so that He may reward those who believe and do good things in all justice. But those who deny the truth will receive boiling water to drink and grievous punishment
column7: for they disbelieved.'

text: 'It is He who gave the sun its radiance
column5: the moon its lustre
column6: and appointed its stations so that you may compute years and numbers. God did not create them but with deliberation. He distinctly explains His signs for those who can understand.'

text: 'In the alternation of night and day
column5: and all that He has created in the heavens and the earth
column6: are certainly signs for people who fear God.'

text: 'As for those who do not hope to meet Us (after death)
column5: and are content with the life of this world
column6: who are oblivious of Our signs

text: Will have Hell as their abode for what they have earned.
But those who believe and act for a beneficial end will be guided by their Lord for their good faith. At their feet shall flow streams of running water in gardens of delight.
'Their invocation will be: "All glory to you
column5: O God
column6: and Peace" will be their salutation
column7: and the end of their prayer (will be): "All praise be to God
column8: the Lord of all the worlds."'

text: 'If God were to hasten the evil
column5: as men try to hasten the good
column6: their term would come to end. So We leave those who do not expect to meet Us to wander perplexed in transgression.'

text: 'When man is afflicted with adversity he calls to Us
column5: whether lying on his side
column6: or sitting or standing. But when We take away his troubles
column7: he moves away
column8: as though he had never called to Us in affliction. In the same way
column9: attractive have been made their deeds to the prodigals.'

text: 'How many generations did We lay low before you when they became wilfully unjust. Their apostles had brought clear proofs to them
column5: yet they never believed. So We punished the sinful people.'

text: Then We appointed you leaders in the land after them to see how you behaved.
'When Our clear messages are recited to them
column5: those who do not hope to meet Us
column6: say: "Bring a different Qur''an
column7: or make amendments to this one." Say: "It is not for me to change it of my will. I follow (only) what is revealed to me. If I disobey my Lord
column8: I fear the punishment of an awful Day."'

text: 'Say: "Had God pleased I would never have recited it to you
column5: nor would He have given you comprehension of it. (Remember that I am one of you) and have lived a whole life with you before (its revelation). Even then you do not understand."'

text: Who is more unjust than he who imputes lies to God or denies His revelations? The sinners will surely not be reprieved.
'They worship those besides God who cannot do them harm or bring them gain
column5: and say: "These are our intercessors with God." Say: "Do you want to inform God of things in the heavens and the earth He does not know?" Glorious is He
column6: and too exalted for what they associate with Him!'

text: 'Men were once a community of one faith; but they differed (and followed different ways). Had it not been for the word proclaimed by your Lord before
column5: their differences would have been resolved.'

text: They say: "How is it that no sign was sent by his Lord (to His Prophet)?" Tell them: "Unknown things are only known to God. So watch and wait (for the sign); I am waiting and expecting with you."
'When We let them taste Our mercy after affliction
column5: they contrive against Our signs. Say: "God is swifter at contriving
column6:
for Our angels record everything you plan.'
TQA1386,QA1386,TLQ01,'It is He who enables you to travel over land and sea. When you sail in ships in a favourable breeze, you rejoice. But when a gale begins to blow and the waves dash against them from every side they realise that they have been caught in it, (and) they call on God in all faith: If You save us from this we shall ever be grateful."'

text: 'But when He rescues them
column5: they commit excesses in the land unjustly again. Your rebellion
column6: O people
column7: shall recoil back on your own selves. The joys of the world (are only ephemeral): You have to come back to Us in the end. We shall then inform you what you were doing.'

text: 'The life of the world is like the rain that waters the crops of the earth which are used as food by men and cattle. But when the earth is embellished and adorned with gold
column5: and its tillers begin to feel that (the crops) are under control
column6: Our command descends suddenly at night or in the day
column7: and We mow them down as though there was nothing there yesterday. This is how We distinctly explain Our signs to those who think.'

text: 'God invites you to mansions of peace
column5: and guides whosoever He will to the path that is straight'

text: 'For those who do good there is goodness and more
column5: and no blot or disgrace will cover their faces. They are people of Paradise
column6: where they will abide for ever.'

text: 'But those who earn evil shall be punished to an equal degree as their evil
column5: and they will be covered with shame
column6: and will have none to protect them against God: Their faces shall be blackened as though with patches of the night. They are the people of Hell
column7: where they will abide for ever

text: 'The day We shall gather them all together We shall say to the idolaters: "Take your stand with the compeers you worshipped as the equals of God." We shall then create a rift between them
column5: and the compeers will say: "You did not worship us;'

text: For God is sufficient as witness between us and you we were not aware of your worship."
'Then each will see what he had done in the past; and they will turn to God
column5: their true Lord
column6: and all the lies they had fabricated will be of no avail to them.'

text: 'Ask them: "Who gives you food and sustenance from the skies and the earth? Or
column5: who is the lord of ear and eye? And who brings forth the living from the dead
column6: the dead from the living? And who directs all affairs?" They will say: "God." So tell them: "Why do you not fear Him?"'

text: 'Such then is God
column5: your true Lord; and when truth is gone what is left but error? So why do you turn away?'

text: 'Thus the word of your Lord about those who disobey comes true
column5: that they do not believe.'

text: Ask them: "Is there among the partners (you ascribe to God) one who first originates then reverts it? Say: "It is God alone who first creates and then reverts it. So where do you stray?"

'Ask: "Is there one among those you associate with God who can show the way to the truth?" Say: "It is God who shows the way to truth." Then who is more worthy of being followed -- He who guides to the truth
column5: or he who cannot find the path until shown the way? What has happened to you that you judge in such a wise?'

text: Many of them follow nothing but illusion; yet illusion cannot replace the reality. God verily knows what they do.
'This Qur''an is not such (a writ) as could be composed by anyone but God. It confirms what has been revealed before
column5: and is an exposition of (Heaven''s) law. Without any doubt it''s from the Lord of all the worlds.'

text: 'Do they say (of the Prophet) that: "He has composed it?" Say to them: "Bring a Surah like this
column5: and call anyone apart from God you can (to help you)
column6: if what you say is true."'

text: 'In fact
column5: they deny what is beyond the reach of their knowledge
column6: whose explanation has not reached them yet. So had those who have gone before them denied; but look at the fate of the unjust'

text: 'Some of them will believe in it
column5: some will not. Your Lord knows the transgressors well.'

text: 'If they (still) call you a liar
column5: tell them: "For me my actions
column6: for you yours. You are not answerable for my deeds
column7: nor I for what you do."'

text: Some of them listen to you: But can you make the deaf hear who do not understand a thing?
Some of them look toward you: But can you show the blind the way even when they cannot see?
Surely God does not wrong anyone; they wrong themselves.

'The day He will gather them together it will appear to them that they had lived (in the world) but an hour of a day to make each other''s acquaintance. Verily those who deny the meeting with God will be lost
column5: and not find the way.'

text: 'Whether We show you some of the promise (of punishment in wait) for them
column5: or take you to Ourself
column6: their returning is to Us in the end; and God is a witness to all they do.'

text: 'For every people there is an apostle; and when their apostle is come the matter is decided between them equitably
column5: and no one is wronged.'

text: 'They say: "When is this promise going to come
column5: if what you say is true?"'

text: Say: "I have no power over my own gain or loss other than what God may please." Every people have a certain term. When their time is come they can neither delay it an hour nor advance it a moment forward.
'Say: "Have you ever thought if His punishment befalls you at night or in the day
column5: what would the sinners do to despatch it?'

text: 'Will you believe it when it comes to pass? Indeed
column5: you will believe it then. How impatient you were to hasten it!'

text: Then will the sinners be told: "Now taste everlasting torment. Should you be rewarded for anything else but what you did?"
'Yet they want to be informed if it is true. Say: "By my Lord
column5: it is the truth. You cannot invalidate it."'

text: 'Even if every soul that has sinned possessed whatever is on the earth
column5: it would surely offer it to ransom itself
column6: and feel repentant on seeing the punishment. Yet the sentence would be passed with justice
column7: and not one will be wronged.'

text: 'For all that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God. Remember
column5: the promise of God is true. But most of them do not know.'

text: 'He is the giver of life and death
column5: and to Him you will return.'

text: 'O men
column5: a warning has come to you from your Lord
column6: a remedy for the (doubts) of the heart
column7: and a guidance and grace for those who believe.'

text: Say: "It is the blessing and mercy of God; so rejoice in it. It is better than all that you amass."
'Say: "Have you thought of what God has sent you for food
column5: of which you have labelled some as lawful and some forbidden?" And ask: "Has God commanded this
column6: or you are imputing lies to God?"'

text: What do those who invent lies of God think about the Day of Reckoning? (Will they escape the judgement?) In fact God is gracious to men; but most of them are not grateful.
'There is no state you are in
column5: whether reading from the Qur''an
column6: or doing something else
column7: but We are watching you as you are engaged in it. There is not the weight of an atom on the earth and in the heavens that is hidden from your Lord
column8: nor is there anything smaller or greater than this but is recorded in the perspicuous Book.'

text: 'Remember
column5: there is neither fear nor regret for the friends of God.'

text: 'Those who believe and obey God
For them is good news in the life of the world and in the life to come. There is no changing the words of God. That will be the great triumph.
You should not be grieved by what they say. All glory is wholly for God: He is the one who hears and knows everything.
'Remember
column5: whosoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to God. Those who call on others they associate with God
column6: follow nothing but conjecture
column7: and only guess.'

text: 'It is He who made the night for you to rest
column5: and made the day enlightening. Indeed there are signs in this for those who listen.'

text: They say: "God has begotten a son." Immaculate is He and self-sufficient." Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. You have no proof for this (assertion): Why do you say things of God you do not know?
Say: "Those who fabricate lies about God will never succeed."
Let them profit by the world (while they may): In the end they will come back to Us. Then We shall make them taste severe punishment for having denied (the truth).
'Recount to them the story of Noah when he said to his people: "O people
column5: if you find my staying with you and warning through God''s signs
column6: unbearable to you
column7: know that I have reposed my trust in God. So plan your move
column8: and call your associates
column9: and make certain of your plan; then do whatever you intend against me
column10: allowing me no respite.'

text: If you turn away from me (remember) I do not ask any recompense from you. My reward is with God; I have been commanded to be one of those who submit to Him."
'Even then they denied him; so We saved him and those with him
column5: in the ark
column6: and established them in the land
column7: and drowned those who denied Our signs. So think of the fate of those who were warned (and took no heed).'

text: Afterwards We sent many messengers who brought clear proofs to their peoples. But they were not prepared to believe what they had once denied. That is how We seal the hearts of the iniquitous.
'Then after them We sent Moses and Aaron with Our signs to the Pharaoh and his nobles; but they behaved arrogantly
column5: for they were a people full of guilt.'

text: 'Thus
column5: when the truth had come to them from Us
column6: they said: "Surely this is nothing but pure magic."'

text: '"You say this of the truth
column5: said Moses, after it has come to you. Is this magic? But sorcerers do not ever prosper."'

text: '"Have you come
column5: said they, to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing
column6: so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land? We shall not believe in what you say.'

text: '"Bring the cleverest magicians to me
column5:
said the Pharaoh.'
TQA1444,QA1444,TLQ01,'So when the magicians arrived, Moses said to them: Cast whatever (spell) you have to cast."'

text: When they had cast (their spell) Moses said: "What you have cast is only a charm which God will surely nullify. God does not verily render the deeds of evil-doers righteous.
'God vindicates the truth by His commands
column5: however the sinners may dislike it."'

text: 'But none of them put faith in Moses except some youths among his people who were nonetheless afraid lest the Pharaoh and his nobles should persecute them; for the Pharaoh was mighty in the land
column5: and guilty of excesses.'

text: 'Moses said: "O my people
column5: if you do believe in God place your trust in Him if you are obedient."'

text: 'They answered: "We have placed our trust in God. O Lord
column5: do not make us a target of oppression for these tyrannical people

text: And deliver us by Your grace from a people who do not believe."
'We commanded Moses and his brother: "Build homes for your people in Egypt
column5: and make your houses places of worship
column6: perform your acts of prayer and give happy tidings to those who believe."'

text: 'And Moses said: "O Lord
column5: have You bestowed on the Pharaoh and his nobles pomp and plenty in the life of this world that they might mislead people from Your path? Destroy their possessions
column6: O Lord
column7: and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they face the painful punishment."'

text: Said (the Lord): "Your prayer is answered. Therefore persist and do not follow the path of those who are ignorant."
'And We brought the people of Israel across the sea
column5: but the Pharaoh and his army pursued them wickedly and maliciously till he was on the point of drowning
column6: and he said: "I believe that there is no god but He in whom the people of Israel believe
column7: and I submit to Him."'

text: '"Yes
column5: now" (was the answer)
column6: "though before this you were disobedient and rebellious.'

text: We shall preserve your body today that you may be a lesson for those who come after you; as many a man is heedless of Our signs."
'We gave the people of Israel a settled abode
column5: and bestowed good things on them to eat and use. So they did not differ until they came to have knowledge. Your Lord will assuredly settle their differences on the Day of Resurrection.'

text: 'If you are in doubt of what We have sent down to you
column5: then ask those who have been reading the Book (for a long time) before you. The truth has indeed come to you from your Lord
column6: so do not be one of those who doubt

text: 'And do not be one of those who deny the signs of God
column5: or you will be among the losers.'

text: 'Verily those against whom the word of your Lord is pronounced will never believe
'Even though all the signs came to them
column5: not till they face the grievous punishment.'

text: 'Why has there been no habitation that believed and profited by their faith
column5: except the people of Jonah? When they came to believe
column6: We removed from them the affliction of shame in the world
column7: and made them prosperous for a time.'

text: 'If your Lord had willed
column5: all the people on the earth would have come to believe

text: 'Are you going to compel the people to believe except by God''s dispensation? He puts doubt in (the minds of) those who do not think.'
Say: "Observe all there is in the heavens and the earth." But signs or warnings will be of no avail to those who do not believe.
Can they expect anything but what the people before them had known? Say: "Then wait. I am waiting with you."
Thus do We deliver our apostles and those who believe. As a matter of duty We save the believers.
'Say: "O men
column5: if you have doubt about my faith
column6: then (know) I do not worship those you worship apart from God
column7: but I worship God who makes you die; and I am commanded to be a believer

text: 'And to set my face toward the way
column5: as one upright
column6: and not be one of those who associate others with God.'

text: 'And not to invoke any other than God
column5: who can neither help nor hurt me; for if I do
column6: I would surely be unjust.'

text: 'Should God bring you harm there is none but He who could deliver you from it
column5: and if He wish you good there is none who could take away His blessings: He showers them on those of His creatures as He please
column6: and He is forgiving and kind."'

text: 'Say: "O men
column5: the truth has come to you from your Lord
column6: so he who follows the right path does so for himself
column7: and he who goes astray errs against himself
column8: and I am not a guardian over you.'

text: 'Follow what is revealed to you
column5: and persist until God pronounce His judgement; for He is the best of all judges."'

text: 'ALIF LAM RA. This is a Book whose verses are indeclinable and distinct
column5: which comes from One who is most wise and all-knowing

text: '(Proclaiming) that you should worship none but God. Verily I bring to you from Him a message of warning and rejoicing
'And that you should seek His forgiveness and turn towards Him. He will bestow the best things of life on you for a time ordained
column5: and favour those with blessings who are worthy of grace. But if you turn away
column6: I fear the punishment of a terrible Day for you.'

text: 'To God have you to go back
column5: and He has power over everything.'

text: 'Look
column5: how they double up their breasts in order to hide from Him. But when they cover themselves up with their garments
column6: He knows what they hide and what they expose. Indeed
column7: He knows the secrets of the hearts.'

text: 'There is not a creature that moves on the earth whose nourishment is not provided by God
column5: whose place of sojourning and depositing is not known to Him. All things conform to a manifest law.'

text: 'It is He who created the heavens and the earth In six spans
column5: and has control over the waters (of life) so that he may bring out the best that everyone of you could do. Yet if you said to them: "You shall certainly be raised from the dead
column6: the unbelievers will say: This will be nothing but sorcery."'

text: 'If We defer their punishment for a certain time
column5: they will say: "What is keeping it back?" And yet
column6: the day it comes
column7: they will not be able to avert it; and what they used to laugh at will encompass them.'

text: 'If We allow man to enjoy Our favours
column5: and then take them away from him
column6: he becomes despondent and ungrateful.'

text: 'If We let him taste Our favours after adversity
column5: he says: "Misfortune has left me
column6:
and begins to brag and exult,'

TQA1485,QA1485,TLQ01,'You may haply omit some of what has been revealed to you, and may be disheartened because they say: Why was no treasure sent down to him
column7: or an angel accompanied him?" Yet you have been sent to warn alone

text: 'Do they say (of the Prophet): "He has forged (the Qur''an)?" Say: "Then bring ten Surahs like it
column5: and call anyone except God to help you
column6: if what you say is true."'

text: 'If they do not answer you
