text: 'To those who desire the life of this world and its many allures
column5: We shall pay them in full for their acts herein and will not withold any thing.'

text: 'Yet these are the people for whom there is nothing but Fire in the world to come. Fruitless will be what they have fashioned
column5: and whatever they have done will perish.'

text: 'Will he who has a clear proof from his Lord
column5: which acts as evidence from Him
column6: before which the Book of Moses was a way-giver and a grace
column7: (not believe in it)? Whoever among the partisans does not believe in it shall have Hell as the promised award. So have no doubt about it
column8: for surely it''s the truth from your Lord
column9: though most men may not believe.'

text: 'Who is more wicked than he who invents lies about God? Such men shall be arraigned before their Lord
column5: and the witnesses will testify: "These are those who imputed lies to God." Beware! The scourge of God will fall on the unjust

text: 'Who obstruct others from the way of God and seek obliquity in it
column5: and do not believe in the life to come.'

text: 'They shall not weaken (the power of) God on earth
column5: nor find any other protector but God. Their punishment will be doubled
column6: for they could neither hear nor see.'

text: 'They are verily those who exceeded themselves
column5: and the (gods) they invented abandoned them.'

text: Undoubtedly they will be losers in the life to come.
'But those who believe and do things good
column5: and are humble before their Lord
column6: are men of Paradise where they will abide for ever.'

text: 'The semblance of these two groups is that of a man who is deaf and blind
column5: and the other who can hear and see. Can they be equal? Why do you not reflect?'

text: We sent Noah to his people (and he said): "I give you a clear warning.
Do not worship anyone but God; for I fear the punishment of a dreadful day for you."
'The leaders of the people who were unbelievers
column5: replied: "We see that you are but a man like us
column6: and see that none among us follows you but the meanest and immature of judgement
column7: and do not see any excellence in you above us. In fact
column8: we think you are a liar."'

text: 'He said: "O my people
column5: think. If I have a clear proof from my Lord
column6: and He has bestowed on me His grace
column7: though unknown to you
column8: can we force it upon you when you are averse?'

text: 'I do not demand for it any wealth from you
column5: O my people. My reward is with God. And I will not drive those away who believe. They have also to meet their Lord. But I see you are an ignorant people.'

text: 'O my people
column5: who will save me from God if I drive them away? Do you not understand?'

text: 'I say not that I have the treasures of God
column5: or that I possess the knowledge of the unknown. I do not claim to be an angel
column6: nor can I say that God will not bestow any good on those you disdain
column7: for God is cognisant of what is in their hearts. If I say this
column8: I will surely be unjust."'

text: 'They said: "O Noah
column5: you have argued with us
column6: and disputed at length; so bring that (retribution) you promise
column7: if you speak the truth."'

text: 'He replied: "Only God will bring it on you if He please
column5: and you cannot prevail against Him.'

text: 'Even if I wish to advise you aright
column5: my counsel will not profit you if God intend that you go astray
column6: for He is your Lord and to Him you will return."'

text: 'Do they say you have fabricated it? Tell them: "If I have fabricated it
column5: then mine is the guilt; but I am clear of what you are guilty."'

text: And Noah was informed through revelation: "Apart from those who have come to believe already not one of your people is going to believe. So grieve not for what they are doing.
'Build an ark under Our eye and as We instruct. Do not plead for those who have been wicked
column5: for they shall certainly be drowned."'

text: 'So he built the ark; and when groups of his people passed by him
column5: they scoffed at him. He said to them: "Though you laugh at us (now)
column6: we shall laugh at you
column7: as you are laughing at us.'

text: 'You will soon come to know who suffers the punishment that would put him to shame
column5: and who suffers lasting torment."'

text: 'When Our command was issued and the waters gushed forth from the source
column5: We said: "Take into (the ark) a pair of every species
column6: and members of your family other than those against whom the sentence has been passed already
column7: and those who come to believe." But only a few believed in him.'

text: And (Noah) said: "Embark. In the name of God be its course and mooring. My Lord is surely forgiving and kind."
'It sailed on waves like mountains (high)
column5: and Noah called to his son who was separated from him: "Embark with us
column6: O my son
column7: and be not one of those who do not believe."'

text: '"I shall go up a mountain
column5: he said, which will keep me from the water." "There is no getting away
column6: said Noah, from the decree of God today
column7: except for those on whom be His mercy." And a wave came between them
column8: and he was among those who were drowned.'

text: 'Then it was said: "O earth
column5: swallow back your water; and
column6: O sky
column7: desist." And the water subsided
column8: and the decree was accomplished. The ark came to rest on Judi (Mount Ararat)

text: 'Noah called on his Lord and said: "O Lord
column5: my son is surely a member of my family
column6: and verily Your promise is true
column7: as You are the most just of all judges."'

text: '"O Noah"
column5: He answered
column6: "truly he is not of your family. He is surely the outcome of an unrighteous act. So ask Me not of what you do not know. I warn you not to be one of the ignorant."'

text: '"Preserve me
column5: O Lord
column6: said (Noah), from asking You that of which I have no knowledge. If You do not forgive me and have mercy on me I shall be among those who perish."'

text: '(And the Lord) said: "O Noah
column5: disembark with peace and safety from Us and blessings on you and the people with you. As for some (of them)
column6: We shall bestow advantages for a time
column7: then send a grievous punishment on them."'

text: 'This is news of the Unknown We reveal to you
column5: which neither you nor your people knew before. So endure with patience. The future is for those who keep away from evil and follow the straight path.'

text: 'We sent to the people of ''Ad their brother Hud
column5: who said: "O my people
column6: worship God; you have no other god but He. (As for the idols
column7: ) you are only inventing lies.'

text: 'O my people
column5: I ask no recompense of you for it: My reward is with Him who created me. Will you not
column6: therefore
column7: understand?'

text: 'O my people
column5: beg your Lord to forgive you

text: 'They said: "O Hud
column5: you have come to us with no proofs. We shall not abandon our gods because you say so

text: 'All we can say is that some of our gods have smitten you with evil." He replied:" I call God to witness

column6: that I am clear of what you associate (in your affairs)'

text: 'Apart from Him. Contrive against me as much as you like

text: I place my trust in God who is my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature that moves on the earth who is not held by the forelock firmly by Him. Verily the way of my Lord is straight.
'If you turn away
column5: then (remember) I have delivered to you the message I was sent with. My Lord will put other people in your place
column6: and you will not be able to prevail against Him. Indeed my Lord keeps a watch over all things."'

text: 'So
column5: when Our command was issued We rescued Hud by Our grace
column6: and those who believed
column7: with him
column8: and saved them from a dreadful doom.'

text: 'These were the people of ''Ad who denied the word of their Lord and rebelled against His apostles

text: 'So they were accursed in the world
column5: and they will be damned on the Day of Doom. Beware! The ''Ad turned away from their Lord.'

text: 'Be warned! Accursed are the people of ''Ad who were Hud''s. To Thamud We Sent their brother Saleh. "O my people

text: 'They said: "O Saleh

text: 'He said: "O my people

text: 'The sinners were seized by a blast from heaven

column6:

column6: they said. Verily He is worthy of praise and glory."'

text: 'When Abraham''s fear was dispelled
column5: and the good news had come to him

column5: compassionate
column6: and penitent.'

text: '"Desist from pleading
column5: O Abraham
column6: (they said). Your Lord''s command has verily been issued

text: 'So when Our angels came to Lot

text: 'So when the decreed moment arrived
column5: We turned the habitations upside down
column6: and rained upon them stones of hardened lava in quick succession

text: Impressed with (the signs) of your Lord. And such (punishment) is not far for the (other) transgressers.
'We sent to Midian their brother Shu''aib. He said: "O my people
column5: worship God; you have no other god but He. So do not give in short measure nor underweigh. I see you are prosperous
column6: but I fear the doom of an overwhelming Day for you.'

text: 'So
column5: O my people
column6: weigh and measure with justness
column7: and do not withhold things due to men
column8: and do not spread corruption in the land
column9: despoiling it.'

text: 'That which is left to you by God is better
column5: if you are true believers; yet I am not a warden over you."'

text: 'They said: "O Shu''aib
column5: does your piety teach that we should abandon what our fathers worshipped
column6: or desist from doing what we like with our goods? How gracious a man of discernment you are indeed!"'

text: 'He said: "O my people
column5: think. I have a clear sign from my Lord
column6: who has also given me a goodly provision
column7: and I do not wish for myself what I forbid you: I only wish to reform you as best I can. My success is from God alone. In Him I have placed my trust

text:
O my people (I fear) lest your opposition to me should bring you the like of what befell the people of Noah or Hud or Saleh; and the people of Lot are not distant from you.

column5: O people
column6: I will do what I will. You will come to know who suffers the punishment that would put him to shame

column5: We rescued Shu''aib and those who believed

text: As though they had not dwelt there at all. Beware! Condemmed were the people of Midian as those of Thamud had been before them!
We sent Moses with Our signs and full authority

text: 'He shall be at the head of his people on the Day of Resurrection

text: 'These are a few accounts of settlements that We narrate to you. Some still survive
column5: and some have been mowed down.'

text: 'We did not wrong them; they wronged themselves. When your Lord''s chastisement descended upon them
column5: their gods
column6: on whom they called apart from God
column7: were not of the least avail
column8: and all they did was only to add to their destruction.'

text: Such is the punishment of your Lord when He seizes human settlements in the acts of wickedness. Surely His hold is grievous and terrible.
'In this surely is a sign for him who fears the torment of the Hereafter
column5: the day when mankind will be assembled together
column6: which will be a day when all things would become evident.'

text: We are deferring it only for a time ordained.
'The day it comes no soul will dare say a word but by His leave; and some will be wretched
column5: some will be blessed.'

text: 'And those who are doomed
column5: will be in Hell: For them will be sighing and sobbing

text: 'Where they will dwell so long as heaven and earth endure
column5: unless your Lord will otherwise. Verily your Lord does as He wills.'

text: 'Those who are blessed will be in Paradise
column5: where they will dwell so long as heaven and earth survive
column6: unless your Lord wills otherwise: This will be a gift uninterrupted.'

text: 'So
column5: you should not entertain any doubt about those whom they worship: They only worship what their fathers had worshipped before them. We shall verily give them their meed without diminution.'

text: 'Verily We gave to Moses the Book
column5: but there was disagreement about it. Had the decree of your Lord (delaying it) not been issued the matter would have been settled between them. They are still suspicious of it and in doubt.'

text: Surely your Lord will reward everyone in accordance with his deeds. He is certainly aware of all they do.
'So
column5: you and those who turned to God with you
column6: should walk along the straight path as you have been commanded
column7: and do not transgress
column8: for He verily sees whatsoever you do.'

text: 'Do not lean towards the wicked
column5: or you will be caught in the flames of Hell
column6: and have none to befriend you other than God
column7: nor will you be given help.'

text: Stand up for the service of prayer at the two ends of day and the first watch of night. Remember that good deeds nullify the bad. This is a reminder for those who are observant.
'Be steadfast
column5: for verily God does not let the reward of those who are upright and do good to go waste.'

text: 'If only there had been men endued with virtue in the ages before you
column5: who could preserve men from doing evil in the world
column6: other than the few We saved from among them. Those who were wicked followed that which made them dissolute
column7: and became sinners.'

text: Your Lord would not surely destroy unjustly human habitations so long as the people are righteous.
'But if your Lord had pleased He could have made all human beings into one community of belief. But they would still have differed from one another
Except those on whom your Lord had mercy for which He has created them. But fulfilled shall be the word of your Lord. "I will fill up Hell with jinns and men."
'The histories of apostles that We relate to you are (meant) to strengthen your heart. Through them has the truth come to you
column5: and guidance
column6: and reminder to those who believe.'

text: 'Say to the infidels. "Act as best you can
column5: we are acting too;'

text: 'And wait (for what is to come)
column5: we are also waiting (to see)."'

text: 'To God belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth
column5: and all things will go back to Him. So worship Him and put your trust in Him; your Lord is not heedless of what you do.'

text: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the immaculate Book.
We have sent it down as a clear discourse that you may understand.
'Through the revelation of this Qur''an We narrate the best of histories of which you were unaware before.'
'When Joseph told his father: "O my father
column5: I saw eleven stars and the sun and the moon bowing before me in homage
column6:
'
TQA1601,QA1601,TLQ01,'He said: O son
column7: do not narrate your dream to your brothers
column8: or they will plot against you. Surely Satan is man''s acknowledged foe.'

text: 'Your Lord will choose you and teach you to interpret events
column5: and confer His favours on you and the house of Jacob
column6: as He had done in the case of two ancestors of yours
column7: Abraham and Isaac
column8: before you. Indeed your Lord is all-knowing and all-wise."'

text: In the story of Joseph and his brothers are lessons for those who inquire.
'"Surely Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we
column5: (said his half brothers) even though we are a well-knit band. Our father is surely in the wrong.'

text: 'Let us kill Joseph or cast him in some distant land so that we may get our father''s exclusive affection; then play innocent."'
'One of them said: "If you must do so
column5: then do not kill Joseph
column6: but throw him into an unused well. Some passing caravan may rescue him."'

text: '(Then going to their father) they said: "O father
column5: why don''t you trust us with Joseph? We are in fact his well-wishers.'

text: Let him go out with us tomorrow that he may enjoy and play. We shall take care of him."
He said: "I am afraid of sending him with you lest a wolf should devour him when you are unmindful."
'They replied: "If a wolf should devour him when we are there
column5: a well-knit band
column6: we shall certainly be treacherous."'

text: 'So
column5: when they took him out they planned to throw him into an unused well. We revealed to Joseph: "You will tell them (one day) of this deed when they will not apprehend it."'

text: 'At nightfall they came to their father weeping
And said: "We went racing with one another and left Joseph to guard our things when a wolf devoured him. But you will not believe us even though we tell the truth."
They showed him the shirt with false blood on it. (Their father) said: "It is not so; you have made up the story. Yet endurance is best. I seek the help of God alone for what you impute."
'A caravan happened to pass
column5: and sent the water-carrier to bring water from the well. He let down his bucket (and pulled Joseph up with it). "What luck
column6: said the man; here is a boy;" and they hid him as an item of merchandise; but what they did was known to God.'

text: And they sold him as worthless for a few paltry dirham.
'The Egyptian who bought him instructed his wife: "House him honourably. He may be of use to us. We may even adopt him as a son." So
column5: We firmly established Joseph in the land
column6: and taught him the interpretation of dreams. God dominated in his affairs
column7: though most men do not know.'

text: When he reached the prime of life We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus We reward those who are good.
'But she in whose house he resided wished to seduce him and
column5: closing the doors
column6: said: "Come into me. "God forbid!" he said; "he is my master who has approved my stay. Surely those who act wrongly do not prosper."'

text: 'But the woman desired him
column5: and he would have desired her but for the indication he received from his Lord. This was so that We may avert both evil and lechery from him
column6: for he was one of Our chosen devotees.'

text: 'Both of them raced to the door
column5: and she (grabbed and) rent his shirt from behind. They met her lord outside the door. "There is no other penalty for a man
column6: said she, who wanted to outrage your wife but imprisonment or grievous punishment."'

text: '(Joseph) said: "It was she who wanted to seduce me." And a witness from her family testified: "If the shirt is torn from the front then the woman is speaking the truth
column5: and he is a liar.'

text: 'But if the shirt is torn from behind then she is a liar
column5: and he speaks the truth."'

text: 'When the husband saw the shirt torn at the back
column5: he said: "Surely this is a woman''s ruse
column6: and the wiles of women are great.'

text: 'Ignore this affair
column5: O Joseph; and you
column6: O woman
column7: ask forgiveness for your sin
column8: for you were surely errant."'

text: 'In the city the women gossiped: "The minister''s wife longs after her page. He has captured her heart. We think she is in clear error."'
'When she heard their slanderings
column5: she sent for them and prepared a banquet
column6: and gave each of them a knife (for paring fruit)
column7: and called (to Joseph): "Come out before them." When they saw him
column8: the women were so wonderstruck they cut their hands
column9: and exclaimed: "O Lord preserve us! He is no mortal but an honourable angel."'

text: 'She said: "This is the one you blamed me for. I did desire his person
column5: but he preserved himself from sin. Yet in case he does not do my bidding he will be put into prison and disgraced."'

text: '(Joseph) prayed: "O Lord
column5: dearer is prison than what they invite me to. Unless You turn their guiles away from me I shall succumb to their charms and thus become a pagan."'

text: 'His Lord heard his prayer
column5: and averted the women''s wiles from him. He verily hears and knows everything.'

text: And yet in spite of having seen these clear proofs they found it proper to incarcerate him for a time.
'Two other youths were imprisoned along with him. Said one of them: "I dreamt that I was pressing grapes;" and the other: "I dreamt that I was carrying bread on my head
column5: and the birds were pecking at it. You tell us the meaning of this. You seem to be a righteous man."'

text: (Joseph) answered: "I will give you its interpretation before the food you are served arrives. This knowledge is one of the things my Lord has taught me. I have given up the religion of those who do not believe in God and deny the life to come.
'I follow the faith of my fathers
column5: of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. We cannot associate anyone with God. This is among God''s favours to us and to all mankind; but most men are not grateful.'

text: '(Tell me) O fellow-prisoners
column5: are a number of gods better
column6: or one God omnipotent?'

text: '(What) you worship besides Him are nothing but names that you and your fathers have assigned
column5: for which no sanction has been sent down by God. Authority belongs to God alone. He commands that you worship none but Him. This is the right way; but most men are ignorant.'

text: 'O fellow-prisoners
column5: one of you will serve wine to your master
column6: the other will be crucified and the birds will peck at his brain. Determined is the matter of your inquiry."'

text: 'And (Joseph) asked the man he knew would be released: "Remember me to your lord;" but Satan made him forget to mention this to his lord
column5: and Joseph remained in prison for a number of years.'

text: '(One day) the king said (to his courtiers): "I saw seven fat cows in a dream being devoured by seven lean ones
column5: and seven ears of corn that were green and seven others that were seared. O courtiers
column6: tell me the significance of my dream
column7: if you know how to interpret them."'

text: '"They were only confused dreams
column5: they said; we do not know how to interpret them."'

text: 'Then the servant
column5: who of the two had been released
column6: remembering (Joseph)
column7: said: "I will give you its interpretation; let me go for it."'

text: '(And coming to the prison) he said: "O Joseph the truthful
column5: tell us (the meaning of) seven fat cows being devoured by seven lean ones
column6: and seven green ears of corn and seven seared
column7: that I may go back to the people and tell them."'

text: 'He said: "Sow as usual for seven years
column5: and after reaping leave the corn in the ears
column6: except the little you need for food.'

text: 'Then there will come seven years of hardship which will consume the grain you had laid up against them
column5: except a little you may have stored away.'

text: 'This will be followed by a year of rain
column5: and people shall press (the grapes)."'

text: 'The king said: "Bring him to me. So when the messenger came to Joseph
column5: he said: "Go back to your lord and ask him: ''How fare the women who had cut their hands?'' My Lord is cognisant of their guile."'

text: 'The king asked the women: "What was the affair of seducing Joseph?" "God preserve us
column5: they said; we know no evil against him." The wife of the minister said: "The truth has now come out. It was I who desired to seduce him
column6: but he is indeed a man of virtue." --'

text: '(At this Joseph remarked:) "From this (the Minister) should know that I did not betray him in his absence
column5: and that God does not surely let the wiles of those who betray ever succeed.'

text: 'But I do not wish to absolve myself
column5: for the soul is prone to evil
column6: unless my Lord have mercy. Indeed my Lord is forgiving and kind." --'

text: 'When the king heard this he said: "Bring him to me. I shall take him in my special service." When he had talked to him
column5: he said: "Today you are established in a rank of trust with us."'

text: '"Appoint me over the granaries of the land
column5: (he said); I shall be a knowledgeable keeper."'

text: 'Thus We gave Joseph authority in the land so that he lived wherever he liked. We bestow Our favours on whomsoever We please
column5: and do not allow the reward of those who are good to go waste.'

text: And certainly the recompense of the life to come is better for those who believe and follow the right path.
'The brothers of Joseph came (to Egypt) and visited him. He recognised them
column5: though they did not recognise him.'

text: 'When he had supplied their provisions
column5: he said to them: "Bring your (half) brother with you. Have you not seen that I have given full measure
column6: and that I am the best of hosts?'

text: 'But if you do not bring him with you
column5: then I shall have no grain for you
column6: nor should you come back to me."'

text: 'They said: "We shall request his father
column5: and will certainly do that."'

text: 'Then he ordered his servants: "Put their money back in their packs: They may find it on reaching home
column5: and perhaps come again."'

text: 'When they returned to their father
column5: they said: "O father
column6: a further measure has been denied us. So send our brother with us that he may bring more grain. We shall take care of him."'

text: 'He replied: "Should I trust you with him as I did his brother? But God is the best of guardians
column5: and most merciful of all."'

text: 'When they unpacked their goods they said: "O father
column5: what more can we ask? Look
column6: even our money has been returned. We shall go and bring a camel-load more of grain for our family
column7: and take good care of our brother. That will be an easy measure."'

text: 'He said: "I will never send him with you until you swear by God that you will bring him back to me
column5: unless all of you are overtaken (by misfortune)." When they had given their promise
column6: he said: "God is witness to our conversation."'

text: '(As they were leaving) their father said to them: "O my sons
column5: do not seek one approach but employ different ways (of attaining your object). If anything should befall you from God I shall not be able to avert it
column6: for all authority belongs to God. I have placed my trust in Him
column7: and the trusting should rely on Him alone."'

text: 'When they entered as their father had advised them
column5: nothing could avail them against (the will of) God
column6: yet it confirmed a premonition Jacob had
column7: for verily he had knowledge as We had taught him
column8: though most men do not know.'

text: 'When they came to Joseph he made his brother his guest
column5: and said: "I am your brother. So do not grieve for what they had done."'

text: 'When he had given them their provisions he put his goblet in his brother''s saddle-bag. Then a crier announced: "O men of the caravan
column5: you are thieves."'

text: They turned to them and asked: "What is it you have lost?"
'"We cannot find the master''s goblet. Whoever comes up with it will be given a camel-load of grain; I vouch for it."'
'They said: "We swear by God. You know we did not come to commit any crime in the land
column5: nor are we thieves."'

text: '"What should be the punishment
column5: they were asked, in case you are liars?"'

text: '"The punishment for that (should be)
column5: they said, that he in whose luggage it is found should be held as punishment. This is how we repay the wrong-doers."'

text: 'So he searched their saddle-bags before his brother''s
column5: then produced the cup from his brother''s bag. That is how We planned an excuse for Joseph
column6: for under the law of the king he could not detain his brother unless God so willed. We raise the status of whom We please. Over every man of knowledge there is one more knowing.'

text: 'Said the brothers: "If he has stolen (no wonder)
column5: his brother had stolen before." But Joseph kept this secret and did not disclose it to them
column6: and said (to himself): "You are worse in the degree of evil
column7: for God knows better of what you allege."'

text: 'They said: "O Minister
column5: he has an aged father
column6: so keep one of us in his place. We see you are a virtuous man."'

text: '"May God forgive us
column5: he said, if we hold any one but him with whom we found our property
column6: or else we would be unjust."'

text: 'When they despaired of (persuading) him
column5: they went aside to confer. The oldest of them said: "You know that your father has pledged you in the name of God
column6: and you have been guilty of iniquity in the case of Joseph before. I will not leave this place unless my father permits or God decides for me
column7: for He is the best of all judges.'

text: 'So
column5: go to your father and tell him: ''O father
column6: your son has committed a theft. We bear witness to only what we know; we could not prevent the unknown.'

text: 'Enquire from the people of that city
column5: or ask the men of the caravan with whom we have come. We are verily speaking the truth.''"'

text: '"No
column5: said (the father). You have made up the story; but patience is best; God may bring them back to me. He is all-knowing and all-wise."'

text: He turned away from them and cried: "Alas for Joseph!" And his eyes turned white with grief which he bore in silence.
'"By God
column5: said they, you will never stop thinking of Joseph till you are consumed or perish."'

text: 'He replied: "I cry my plaint and grief to God
column5: and know from God what you do not know.'

text: 'O sons
column5: go in search of Joseph and his brother
column6: and do not despair of the mercy of God. Only they despair of God''s mercy who do not believe."'

text: 'When they returned to him
column5: they said (to Joseph): "O Minister
column6: calamity has befallen us and our people. We have brought but a meagre sum
column7: but give us full measure as alms bestowed. God surely rewards those who give alms."'

column5: He said: "Do you know what you did to Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?"'

text: 'They said: "Surely you are not Joseph!" "I am Joseph
column5: he said, and this is my brother. God has been gracious to us; for God does not verily deprive those who fear Him and are patient of the recompense of those who are good."'

text: 'They said: "By God
column5: God has favoured you above us
column6: for we have indeed been sinners."'

text: '"There is no blame on you today
column5: he said, May God forgive you. He is the most merciful of all.'

text: 'Take my shirt and put it on my father''s face; his eyesight will be restored; and bring your entire family to me."'
'The caravan departed (from Egypt) and Jacob said (at home): "Say not that I am in my dotage
column5: but I get the smell of Joseph."'

text: 'They said: "By God
column5: you are still persisting in your old delusion."'

text: 'Then
column5: as the harbinger of happy news arrived and put the garment over his face his eyesight was restored. He said: "Did I not tell you? I know from God what you do not know."'

text: 'Said (the sons): "O our father
column5: pray for us that our sins be forgiven
column6: for we are really sinners."'

text: '"I will ask my Lord to forgive you
column5: he replied, for He is forgiving and kind."'

text: 'When they went back to Joseph he gave his father and mother a place of honour
column5: and said: "Enter Egypt in peace by the will of God."'

text: 'He seated his parents by his side on the throne; and they fell down before him in homage. "O my father
column5: said Joseph, this is the meaning of my earlier dream. My Lord has made it come true. He was gracious in getting me out of the prison
column6: and bringing you out of the desert to me after the discord created by Satan between me and my brothers
column7: for my Lord is gracious to whomsoever He please. He is indeed all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'O my Lord
column5: you have given me dominion and taught me the interpretation of dreams; O Creator of the heavens and the earth
column6: You alone are my saviour in this world and the world to come; let me die submitting to You
column7: and place me among the upright."'

text: 'This is news of the unknown We reveal to you
column5: for you were not present when Joseph''s brothers agreed on their course of action
column6: and devised their plot.'

text: 'Many men will not believe howsoever you wish
Even though you ask no recompense (for it). It is only a warning for all mankind.
'How many a sign there is in the heavens and the earth which most men pass by and ignore
'Not only do they not believe in God
column5: but also associate others with Him.'

text: 'Do they really believe that an all-embracing punishment of God will not come upon them
column5: or the Day of Doom overtake them suddenly while they remain unaware?'

text: 'Say: "My way
column5: and that of my followers
column6: is to call you to God with full perception. All glory to God
column7: I am not an idolater."'

text: 'All the apostles We had sent before you were men of those regions
column5: to whom We sent Our revelations. Have they not travelled on the earth and seen what befell the people before them? Surely the abode of the Hereafter is better for those who fear straying from the right path. Do you not understand?'

text: 'When the apostles despaired and thought they were made false promises
column5: Our help arrived
column6: and We delivered whom We pleased; but never will Our punishment be averted from the sinners.'

text: 'Verily in their accounts is a lesson for men of wisdom. This is not a fictitious tale
column5: but a verification of earlier Books
column6: and a clear exposition of everything
column7: and a guidance and grace for those who believe.'

text: ALIF LAM MIM RA. These are the verses of the Scripture. Whatsoever is sent down to you from your Lord is the truth; but most men do not believe.
'It is God who raised the skies without support
column5: as you can see
column6: then assumed His throne
column7: and enthralled the sun and the moon (so that) each runs to a predetermined course. He disposes all affairs
column8: distinctly explaining every sign that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.'

text: It is He who stretched the earth and placed upon it stabilisers and rivers; and made two of a pair of every fruit; (and) He covers up the day with the night. In these are signs for those who reflect.
'On the earth are tracts adjoining one another
column5: and vineyards
column6: fields of corn and date-palm trees
column7: some forked
column8: some with single trunks
column9: yet all irrigated by the self-same water
column10: though We make some more excellent than the others in fruit. There are surely signs in them for those who understand.'

text: 'If you are surprised
column5: then astonishing is the speech (of those who say:) "Having turned to dust shall we be raised as a new creation?" They are the ones who deny their Lord
column6: and they will have collars around their necks. They are the inmates of Hell
column7: where they will abide for ever.'

text: 'They want you to hasten the evil before the good
column5: even when there have been examples of retribution before them. Though certainly your Lord forgives human beings for their iniquities
column6: your Lord is severe of retribution.'

text: 'The unbelievers say: "Why no miracle was sent down to him by his Lord?" But you are only a bearer of warnings
column5: and a guide for every nation.'

text: 'God is cognisant of what every female carries in her womb
column5: or what the wombs want or exceed (of their disburdening time). With Him all things are in determined measure.'

text: 'He is the knower of the known and the unknown
column5: the mighty and most high.'

text: 'He who keeps his secret among you is the same to Him as he who speaks out publicly
column5: and he who hides himself in the night and walks freely in the day.'

text: 'His angels keep watch over him in succession (night and day)
column5: in front and behind
column6: by God''s command. Verily God does not change the state of a people till they change themselves. When God intends misfortune for a people no one can avert it
column7: and no saviour will they have apart from Him.'

text: 'It is He who makes the lightning flash for fear and hope
column5: and raises massive clouds.'

text: 'The thunder sings His praises
column5: and the angels too
column6: for awe of Him. He sends thunder-bolts and strikes whosoever He will with them: Even then it is God they contend about! But mighty is He in (His) power.'

text: 'To call on Him is true (supplication). For those they invoke other than Him do not answer them at all
column5: except like a man who stretches his hands towards the water that it reach his mouth
column6: but it will never reach it. Not more than error are the prayers of infidels.'

text: 'Whosoever is in the heavens and on earth bows to God in submission with a will or perforce
column5: as do their shadows in the morning and evening.'

text: 'Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?" (They will) say: "God." Say: "Then why do you take protectors besides Him who have no power over their own gain or loss?" Say: "Can a blind man and one who can see be equal? Or
column5: darkness and light be the same? Or
column6: have those they have appointed equal of God created
column7: as He has created
column8: so that the (two) creations look alike to them?" Say: "God is the creator of everything. He is One
column9: the omnipotent."'

text: 'He sends down water from the skies
column5: which flows in channels according to their capacity
column6: with the scum borne on the surface of the torrent
column7: as rises the scum when metals are heated on the fire for making ornaments and household utensils. This is how God determines truth and falsehood. The scum disappears like the foam on the bank
column8: and that which is useful to man remains on the earth. That is how God sets forth precepts of wisdom.'

text: 'For those who obey their Lord is excellence. For those who fail to obey
column5: the reckoning will be hard
column6: even if they possess and give as ransom all that there is on the earth
column7: and as much more; and Hell will be their abode: How wretched is its wide expanse!'

text: 'Can a man who knows what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth
column5: and one who cannot see
column6: be the same? They alone take warning who are wise

text: 'Who fulfil their covenant with God and do not break their agreement
'Who keep together what God has ordained held together
column5: and fear their Lord and dread the hardship of the Reckoning

text: 'Who persevere in seeking the way of their Lord
column5: who fulfil their devotional obligations
column6: and spend of what We have given them
column7: secretly or openly
column8: who repel evil with good: For them is the recompense of Paradise:'

text: 'Perpetual gardens which they will enter with those of their fathers
column5: spouses and children who were virtuous and at peace
column6: with angels coming in through every door'

text: 'Saying: "(Welcome
column5: ) peace on you
column6: for you persevered." How excellent the recompense of Paradise!'

text: 'As for those who break God''s covenant after validating it
column5: and sever relations which God ordained cohered
column6: and spread corruption in the land
column7: there is condemnation for them and an evil abode.'

text: 'God increases or decreases the fortunes of whosoever He will
column5: and they rejoice in the life of this world. Yet the life of this world is nothing but a merchandise as compared to the life of the next.'

text: 'The unbelievers say: "How is it that no miracle was sent down to him by his Lord?" Say: "God leads whosoever He wills astray
column5: and guides whoever turns to Him in repentance.'

text: Those who believe and find peace in their hearts from the contemplation of God: Surely there is peace of heart in the contemplation of God!"
'Those who believe and do the right
column5: have happiness
column6: and an excellent resting place.'

text: 'That is how We have sent you to a people before whom many a people have come and gone
column5: so that you may announce to them whatever We have revealed to you. But they do not believe in Ar-Rahman. Tell them: "He is my Lord. There is no other god but He. In Him have I placed my trust
column6: and to Him is my reversion."'

text: 'Had there been a Qur''an which could have made the mountains move
column5: or the earth to cleave asunder
column6: or the dead to speak
column7: yet all authority belongs to God. Have the believers not learnt that if God had so willed He could have guided all mankind? As for unbelievers
column8: they will be visited by misfortune endlessly for what they have done; or it would sit in their homes till the promised threat of God comes to pass. Surely God does not go back on His promise.'

text: 'Many an apostle have they mocked before you; but I allowed the unbelievers respite
column5: then I seized them. How severe was My punishment then!'

text: 'Who is it who stands (watch) over every soul for what it does? Yet they ascribe compeers to God. Say: "Then name them. Or are you announcing to God what He does not know on the earth? Or is it only empty talk? In fact
column5: the unbelievers'' plots are made to look attractive to them
column6: so that they are held back from the right path. Whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way.'

text: For them is punishment in this world; and the punishment of the world to come is far more severe. They will have no one to save them from God.
'The likeness of Paradise promised the pious and devout is (of a garden) with streams of rippling water
column5: everlasting fruits and shade. This is the recompense of those who keep away from evil; but the recompense of those who deny the truth is Hell.'

text: 'Those to whom We have given the Scriptures rejoice in what We have sent down to you; but some of their factions reject some of it. Tell them: "I am commanded to worship only God
column5: and not to associate compeers with Him. To Him I call you
column6: and to Him is the destination."'

text: 'That is how We have sent down this (Qur''an) as a code of clear judgement. But if you follow their caprices
column5: now that you have been given knowledge
column6: you will have no friend or protector against God.'

text: 'We sent many apostles before you
column5: and bestowed on them wives and children
column6: but it was not for any apostle to come up with a miracle unless by the leave of God. For every age there is a law.'

text: 'God abrogates or confirms whatsoever He will
column5: for He has with Him the Book of Books.'

text: 'Whether We allow you to see (the punishment) We have promised them
column5: or end your life before (its execution)
column6: it is certainly for you to convey the message; the reckoning is for Us to do.'

text: Do they not see Us advancing from all sides into their land and reducing its frontiers? It is for God to judge; and there is none to reverse His judgement. He is swift at reckoning.
'Surely those who had gone before them had also plotted; but God''s is all the planning
column5: for He has knowledge of what each does. The unbelievers will soon learn for whom is the guerdon of Paradise.'

text: 'Yet those who are disbelievers say: "You are not the apostle sent (by God)." Tell them: "God is sufficient as witness between me and you
column5: and he who has knowledge of the Book."'

text: 'ALIF LAM RA. A Book We have sent down to you that you may lead men out of darkness into light
column5: by their Lord''s command
column6: to the path of the mighty
column7: the worthy of praise.'

text: 'God
column5: to whom belongs all there is in the heavens and the earth. Woe to the unbelievers for the terrible punishment (that awaits).'

text: 'Those who hold the life of this world dearer than that of the next
column5: who obstruct the path of God and seek obliquity in it
column6: have wandered far into error.'

text: 'We never sent a messenger who did not speak the tongue of his people
column5: that he may explain to them distinctly. God leads whosoever He wills astray
column6: and shows whoever He wills the way: He is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'Remember when We sent Moses with Our signs (We said): "Bring your people out of darkness into light
column5: and remind them of the visitations of God. Indeed there are signs in this for every steadfast
column6: thankful soul"'

text: 'So Moses said to his people: "Remember the favours of God when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh who afflicted you with oppression
column5: slaying your sons but keeping alive your women
column6: which was a great trial from your Lord."'

text: 'Remember
column5: your Lord proclaimed: "I shall give you more if you are grateful; but if you are thankless then surely My punishment is very great."'

text: 'And Moses said: "What if you and all the people of the world deny
column5: God is unconcerned and worthy of praise."'

text: 'Has not the news of those before you
column5: the people of Noah and ''Ad and Thamud
column6: and those who came after them
column7: come to you? None knows (about) them except God. Their apostles came to them with clear proofs
column8: but they tried to silence them and said: "We do not believe in what you have been sent with
column9: and we are in doubt of what you call us to
column10: about which we are in disquiet.'''

text: 'Said their apostles: "Can there be doubt about God
column5: the originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to forgive some of your sins
column6: and give you respite for a time ordained." They said: "You are only men like us
column7: and yet you wish to turn us away from what our fathers worshipped. Bring to us then a clear proof."'

text: 'Their apostles said to them: "Indeed we are men like you
column5: but God bestows His favours on whomsoever He wills among His creatures. It is not in our power to bring a miracle for you without the leave of God. The believers should only place their trust in God.'

text: And why should we not repose our trust in God when He has shown us our paths of duty to Him? We shall bear with fortitude the hardships you inflict upon us. The trusting place their trust in God."
'The unbelievers said to their apostles: "We shall drive you out of our land
column5: or else you come back to our fold." Their Lord then communicated to them: "We shall annihilate these wicked people

text: 'And establish you in their place. This is for him who fears My station
column5: and dreads My commination."'

text: 'Then (the apostles) asked of God''s assistance
column5: and every arrogant tyrant was frustrated:'

text: 'Before him is Hell
column5: and he will get putrid liquid to drink.'

text: 'He will sip it
column5: yet will not be able to gulp it down. Death will crowd in upon him from every side
column6: but die he will not. A terrible torment trails him.'

text: 'Like ashes are the deeds of those who deny their Lord
column5: which the wind blows away on a windy day. They shall have no power over what they earned. This is the farthest limit of going astray.'

text: Do you not see that God has created the heavens and the earth with ultimate reason? If He so wills He could take you away from the earth and raise a new creation (in your place).
This is well within the power of God.
'When they will all appear before God together
column5: the weak will say to those who were arrogant: "We were your followers
column6: so can you now save us a little from God''s punishment?" They will say: "If we had been guided by God we would surely have shown you the way. To lament or endure is all the same to us now. No getting away is there for us."'

text: 'When the reckoning is over Satan will say: "The promise that was made to you by God was indeed a true promise; but I went back on the promise I had made
column5: for I had no power over you except to call you; and you responded to my call. So blame me not
column6: but blame yourselves. Neither can I help you nor can you give me help. I disavow your having associated me earlier (with God). The punishment for those who are wicked is painful indeed."'

text: 'Those who believed and did the right
column5: will be admitted to gardens with rivers flowing by
column6: where they will abide by the leave of their Lord
column7: with ''Peace'' as their salutation.'

text: 'Do you not see how God compares a noble act to a healthy tree whose roots are firm and branches in the sky
column5: which yields'

text: 'By the leave of its Lord its fruit in all seasons
column5: God presents words of wisdom to men that they might reflect.'

text: An evil act is like a rotten tree torn out of the earth with no (base or) firmness.
'With immutuble words God makes the faithful dauntless in the life of the world and the life to come
column5: but leads the unjust into error
column6: for God does as He pleases.'

text: 'Have you not looked at those who repaid God''s favours with ingratitude; who pulled their people down to ruin
'Hell
column5: where they will roast in the fire? And what an evil repository!'

text: They have appointed equals of God to mislead people from His path. Tell them: "Enjoy yourselves (so long as you may). In the end you have to go to Hell."
'Tell those of My creatures who believe: "Observe your devotional obligations and give of what We have given you in charity
column5: secretly or openly
column6: before the Day arrives when there will be no buying or selling or befriending."'

text: 'It is God who created the heavens and the earth
column5: and sent down rain from the sky producing fruits for your food thereby
column6: and made you master of the ships that ply in the oceans by His command
column7: subjected the rivers to your control

text: And subjugated the sun and moon for you so that they perform their tasks diligently; and subdued the night and day for your service.
'He gave you whatsoever you asked. If you try to count the favours of God you will not be able to calculate. Man is most unjust indeed
column5: full of ingratitude.'

text: 'Remember when Abraham prayed: "O Lord
column5: make this a city of peace
column6: and preserve me and my progeny from worshipping idols:'

text: 'Many a man have they led astray
column5: O Lord. So he who follows me is truly of me; but as for him who disobeys me
column6: surely You are forgiving and kind.'

text: 'I have settled some of my children
column5: O Lord
column6: in a barren valley near Your sacred House
column7: so that
column8: O our Lord
column9: they may be constant in devotion. So put in the hearts of men some kindness for them
column10: and provide fruits for them: They may haply be grateful.'

text: 'O Lord
column5: You have knowledge of what we hide and what we reveal
column6: for nothing on the earth or in the skies is hidden from God.'

text: All praise be to God who bestowed on me Ishmael and Isaac in old age. Verily my Lord listens to prayer.
'Grant
column5: O Lord
column6: that I and my offspring may remain constant in devotion. Grant
column7: O Lord
column8: my supplication.'

text: 'O Lord
column5: forgive me
column6: my parents and the faithful on the Day the reckoning is done."'

text: 'Think not God is oblivious of the deeds of the wicked. He has only allowed them respite till the Day on which all eyes would stare aghast
'(And) they would hasten forward
column5: heads lifted upwards
column6: gazes fixed
column7: and emptied out their hearts.'

text: 'Warn the people of that Day when the punishment would be inflicted upon them. Then will the wicked say: "O our Lord
column5: give us respite a while more. We shall heed Your call and follow the apostles." (But they will be told
column6: ): "Are you not those who used to swear: ''There is no reverse for us?'''

text: 'Yet you dwelt in the dwellings of those who had exceeded themselves
column5: and it was evident to you how We had dealt with them; and We held out examples before you."'

text: 'Still they are plotting their plots
column5: but evident are their plots to God
column6: even though they are so adroit as to make the mountains move.'

text: 'Think not that God would go back on His promise (made) to the apostles. Indeed God is mighty
column5: the Lord of retribution.'

text: 'The day when the earth will he replaced by some other than the earth
column5: as will be the skies
column6: and every one will appear before God the one and omnipotent

text: You will see the wicked on that day bound together in chains.
'Of molten pitch shall be their garments
column5: their faces covered with flames

text: That God may reward each soul for its deeds. Indeed God is swift at reckoning!
'This is a message for mankind that they may take a warning from it
column5: and may know that He is the one and only God
column6: and that men of wisdom may reflect.'

text: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the Book and the perspicuous oration.
The unbelievers would haply like to wish that they had submitted (and become Muslim).
'Leave them to feast and revel
column5: beguiled by hope; they will come to know soon.'

text: Not one habitation have We destroyed but at the time determined for it.
No people can hasten or delay the term already fixed for them.
'And yet they say: "You
column5: to whom this Exposition has been sent are surely possessed of the Devil.'

text: 'If you are a man of truth
column5: why can''t you bring the angels to us?"'

text: 'But then We never send the angels down save with the purpose (of enforcing their doom)
column5: after which they will not be given more respite.'

text: 'We have sent down this Exposition
column5: and We will guard it.'

text: We had also sent apostles to people of earlier persuasions.
But never once an apostle came to them at whom they did not scoff.
We place in the hearts of sinners (disbelief).
'So
column5: they will not believe in it: The example of former people is there.'

text: 'Even if We open a door in the heavens and they ascend through it in broad daylight
They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."
'We have placed the signs of the Zodiac in the sky
column5: and decked it out for those who can see;'

text: 'And We have preserved it from every accursed devil
'Except the ones who listen on the sly
column5: yet they are chased away by a shooting flame.'

text: 'We stretched the earth and placed upon it firm stabilisers
column5: and made all things grow upon it balanced evenly.'

text: 'We have provided on it sustenance for you
column5: and for those you cannot provide.'

text: 'Of all things there are We have the stores
column5: and send them down in determined measure.'

text: 'We send rain-impregnated winds
column5: and water from the sky which you drink
column6: but you are not the keepers of its store.'

text: 'It is We who give life and We who give death
column5: and We are the One who will abide.'

text: We surely know those of you who go forward and those of you who lag behind.
Your Lord will surely gather them together: Certainly He is all-wise and all-knowing.
'Man We fashioned from fermented clay dried tingling hard
As We fashioned jinns before from intense radiated heat.
But when your Lord said to the angels: "I am verily going to create a human being from fermented clay dried tingling hard;
'And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit
column5: bow before him in homage;"'

text: The angels bowed in homage in a body
Except Iblis. He refused to bow with the adorers.
'"How is it
column5: O Iblis
column6: said (the Lord), you did not join those who bowed in homage?"'

text: '"How could I bow
column5: said he, before a mortal whom You created from fermented clay dried tingling hard?"'

text: '"Go hence
column5: execrable
column6: (said the Lord), from this place

text: Condemned till the day of Doom!"
'"O my Lord
column5: said he, give me respite till the day the dead are raised."'

text: '"You are among the reprieved
column5:
(said the Lord),'
TQA1840,QA1840,TLQ01,Till the predetermined time."

text: '"O my Lord
column5: he said, since You have led me into error I''ll beguile them with the pleasures of the world and lead them astray

text: Except the chosen ones among Your creatures."
(To which God) said: "This way is right by Me.
'No power shall you have over (all) My creatures except those who fall into error and follow you
'For whom the ordained place is surely Hell
'Which has several gates
column5: and each gate is marked for every section of them."'

text: Verily those who keep away from evil and follow the straight path shall be in the midst of gardens and springs of water.
'"Enter in peace and tranquility
column5:
(they will be told).'
TQA1849,QA1849,TLQ01,We shall cast out any grudge they may have in their hearts. (There) they will sit on couches face to face like brothers together.

TQA1851,QA1851,TLQ01,'Announce to My creatures that I am indeed forgiving and kind,'

text: '"Have no fear
column5: they said. We bring you news of a son full of wisdom."'

text: '"You bring me the good news now
column5: he said, when old age has come upon me. What good news are you giving me then?"'

text: '"We have given you the happy tidings of a truth
column5: they replied. So do not be one of those who despair."'

text: '"Who would despair of the mercy of his Lord
column5: he answered, but those who go astray."'

text: 'And asked them: "What matter
column5: O angels
column6: brings you here?"'

text: '"We have been sent
column5: they said, to (punish) a sinful people

text:
Except the family of Lot whom we shall save

column5: it is decreed

text: 'When the messengers came to the family of Lot
He said: "You are people I do not know."
'"We have come to you with news
column5: they said, of what your people doubt;'

text: '"Yet we bring to you the truth
column5: and we are truthful.'

text: '"So leave with your family late in the night
column5: yourself remaining in the rear
column6: and let none turn back to look
column7: and go where you will be commanded."'

text: 'We issued this command to him
column5: for they were going to be destroyed in the morning.'

text: 'Then came the people of the city
column5: exulting at the news.'

text: 'Said Lot: "These are my guests; do not put me to shame
And do not disgrace me. Have some fear of God.
'"Did we not restrain you
column5: they said, from (entertaining) creatures from the outside world?"'

text: '"Here are my daughters
column5: said Lot, if you are so active."'

text: Verily by your life they were utterly confused in their (lustful) drunkenness.
So they were seized by the mighty blast at break of day;
'And We turned the city upside down
column5: and rained on them stones of hardened lava.'

text: Herein are really signs for those who discern.
This (city) lies on a road that still survives.
Indeed there is a portent in this for those who believe.
The dwellers of the Wood (near Midian) were also wicked.
'So We punished them too. They are both situated by the highway
column5: clearly visible.'

text: The people of Al-Hijr denied Our apostles;
And though We had given them Our signs they turned away from them.
They used to hew dwellings in the mountains to live in security.
But they were seized by the mighty blast towards the morning;
And all that they had done (for security) availed them nothing.
We have not created but with reason the heavens and the earth and all that lies within them. The Hour (of the great change) is certain to come. So turn away (from them) with a grace.
Surely your Lord is the Creator and knows (everything).
'We have indeed given you the seven oft-repeated (examples)
column5: and the majestic Qur''an.'

text: 'So covet not things We have bestowed on a portion of them to enjoy
column5: and do not grieve for them
column6: and protect those who believe;'

text: 'And say: "I am a distinct warner
column5:
'

TQA1897,QA1897,TLQ01,'We are surely sufficient to deal with those who scoff at you,'
