text: He created the heavens and the earth with reason. Too glorious and high is He for what they associate with Him.
Man He created from a drop of semen; and still he becomes an open contender.
'He created the cattle from whom you get warm clothing and (other) advantages
column5: and some you eat.'

text: 'There is life and cheer for you as you drive them home in the evening
column5: and lead them out in the morning to graze.'

text: They carry your burdens to lands so distant you could not have reached without much hardship. Indeed your Lord is compassionate and kind.
'He created horses
column5: mules and donkeys for riding and for splendour. He created other things too which you do not know.'

text: 'To God leads the right path
column5: though some deviate. If He willed He could guide you all to the right way.'

text: 'It is He who sends down water from the sky of which you drink
column5: and which nourishes the plants you feed your cattle

text: 'With which He makes crops grow
column5: and olives
column6: dates and grapes and fruits of every kind for you. In this is a sign for those who think.'

text: 'He harnessed the day and night for you
column5: as also the sun
column6: the moon and the stars
column7: by His command. In this are signs for men who understand.'

text: And other things of different shades has He produced on the earth for you. In this are signs for those who reflect.
'It is He who has subdued the sea that you may eat fresh meat from it
column5: and obtain ornaments to wear. You see the ships plough through it that you may seek of His bounties and
column6: perhaps
column7: be grateful.'

text: 'He placed stablisers in the earth so that while it revolves you live undisturbed
column5: and rivers and tracks so that you may find your way;'

text: 'As well as many other signs
column5: as by the stars (you) find direction.'

text: 'So
column5: could one who creates be like one who cannot? Will you not then contemplate?'

text: If you count the favours of God you will not be able to calculate. Assuredly God is forgiving and kind.
God knows what you hide and disclose.

column5: As for those they call besides God
column6: they cannot create a thing
column7: and have themselves been created.'

text: 'Dead
column5: without life they are
column6: and do not know when they will be raised.'

text: 'Your God is one God. But the hearts of those who believe not in the life to come are filled with denial
column5: and they are puffed up with pride.'

text: Surely God knows what they hide and what they disclose. He certainly does not love the proud.
For when they are asked: "What has your Lord sent down?" they say: "Tales of long ago."
'On the Day of Resurrection they will carry their own burden and some of the load of those they have led astray without any knowledge. Oh
column5: how evil a burden they will carry!'

text: 'Those who have gone before them had also conspired; then God uprooted their structure from its foundation; the roof fell over them from above
column5: and punishment came upon them from somewhere they did not suspect.'

text: On the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and ask: "Where are My compeers for whom you contended?" Those endowed with knowledge will say: "Shame and evil surely are for unbelievers today."
'They whose souls are drawn out by the angels while they are sinning
column5: shall offer submission: "We did no evil." But God knows well what you did.'

text: 'So enter the gates of Hell
column5: and dwell there for ever. How dreadful a dwelling for the haughty!'

text: 'When those who took heed for themselves would be asked: "What did your Lord send down?" They will answer: "The best." For those who do good there is good in the world
column5: but certainly the abode of the next is better. How excellent the home of the virtuous!'

text: They will enter perennial gardens with streams of water and all they wish. Thus will the pious and devout be rewarded.
When the angels receive the souls of those who are blameless they will say: "Peace on you. Enter Paradise as recompense for what you did."
'What! Do the (unbelievers) expect that the angels should descend
column5: or the sentence of your Lord come to pass? So had the people done before them; yet God did not wrong them
column6: they wronged themselves.'

text: 'The evil they perpetrated overtook them
column5: and what they mocked has turned upon them.'

text: 'The idolaters say: "If God had willed we would not have worshipped anything apart from Him
column5: nor would our fathers have done
column6: nor would we have forbidden any thing without His (leave)." So had the people done before them. Therefore it is binding on the prophets to convey the message in clearest terms.'

text: 'To every community We have sent an apostle. (saying:) "Worship God
column5: and keep away from all other deities." Thus some of them were guided by God
column6: and ruin was justified on some. Travel over the earth and see what befell those who accused (the apostles) of lies.'

text: 'Even if you are eager to guide them
column5: God does not surely guide those who have gone astray: They will have no one to help them.'

text: 'They swear emphatically in the name of God that God will not raise the dead. On the contrary
column5: it is a promise incumbent on Him
column6: though most men do not understand

text: 'For (they fear) He might make what they differed about plain to them
column5: and that the infidels may realise that they were liars.'

text: 'Yet when We will a thing We have only to say: "Be"
column5: and it is.'

text: 'Those who left their homes in the cause of God after having been oppressed
column5: will be given by Us a better place in the world
column6: and if they knew
column7: the guerdon of the next would be greater'

text: (For) those who persevere and place their trust in their Lord.
'We sent before you none (as apostles) but men
column5: to whom We sent revelations. In case you are unaware
column6: enquire of those who are keepers of the Oracles of God.'

text: We had Sent them with miracles and Books; and We have sent to you this Reminder so that you may explain distinctly to men what was sent down to them: They may haply reflect.
'Have the plotters of mischief become unafraid that God will not split the earth to swallow them
column5: or that punishment will not fall upon them from somewhere they do not (even) suspect?'

text: 'Or that He will not seize them as they move about
column5: and they will not be able to elude (His grasp);'

text: Or He may seize them by diminishing their portion. Yet your Lord is compassionate and kind.
'Do they not see the shadows of all things God has created incline to the right and the left
column5: bowing in obeisance to God?'

text: 'All things that move on the earth and in the heavens
column5: and the angels
column6: bow in homage to God
column7: and do not behave with pride.'

text: 'They have fear of God for His power over them
column5: and act as commanded.'

text: 'God says: "Do not take to two gods
column5: for there is only one God. So fear Me."'

text: 'Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him
column5: and His the judgement for ever. So will you fear any other than God?'

text: 'Whatsoever the blessings you enjoy are surely from God
column5: and when in trouble you turn to Him in supplication.'

text: 'Yet when He has delivered you from affliction
column5: some of you ascribe companions to your Lord'

text: 'So as to deny what We have bestowed on them. Well
column5: enjoy yourselves
column6: you will come to know soon.'

text: 'They set aside a portion of the food We have given them for those they do not know. By God
column5: you will surely have to answer for all you contrive!'

text: 'They attribute daughters to God
column5: the glorious
column6: but for themselves whatsoever they please.'

text: 'Yet when news of the birth of a daughter reaches one of them
column5: his face is darkened
column6: and he is overwhelmed with silent grief

text: 'And hides from people for shame at the news
column5: (at a loss) whether he should keep her with shame
column6: or bury her in the ground. How bad is the judgement that they make!'

text: 'The semblance of those who believe not in the life to come is that of the meanest; but the semblance of God is the most sublime
column5: for He is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'If God were to punish men for their inequity He would not leave a single moving thing on earth. Yet He gives them latitude for a time ordained. When that time is come
column5: there will not be a moment''s delay nor a moment''s haste.'

text: 'Yet they attribute to God what they find detestable; and their tongues assert the lie that for them is only good. On the contrary
column5: there is Fire for them
column6: and they will be thrown into it.'

text: 'By God
column5: We sent apostles to many a people before you
column6: but Satan made their acts seem attractive to them
column7: and he is their friend this day
column8: and a painful torment awaits them.'

text: 'We have sent down this Book to you that you may explain to them what it is that they are differing about
column5: and as guidance and a grace for those who believe.'

text: God sends down water from the skies and quickens the dead earth to a new birth. Here is a sign for those who listen.
And surely in cattle there is a lesson for you: We give you a drink from the extract of food in their bellies and blood-purest milk so delicious to drink;
'And in fruits of the date-palm and the vine
column5: from which you obtain inebriating drinks and excellent food. In this indeed are signs for those who understand.'

text: 'Your Lord predisposed the bees to make their hives in mountains
column5: trees and trellices

text: And suck from all fruits and flit about the unrestricted paths of their Lord. A drink of various hues comes out of their bellies which contains medicine for men. In this is a sign for those who reflect.
'It is God who creates you
column5: then makes you die; and some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they had known before. God is indeed all-knowing and all-powerful.'

text: 'God has favoured some of you over others in the means of subsistence. But those who have been favoured with more do not give of their means to their dependents so that they may become equal with them. Do they then deny God''s beneficence?'
'God has provided mates for you of your own kind
column5: and has bestowed on you sons and daughters from your mates
column6: and has given you good things for food. Will they even then believe in the false and deny God''s grace?'

text: 'Yet they worship those apart from God who cannot provide for them any sustenance from the heavens or the earth
column5: nor will they have power to do so.'

text: 'So do not invent similitudes for God. Indeed God knows
column5: and you do not know.'

text: 'God presents the example of a man who is a hired servant with no power over anything
column5: and another on whom We have bestowed a handsome fortune
column6: who spends from it in private and in public: Can they be equal? Praised be God! But most men do not understand.'

text: 'God presents another example of two men
column5: one dumb and unable to do a thing and is a burden on his master. Wherever he is sent he returns without any good (result). Could he be equal to one who enjoins what is just
column6: and follows the right path?'

text: 'To God belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth
column5: and the Hour of Doom is a matter of the winking of an eye
column6: even less
column7: for God has certainly power over all things.'

text: 'God produced you from your mothers'' wombs knowing nothing
column5: but gave you ears and eyes and hearts so that you may be grateful.'

text: Do you not see the birds held high between the heavens and the earth? Nothing holds them (aloft) but God. There are verily signs in this for those who believe.
'God has given you homes to live in
column5: and tents (made) from the hides of cattle convenient for days of travelling and halting; and from their wool and fur and hair you make domestic articles and goods that last a certain time.'

text: 'God has given you of things created
column5: shade
column6: and places of shelter in the mountains
column7: and clothes for protection against the heat
column8: and coats (of mail) for defence during war. He thus bestows His favours on you so that you may be grateful to Him.'

text: 'If they still turn away
column5: your duty is to warn them in clear terms.'

text: 'They do know the favours of God
column5: and yet they deny them
column6: for most of them are not grateful.'

text: 'The day We shall call a witness from every people
column5: the unbelievers will not be allowed to make excuses.'

text: 'And when the wicked shall face the torment it will not be decreased
column5: nor will they be reprieved.'

text: 'When the idolaters see their partners they will call out: "O our Lord
column5: these are the partners we invoked instead of You;" but they will retort: "You are liars."'

text: 'They will offer submission to God that Day
column5: and the lies they fabricated will not be of the least avail.'

text: 'For those who deny the truth and obstruct (others) from the way of God
column5: We shall add torment to torment as they were perpetrating corruption.'

text: 'Remind them of the Day when We shall call from every people a witness against them
column5: and make you a witness over them
column6: for We have revealed to you the Book as an exposition of everything
column7: and as guidance and grace and happy tidings for those who submit.'

text: 'Verily God has enjoined justice
column5: the doing of good
column6: and the giving of gifts to your relatives; and forbidden indecency
column7: impropriety and oppression. He warns you so that you may remember.'

text: 'Fulfil your covenant with God
column5: having made the covenant
column6: and do not break your oaths once you have sworn them
column7: as you have made God a witness over you. Indeed God knows what you do.'

text: And do not be like her who untwists her yarn having spun it into durable thread. Do not use your oaths deceitfully because one party has ascendency over you. God surely tries you in this way: He will make it clear to you on the Day of Resurrection what you were differing about.
'If God had pleased He would surely have made you a single community of belief; but He leads whosoever He wills astray
column5: and guides whosoever He please. But you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.'

text: 'So do not make your oaths a means of deceiving one another
column5: lest your foot should slip after having found its hold
column6: and you taste of evil for having hindered (others) from the way of God
column7: and suffer a grievous punishment.'

text: 'And do not trade God''s covenant for a paltry price. Remember
column5: what is with God is better for you
column6: if only you knew!'

text: 'For what you possess will pass
column5: but what is with God will abide. We shall certainly award those who persevere a recompense in keeping with their deeds.'

text: 'We shall invest whosoever works for good
column5: whether man or woman
column6: with a pleasant life
column7: and reward them in accordance with the best of what they have done.'

text: 'So
column5: when you recite the Qur''an seek refuge in God from Satan the execrable.'

text: He does not have power over those who believe and place their trust in their Lord.
'His power is only over those who take him as their patron
column5: and those who ascribe equals (to God).'

text: When We replace a message with another -- and God knows best what He reveals -- they say: "You have made it up;" yet most of them do not know.
'You say: "It has been sent by divine grace from your Lord with truth to strengthen those who believe
column5: and as guidance and good news for those who have submitted (to God)."'

text: Yet We know what they say: "It is only a man who instructs him." The speech of the man they imply is obscure while this is clear Arabic.
Those who do not believe in the words of God are verily not guided by God. For them is severe punishment.
'They alone invent lies who do not believe in the words of God
column5: and they are liars.'

text: 'Whosoever denies having once believed -- unless he is forced to do so while his heart enjoys the peace of faith -- and opens his mind to disbelief will suffer the wrath of God. Their punishment will be great
For they loved the life of this world more than the life to come; and God does not guide those who do not believe.
They are the ones whose hearts and ears and eyes have been sealed by God; and these are the heedless.
'They will surely be losers in the life to come
'But (to) those who were victimised and left their homes and then fought and endured patiently
column5: your Lord will surely be forgiving and kind.'

text: 'On the day when every soul will come pleading for itself
column5: and every soul will be recompensed for what it had done
column6: no one will be wronged.'

text: 'God presents the example of a town which enjoyed peace and security
column5: its provisions coming from everywhere in abundance
column6: but it denied the favours of God; so God acquainted it with intimate hunger and fear (as punishment) for what they had done.'

text: 'An apostle came to them who was one of them
column5: but they called him a liar. Then they were seized by torment for they were sinners.'

text: 'Eat the good and lawful of things that God has given you
column5: and be grateful for the bounty of God
column6: if you really worship Him.'

text: 'He has forbidden carrion and blood and the flesh of the swine
column5: and what has been killed in the name of any other but God; but if one is driven by necessity (to eat it) without craving or reverting to it
column6: then God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Do not utter the lies your tongues make up: "This is lawful
column5: and this is forbidden
column6:
in order to impute lies to God; for they who impute lies to God will not find fulfilment.'
TQA2018,QA2018,TLQ01,'For them there is some enjoyment, but the punishment is painful.'
TQA2019,QA2019,TLQ01,'We have already told you what We have forbidden the Jews. We did not wrong them, they wronged themselves.'
TQA2020,QA2020,TLQ01,'To those who do wrong out of ignorance, then repent and correct themselves, your Lord is indeed forgiving and kind.'
TQA2021,QA2021,TLQ01,'Abraham was certainly a model of faith, obedient to God and upright, and not one of idolaters,'
TQA2022,QA2022,TLQ01,'Grateful to Him for His favours; so He chose him and guided him to the path that is straight,'
TQA2023,QA2023,TLQ01,'And gave him what is good in the world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous and the good.'
TQA2024,QA2024,TLQ01,So We commanded you to follow the way of Abraham the upright who was not of idolaters.
TQA2025,QA2025,TLQ01,'As for the Sabbath, it was imposed on those who had differed about it; and your Lord will tell them on the Day of Resurrection what it was they had differed about.'
TQA2026,QA2026,TLQ01,'Call them to the path of your Lord with wisdom and words of good advice; and reason with them in the best way possible. Your Lord surely knows who strays from His path, and He knows those who are guided the right way.'
TQA2027,QA2027,TLQ01,'If you have to retaliate, do so to the extent you have been injured; but if you forbear it is best for those who bear with fortitude.'
TQA2028,QA2028,TLQ01,'Endure with patience, for your endurance is not without the help of God. Do not grieve for them, and do not be distressed by their plots.'
TQA2029,QA2029,TLQ01,'God is verily with those who are pious and devout, and those who are doers of good.'
TQA2030,QA2030,TLQ01,'GLORY TO HIM who took His votary to a wide and open land from the Sacred Mosque (at Makkah) to the distant Mosque whose precincts We have blessed, that We may show him some of Our signs. Verily He is all-hearing and all-seeing.'
TQA2031,QA2031,TLQ01,'We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guidance for the children of Israel that they should not take another protector apart from Me.'
TQA2032,QA2032,TLQ01,'O you, the offspring of those We bore (in the ark) with Noah, he was indeed a grateful votary.'
TQA2033,QA2033,TLQ01,'We announced to the children of Israel in the Book: You will surely create disorder twice in the land
column7: and become exceedingly arrogant."'

text: 'So
column5: when the time of the first prediction came
column6: We sent against you Our creatures full of martial might
column7: who ransacked your cities; and the prediction was fulfilled.'

text: 'Then We gave you a chance against them
column5: and strengthened you with wealth and children
column6: and increased your numbers (and said):'

text: '"If you do good
column5: you will do so for your own good; if you do ill
column6: you will do it for your own loss." So
column7: when the time of the second prediction comes
column8: (We shall rouse another people) to shame you
column9: and enter the Temple as they had done the first time
column10: and to destroy what they conquered utterly.'

text: 'Your Lord may haply be merciful to you. But if you repeat it
column5: We shall do the same. We have constituted Hell as prison for unbelievers.'

text: 'Verily this Qur''an directs you to the path that is straight
column5: and gives happy tidings to those who believe and do the right: For them is a great reward.'

text: 'As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter
column5: We have prepared a painful punishment.'

text: 'Man prays for evil as he prays for good
column5: for man is hasty.'

text: 'We have created night and day as two signs
column5: then We efface the sign of the night
column6: and make the sign of the day resplendent that you may seek the bounty of your Lord
column7: and know the computation of years and numbers. We have expounded most distinctly everything.'

text: 'Round each man''s neck We have hung his ledger of deeds
column5: and on the Day of Resurrection will present it as a book spread out (and say):'

text:
Read your ledger; this day you are sufficient to take your own account.
TQA2044,QA2044,TLQ01,'He who finds the right path does so for himself; and he who goes astray does so to his own loss; and no one who carries a burden bears another''s load. We never punish till We have sent a messenger.'
'"And when We destroy a human habitation We send Our command to (warn) its people living a life of ease; and when they disobey
column5: the sentence against them is justified
column6: and We destroy them utterly.'

text: '"How many generations have We laid low after Noah
column5: for your Lord knows and notices well enough the sins of His creatures.'

text: '"Whosoever desires what hastes away
column5: We hasten to give him (in this life) as much as We please to whosoever We will; but afterwards there is Hell for him in which he will burn
column6: disgraced and ostracised.'

text: '"But he who desires the Hereafter
column5: and strives for it with a will
column6: and is a believer
column7: will be favoured for his endeavour.'

text: '"We bestow from the gifts of your Lord on these and on those
column5: for the gifts of your Lord are not restricted.'

text: '"See
column5: how We favour one over the other; and in life to come are higher ranks and favours greater still.'

text: '"Do not set up another god with God
column5: or you will remain disgraced and destitute.'

text: '"So your Lord has decreed: Do not worship anyone but Him
column5: and be good to your parents. If one or both of them grow old in your presence
column6: do not say fie to them
column7: nor reprove them
column8: but say gentle words to them'

text: '"And look after them with kindness and love
column5: and say: "O Lord
column6: have mercy on them as they nourished me when I was small."'

text: 'Your Lord knows what is in your heart. If you are righteous
column5: then He is indeed forgiving to those who turn (to Him) in repentance.'

text: 'So give to your relatives what is their due
column5: and to those who are needy
column6: and the wayfarers; and do not dissipate (your wealth) extravagantly.'

text: 'Those who dissipate (their wealth) are the brethren of the devils
column5: and the Devil was ungrateful to his Lord.'

text: 'If you neglect (your parents) while seeking the bounty of your Lord
column5: of which you are hopeful
column6: speak to them softly.'

text: 'Do not be niggardly
column5: nor extravagant that you may later feel reprehensive and constrained.'

text: 'Certainly your Lord provides with open hands whosoever He will
column5: but according to capacity
column6: for He knows and watches His creatures.'

text: Do not abandon your children out of fear of poverty. We will provide for them and for you. Killing them is certainly a great wrong.
'And do not go near fornication
column5: as it is immoral and an evil way.'

text: 'And do not take a life
column5: which God has forbidden
column6: except in a just cause. We have given the right (of redress) to the heir of the person who is killed
column7: but he should not exceed the limits (of justice) by slaying (the killer)
column8: for he will be judged (by the same law).'

text: 'And do not touch the property of the orphans except for bettering it
column5: until they come of age; and fulfil the promise made: You will surely be questioned about the promise.'

text: 'Give full measure when you are measuring
column5: and weigh on a balanced scale. This is better
column6: and excellent its consequence.'

text: 'Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Verily the ear
column5: the eye
column6: the heart
column7: each will be questioned.'

text: 'And do not strut about the land with insolence: Surely you cannot cleave the earth
column5: nor attain the height of mountains in stature.'

text: All these are evil and odious to your Lord.
'This is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. So do not take another god apart from God
column5: or you will be cast into Hell
column6: reproved
column7: ostracised.'

text: 'Has God chosen to give you sons
column5: and taken for Himself daughters from among the angels? You utter grievous things indeed!'

text: 'We have explained (the truth) in various ways in this Qur''an
column5: that they may be warned; but it only increased their refractoriness.'

text: 'Say: "Had there been other gods with Him
column5: as they assert
column6: they would surely have sought a way (of opposition) against the Lord of the Throne."'

text: 'Too glorious and high is He
column5: too exalted for what they say!'

text: 'The seven skies
column5: the earth
column6: and all that lies within them
column7: sing hallelujas to Him. There is nothing that does not chant His praises
column8: but you do not understand their hymns of praise. He is verily clement and forgiving.'

text: 'When you recite the Qur''an
column5: We place a hidden veil between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter;'

text: 'And We put covers over their hearts and deafness in their ears that they should not understand it. So when you invoke your Lord alone in the Qur''an they turn their backs and walk away.'
'We know well with what (intent) they hear you
column5: for when they confer privately the wicked say: "You follow but a man deluded."'

text: 'See
column5: what comparisons they coin for you
column6: and go astray
column7: and thus cannot find the way.'

text: 'Yet they say: "When we are turned to bones and bits
column5: shall we be raised as a new creation?"'

text: 'Tell them: "(Even if) you turn to stones or steel

'Or some other created thing which may seem to you most difficult (to create)!" They will then say: "Who will revert us back?" Say: "He who originated you in the first place." They will shake their heads at you and say: "When will that be?" Say: "In the near future
column5: perhaps

text: '"On the day when He will call you
column5: and you will answer with His praises and imagine you did not tarry but a while."'

text: Tell My creatures only to speak words that are good. Verily Satan sows dissensions: Satan is indeed the acknowledged enemy of mankind.
'Your Lord knows you better: He may have mercy on you if He please
column5: or punish you if He will. Yet We have not sent you as warden over them.'

text: Your Lord knows whoever is in the heavens and the earth. We exalted some of the prophets over the others; and to David We gave the Book of Psalms.
Say: "Call those whom you imagine to be gods besides Him; yet they have no power to relieve you of any distress or to avert it."
'Those they invoke themselves seek the way to their Lord
column5: (striving) which one of them shall be nearest (to Him); and hope for His grace
column6: and dread His punishment. Indeed
column7: the punishment of your Lord is to be feared!'

text: 'There is not a habitation We shall not destroy before the Day of Resurrection
column5: or not inflict severe punishment upon it. This is in accordance with the law (of God).'

text: 'Nothing could stop Us from sending signs except that the earlier people had rejected them as lies. We sent to Thamud the she-camel as a token to make it clear to them
column5: but they treated her cruelly; and We send signs only to deter.'

text: 'When We said to you: "Verily your Lord circumscribes mankind
column5:
and showed you the vision and the accursed tree of the Qur''an, it was as a bone of contention for men. Thus do We (instil) fear in them; but they only transgress the more.'
TQA2090,QA2090,TLQ01,'When We asked the angels to bow before Adam, they all bowed but Iblis, who said: Can I bow before him whom You created from clay?"'

text: '(And) said: "Look! This is what you have honoured above me! If You defer (my term) till the Day of Resurrection
column5: I will bring his progeny into complete subjugation
column6: barring a few."'

text: (And God) said: "Away! Whosoever of them follows you will surely have Hell with you as requital -- an ample recompense.
'Mislead any of them you may with your voice
column5: attack them with your cavalry and soldiers on foot
column6: share their wealth and children with them
column7: and make promises to them." -- But the promises of Satan are nothing but deceit.'

text: You will surely have no power over My devotees: Your Lord is sufficient as their protector.
It is your Lord who drives your ships across the seas that you may seek of His bounty. He is verily kind to you.
'When a calamity befalls you on the sea
column5: all those you invoke fail you except Him. But when He brings you safely to the shore
column6: you turn away
column7: for man is most ungrateful.'

text: 'Have you then become so sure that He will not cleave the earth and sink you in it by the shore
column5: or send a gale against you
column6: when you will not find any protector.'

text: 'Or you feel so secure that He will not send you back (to sea) again or send a gravel-hurtling storm against you
column5: and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will not find any avenger against Us.'

text: 'Indeed We have honoured the children of Adam
column5: and carried them over land and sea
column6: provided them with good things for their sustenance
column7: and exalted them over many of Our creatures.'

text: 'The day We shall summon all men with their leaders
column5: whosoever is given his record in his right hand will be able to read his account
column6: and none will be wronged the breadth of a thread.'

text: 'But whoso has been blind in this world shall be blind in the world to come
column5: even farther astray from the path.'

text: 'They had almost led you away from what has been revealed to you
column5: that you may invent things about Us besides those revealed
column6: when they would have taken you as friend.'

text: If We had not kept you constant you had almost leaned towards them.
'In that case We would have made you taste a double anguish of life and a double anguish of death
column5: and then you would not have been able to find a helper against Us for yourself.'

text: 'They had nearly expelled you from the land and driven you away from it. But then
column5: they too would have stayed but a little after you.'

text: This has been Our way with the apostles whom We sent before you. You will not find any variation in Our line of action.
'Observe the service of prayer from the sun''s declining from the meridian to the darkening of the night
column5: and the recitation at dawn. Indeed the Recitation at dawn is palpably evident.'

text: Say a supererogatory prayer at the hour of the first watch: Your Lord may raise you to a most exalted station.
'And pray: "O my Lord
column5: let my entry be with honour
column6: and let my exit be with honour
column7: and grant me power from You which would help (sustain) me."'

text: And say: "Truth has come and falsehood nullified." Verily falsehood is perishable.
'What We have sent down of the Qur''an is a healing and a grace for the faithful
column5: and adds only loss for the sinners.'

text: When We are gracious to man he turns away and moves aside; yet when evil befalls him he begins to despair.
'Say: "Each one acts according to his disposition
column5: but your Lord knows well who follow the right path."'

text: 'They ask you about revelation. Say
column5: revelation is by the command of your Lord
column6: and that you have been given but little knowledge.'

text: 'If We pleased We could take away what We have revealed to you. Then you will not find any one to plead for it with Us
Unless your Lord have mercy. His blessings on you are great indeed.
'Say: "Surely if men and jinns get together to produce the like of this (Qur''an)
column5: they will not be able to produce the like of it
column6: however they might assist one another.'

text: 'We have given examples of every kind to men in this Qur''an in various ways
column5: and even then most men disdain everything but unbelief

text: And say: "We will not believe you until you make a spring of water gush forth from the earth for us;
'Or
column5: until you acquire an orchard of date-palm trees and grapes
column6: and produce rivers flowing through it;'

text: 'Or
column5: let chunks of sky fall over us
column6: as you assert (you will); or
column7: bring God and the angels as a surety;'

text: 'Or
column5: you come to possess a house of gold; or ascend to the skies
column6: though we shall not believe in your having ascended till you bring down a book for us which we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord. I am only man and a messenger."'

text: 'Nothing prevented men from believing when guidance came to them
column5: other than (what) they said: "Has God sent (only) a man as messenger?"'

text: 'Say: "If angels had peopled the earth and walked about in peace and quiet
column5: We would surely have sent to them an angel as messenger.'

text: 'Tell them: "God is sufficient witness between me and you
column5: for He knows His creatures well
column6: and is well-informed."'

text: 'He is guided whom God guides. As for him He allows to go astray
column5: you will not find a protector other than Him. We shall raise them on the Day of Resurrection in their own image
column6: blind and dumb and deaf: Their habitation will be Hell. Every time (its fire) subsides We will intensify its flame.'

text: 'This will be their retribution for having denied Our signs and said: "Once we are turned to bones and bits
column5: can we be raised as a new creation?"'

text: 'Do they not perceive that God
column5: who created the heavens and the earth
column6: has the power to create the like of them? There is no doubt that. He has fixed a term for them. Even then the wicked disdain everything but unbelief.'

text: 'Say: "Even if you owned the stores of the mercy of my Lord
column5: you would have held them back for fear of spending them
column6: for man is niggardly."'

text: 'We gave Moses nine clear signs; so ask the children of Israel. When (Moses) came to them the Pharaoh said: "I think
column5: O Moses
column6: you have been deluded."'

text: 'He replied: "You know that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these (signs) as cogent proof. I truly think
column5: O Pharaoh
column6: your days are done."'

text: 'Then he sought to turn them out of the land
column5: but We drowned him and all his followers.'

text: 'After this We told the children of Israel: "Dwell in the land. When the promise of reckoning comes
column5: We shall bring you together from a motley crowd.'

text: 'We have sent it down with truth
column5: and with truth has (the Qur''an) come down. And We have sent you only to give good news and to warn.'

text: 'We have divided the Qur''an into parts that you may recite it to men slowly
column5: with deliberation. That is why We sent it down by degrees.'

text: 'Say: "Believe in it or do not believe: Those who were given knowledge before it bow in adoration when it is read out to them
And say: "Glory be to our Lord. The promise of our Lord has indeed been fulfilled."
'And weeping they kneel down
column5: and this increases their humility.'

text: 'Say: "Call Him Allah or call Him Ar-Rahman; whatever the name you call Him by
column5: all His names are beautiful." Do not say your prayers too loudly or in too low a voice
column6: but follow a middle coarse.'

text: And say: "All praise be to God who has neither begotten a son nor has a partner in His kingdom; nor has He need of any one to protect Him from ignominy. So extol Him by extolling His majesty."
'ALL PRAISE BE to God who has revealed to His votary the Book which is free of all obliquity
'Immutable
column5: so that it may warn of a severe punishment from Him; and give happy tidings to those who believe and do the right that there is a better reward (of Paradise) for them

text: Where they will abide for ever;
And that it may warn those who say: "God has begotten a son."
'They have no knowledge of this
column5: as their fathers did not have. How terrible are the words they utter! They speak nothing but lies.'

text: Will you kill yourself for grief of them if they do not believe in this presentation?
We have made whatever exists on the earth its adornment to test and try them (and) know who acts better;
For We shall certainly turn it to barren dust.
Do you think the men of the cave and Ar-Raqim were so strange among Our signs?
'When those young men took shelter in the cave

'

text: 'As for these our people here

'

text: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no one who can change the word of God; and you will not find refuge except in Him.

text: 'Say: "The truth is from your Lord: So believe if you like

text: 'Tell them the parable of two men. We gave one two gardens of grapes surrounded by date-palm trees

text: 'The day We shall move the mountains

text: 'The ledger (of their deeds) would be placed before them. Then you will see the sinners terrified at its contents

text: 'When We said to the angels: "Bow before Adam in adoration
column5:
they all bowed but Iblis. He was one of the jinni and rebelled against his Lord''s command. And yet you take him and his offspring as your friends instead of Me, even though they are your enemies. How sad a substitute for the evil-doers!'
TQA2191,QA2191,TLQ01,'I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation. I would not take as helpers those who lead (men) astray.'

column6:
they will call them, but will get no response, and We shall place a gulf between them.'

TQA2194,QA2194,TLQ01,'We have explained in various ways all things to men in this Qur''an; but of all things man is most contentious.'

TQA2196,QA2196,TLQ01,'We never send apostles but to convey happy tidings, and to warn. But those who disbelieve contend with false arguments to nullify the truth. They make a mockery of My revelations and of what they had been warned.'
TQA2197,QA2197,TLQ01,'Who is more unjust than he who, on being reminded of his Lord''s revelations, turns away from them, and forgets the evil deeds he had committed in the past. Verily We have placed a covering on their hearts so that they do not understand, and a deafness in their ears so that however you may call them to guidance they will never be guided aright.'
TQA2198,QA2198,TLQ01,'But your Lord is forgiving, full of benevolence. If He had pleased to punish them for their doings He would have punished them immediately. But a term is fixed for them from which they will find no escape.'
TQA2199,QA2199,TLQ01,'As for these habitations, We destroyed them only when they transgressed; even so We had fixed a time for their annihilation.'
TQA2200,QA2200,TLQ01,'When Moses said to his servant (Joshua): I will not give up till I reach the confluence of two oceans
column7: or I will journey on and on."'

text: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea.
'When they had gone past (the confluence)
column5: Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."'

text: 'He said: "You see

text: Moses said: "But that is exactly what we were seeking." So they retraced their steps.

text: Moses said to him: "May I attend upon you that you may instruct me in the knowledge you have been taught of the right way?"

text: '"If you must follow me

text: 'The two went on till they came to a boy

text: He said: "Did I not tell you you will not be able to bear with me?"

'The two went on till they came upon some villagers

text: '"This is the parting of our "ways

text: 'They ask you about Dhu''l-Qarnain.'

text: 'Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. Therefore worship Him

'So

text: 'The day We shall usher the righteous before Ar-Rahman like envoys into the presence of a king

column6: and split the mountains

text: 'How many generations have We laid low before them. Do you see any sign of them

text: TA HA.

'The ever-merciful
column5: established on the throne (of authority).'

text: 'Whatever is in the heavens and the earth and in between them

text: 'Whether you say a thing aloud or inaudibly

text: God: There is no god but He. To Him belong the attributes most beautiful.

'When he saw a fire he said to his family: "You wait here. I have seen a fire. I may haply be able to bring an ember from it

column5: but he denied them and refused

text: 'And said: "Have you come to us

text: 'After this the Pharaoh withdrew and settled his stratagem

text: 'Moses said to them: "Woe betide you. Do not fabricate a lie against God

text: 'So they discussed their strategy among themselves and conferred privately

column6: or we shall cast it first."'

text: Moses said: "No. You cast it first" Then it seemed to Moses that by their magic their cords and rods were flying;

'The magicians

text: 'We commanded Moses: "Journey by night with Our creatures

column6: from your people?"'

text: 'Whoever turns away from it will surely carry a burden on the Day of Judgement

text: 'Exalted then be God

text: '"Woe

text: 'If any one of them said: "I am God besides Him
column5:
We should award him Hell; for this is how We requite the evil-doers.'
TQA2513,QA2513,TLQ01,'Do not these unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were an integrated mass, then We split them and made every living thing from water? Will they not believe even then?'

text: 'Man is made of inordinate haste. We will show you Our signs

text: 'Yet they say: "When will the promised threat come to pass

text: 'It will come upon them unawares confounding them

text: Many apostles have been scoffed before you; but they who scoffed were themselves caught by what they had ridiculed.

text: 'We allowed them and their fathers time to enjoy till the very end of their lives. Do they not see Us advancing into the land

text: 'Say: "I am warning you by God''s command." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.'

column5: alas
column6: we were surely sinful."'

text: 'We shall fix the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection

text: 'We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion
column5: and a light and reminder for those who take heed for themselves

text: Who are fearful of their Lord inwardly and dread the Hour.
And this is a blessed reminder that We have sent down. Will you then deny it?
'We had earlier given Abraham true direction

text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these idols to which you cling so passionately?"

column5: or only jesting?"'

text: 'He said: "In fact it was your Lord
column5: the Lord of the heavens and the earth
column6: who created them; and I bear witness to this.'

text: They asked (on return): "Who has done this to our gods? He is surely a mischief-monger."

column5: they said, that they may bear witness."'

text: '"Did you do this to our gods
column5: O Abraham?" they enquired.'

text: '"No
column5: he said. It was done by that chief of theirs. Ask him in case they can speak."'

column5: as you know
column6: they cannot speak."'

text: (So Abraham) said: "Then why do you worship something apart from God that cannot profit you or do you harm?

'They said: "Burn him

text: '"Turn cold
column5: O fire
column6: We said, and give safety to Abraham."'

text: 'They wished to entrap him

text: 'And We bestowed on him Isaac

text: And We made them leaders to guide (the people) by Our command; and We inspired them to perform good deeds and observe their moral obligations and pay the zakat; and they obeyed Us.

text: Thus We admitted him to Our grace. He is surely one of the righteous.

'And We helped him against the people who rejected Our signs as lies. They were a wicked people indeed
column5: so We drowned them one and all.'

text: '(Remember) David and Solomon
column5: when they pronounced judgement about the field which was eaten up at night by sheep belonging to certain people. We were witness to their judgement.'

text: 'We made Solomon understand the case

text: 'And We taught him the art of making coats of mail to shield you from each other''s violence. Will you not be grateful even then?'

'And many of the devils (We also made obedient to him) who dived for him
column5: and did many other things; and We kept watch over them.'

text: '(Remember) Job when he called to his Lord: "I am afflicted with distress

text: 'So We heard his cry and relieved him of the misery he was in. We restored his family to him
column5: and along with them gave him others similar to them as a grace from Us and reminder for those who are obedient.'

text: '(Remember) Ishmael
column5: Edris and Dhu''l-Kifl. They were men of fortitude

text: 'We heard his cry
column5: and saved him from the anguish. That is how We deliver those who believe.'

text: '(Remember) Zachariah when he called to his Lord: "Do not leave me alone (and childless)
column5: for you are the best of givers."'

text: 'So We heard him and gave him John
column5: and cured his wife (of barrenness). These were men who vied in good deeds with one another
column6: and prayed to Us with love and awe
column7: and were meek before Us.'

text: '(Remember) her who preserved her chastity
column5: into whom We breathed a new life from Us
column6: and made her and her son a token for mankind.'

text: 'Verily this your order is one order
column5: and I am your Lord; so worship Me.'

text: But they split up the order among themselves; (yet) all of them have to come back to Me.

column5: will not have his labour denied
column6: for We are congnisant of it.'

text: It is imperative that a habitation We have destroyed will not desist (from unbelief)
'Until when the way is opened up for Gog and Magog and they press from every elevated place
'And the certain promise (of Doom) comes near. Then the eyes of unbelievers will be fixed in horror
column5: (and they will cry:) "Ah
column6: woe betide
column7: we were indeed heedless of this
column8: and were oppressors and unjust."'

text: Verily you and those you worship other than God will be faggots for Hell; and come to it you will.

'There will only be groaning for them
column5: and they will not hear any thing.'

text: 'But those for whom a good reward had been fore-ordained by Us
column5: will be far removed from it

text: 'And will not hear its hissing

text: 'They will have safety from the mighty terror

column6: (saying:) "This is your day which had been promised you."'

text: 'The day We shall roll up the heavens like a written scroll

text: 'We had prescribed in the Book of Psalms after the reminder and admonition

text: Verily there is a message in this for people who are devout.

'Say: "This is what has been revealed to me: ''Your God is one and only God.'' So will you bow in homage to Him?"'
'If they turn away
column5: tell them: "I have warned you all alike. I do not know if what has been promised you is near or far away.'

text: 'He knows surely what you say aloud
column5: and what you hide within your breasts.'

text: 'I do not know if this be a trial for you
column5: or a little advantage for a while."'

text: '"Judge in truth (between us)
column5: O Lord
column6: he said. Our Lord is merciful
column7: whose help we seek against what you attribute."'

text: 'O YOU PEOPLE
column5: fear your Lord. The great upheaval of the Hour will indeed be terrible.'

text: 'The day you see it every suckling female will forget her suckling
column5: and every pregnant female will discharge her burden. You will see men drunk
column6: yet it will not be intoxication. The torment of God will be severe.'

text: 'And yet there are men who contend about God without understanding
column5: and follow every wayward devil'

text: 'Who
column5: it is inscribed
column6: will beguile whoever follows him
column7: and lead him to the torment of Hell.'

text: 'If you have any doubt
column5: O men
column6: about being raised to life again
