column9: then an embryo
column10: then a chewed up lump of flesh shaped and shapeless
column11: that We may reveal (the various steps) to you. We keep what We please in the womb for a certain time
column12: then you come out as a child
column13: then reach the prime of age. Some of you die
column14: some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they knew
column15: having known it once. You see the earth all withered
column16: then We send down rain upon it
column19: and brings forth every kind of beauteous verdure.'

text: 'That is so for God is the undeniable Reality. It is He who brings the dead to life
column5: for He has power over everything.'

text: 'The Hour will come without a doubt
column5: and God will raise those who are dead.'

text: 'Yet there are some who contend about God without any knowledge or guidance or enlightening Book
'Turning their backs that they may lead away from the path of God. For such there is disgrace in the world
column5: and on the Day of Judgement We shall make them taste the torment of burning.'

text: That is on account of what you had done in the past; yet God is not unjust to His creatures.
'There are some men who worship God only from the margin. If there is some profit they are content; but if calamity befalls them they turn about
column5: thus losing both this world and the next. This is indeed a palpable loss.'

text: Leaving God they pray to those who cannot harm or profit them. That is the limit of going astray.
They pray to him whose bane is more imminent than his boon: How bad the protector and how bad the associate!
God will admit those who believe and do the right to gardens full of rippling streams. Verily God does as He pleases.
He who thinks that God will not help him in this world and the next should stretch a rope to the sky then cut it off and see if his mind is relieved (of doubts) by this stratagem.
'That is why We have sent down these clear revelations
column5: for God gives guidance whomsoever He please.'

text: 'God will judge between those who believe and the Jews
column5: the Sabians
column6: Christians and the Magians and the idolaters
column7: on the Day of Judgement. Verily God is witness to everything.'

text: 'Do you see how all things in heavens and the earth
column5: the sun
column6: the moon
column7: the stars
column8: the mountains
column9: trees and beasts
column10: and men in abundance
column11: pay homage to God? Yet there are many who deserve the punishment. And whosoever God disgraces will have none to raise him up in honour. God does verily as He will.'

text: 'These two (believers and unbelievers) are disputants
column5: who contend about their Lord. But they who disbelieve will be fitted out with garments of flames. Boiling water will be poured down over their heads'

text: 'Which will dissolve everything within their bellies
column5: and their skins.'

text: There are iron maces for them.
'As often as they try to escape from its anguish they would be put back into (the fire)
column5: and taste the torment of burning.'

text: 'God will surely admit those who believe and do the right to gardens with rivers running by
column5: where they will be decked in bracelets of gold and of pearls; and of silk will be their garments.'

text: 'They will be guided with gentle words
column5: and guided to the commended path.'

text: 'As for those who disbelieve
column5: and obstruct the way of God and the holy Mosque which We have set down for all men
column6: the native and the visitor alike. Whoever puts obstructions in this mischievously will taste of painful punishment.'

text: 'When We chose the site of the House for Abraham (We said:) "Associate no one with Me
column5: and clean My House for those who will circumambulate it
column6: stand (in reverence)
column7: and bow in homage.'

text: 'Announce the Pilgrimage to the people. They will come to you on foot and riding along distant roads on lean and slender beasts
'In order to reach the place of advantage for them
column5: and to pronounce the name of God on appointed days over cattle He has given them for food; then eat of the meat and feed the needy and the poor.'

text: 'Let them then attend to their persons and complete the rites of pilgrimage
column5: fulfil their vows and circuit round the ancient House.'

text: 'Apart from this
column5: whoever respects the sacred ordinances of God
column6: will find a better reward for him with his Lord. You are allowed to eat all cattle except those already mentioned to you. Avoid the repugnance of idols
column7: and false and frivolous talk.'

text: Turn uprightly to God without ascribing compeers to Him; for he who associates any one with God is like a thing that falls from the sky and is either snatched away by birds or carried far away by the wind.
'All this
column5: and honouring the offerings to God
column6: comes from purity of heart.'

column5: There are advantages for you in these (cattle) up to a time
column6: then their place is the ancient House for sacrifice.'

text: 'For every community We have ordained certain rites that they may commemorate the name of God by reading it over the cattle We have given them for sacrifice. Your God is one God
column5: so be obedient to Him. Give good tidings to those who bow in obedience to God

text: 'Whose hearts are filled with awe when the name of God is mentioned before them
column5: who endure with fortitude what befalls them
column6: and fulfil their moral obligations
column7: and expend of what We have given them.'

text: 'We have made the camels signs of God for you. There is good for you in this. So pronounce the name of God over them as they stand with their forefeet in a line. When they have fallen (slaughtered) on their sides
column5: eat of (their meat) and feed those who are content with little
column6: and those who supplicate. That is why We have brought them under your subjugation so that you may be grateful.'

text: It is not their meat or blood that reaches God: It is the fealty of your heart that reaches him. That is why He has subjugated them to you that you may glorify God for having shown you the way. So give glad tidings to those who are doers of good.
God will certainly defend the believers. Surely God does not like the traitors who deny the truth.
Permission is granted those (to take up arms) who fight because they were oppressed. God is certainly able to give help to those
'Who were driven away from their homes for no other reason than they said: "Our Lord is God." And if God had not restrained some men through some others
column5: monastries
column6: churches
column7: synagogues and mosques
column8: where the name of God is honoured most
column9: would have been razed. God will surely help those who help Him
column10: -- verily God is all-powerful and all-mighty

text: 'Those who would be firm in devotion
column5: give zakat
column6: and enjoin what is good and forbid what is wrong
column7: if We gave them authority in the land. But the resultance of things rests with God.'

text: 'If they accuse you of falsehood
column5: (remember that) the people of Noah
column6: ''Ad and Thamud had accused (their apostles) before

text: 'And the people of Abraham and Lot
And the people of Midian too. Moses was also accused of lies. So I allowed the infidels respite and then seized them. How was My reprobation then!
'How many a habitation given to wickedness have We destroyed
column5: whose roofs tumbled down
column6: which fell into ruins. How many a well and fortress reinforced lie abandoned!'

text: 'Have they not travelled in the land that they could have the heart to understand
column5: and ears to hear? It is not the eyes alone that do not see
column6: oblivious are the hearts within their breasts.'

text: That is how they ask you to hasten the punishment; but God does not go back on His promise. Verily a day with your Lord is equal by your reckoning to a thousand years.
'To how many habitations did We give respite
column5: though given to wickedness
column6: and then seized them. To Me they had to come back in the end.'

text: 'Tell them: "O men
column5: it''s my duty to warn you clearly."'

text: For those who believe and do the right is forgiveness and gracious provision.
But those who try to defeat Our signs are people of Hell.
'We have sent no messenger or apostle before you with whose recitations Satan did not tamper. Yet God abrogates what Satan interpolates; then He confirms His revelations
column5: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: This is in order to make the interpolations of Satan a test for those whose hearts are diseased and hardened: Surely the sinners have gone far in dissent.
'At the same time those who have been given knowledge may know that this is the truth from your Lord
column5: and come to believe in it
column6: and their hearts become submissive to Him. Verily God guides those who believe
column7: to the even path.'

text: 'The infidels will remain in doubt about it till the Hour overtakes them unawares
column5: or the punishment of the barren day destructive should come upon them.'

text: 'The order will be God''s on that Day; He will judge between them. Then those who had come to believe and done the right will be in gardens of delight.'
'But those who did not believe and called Our revelations lies
column5: will be given disgraceful punishment.'

text: 'Those who left their homes in the way of God
column5: and then were killed or died
column6: will surely be given a better provision by God
column7: for God is surely the best of providers.'

text: God will surely lead them to a place with which they will be gratified. Verily God is all-knowing and forbearing.
'Whosoever retaliates to the extent of injury suffered by him
column5: and is wronged again
column6: will certainly be helped by God. Verily God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'That is so for God turns night into day and day into night
column5: for God is all-hearing and all-seeing;'

text: 'That is so for God is the undeniable truth
column5: and what they invoke apart from Him is false; yet God is all-high and supreme.'

text: Do you not see how God sends down water from the sky and in the morning the earth turns green? Truly God is benign and well-informed.
'Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. Surely God is all-sufficing
column5: worthy of praise.'

text: 'Do you not see God has harnessed all that is in the earth
column5: to your service? And the boats ply in the ocean by His command. He holds the sky in position lest it should fall upon the earth save by His dispensation. Verily God is compassionate and kind to men.'

text: 'It is He who gives you life
column5: then makes you die; then He will bring you back to life again. Man is surely most ungrateful.'

text: We have determined for each community a way of worship which they follow. So they should not contend with you in this matter; and you should go on calling them to your Lord. You are surely on the right path.
'If they argue with you
column5: tell them: "God knows well what you are doing.'

text: God will judge between you on the Day of Judgement in what you are at variance."
Do you not know that God knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? This is surely in accordance with the law. This is certainly how (the law of) God works inevitably.
'Yet they worship in place of God that for which no authority has been sent to them
column5: and of which they have no knowledge. The wicked will have none to help them.'

text: 'When Our clear messages are read out to them you can see denial on the faces of unbelievers. They can hardly restrain themselves from attacking those who recite Our revelations. Tell them: "Should I give you news of something worse than this?" -- Hell
column5: which God has promised the infidels. How evil a destination!'

text: 'O men
column5: give ear to this parable: Those you worship other than God can never create as much as a fly
column6: even if they get together to do so; and if the fly were to rob them of a thing they would not be able to snatch it away from it. How weak the seeker and how weak the sought!'

text: They do not esteem God with the right estimation. God is surely all-powerful and all-mighty.
God chooses messengers from the angels and human beings. Verily God is all-hearing and all-seeing.
'He knows what is before them and what lies behind them
column5: and all things go back to God.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: bow in adoration
column6: Worship your Lord and do what is good that you may find success.'

text: 'Strive in the way of God with a service worthy of Him. He has chosen you and laid no hardship on you in the way of faith
column5: the faith of your forbear Abraham. He named you Muslim earlier
column6: and in this (Qur''an)
column7: in order that the Prophet be witness over you
column8: and you be witness over mankind. So be firm in devotion
column9: pay the zakat
column10: and hold on firmly to God. He is your friend: How excellent a friend is He
column11: how excellent a helper!'

text: 'THE TRUE BELIEVERS will be successful
'Who are humble in their service
'Who shun all frivolities
Who strive for betterment;
Who guard their sex
'Except from their wives and women slaves of old are free of blame
But those who covet more than this will be transgressors;
And those who fulfil their trusts and keep their promises;
And those who are watchful of their acts of prayer.
'These are the real gainers
'Who will inherit Paradise
column5: and live in it for ever.'

text: 'We created man from the finest extract of clay
Then We placed him as a sperm in a firmly established lodging;
'Then We fashioned the sperm into an embryo
column5: then fashioned the embryo into a shapeless lump of flesh; then from the lump of flesh We fashioned bones
column6: then clothed the bones with flesh. Thus We formed him into a new creation. So blessed be God the best of Creators.'

text: 'And then you will certainly die
Then will be raised up on the Day of Resurrection.
We made several highways one over the other above you. We are not neglectful of creation.
'We send down water from the sky in determined measure
column5: and store it up in the earth; and We have power to drain it away.'

text: 'We grow orchards of dates and grapes from it for you
column5: Which yield fruits in abundance that you eat.'

text: The tree that grows on Mount Sinai yields oil and seasoning for those who eat.
'There are lessons for you in the cattle from whose bellies We give you milk to drink
column5: and there are other advantages that you derive from them
column6: and some of them you eat;'

text: And you are carried on them and on boats.
'We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people
column5: worship God
column6: for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"'

text: 'The chiefs of his people
column5: who did not believe
column6: said: "He is only a man like you. He wishes to acquire ascendancy over you. If God had willed He would have sent down angels. We never heard this from our elders.'

text: He is only a man possessed; so wait and watch him for a time."
'"O my Lord
column5: prayed (Noah), help me against them
column6: for they accuse me of lies."'

text: 'So We asked him to build the ark under Our eyes and guidance
column5: (and said): "When Our command is issued and the source of water boils over
column6: put a pair of every species in it
column7: and your family except those for whom Our sentence has been passed already; and do not speak to Me for those who are wicked: They will be drowned.'

text: 'When you and those with you have boarded the ark
column5: say: ''All praise be to God who has delivered us from the people who were sinful.'''

text: 'And say: ''O Lord
column5: disembark me in a welcome place; You are the best of deliverers.'''

text: There were surely signs in this; We will surely put you to the test.
After them We raised a new generation.
'Then We sent to them an apostle from among them (who said): "Worship God
column5: for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed and fear God?"'

text: 'The chiefs of the people who did not believe and denied the life to come
column5: though We had given them good things of this life to enjoy
column6: (said): "He is only a mortal like you. He eats as you do
column7: and drinks as you drink.'

text: So if you follow a man like yourself you will certainly be doomed.
'Does he give you a promise that when you are dead and turned to dust and bones
column5: you will be raised to life again?'

text: How far-fetched what you are promised;
There is only the life of this world: We die and we live: there is no rising from the dead for us.
He is just a man who invents a lie about God; we cannot believe in him."
'(The apostle prayed): "O Lord
column5: deliver me
column6: for they accuse me of lies."'

text: Answered (the Lord): "They shall wake up repenting soon."
So they were rightly seized by a mighty blast; and We turned them into mouldy rubbish: A good riddance of the wicked people!
Then after them We raised other generations.
'No nation can live beyond its allotted time
column5: or lag behind.'

text: 'Then We sent Our apostles one after the other. Every time an apostle came to a people they denied him. So We made one follow the other (to its doom)
column5: and turned them into bygone tales. Cursed be the people who do not believe!'

text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear proofs
'To Pharaoh and his nobles who behaved with arrogance
column5: for they were a conceited lot

text: 'And said: "Should we believe in two men like yourselves
column5: whose people are our subjects?"'

text: 'Then they accused them of lies
column5: and joined the company of those who were destroyed.'

text: And We gave the Book to Moses so that they may be guided.
'And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign
column5: and gave them shelter on an elevated ground
column6: sequestered
column7: watered by a spring.'

text: 'O you apostles
column5: eat things that are clean
column6: and do things that are good. We are surely cognisant of what you do.'

text: 'Verily this your order is one order
column5: and I am your Lord
column6: so fear Me.'

text: 'But then they divided up their order into different creeds
column5: each section rejoicing in what it had come to have.'

text: So leave them to their ignorance for a time.
Do they think that by increasing their wealth and children
We are hastening to reward them for good deeds? No. They do not comprehend.
'Surely those who live in awe of their Lord
'Who believe in their Lord''s revelations
'Who do not associate any one with their Lord
'Who give whatsoever they give (in His way)
column5: and their hearts tremble with fear that they have to go back to their Lord

text: Are the ones who hasten to goodness and outpace the others.
'We do not burden a soul beyond capacity
column5: for We have a record that tells the truth. No wrong will be done to any one.'

text: 'Yet their hearts are oblivious of this; and besides
column5: they are busy with other things

text: 'So that when We seize the affluent among them with affliction
column5: they will begin to implore for help.'

text: Why did they not think over the message? Or has something come to them which had not come to their fathers?
'Or did they not recognise their apostle
column5: and rejected him?'

text: 'Or do they say that he is possessed? In fact
column5: he has brought the truth to them
column6: but most of them abhor the truth.'

text: 'Had truth been subject to their whims the heavens and the earth and all those within them would have been depraved. In fact We had sent them their reminder
column5: but they turned away from good advice.'

text: 'Or do you ask of them any tribute? In that case the tribute of your Lord is better
column5: for He is the best of providers.'

text: You are surely calling them to the right path.
But those who believe not in the Hereafter turn away from the straight path.
'If We took compassion on them and removed the affliction they are in
column5: they would only wander lost in confusion.'

text: 'We had seized them with the punishment
column5: but they did not bow before their Lord nor turned to Him in humility

text: So that when at last We open up the gate of severe punishment on them they will be overwhelmed with despair.
'It is He who gave you hearing
column5: sight
column6: and hearts
column7: but only few of you give thanks.'

text: 'It is He who multiplied you on the earth
column5: and it will be before Him that you will be gathered.'

text: 'It is He who gives you life and death
column5: and His the alternation of night and day. Even then you do not understand

text: And talk as did the people of old.
'They say: "When we are dead and turned to dust and bones
column5: shall we be raised to life again?'

text: We and our fathers were promised this before; it is nothing but ancient lore!"
'Say: "To whom does the earth and whosoever is upon it then belong
column5: if you know?"'

text: They will say: "To God." Say: "Then why do you not bethink yourselves?"
Say: "Then who is the Lord of the seven skies? And who is the Lord of the mighty Throne?"
They will say: "God." Say: "Then why do you not obey and fear Him?"
'Say: "Whose is the sovereignty over all things
column5: who protects
column6: and against whom there is no protection? {Answer) if you have knowledge."'

text: 'They will say: "God''s." Say: "Then why are you so deluded?"'
'In fact We have sent the truth to them
column5: but they are liars.'

text: 'God has not begotten a son
column5: nor is there any god besides Him. Had this been so
column6: each god would have taken away what he had created with him
column7: and some would have risen over the others. God is much too glorious for what they attribute (to Him)!'

text: 'The knower of the absent and the present
column5: too exalted is He for what they associate (with Him)!'

text: 'Say: "O Lord
column5: if I am made to see what has been promised them

text: 'Then do not
column5: O Lord
column6: put me among the sinners."'

text: We have certainly the power to make you see what We have promised them.
Dispel evil with what is good. We know well what they attribute (to Us).
'Say: "My Lord
column5: I seek refuge in You from the evil promptings of the devils.'

text: I seek refuge in You lest they come to me."
'(But the unbelievers will persist) until when death comes to one of them he will say: "O Lord
column5: send me back again'

text: That I may do some good I did not do (in the world)." Not so. These are only words he utters. Behind them lies the intervening barrier (stretching) to the day of their resurrection.
'When the trumpet blast is sounded no ties of lineage will hold among them
column5: nor will they ask after one another.'

text: Only those whose scales are heavier in the balance will find happiness.
But those whose scales are lighter will perish and abide in Hell for ever.
'Their faces will be scorched by flames
column5: and they will grin and scowl within it.'

text: Were not My messages read out to you? But you denied them.
'They will say: "O Lord
column5: our misery overwhelmed us
column6: so we remained a people astray.'

text: 'Get us out of this
column5: O Lord. If we transgress we will surely be sinful."'

text: 'He will say: "Remain condemned in it
column5: and do not speak to Me.'

text: 'There was a section among My creatures that said: ''O Lord
column5: we believe. Forgive us and have mercy upon us
column6: for You are the best of the merciful.'''

text: But you ridiculed them. So much so that out of (spite) for them you forgot to remember Me and laughed at them.
'I have rewarded them this day for they were constant
column5: and they have come to attainment."'

text: They will be asked: "How long did you live on the earth in terms of years?"
They will say: "A day or less than a day. Ask the enumerators of numbers."
'He will say: "You stayed there only a moment
column5: if you knew.'

text: 'Do you think We created you for nothing
column5: and that you will not return to Us?"'

text: 'Exalted then be God
column5: the King
column6: the Real. There is no god but He
column7: the Lord of the glorious throne.'

text: 'Whoever worships another god apart from God
column5: for which he holds no proof
column6: will have to account for it before his Lord. Verily the unbelievers will not prosper.'

text: 'Say: "My Lord
column5: forgive and have mercy. You are the best of the merciful."'

text: WE HAVE REVEALED this Surah and made it obligatory as We have sent down clear injunctions in it that you may be warned.
'The adulteress and adulterer should be flogged a hundred lashes each
column5: and no pity for them should deter you from the law of God
column6: if you believe in God and the Last Day; and the punishment should be witnessed by a body of believers.'

text: 'The adulterer can marry no one but an adulteress or his partner (in the act)
column5: and the adulteress cannot marry any but an adulterer or her partner (in the act). This is forbidden the believers

text: 'Those who defame chaste women and do not bring four witnesses should be punished with eighty lashes
column5: and their testimony should not be accepted afterwards
column6: for they are profligates

text: Except those who repent after this and reform; and God is surely forgiving and kind.
'Those who accuse their wives and do not have any witnesses except themselves
column5: should swear four times in the name of God
column6: the testimony of each such person being that he is speaking the truth

text: And (swear) a fifth time that if he tell a lie the curse of God be on him.
'The woman''s punishment can be averted if she swears four times by God as testimony that her husband is a liar
Her fifth oath being that the curse of God be on her if her husband should be speaking the truth.
(This would not have been possible) if the grace and benevolence of God were not upon you; but God is compassionate and wise.
'Those who spread lies were a clique among you. Do not think that it was bad for you: In fact it has been good for you. Each of them will pay for the sin he has committed
column5: and he who had greater share (of guilt) will suffer grievous punishment.'

text: 'Why did the faithful men and women not think well of their people when they heard this
column5: and said: "This is a clear lie?"'

text: Why did they not bring four witnesses (in support of their charge)? And since they did not bring the four witnesses they are themselves liars in the sight of God.
'Were it not for the grace of God and His mercy upon you in this world and the next
column5: you would have suffered a great affliction for the false accusation.'

text: 'When you talked about it and said what you did not know
column5: and took it lightly -- though in the sight of God it was serious --'

text: 'Why did you not say when you heard it: "It is not for us to speak of it? God preserve us
column5: it is a great calumny!"'

text: 'God counsels you not to do a thing like this
column5: if you are believers.'

text: 'God explains His commands to you clearly
column5: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers
column5: for God knows and you do not know.'

text: But for the grace of God and His mercy (much harm would have been done); yet God is compassionate and kind.
'O you who believe
column5: do not follow in the footsteps of Satan
column6: for he who follows in the footsteps of Satan will be induced by him to what is shameful and forbidden. But for the grace of God and His mercy upon you none of you would have escaped undefiled; but God makes whosoever He will grow in goodness
column7: for God is all-hearing and all-knowing.'

text: Let not those who are men of plenty and means among you swear that they will not give to their relatives and the poor and those who leave their homes in the service of God. They should forgive and overlook (their failings). Would you not like God to forgive you? And God is forgiving and kind.
Verily those who blaspheme unsuspecting chaste believing women will be cursed in this world and the next; and for them there will be severe punishment.
'The day their tongues and hands and feet bear witness to what they had done
'God will pay them on that day their just due in full
column5: and they will come to know that God is the tangible Reality.'

text: 'Bad women deserve bad men
column5: and bad men are for bad women; but good women are for good men
column6: and good men for good women
column7: for they are innocent of what people say. There is forgiveness for them and a gracious provision.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not enter other houses except yours without first asking permission and saluting the inmates. This is better for you: You may haply take heed.'

text: 'If you find that no one is in
column5: then do not enter unless you have received permission. If you are asked to go away
column6: turn back. That is proper for you. God is aware of what you do.'

text: 'There is no harm in going into uninhabited houses where there is some convenience for you
column5: as God has knowledge of what you hide and what you disclose.'

text: Tell the believing men to lower their eyes and guard their private parts. There is for them goodness in this. God is aware of what they do.
'Tell the believing women to lower their eyes
column5: guard their private parts
column6: and not display their charms except what is apparent outwardly
column7: and cover their bosoms with their veils and not to show their finery except to their husbands or their fathers or fathers-in-law
column8: their sons or step-sons
column9: brothers
column10: or their brothers'' and sisters'' sons
column11: or their women attendants or captives
column12: or male attendants who do not have any need (for women)
column13: or boys not yet aware of sex. They should not walk stamping their feet lest they make known what they hide of their Ornaments. O believers
column16: so that you may be successful.'

text: 'Marry off those who are single among you
column5: and those of your male and female servants who are righteous. If they are poor
column6: God will enrich them of His grace
column7: for God is bounteous and all-knowing.'

text: 'Those who cannot afford to marry should abstain from what is unlawful until God enriches them by His grace. And free those slaves you possess who wish to buy their freedom after a written undertaking
column5: if you know they have some goodness
column6: and give them out of the riches God has given you. Do not force your maids to prostitution if they wish to lead married lives

text: 'We have sent down clear instructions to you

text: 'God is the light of the heavens and the earth. The semblance of His light is that of a niche in which is a lamp
column5: the flame within a glass
column6: the glass a glittering star as it were

column8: the olive
column9: neither of the East nor of the West
column10: whose oil appears to light up even though fire touches it not

text: '(The light is lit) in houses of worship which God has allowed to be raised

text: 'By men not distracted from the remembrance of God either by trade and commerce or buying and selling

text: 'That God may reward them for the best of their deeds

text: 'As for those who disbelieve

text: 'Or like darkness in a wide
column5: wide sea
column6: waves surging upon waves
column7: with clouds overhanging
column8: darkness on darkness. If you stretch your hand

text: 'Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and the earth

text: 'For God''s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth

text: 'Have you not seen that God drives the clouds

column5: one walks on two legs

text: We have surely sent down clear signs. It is God who guides whom He will to the path that is straight.

text: 'When they are called to God and His Prophet

text: 'The answer of the believers when they are called to God and His Apostle that he may judge between them

text: 'Whoever obeys God and His Prophet

text: 'They swear solemnly by God: "If you command us we shall go forth." Say: "Do not swear. What is wanted is obedience

text: 'Say: "Obey God and obey the Apostle. If you turn away

text: 'God has promised to make those of you who believe and do the right

text: 'So observe your devotional obligations

column7: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'When your children have reached the age of puberty

column6: for God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'As for your women past the age of bearing children

text: Do not consider your being summoned by the Apostle to be like your summoning one another. God knows those of you who go away surreptitiously. So let those who act in contravention of his command take heed lest a trial should befall them or a grievous punishment come upon them.
'Does not everything in the heavens and the earth belong to God? He surely knows what state you are in; and on the day they go back to Him. He will tell them what they used to do
column5: for God has knowledge of everything.'

text: 'BLESSED IS HE who revealed the Criterion (of right and wrong) to His votary that it may be a warning for the world

column5: who has neither begotten a son nor has He a partner in His kingdom
column6: (who) created everything and determined its exact measure.'

text: 'Yet they choose apart from Him gods who have not created any thing and have themselves been created
column5: who possess no power over their loss or gain
column6: or their death or life or being raised to life again.'

text: Yet the unbelievers say: "This is nothing but a lie he has concocted in which others have aided him." They have come down to mischief and lies.
'And they say: "These are fables of antiquity he has invented
column5: which are dictated to him morning and evening."'

text: Say: "He who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth has revealed it to me; and He is surely forgiving and kind."

'Or a treasure should have been given to him
column5: or he should have had an orchard from which he could eat." And these wicked people say: "You only follow a man ensorcelled."'

text: Just see what comparisons they bring up for you! They are lost and cannot find the way.
'Blessed be He who
column5: if He pleased
column6: could give you better than that

text: Yet they reject the Hour as untrue. We have prepared a Fire for those who deny the Resurrection.

'And when they are cast within a narrow space of it chained together

text: Do not ask for one death but many deaths on this day.

'There will they have whatever they wish
column5: and there abide for ever." This is a promise incumbent on your Lord which will certainly be fulfilled.'

text: 'The day He will gather them together along with those they worshipped other than God
column5: He will ask them: "Did you lure these creatures of Mine away
column6: or did they themselves go astray?"'

text: They will answer: "Glory to You. It was not worthy of us to seek any protector other than You. But You allowed them and their fathers a life of ease until they turned oblivious of the Reminder. They were a people impenitent.
(The idolaters will be told): "Your gods have refuted your assertion. You can neither avert (your doom) nor receive any help. We shall make the wicked among you taste of severe punishment."
We never sent before you apostles who did not eat food and walk the market places. We make some of you the means of trying the others. So will you persevere? Your Lord is always watching.
'Those who do not hope to meet Us say: "Why are no angels sent down to us
column5: or why do we not see our Lord?" They are full of self-conceit and behave with intense arrogance.'

text: The day they see the angels there will be no happy tidings for the sinners; and they will say: "There is an insurmountable barrier!"

'The inmates of Paradise will have a better abode that day
column5: and a better resting place.'

text: 'The day the heavens splits asunder with a dazzling white cloud gathering and the angels descend in a continuous stream
The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!
The sinner will then bite his hand and say: "Would that I had taken the road with the Prophet.
'Woe alas
column5: ah would I had not taken so-and-so as friend!'

text: He led me astray from the Warning after it had come to me. Satan always betrays man.
'The prophet will say: "O my Lord
column5: my people had fettered the Qur''an."'

text: Thus do We keep opponents among the sinners for every apostle; yet your Lord is sufficient as a guide and helper.
'The unbelievers say: "Why was the whole Qur''an not sent down all at once to him?" It was sent thus that We may keep your heart resolute. So We enunciated it by steps and distinctly.'
There is not an example they advance to which We do not give you a right answer and a better explanation.
'Those who will be pushed faces forward into Hell will be in a worse position
column5: farther away from the path.'

text: 'We gave Moses the Book
column5: and made his brother Aaron his minister

text: Then We told them: "Go to the people who have rejected Our signs." Then We annihilated them completely.
'We had drowned the people of Noah when they had accused the apostles of lies
column5: and turned them into an example for men. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wicked.'

text: '(As for) ''Ad
column5: Thamud and the people of ar-Rass
column6: and many generations in between them

text: 'We administered warnings to each of them
column5: and then destroyed them completely.'

text: They must have surely passed by the town on which We had rained the terrible rain of ruin. How could they not have seen it? Still they do not dread the Resurrection.
When they see you they take you only in jest: "Is this the one whom God has sent as messenger?
He would have surely turned us away from our gods if we had not adhered to them." They will know soon who is farther away from the path when they see the punishment!
Have you considered him who takes his own lust for his god? Can you stand a surety for him?
Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are no better than cattle; in fact they are farther astray from the path.
Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? He could have kept it motionless if He liked. Yet We make the sun its pilot to show the way.
'Then We draw it back to Us
column5: withdrawing it little by little.'

text: 'It is He who made the night a covering for you; and made sleep for rest
column5: the day for rising.'

text: It is He who sends the winds with auspicious news in advance of His benevolence; and We send pure water down from the sky
'To quicken a region that was dead
column5: and to give it as drink to animals We have created and to men in plenty.'

text: And We distribute it among them in various ways that they may ponder and reflect; yet most men disdain everything but denial and thanklessness.
Had We pleased We could have raised a warner in every town.
'So do not listen to unbelievers
column5: and strive against them with greater effort.'

text: 'It is He who made two bodies of water flow side by side
column5: one fresh (and) sweet
column6: the other brine (and) bitter
column7: and has placed an interstice
column8: a barrier between them.'

text: 'It is He who created man from water
column5: then gave him consanguinity and affinity. Your Lord is omnipotent.'

text: And yet they worship besides God what cannot bring them gain or do them harm. The unbeliever has always been an auxiliary against his Lord.
Yet We have not sent you but to give good tidings and to warn.
Tell them: "I do not ask any recompense of you for this other than (urging) whoever likes may take the way to his Lord."
'Have trust in God the Living
column5: who will never die
column6: and sing His hallelujas; for He is well aware of the sins of His creatures.'

text: He created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them in six spans then assumed His authority. He is the benevolent: Ask those who are well-informed.
'When you say to them: "Bow before Ar-Rahman
column5: they say: What is Ar-Rahman? Should we adore whoever you ask us to?" And their aversion increases further.'

text: 'Blessed is He who placed in the heavens constellations of stars
column5: and placed a burning lamp in it and the luminous moon.'

text: It is He who made the night and day an alternation for him who cares to reflect and be grateful.
'Devotees of Ar-Rahman are those who walk with humility on the earth
column5: and when they are addressed by the ignorant
column6: say: ''Peace;"'

text: And those who spend their nights bowed and standing before their Lord;
'Who say: "O our Lord
column5: avert from us the torment of Hell: Its punishment is surely continuous.'

text: It is indeed an evil halt and an evil abode;"
Who are neither prodigal nor miserly in their spending but follow a middle path;
'Who do not invoke any god apart from God
column5: who do not take a life which God has forbidden except for a cause that is just
column6: and do not fornicate -- and any one who does so will be punished for the crime

text: 'Whose punishment will be doubled on the Day of Judgement
column5: and he will live for ever in disgrace

text: 'Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right
column5: for whom God will turn evil into goodness
column6: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Whosoever repents and does the right
column5: will have turned back to God by way of repentance;'

text: 'And those who do not give false evidence
column5: and if they come across unbecoming talk ignore it and pass by in a sedate way;'

text: 'Who
column5: when reminded of their Lord''s revelations
column6: do not fall for them like the deaf and blind;'

text: 'And those who say: "O Lord
column5: give us comfort in our spouses and children
column6: and make us paragons of those who follow the straight path."'

text: 'They will be rewarded for their perseverance with lofty mansions in empyrean where they will be received with greetings of peace and salutations
And abide there for ever: What an excellent destination and abode!
Say: "My Lord is not concerned on your account if you do not pray to Him. You have surely done with denying; soon will come the inevitable judgement.
TA SIN MIM.
These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.
You may perhaps wear out your heart because they do not come to belief.
'We could send down from the heavens a sign to them if We pleased
column5: before which their heads would remain bowed.'

text: Never does a new reminder come to them from Ar-Rahman but they turn away from it.

'Do they not see the earth
column5: how We grow all kinds of noble things upon it?'

text: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe.
Your Lord is surely mighty and merciful.
'When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people
The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"
': He said: "O Lord
column5: I fear that they will deny me.'

text: 'My heart is constrained
column5: my tongue falters
column6: so delegate Aaron;'

text: And they have a charge (of murder) against me. So I fear that they will kill me."
'(It was) said: "By no means. Go with My signs

text: 'Go to the Pharaoh and tell him: ''We bring a message from the Lord of all the worlds'
'That you should send the children of Israel with us.'''
(The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us.
'And you commited what you did
column5: and you are ungrateful!"'

text: '(Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong
'So I ran away from you out of fear. But my Lord has given me wisdom

text: But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."
The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"
'(Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them

text: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"
(Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."
'(The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you
column5: is certainly mad."'

text: '(Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them
column5: if you have sense."'

text: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."

'(The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it
column5: if you speak the truth."'

text: 'So (Moses) cast his staff
column5: and lo

text: 'And he drew forth his hand
column5: and lo
column6: it looked white to the beholders.'

text: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician.
'He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. So
column5: what do you bid?"'

text: 'They said: "Put him and his brother off awhile
column5: and send summoners to the cities to gather'

text: And bring the ablest magicians to you."

'When the magicians arrived
column5: they said to the Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we are victorious?" --'

text: '"Yes
column5: he replied. You ''will be among the honoured."'

column5: and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh
column6: we shall be victorious."'

text: 'Then Moses threw down his staff
column5: and lo

text: 'Then the magicians fell prostrating in adoration
'And said: "We (affirm and) believe in the Lord of all the worlds

column6: and have every one of you crucified."'

text: They said: "There will be no harm. We shall return to our Lord.

'Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities
(Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives).

'So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water

'When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other
column5: the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."'

text: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."
'We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted

text: Then We brought the others to that place.
'We delivered Moses and every one with him

column5: but most of them do not believe.'

text: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful.

They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."
(Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?
'Or do they benefit you
column5: or do you harm?"'

text: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."
'He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping

Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the worlds

'Who gives me food and drink
'And heals me when I am sick
'Who will make me die
column5: then give me life again

text: 'And who
column5: I hope
column6: will condone my faults on the Day of Judgement.'

text: 'O Lord
column5: give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous

text: 'And uphold my name with posterity

Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray.
'And do not disgrace me on the day when they are raised from the graves
The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail
But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."
Paradise will be brought near those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path;
And Hell made visible to those who had gone astray.
They will be asked: "Where are those you worshipped
Other than God? Can they save you or even save themselves?"
They will then be thrown into Hell with those who had gone astray
Together with the hordes of Iblis.
Disputing among themselves they will say:
'"By God
column5: we were plainly in error'

text: In equating you with the Lord of all the worlds;

'Now we have none to intercede for us

If only we could return and be among the believers!"
'Verily there is a sign in this
column5: but many of them do not believe.'

text: Verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.

When their brother Noah said to them: "Will you not take heed?
I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So be fearful of God and listen to me.
I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.

They said: "Should we place our trust in you when only the condemned follow you?"
He said: "It is not for me to know what they were doing.
'It is for my Lord to bring them to book
column5: if you can understand.'

text: I am certainly not one to drive away the believers.
I am only a plain admonisher."
'They said: "If you do not desist
column5: O Noah
column6: you will be stoned to death."'

text: 'He prayed: "O Lord
column5: verily my people accuse me of lies.'

text: 'So adjudge between me and them conclusively
column5: and save me and the believers who are with me."'

text: 'So We delivered him and those with him in the loaded ark

'Verily there is a sign in this
column5: yet many of them do not believe.'

text: But surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
'The people of ''Ad accused the messengers of lies.'

I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So fear God and listen to me.
I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
'You construct monuments on every hill in vain
'Erect palaces (thinking) that you will live for ever
And whenever you apply force become tyrannical.
So be fearful of God and follow me.
'Fear Him who has bestowed on you what you know
'Gave you increase of cattle and sons

I fear the punishment of a terrible day for you.
They said: "It is the same to us if you warn us or do not warn.

'Then they accused him of lies; so We annihilated them. Verily there is a sign in this
column5: but most of them do not believe.'

text: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.

I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.

(Do you think) you will be left secure here
'In these gardens and these springs

They said: "Surely you are deluded.

'(Saleh) said: "Here is a she-camel. She has a right of drinking water

Weigh on an even balance.
'And do not withhold from people what belongs to them
column5: and do not corrupt the land;'

text: And fear Him who created you and all the earlier people."
They said: "Surely you are deluded.
'You are nothing but a man like us
column5: and we think you are a liar.'

text: 'But in case you are speaking the truth
column5: then make a segment of the sky to fall upon us."'

text: '(Shu''aib) said: "My Lord knows well what you are doing."'
'But they denied him
column5: and We seized them with the torment of the Day of Shadowing (when the cloud had rained down fire). It was indeed the torment of a terrible day!'

text: 'Verily in this was a sign
column5: but most of them do not believe.'

text: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
'And this (Qur''an) is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds
Which the trusted spirit descended with
To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warner
In eloquent Arabic.
This is (indicated) in the Books of earlier people.
Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of Israel knew about this?
Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongue
'And he had recited it to them
column5: and they had not believed (it would have been different).'

text: Thus do We cause (unbelief) to enter the hearts of sinners.
They will not believe it until they behold the painful punishment.
'It will come upon them unawares
column5: and they will not comprehend it.'

text: Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"
Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
'Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more
'And then what they were promised comes upon them
Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?
Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to them
To warn. For We are never unjust.
The devils did not bring it down:
'They are not worthy of it
column5: nor have they power.'

text: They have been precluded from hearing it.
'So call on no other god but God
column5: lest you are condemned to torment;'

text: 'And warn your near relations
And take those believers under your wing who follow you.
'If they do not obey you
column5: tell them: "I am not responsible for what you do."'

text: 'Have trust in the Mighty
column5: the Merciful

text: 'Who watches you when you get up
And your movements among those who bow in homage to God.
He is all-hearing and all-knowing.
Should I tell you on whom the devils descend?
'They come down to every mendacious sinner
Who listens to you (for spreading rumours); but most of them are liars.
'As for the poets
column5: only those who go astray follow them.'

text: 'Have you not seen that they wander distract in every valley
'And they say what they do not do
'Except those who believe and do the right
column5: and remember God a great deal
column6: who retaliate only when they have been wronged. Yet the oppressors will now come to know through what reversals they will be overthrown!'

text: 'TA SIN. THESE are the verses of the Qur''an
column5: and collection of explicit laws

text: 'A guidance and good tidings for the believers
'Who fulfil their devotional obligations
column5: pay the zakat
column6: and believe with certainty in the life to come.'

text: 'We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter
column5: so that they may wander in perplexity.'

text: 'They are those who will suffer the worst chastisement in this life
column5: and will be the greatest losers in the life to come.'

text: 'You have been conveyed the Qur''an from One all-wise and all-knowing.'
'(Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it
column5: or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."'

text: 'But when he reached it
column5: a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God
column6: the Lord of all the worlds.'

text: 'O Moses
column5: I am that God
column6: the mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses
column5: (said the voice), be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence

text: Except those who do some wrong but afterwards do good to make up for the wrong. And I am forgiving and merciful.
'Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people
column5: who are a wicked lot indeed."'

text: 'And when Our signs came as distinct proofs
column5: they said: "This is only magic."'

text: 'And they denied them out of malice and pride
column5: though in their hearts they believed that they were true. So see how was the end of evil-doers!'

text: We gave David and Solomon knowledge; and they said: "All praise be to God who has favoured us over many of His creatures who believe."
'Solomon was heir to David
column5: and he said: "O people
column6: we have been taught the language of Tair
column7: and have been given of everything. This is a clear favour indeed."'

text: 'His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled
column5: formed into ranks
column6: (and marched)'

text: 'Till they reached the Valley of Naml. Said the lady of Naml: "O Naml
column5: go into your dwellings lest Solomon and his hordes should crush you unawares."'

text: '(Solomon) smiled
column5: amused at her speech
column6: and said: "O Lord grant me that I should be grateful for the favours You have bestowed on me and my parents
column7: and do good things of Your pleasing; and admit me among Your righteous devotees by Your grace."'

text: 'When he reviewed the Tair
column5: he said: "How is it I do not see Hud-hud? Is he absent?'

text: 'I will punish him severely
column5: or cut his throat
column6: unless he bring a valid excuse."'

text: 'But he was not long in coming
column5: and reported: "I have been around where you have not been. I come from Saba with positive news.'

text: 'I found a woman reigning over them
column5: and she has been favoured with everything; and she has a throne that is magnificent.'

text: 'I found that she and her people worship the sun in place of God
column5: for Satan has made their deeds look attractive to them and has turned them away from the Path
column6: so they do not find the way'

text: 'To worship God who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth
column5: and is cognisant of what you hide and what you disclose.'

text: 'God: There is no god but He
column5: the Lord of the glorious throne."'

text: '(Solomon) said: ''We shall see if you speak the truth or you are a liar.'
'Take this letter from me
column5: and deliver it to them and withdraw
column6: then see what reply they give in return."'

text: '(The Queen said): "O nobles
column5: a venerable letter has been delivered to me.'

text: 'It is from Solomon
column5: and (says): ''In the name of Allah
column6: Ar-Rahman
column7: Ar-Rahim.'

text: 'Do not rise against me
column5: but come to me in submission.'''

text: '." Advise me
column5: O nobles
column6: she said in this matter. I do not decide any thing until you concur."'

text: 'They said: "We are men of valour
column5: and brave fighters. It is for you to decide. So consider what you should command."'

text: She said: "Surely when kings enter a city they destroy it and despoil the honour of its nobility. So will they do (to us).
But I will send them a gift and see what the envoys bring back (in return)."
'So
column5: when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth? Yet what God has given me is better than what He has given you. No. Be gratified in your present.'

text: 'Go back to them. We shall soon come with our armies which they will not be able to face. We shall drive them out of (the land) with ignominy
column5: and they will be humbled."'

text: 'He (then) said (to his courtiers): "O you nobles
column5: is there any one who can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"'

text: 'A crafty jinn said: "I will bring it before you rise from your seat
column5: for I am strong and trustworthy."'

text: 'But one who had knowledge of the letter
column5: said: "I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye." When Solomon saw it before him
column6: (he said): "This is by the grace of my Lord that He may test me whether I am grateful or I am thankless. Yet if one is grateful
column7: he is grateful for himself
column8: and if one is thankless
column9: then surely my Lord is unconcerned and magnanimous."'

text: '(Turning to his nobles) he said: "Change the appearance of her throne. Let us see if she is rightly guided
column5: or is not guided at all."'

text: 'When she arrived
column5: they asked her: "Is your throne like this?" She said: "As though this is it. We had come to have knowledge and already submitted."'

text: 'She was (in fact) turned away by what she worshipped other than God
column5: for she came of an unbelieving people.'

text: 'She was invited to enter the court. When she saw it
column5: she took it for a sheet of water
column6: and (pulling up her skirts) uncovered her legs. (Solomon) told her: "This is paved with tiles of glass." "O Lord
column7: she said, I have wronged myself
column8: and I submit to the Lord of all the worlds with Solomon."'

text: We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh (who said): "Worship God." But they were divided into two groups disputing with one another.
'(Saleh) said: "O people
column5: why do you wish to hasten evil rather than good? Why not ask for God''s forgiveness? You may well be forgiven."'

text: 'They said: "You betoken evil
column5: and those with you." (Saleh) replied: "The evil you presage can only come from God. In reality you are a people under trial (for your own inauspiciousness)."'

text: 'There were in that city nine persons who spread disorder in the land
column5: and did not reform.'

text: 'They said: "Let us swear by God that we will attack Saleh and his family at night
column5: and later tell his heirs: ''We did not see his family destroyed
column6: and we speak the truth.''"'

text: They hatched up the plot; We also planned without their knowledge.
Now see the end of their machinations: We destroyed them and their entire people.
So these their habitations lie deserted now because of their iniquities. Verily there is a sign in this for those who understand.
We deliver those who believe and take heed for themselves.
'(Remember) Lot
column5: when he said to his people: "Why do you indulge in obscenities when you know (it is evil)?'

text: You lust after men in place of women. You are indeed a stolid people."
His people had no answer except saying: "Expel the family of Lot from your city. They are a people who would (rather) be pure!"
So We saved him and his family except his wife who was destined to stay behind.
And We rained down on them a shower (of stones). How ruinous was the rain that fell on those who had been warned (but warned in vain)!
'Say: "All praise be to God
column5: and peace on those of His creatures whom He has chosen." Is God better or those they associate with Him --'

text: 'Who created the heavens and the earth
column5: who sends down water from the sky for you
column6: with which He causes graceful gardens to grow? It was not in your power to make trees germinate. Is there any other god along with God. In fact they are a people who turn away (from the truth).'

text: 'Who then made the earth a habitable place
column5: and made the rivers (flow) in its valleys and dales
column6: and placed upon it firm stabilisers
column7: and kept a barrier between two bodies of water? Is there any other god along with God? In reality most of them do not know.'

text: 'Who hears the cry of the anguished (soul) when it calls to Him
column5: and relieves its suffering? And who made you trustees on the earth? Is there any other god along with God? How little it is that you reflect!'

text: Who then really shows you the way in the darkness of the desert and the sea? And who sends breezes bringing news of His benevolence? Is there any other god along with God? He is far too exalted for what they associate with Him!
'Who creates first then reverts it? And who gives you provision from the heavens and the earth? Is there any other god along with God? Tell them: "Bring your proof
column5: if you are truthful."'

text: 'Say: "No one in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unknown except God
column5: nor can they know when they will be raised again.'

text: 'Still less do they comprehend the life to come. In fact they are in doubt about it. Still more
column5: they are blind to it."'

text: 'Those who do not believe
column5: say: "When we and our fathers have turned to dust
column6: how shall we be raised again?'

text: 'Indeed we and our fathers had been promised this before. It is nothing but the earlier people''s lore."'
Say: "Travel in the land and see how (bad) was the end of sinners."
'Do not grieve over them
column5: and do not be distressed by what they contrive.'

text: Yet they say: "When will this promise come to pass? (Tell Us) if you speak the truth."
Say: "Perhaps some of what you wish to hasten is right behind you."
'Verily your Lord is gracious to men
column5: though most men are ungrateful.'

text: Verily your Lord knows what lies hidden in their breasts and what they disclose.
There is nothing of the hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not recorded in the luminous Book.
'Indeed this Qur''an explains to the children of Israel much of what they are at variance.'
It is a guidance and grace for those who believe.
Surely your Lord in His wisdom will decide between them. He is all-mighty and all-knowing.
So you place your trust in God. Certainly you stand on positive truth.
'You cannot make the dead to listen
column5: or the deaf to hear the call
column6: when they have turned their backs

text: Nor can you lead the blind when they have gone astray. You can make none hear except those who believe in Our signs and have come to peace and submission.
'When the sentence will have been passed against them
column5: We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them
column6: for men certainly do not believe Our signs.'

text: 'The day We shall gather from every community a section of those who denied Our signs
column5: and they will be brought (in separate groups)

text: So that when they come (before the Lord) He will say: "Did you deny My signs without having understood them? Or what was it that you were doing?"
'When the sentence will have been passed upon them for their wickedness
column5: they will not be able to say a word.'

text: 'Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest
column5: the day to make things clear? Indeed there are signs in this for people who believe.'

text: 'The day the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be terrified
column5: save those whom God please
column6: and all will appear before Him in abjectness.'

text: 'You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted
column5: but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything. He is indeed fully aware of what you do.'

text: 'Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done)
column5: and be safe that day from terror.'

text: But whosoever comes with evil will be flung face forward into the Fire. Can you expect reward for any thing but what you do?
'(Say): "I am commanded to worship the Lord of this land He has blessed
column5: to whom all things belong; and I am commanded to be one of those who submit

text: 'And to recite the Qur''an." Whoever comes to guidance does so for himself; as for him who stays astray
column5: tell him: "I am only a warner."'

text: 'Say: "All praise be to God. He will show you His signs
column5: and you will recognise them. Your Lord is not heedless of what you do."'

text: TA SIN MIM.
These are the verses of the illuminating Book.
'We narrate to you from the history of Moses and Pharaoh in all verity
column5: for those who believe.'

text: 'The Pharaoh had become high and mighty in the land
column5: and divided the people into different classes
column6: and impoverished one class
column7: slaying its males and sparing its women
column8: for he was indeed a tyrant.'

text: 'We wished to favour those who were weak in the land and make them leaders and heirs
'And establish them in the country; and to make the Pharaoh
column5: Haman and their hordes beware of what they feared from them.'

text: 'So We conveyed to the mother of Moses: "Suckle him. If you are afraid for him
column5: cast him in the river without any fear or regret
column6: for We shall restore him to you
column7: and make him an apostle."'

text: 'Then he was picked up by the family of Pharaoh (unaware) that he would become their enemy and a cause for regret. Surely the Pharaoh
column5: Haman and their hordes were habitual sinners.'

text: 'The Pharaoh''s wife said: "He will be a comfort to me and to you. Do not kill him. He may well be of some advantage to us
column5: or we may adopt him as a son." They were not aware (of what the future held in store).'

text: The mother of Moses was perturbed in the morning. Had We not strengthened her heart to remain a believer she had almost given him away.
'She told his sister: "Follow him." So she kept an eye on him from a distance
column5: unbeknown to them.'

text: We made (Moses) refuse a wet nurse. So his sister said: "Should I tell you of a household that could bring him up for you and take care of him?"
'Thus We restored him to his mother that she may be tranquil and not grieve
column5: and know that the promise of God is true
column6: though most men do not know.'

text: 'When he had grown up to full maturity
column5: We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus do We recompense the doers of good.'

text: 'He came to the city when the people were in a care-free mood
column5: and saw two men quarrelling
column6: one belonging to his community
column7: the other to his enemies. The man who belonged to his community appealed for help against the one who belonged to the enemies. Moses struck him a blow with his fist and finished him off. "This is of Satan''s doing
column8: he said. He is certainly an enemy and a corrupter."'

text: '"O Lord
column5: he prayed, I have done wrong
column6: forgive me." And God forgave him. Verily He is forgiving and kind.'

text: '(Moses) said: "O Lord
column5: as You have been gracious to me I will never aid the guilty."'

text: 'In the morning he came to the city
column5: fearful and hesitant. Just then he who had asked him for help the day before called out for help (again). "You are indeed a meddlesome fellow
column6:
Moses said to him.'
TQA3271,QA3271,TLQ01,'Then as he was about to lay hands on the one who was their common enemy, he cried out: O Moses
column7: do you want to kill me as you killed that person yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."'

text: 'There came a man running from the other part of the city. "O Moses
column5: he said, the chiefs are deliberating to kill you. Go away from the city. I wish you well."'

text: 'So he left the city
column5: fearful and hesitant
column6: (and) prayed: "O Lord
column7: deliver me from these wicked people."'

text: 'Then as he turned his face to Midian
column5: he said: "Maybe my Lord will show me the right way."'

text: 'And when he came to the waters of Midian he found a crowd of people watering (their flocks)
column5: and saw two maidens holding back (their cattle). He asked: "What is the trouble with you?" They said: "We cannot water our flock till the shepherds have driven away theirs
column6: and our father is a very old man."'

text: 'So he watered (their flock)
column5: and moved into the shade and prayed: "My Lord
column6: I have need of whatever good you send me."'

text: 'Then one of the (maidens) came to him walking bashfully
column5: (and) said: "My father invites you that he may repay you for having watered our flock." So
column6: when (Moses) came to him and told him his story
column7: he said: "Have no fear. You have escaped from the wicked people."'

text: 'Said one of the maidens: "O father
column5: employ him. Surely the best (man) to employ is one who is strong and honest."'

text: 'He said: "I would like to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you if you agree to work for me on hire for eight years. And if you stay on for ten
column5: it is up to you. I do not wish to impose any hardship on you. God willing you will find me a man of honour."'

text: '(Moses) said: "This is (agreed) between you and me. Whichever term I fulfil
column5: no injustice will be done to me. God is witness to our agreement."'

text: 'When Moses had fulfilled the term and was journeying with his family
column5: he noticed a fire on the side of the mountain. "Wait here
column6: he said to his family; I have seen a fire. I may haply bring some news from there
column7: or an ember that you may warm yourselves."'

text: 'When he drew near
column5: a voice called out to him from the tree on the blessed spot on the right side of the valley: "O Moses
column6: I am verily God
column7: the Lord of all the worlds.'

text: 'Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent
column5: he turned about and fled without turning. "O Moses
column6: approach
column7: (said the Voice), and have no fear. You will be safe.'

text: Put your hand inside your shirt. It will come out white without a tarnish of blame; and do not be perturbed or afraid. These are two proofs from your Lord for the Pharaoh and his nobles. They are certainly a rebellious people."
'He said: "O Lord
column5: I have killed a man of theirs
column6: and fear they would kill me.'

text: 'So send my brother Aaron with me as helper for he is more fluent than I with words
column5: that he should affirm me
column6: for I fear that they would call me a liar."'

text: '(And) God said: "We shall strengthen your arm with your brother
column5: and give you power with Our signs and give you authority
column6: so that they will not be able to harm you. Both of you and your followers will be victorious."'

text: 'But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs they said: "This is nothing but magic he has contrived
column5: for we have not heard of this from our fathers of old."'

text: 'But Moses said: "My Lord knows well who has come with guidance from Him
column5: and for whom is the guerdon of Paradise. But surely the wicked will not prosper."'

text: 'The Pharaoh said: "O nobles
column5: I am not aware of any other lord of yours but myself. So
column6: O Haman
column7: fire some clay (bricks) to build a tower for me that I may mount up (and see) the God of Moses; for I think he is a liar."'

text: 'He and his soldiers had become arrogant in the land for no reason
column5: and did not think that they have to come back to Us in the end.'

text: So We seized him and his hordes and threw them into the sea. Behold then how was the end of the wicked!
We made them the leaders of those who call to Hell; and on the Day of Judgement they will not be helped.
'A curse lies upon them in this world
column5: and on the Day of Resurrection they will be despised.'

text: 'After We had destroyed the earlier generations We gave Moses the Book as evidence for mankind
column5: and a guidance and grace
column6: so that they may remember.'

text: 'You were not there on the western side (of Mount Sinai) when We gave the commandments to Moses
column5: nor were you witness (to the event).'

text: 'We raised (many more) generations and prolonged their lives. You did not live with the people of Midian
column5: nor recited to them Our revelations; but We kept on sending messengers.'

text: 'You were not present on the side of Mount Sinai when We called. And all this (knowledge that you are given) is by the grace of your Lord so that you may warn a people to whom no admonisher had come before you
column5: that they may take heed;'

text: 'And in case disaster comes upon them for what they have done themselves
column5: they should say: "O Lord
column6: why did You not send an apostle to us that we should have followed Your commands
column7: and been with those who are believers;"'

text: 'But when the truth came to them from Us
column5: they said: "Why is he not given the like of what was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve before in what was given to Moses? They said: "Both are imposters one like the other
column6: and added: We do not believe in either."'

text: 'Say: "Then bring a Book from God which gives better guidance than these so that I may follow it
column5: if you speak the truth."'

text: 'Then
column5: if they cannot give you an answer
column6: know that they are only following their lusts. And who can be farther astray than he who follows his lust without any guidance from God? And certainly God does not guide an unjust people.'

text: We have been sending word to them that they may take a warning.
Those to whom We gave the Book before this do believe in it;
'And when it is read out to them
column5: say: "We believe in it. It''s the truth from our Lord. We had committed ourselves before it came."'

text: 'These will be given their recompense twice
column5: for they persevered and repelled evil with good
column6: and spent of what We had given them.'

text: 'When they hear idle talk they turn aside and say: "To us our actions
column5: to you yours. Peace on you; we do not look for the ignorant."'

text: You cannot guide any one you like: God guides whosoever He please. He knows best who will come to guidance.
'They say: "If we followed your guidance we would be driven from the land by force." Have We not set up a sanctuary for them
column5: to which is brought a wealth of everything as provision from Us? But most of them do not understand.'

text: How many habitations that had come to boast of their resources have We destroyed? These their dwellings were never inhabited except rarely after them; and they came back to Us.

But your Lord does not destroy habitations without having sent an apostle to their metropolis to read out Our commandments to them. We would never have destroyed cities if their inhabitants were not given to wickedness.
'Whatsoever has been given you is the stuff this life is made of
column5: and only its embellishment. What is with your Lord is better and abiding. Will you not understand?'

text: 'Can one who was given a better promise
column5: which he will find come true
column6: be like him who was given a little enjoyment of this life
column7: but who will afterwards be brought (to judgement) on the Day of Resurrection?'

text: That day God will call them and ask: "Where are they you imagined were My compeers?"
'Those against whom the sentence is justified will say: "O Lord
column5: these are those we had led astray as we had ourselves gone astray. We clear ourselves before You: They never worshipped us."'

text: '(The sinners) will be told: "Invoke your partners." They will call on them
column5: but they will not answer; and they will see the torment (and wish) if only they had come to guidance.'

text: (God) will ask them on that day: "What answer did you give the apostles?"
'Then all news will be blacked out for them
column5: and they will not even ask one another.'

text: But he who repents and believes and does good things may well be among the successful.
Your Lord creates what He wills and chooses. The good is not for them to choose. Too holy and high is God for what they associate with Him.
Your Lord well knows what they hide in their breasts and what they disclose.
'He is God. There is no god but He. His alone is praise first and last
column5: and His the judgement
column6: and to Him will you be brought back in the end.'

text: 'Say: "Just think
column5: if God were to cover you up with night for ever until the Day of Doom
column6: what other god apart from God will give you light? Why do you not pay heed?"'

text: 'Say: "Just think. If God were to make the day perpetual till the Day of Resurrection
column5: what other god but God would bring you night for rest? Why do you not reflect?'

text: 'Yet in His benevolence He made you night and day that you may rest and seek His bounty during them
column5: and haply maybe grateful."'

text: Upon a day He will call them and ask: "Where are they you imagined were My compeers?"
'And We shall single out one witness from each community and say: "Bring your proof." Then will they know that God''s is the judgement
column5: and what they contrived will avail them not in the least.'

text: 'Verily Qarun was of Moses'' people
column5: but he began to oppress them. We had given him treasures
column6: so many that a team of wrestlers could hardly lift their keys. His people said to him: "Do not be exultant. God does not like those who exult.'

text: 'So seek the abode of the Hereafter through what God has given you
column5: and do not forget your part in this world. Do good to others as God has done good to you
column6: and do not try to spread corruption in the land. Surely God does not like corrupters."'

text: 'He said: "This has come to me through my own acumen." Did he not know that God had destroyed many generations before him who possessed far more acumen than he
column5: and more wealth? The sinners will not be asked about their sins.'

text: 'Then he came before his people in all pomp; and those enamoured of this world
column5: said: "Ah would that we had what Qarun has been given! He indeed possesses great good fortune."'

text: 'But those who knew better
