column5: said: "Alack-a-day! God''s guerdon is better for those who believe and do the right. Only those who persevere will receive it."'

text: 'So We opened up the earth and sunk him and his mansion. There was not a body that could help him against (the will) of God
column5: nor was he able to save himself.'

text: 'Those who were envious of his position only yesterday said on the morrow: "Indeed God increases the fortunes of those of His creatures as He will
column5: and decreases. Had God not been gracious to us He could have (opened up) the earth and made it swallow us. Surely the infidels will not succeed."'

text: We shall give the mansion of the Hereafter to those who do not want to be haughty in the land and spread corruption. The future belongs to those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path.
Whoever does good will receive better than what he has done; and whoever does ill shall be requited but to the extent of what he does.
'He who has assigned (the propagation) of the Qur''an to you will bring you back to the destination. Say: "My Lord knows who has come to guidance
column5: and who is clearly in error."'

text: 'You did not expect that the Book would be given to you except by the favour of your Lord. So do not be the helper of unbelievers
'Nor should you let them turn you away from the commandments of God once they have been delivered to you; and call them to your Lord
column5: and do not be an idolater

text: 'And do not call on any other god apart from God. There is no god but He. All things will perish save His magnificence. His is the judgement
column5: and to Him will you be brought back in the end.'

text: ALIF LAM MIM.
'Do men think they will get away by saying: "We believe
column5:
and will not be tried?'
TQA3343,QA3343,TLQ01,'We had tried those who were before them so that God knew who spoke the truth, and who were liars.'
TQA3344,QA3344,TLQ01,Do those who do evil think that they will get the better of Us? How bad is the judgement that they make!
TQA3345,QA3345,TLQ01,'He who hopes to meet God (should know) that God''s appointed time will surely come. He is all-hearing and all-knowing.'
TQA3346,QA3346,TLQ01,He who strives does so for himself. Verily God is independent of the creatures of the world.
TQA3347,QA3347,TLQ01,'We shall pardon the sinful deeds of those who believe and do the right, and give them a reward better than their deeds.'
TQA3348,QA3348,TLQ01,'We have enjoined on man to be good to his parents; but if they try to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, then do not obey them. You have to come back to Us, when I will tell you what you used to do.'
TQA3349,QA3349,TLQ01,We shall admit those who believe and do the right among the righteous.
TQA3350,QA3350,TLQ01,'There are among men those who say: We believe in God;" yet if they happen to suffer in the cause of God they take oppression by men as punishment from God. And if help comes to them from your Lord
column6: they say: "We were with you." Does not God know what is hidden in the hearts of men?'

text: God will surely know the believers and know the hypocrites.
Those who deny say to those who affirm: "Follow our way; we shall carry the burden of your sins." But they cannot carry the burden of their sins in the least. They are liars indeed.
They will carry their own loads and other loads besides their own; and will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they contrived.
'We sent Noah to his people
column5: and he lived with them a thousand years minus fifty. Then they were caught by the deluge for they were evil.'

text: 'But We saved him and those with him in the ark
column5: and made it a sign for the creatures of the world.'

text: And (remember) Abraham who said to his people: "Worship God and be obedient to Him. This is better for you if you understand.
'You worship idols in place of God and invent lies. Surely those you worship other than God have no power over your means of livelihood. So seek your sustenance from God
column5: and worship Him and give Him thanks. To Him will you be brought back in the end.'

text: 'But if you deny
column5: then many a people have denied before you. The duty of the apostle is to convey the message clearly."'

text: 'Do they not see how God originates creation
column5: then reverts it back? This is indeed how inevitably the law of God works;'

text: 'Say: "Travel on the earth and see how He originated creation. Then (you will know) how God will raise the last raising (of the dead). Surely God has power over everything
'Punish whom He will
column5: and have mercy on whom He please. And to Him will you be brought back in the end.'

text: Escape Him you cannot either in the earth or in the sky; and you have no friend or helper apart from God.
'Those who deny the signs of God and the meeting with Him
column5: cannot have hope of My mercy. There is a painful punishment for them.'

text: The people (of Abraham) had no answer except: "Kill him or burn him;" but God saved him from the fire. There are lessons in this for those who believe.
'He said: "You have taken to idols through mutual affection in this life
column5: in place of God
column6: but on the Day of Resurrection you will disown and curse each other
column7: and your abode will be Hell
column8: and you will have none to help you."'

text: Then Lot believed in him; and (Abraham) said: "I will separate myself and take refuge in my Lord. Surely He is all-mighty and all-wise."
'So We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob and gave his progeny prophethood and scripture
column5: and rewarded him in this world
column6: and in the next he will be among the upright.'

text: And (remember) Lot when he said to his people: "You indulge in lecherous acts which none of the creatures had done before you.
'You commit unnatural acts with men and cut off the way (of procreation)
column5: and commit obscenities in your gatherings." The only answer his people made was: "Bring the punishment of God
column6: if you are truthful."'

text: '"O Lord
column5: help me against the wicked people
column6:
(Lot) prayed.'
TQA3371,QA3371,TLQ01,'When Our messengers came to Abraham with good news, they said: We have to destroy this city as its inhabitants have become sinful."'

text: 'He said: "Surely Lot is there." They answered: "We know who is there. We are to save him and his family except his wife
column5: for she is one of those who will stay behind."'

text: 'So
column5: when Our messengers came to Lot
column6: he was worried on their account as he was unable to protect them. They said: "Have no fear or regret. We will certainly save you and your family except your wife
column7: for she is one of those who will stay behind.'

text: We have to bring a scourge from the heavens on the people of this city as they are depraved."
Verily We have left a clear sign of this for people of sense to see.
'To Midian We sent their brother Shu''aib. He said: "O people
column5: worship God and be ready for the Day of Resurrection. Do no evil
column6: and create no mischief in the land."'

text: 'But they denied him and were seized by an earthquake
column5: and lay overturned in their homes in the morning.'

text: 'And (remember) ''Ad and Thamud. It will be clear to you from their habitations (how they were destroyed)
column5: for Satan had made their deeds look attractive to them
column6: and turned them away from the path; and yet they were a people of acumen.'

text: '(Remember) Qarun
column5: Pharaoh and Haman to whom Moses came with clear signs; but they were haughty (and oppressed) the land. Yet they could not run away from Us;'

text: 'And We seized all of them for their crimes. Against some We sent a violent wind hurling stones
column5: and some We seized with a mighty blast
column6: and some We submerged under the earth
column7: and some We drowned. It was not for God to wrong them
column8: they wronged themselves.'

text: 'The semblance of those who take protectors besides God is that of the spider. She arranges a house for herself
column5: but the flimsiest of houses is the spider''s. If only they had sense!'

text: 'Verily God knows what they invoke in His place
column5: for He is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'These are precepts of wisdom We offer to men
column5: but only those who are rational understand.'

text: God has created the heavens and the earth with reason. Surely in this is a sign for those who believe.
'Recite what has been revealed to you of this Book
column5: and be constant in devotion. Surely prayer keeps you away from the obscene and detestable
column6: but the remembrance of God is greater far; and God knows what you do.'

text: 'Do not argue with the people of the Book unless in a fair way
column5: apart from those who act wrongly
column6: and say to them: "We believe what has been sent down to us
column7: and we believe what has been sent down to you. Our God and your God is one
column8: and to Him we submit."'

text: That is how We have revealed this Book to you and those to whom We have sent down the Book will believe in it. Only those who are infidels will deny it.
'You did not read any Scripture before this
column5: nor wrote one with your right hand
column6: or else these dissemblers would have found a cause to doubt it.'

text: 'In fact
column5: in the minds of those who have intelligence these are clear signs. No one denies Our revelations except those who are unjust.'

text: 'For they say: "How Is it no signs were sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "The signs are with God. I am only a warner
column5: plain and simple."'

text: Is it not sufficient for them that We have revealed the Book to you which is read out to them? It is indeed a grace and reminder for people who believe.
Say: "God is sufficient as witness between me and you." He knows what is in the heavens and the earth. It is those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in God who will perish.
'They want you to hasten the punishment: But for a time already determined the punishment would have come upon them. It will come upon them all too suddenly
column5: and they will be caught unawares.'

text: They want you to hasten the punishment: Hell will indeed surround the unbelievers.
'The day the punishment comes upon them from above and underneath their feet
column5: (God will) say: "And now taste of what you had done."'

text: 'O My creatures who believe
column5: surely My earth has plenty of scope and so worship only Me.'

text: Every soul has to know the taste of death. You will then be sent back to Us.
'We shall admit those who believe and do the right to empyreal gardens with rivers rippling by
column5: where they will abide for ever. How excellent the guerdon of those who toil

text: Who persevere and place their trust in their Lord.
How many living things there are on the earth that do not Store their food; God provides them as well as you. He is all-hearing and all-knowing.
'If you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth
column5: and who set the sun and the moon to work?" They will answer: "God." Why then do they vacillate?'

text: 'God increases the means of those of His creatures as He please
column5: or limits them for whomsoever He will. He is certainly cognisant of everything.'

text: If you ask them: "Who sends down rain from the sky and quickens the earth when it is dead?" They will answer: "God." Say: "All praise be to God." But most of them do not understand.
'The life of this world is only a sport and play. It is surely the home of the Hereafter that will indeed be life extended and new
column5: if only they knew!'

text: 'When they board a ship they call on God
column5: placing their faith wholly in Him. But when He brings them safely back to shore
column6: they begin to associate others with Him

text: 'And deny what We had given them
column5: in order to go on enjoying themselves. They will come to know soon.'

text: 'Do they not see that We have given them a safe sanctuary
column5: while all around them men are being despoiled? Do they then believe what is false
column6: and deny the bounty of God?'

text: 'Who is more unjust than he who fabricates a lie about God
column5: or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not an abode for unbelievers in Hell?'

text: We shall guide those who strive in Our cause to the paths leading straight to Us. Surely God is with those who do good.
ALIF LAM MIM.
The Romans have been conquered
In the neighbouring land. But having been conquered they will conquer
'In a few years (less than ten). God''s is the imperative first and last. On that day the believers will rejoice'
'In the help of God. He helps whom He will; He is all-mighty
column5: ever-merciful.'

text: It is a promise of God; and God does not go back on His promise. Yet most men do not understand:
'They only know the palpable life of this world
column5: and are oblivious of the Hereafter.'

text: Do they not think for themselves that God did not create the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them without reason and a determined purpose? But many men reject the meeting with their Lord.
'Have they not travelled on the earth and seen how the others before them had met their end? They were far more powerful than them
column5: furrowed the earth and colonised it far more than they; and their apostles came to them with visible signs. It was surely not for God to wrong them
column6: they wronged themselves.'

text: 'Therefore evil was the end of those who did evil
column5: for they denied the signs of God and made fun of them.'

text: 'God originates creation
column5: and then will revert it
column6: then you will go back to Him.'

text: The day the Resurrection comes the sinners will be overwhelmed with despair.
'No intercessor will they have among those they associated (with God)
column5: and will reject their partners.'

text: The day the Hour comes they will be separated into categories.
'Those who believed and did the right will be feasted in a rich
column5: well-watered meadow.'

text: 'Those who did not believe and rejected Our signs and the meeting in the Hereafter
column5: will be given over to punishment.'

text: 'So extol God when the evening comes and the day dawns
'For His is the praise in the heavens and the earth
column5: -- and at nightfall and the time of noon.'

text: 'He brings the living from the dead
column5: the dead from the living
column6: and quickens the earth after it had died. So will you be brought forth (from the dead).'

text: 'Among His signs is that He created you from the earth
column5: and you are now human beings dispersed everywhere.'

text: 'Another of His signs is that He created mates of your own kind of yourselves so that you may get peace of mind from them
column5: and has put love and compassion between you. Verily there are signs in this for those who reflect.'

text: 'Among other signs of His is the creation of the heavens and the earth
column5: and the variety of your tongues and complexions. Surely there are signs in this for those who understand.'

text: 'Another of His signs is the night
column5: a time for you to sleep
column6: and the day to seek His bounty. Verily there are signs in this for those who pay heed.'

text: 'Another of His signs is the lightning He shows to fill you both with dread and hope
column5: and the water He sends down from the sky which reawakens the earth that was dead. There are indeed signs in this for those who have sense.'

text: Another of His signs is that the heavens and the earth stay in position by His command; and then when He will call you once you will come out of the earth.
'All those who are in the heavens and the earth are His
column5: and they are all obedient to Him.'

text: It is He who first creates and then reverts it. This is how His law works inevitably. His semblance is of the most sublime in the heavens and the earth. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'He gives you an example from your own life: Do you possess among your dependants any partners in what We have bestowed on you
column5: so that you and they have equal (share) in it
column6: and that you fear them as you fear each other? That is how We explain Our signs clearly for those who comprehend.'

text: And yet the wicked follow their own lusts without understanding. Who can show the way to those whom God allows to go astray? None will they have to help them.
'So keep yourself exclusively on the true way
column5: the creational law of God according to which He created man with the quality of choosing right or wrong. There is no altering of God''s creation. This is the supreme law. But most men do not understand.'

text: 'Turn towards Him and be dutiful to Him; be firm in devotion
column5: and do not become an idolater

text: '(Or) one of those who created rifts in their order and are divided into sects
column5: with each group exulting in what it has (carved out for itself) --'

text: When misfortune befalls men they pray to their Lord and turn to Him; but afterwards when He has given them a taste of His benevolence a section of them begins to ascribe compeers to their Lord
So as to deny what We have given them. Please yourselves for a time; you will come to know soon.
Have We sent down a charter to them which mentions what they associate with Him?
'When We give men a taste of Our benevolence they start rejoicing in it. When misfortune befalls them as a result of what they have done themselves
column5: they begin to despair.'

text: Do they not see God increases or decreases the means of whosoever He please? Verily there are signs in this for those who believe.
'So
column5: give their share to the relatives
column6: the needy
column7: and the wayfarers. This is best for those who seek the way that leads to God
column8: and they will be successful.'

text: 'What you give on interest to increase (your capital) through others'' wealth
column5: does not find increase with God; yet what you give (in alms and charity) with a pure heart
column6: seeking the way of God
column7: will be doubled.'

text: 'It is God who created you
column5: then gave you sustenance
column6: then He will make you die
column7: and bring you back to life. Is there one among those you associate with Him who can do the least of these things? Too high and exalted is He for what they associate with Him!'

text: Corruption has spread over land and sea from what men have done themselves that they may taste a little of what they have done: They may haply come back (to the right path).
Say: "Travel on the earth and see how came the end of those before you." Most of them were idolaters.
So set your face towards the straight path before the day arrives from God which is irreversible. Men will be segregated on that day.
'So that he who disbelieves will bear the consequence of his unbelief; and he who does the right will straighten out the way for himself
'So that God may reward those who believed and did what was good
column5: by His grace. Surely He does not love unbelievers.'

text: 'Among His signs are the breezes He sends as harbingers of happy news
column5: so that He may allow you to taste of His mercy
column6: and that ships may sail by His command
column7: and you may seek of His bounty
column8: and may haply be grateful.'

text: 'Verily We sent many apostles before you to their people
column5: who brought clear signs with them. Then We retributed those who were sinful. It is a duty incumbent on Us to help the believers.'

text: 'It is God who sends the breezes that raise clouds
column5: then spreads them over the sky as He please
column6: fold on fold
column7: then you see the drops of rain issue from between them. When He sends it down to those of His creatures as He will
column8: they are filled with joy

text: Although before it came down they were despondent.
So consider the signs of His benevolence: How He quickens the earth after it had become waste. He is verily the one who will raise the dead. He has power over everything.
'If We send a (blighting) wind and they see (the earth) seared autumnal
column5: they would surely become ungrateful.'

text: 'You cannot make the dead to listen nor the deaf hear the call when they have turned back and retreated
Nor can you make the blind see the way when they have gone astray. You can make none hear except those who believe Our signs and have come to submission.
'It is God who created you of weakness
column5: then after weakness gave you strength
column6: then after strength will give you weakness and grey hair. Surely He makes whatever He wills. He is all-knowing and all-powerful.'

text: The day Resurrection is set the sinners will swear: "We did not tarry more than an hour (and cannot be guilty)." That is how they have always been deceived.
'But those who were given the knowledge and belief will say: "You have tarried
column5: according to the Book of God
column6: as long as the Day of Resurrection
column7: and this is the Day of Resurrection
column8: but ''you do not know."'

text: 'Their excuses will be of no avail to the sinners on that day
column5: and they will not be allowed to beg for favour.'

text: 'We have offered every kind of example here in this Qur''an to men. Even then if you bring a verse to them
column5: those who disbelieve say: "You are nothing but a liar."'

text: That is how God seals the hearts of those who do not know.
So have patience. The promise of God is surely true; and let not those who do not believe make you relax (your endeavours).
ALIF LAM MIM.
'These are the verses of the sagacious Book
'And a guidance and grace for those who do good
'Who are constant in devotion
column5: pay the zakat
column6: and are certain of the Hereafter.'

text: 'They are on guidance from their Lord
column5: and will prosper.'

text: 'But among men are also those who spread frivolous stories to mislead (others) from the way of God
column5: without any knowledge
column6: and take it lightly. For such as these the nemesis will be shameful.'

text: 'When Our verses are recited before them they turn away haughtily as though they did not hear them
column5: as if a deafness had come into their ears. So give them tidings of a shameful punishment.'

text: Surely for those who believe and do the right are pleasure gardens.
They will abide in them for ever. The promise of God is true; and He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'He created the skies without a support
column5: as you can see
column6: and placed stabilisers in the earth that you may dwell at ease as it revolves; and dispersed on it all varieties of creatures
column7: and He sent down water from the skies and grew all kinds of splendid things upon it.'

text: 'Such is God''s creation. Show me now what those (they worship) beside Him have created. Surely the evil-doers are in clear error.'
'We bestowed wisdom on Luqman that he may be grateful to God. Whosoever is grateful is so for his own good
column5: and whoever is ungrateful (should remember) that God is above all concern
column6: worthy of praise.'

text: '(Remember) when Luqman counselled his son: "O son
column5: do not associate any one with God. To associate others with God is a grievous wrong."'

text: 'We have committed man about his parents. His mother carries him in her womb in weakness and debility
column5: weaning him in two years. So he should be grateful to Me and his parents. To Me is the journeying back.'

text: 'If they try to force you to associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge
column5: do not obey them. Live with them honourably in the world
column6: but follow the way of him who turns to Me. Your returning is to Me in the end
column7: when I will tell you what you did.'

text: '"O my son
column5: whatsoever it may be
column6: even though equal to a mustard seed in weight
column7: or within a rock or in the sky or in the earth
column8: God will bring it forth. Verily God is perceptive
column9: all-aware.'

text: 'O my son
column5: fulfil your moral obligations
column6: bid what is known to be right and forbid what is wrong
column7: and bear with patience what befalls you. These are indeed acts of courage and resolve.'

text: 'Do not hold men in contempt
column5: and do not walk with hauteur on the earth. Verily God does not like the proud and boastful.'

text: 'Be moderate in your bearing
column5: and keep your voice low. Surely the most repulsive voice is the donkey''s."'

text: 'Have you not seen that God has subjugated what is in the heavens and the earth to you
column5: and bestowed His favours
column6: external and esoteric
column7: in abundance on you? And yet there are men who contend about God without any knowledge or guidance or the Book enlightening.'

text: 'When you ask them to follow what God has revealed
column5: they say: "No. We shall follow what we found our ancestors following
column6:
even though the devil were calling them to the torment of Hell!'
TQA3491,QA3491,TLQ01,'He who turns his face to God in submission and does good, holds fast to a handle that is strong; for the resultance of things rests with God.'
TQA3492,QA3492,TLQ01,'So do not let the unbelief of disbelievers grieve you. They will be brought back to Us, when We shall tell them what they used to do. Whatever is in their hearts is known to God.'
TQA3493,QA3493,TLQ01,'We let them enjoy themselves only for a while, then We shall drag them to a severe punishment.'
TQA3494,QA3494,TLQ01,If you ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth?" They will surely answer: "God." Say: "All praise be to God." But most of them do not understand.

text: 'To God belongs what is in the heavens and the earth. Verily He is all-sufficient
column5: worthy of praise.'

text: 'If all the trees of the earth were pens and the oceans ink
column5: with many more oceans for replenishing them
column6: the colloquy of God would never come to end. He is indeed all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: Your creation and resurrection is but like that of a single cell. Verily He is all-hearing and all-seeing.
'Do you not see that God makes the night succeed the day
column5: the day succeed the night? And He has harnessed the sun and the moon so that each runs its appointed course. Surely God is aware of all you do.'

text: 'That is so for God is the Reality
column5: and what they invoke other than Him is illusion. Indeed God is all-high and supreme.'

text: 'Do you not see that the ships sail in the ocean by the grace of God
column5: that He may show you some of His glories. Verily there are signs in this for those who are constant and give thanks.'

text: 'When the waves overshadow them like a canopy
column5: they pray to God with all-exclusive faith in Him. But after He has safely brought them to the shore
column6: there are some who vacillate between doubt and belief
column7: but no one rejects Our signs except those who are perverse and disbelieve.'

text: 'O people
column5: fear your Lord and dread the day when no father will avail a son
column6: nor son his father. Truly the promise of God is true. Do not be deluded by the life of this world
column7: and do not let the deceiver draw you away from God.'

text: 'Only God has the knowledge of the Hour. He sends rain from the heavens
column5: and knows what is in the mothers'' wombs. No one knows what he will do on the morrow; no one knows in what land he will die. Surely God knows and is cognisant.'

text: ALIF LAM MIM.
The revelation of this Book free of doubt and involution is from the Lord of all the worlds.
'Or do they say he has fabricated it? In fact
column5: it is the truth from your Lord so that you may warn the people to whom no admonisher was sent before you. They may haply come to guidance.'

text: 'It is God who created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them
column5: in six spans
column6: then assumed all authority. You have no protector other than Him
column7: nor any intercessor. Will you not be warned even then?'

text: 'He regulates all affairs from high to low
column5: then they rise to perfection step by step in a (heavenly) day whose measure is a thousand years of your reckoning.'

text: 'Such is (He) the knower of the unknown and the known
column5: the mighty and the merciful

text: 'Who made all things He created excellent; and first fashioned man from clay
'Then made his offspring from the extract of base fluid
'Then proportioned and breathed into him of His spirit
column5: and gave you the senses of hearing
column6: sight and feeling. And yet how little are the thanks you offer!'

text: 'But they say: "When we have mingled with the earth
column5: shall we be created anew?" In fact they deny the meeting with their Lord.'

text: 'Say: "The angel of death appointed over you will take away your soul
column5: then you will be sent back to your Lord."'

text: 'If only you could see when the sinners will stand before their Lord
column5: heads hung low
column6: (and say:) "O Lord
column7: we have seen and heard. So send us back. We shall do the right
column8: for we have come to believe with certainty."'

text: Had We intended We could have given every soul its guidance; but inevitable is My word that I will fill up Hell with men and jinns together.
'So now suffer. As you forgot the meeting of this your Day of Doom
column5: so have We forgotten you. Now taste the everlasting punishment for your deeds.'

text: 'Only they believe in Our revelations who
column5: when they are reminded
column6: bow in adoration
column7: and give praise to their Lord
column8: and do not become arrogant.'

text: 'Their backs do not rest on their beds
column5: and they pray to their Lord in fear and hope
column6: and spend of what We have given them (in charity).'

text: No soul knows what peace and joy lie hidden from them as reward for what they have done.
'Is one who is a believer like one who is a transgressor? No
column5: they are not alike.'

text: 'As for those who believe and do the right
column5: there are gardens for abode as welcome for what they had done.'

text: 'As for those who disobey
column5: their abode is Hell. Whensoever they wish to escape from it they would be dragged back into it
column6: and told: "Taste the torment of the Fire which you used to call a lie."'

text: 'But We shall make them taste the affliction of this world before the greater torment
column5: so that they may retract.'

text: 'Who is more wicked than he who is reminded of his Lord''s revelations yet turns away from them; We will surely requite the sinners.'
Verily We gave Moses the Book; so be not in doubt about his having received it; and We made it a guidance for the children of Israel.
When they persevered and firmly believed Our revelations We appointed learned men among them who guided them by Our command.
'Surely your Lord will decide between them about what they were at variance
column5: on the Day of Resurrection.'

text: 'Did they not find guidance in the many generations We had destroyed before them
column5: over whose dwellings they (now) walk? There were indeed signs in this. Will they even then not listen?'

text: 'Do they not see that We drive the rain towards a land that is dry
column5: then grow grain from it which their cattle and they themselves eat? Will they not see even then?'

text: 'Yet they say: "When will this decree come
column5: if you speak the truth?"'

text: 'Say: "Of no use will be the acceptance of belief to unbelievers on the Day of Decision
column5: nor will they be granted respite.'

text: Therefore turn away from them and wait as they are waiting.
O PROPHET FEAR God and do not follow the unbelievers and the hypocrites.
Follow what is revealed to you by your Lord. Verily God is all-knowing and all-wise.
Trust in God. God is sufficient as guardian.
'God has not provided two hearts in the breast of a man
column5: nor made your wives
column6: whom you pronounce "mothers" (in order to divorce them)
column7: your real mothers
column8: nor has He made your adopted sons your real sons. This is only what your lips pronounce. God says what is just
column9: and shows the right way.'

text: 'Call them by the names of their fathers. This is the right course in the sight of God. If you do not know their fathers
column5: they are then your brothers in religion and your friends. It will not be a sin if you make a mistake
column6: unless you do so intentionally; for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'The Prophet is closer to the faithful than they are themselves; and his wives are as their mothers. Yet blood relations are closer to one another according to God''s decree
column5: more than (other) believers and the emigrants (who left their homes in the cause of God)
column6: but you should be kind to your friends. This is inscribed in the Book (of decrees).'

text: 'When We made the covenant with the prophets
column5: and with you
column6: as with Noah and Abraham
column7: Moses and Jesus son of Mary
column8: a binding covenant

text: '(It was) so that God may ask the truthful of their sincerity. As for the infidels
column5: He has prepared a painful punishment for them.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: remember the favours of God to you when an army came against you and We sent a wind against them and forces that you did not see. But God sees all that you do.'

text: 'When they came upon you from above and below you
column5: when the eyes were stupefied with horror
column6: and hearts jumped to the throats
column7: and you made wild suppositions about God.'

text: 'The faithful were sorely tried there and were shaken completely
'When the hypocrites and those who were filled with doubt
column5: said: "The promise of God and His Apostle was nothing but deceit."'

text: 'When a section of them said: "O people of Yathrib
column5: there is no place for you here
column6: turn back;" and a section of them asked leave of the Prophet
column7: saying: "Our homes lie exposed
column8:
-- while they were not exposed. Their only intention was to run away.'
TQA3547,QA3547,TLQ01,'If the (enemy) had entered the city from every side and asked them to rise in revolt, they would have done so, and not hesitated but a little;'
TQA3548,QA3548,TLQ01,Whereas earlier they had made a promise to God that they would never turn their backs; and a promise made to God is answerable.
TQA3549,QA3549,TLQ01,'Say: Of no gain will be your running away if you run from death or being killed
column9: even then you will enjoy the good things of life but only for a while."'

text: Say: "Who will save you from God if He decide to afflict you or show you His mercy?" They will never find a friend or helper apart from God.
'Surely God knows who among you obstruct
column5: and those who say to their brethren: "Come to us
column6:
and go to battle but seldom,'
TQA3552,QA3552,TLQ01,'Being chary of helping you. But when danger appears you will find them looking at you with eyes turning like a man''s in the swoon of death. Yet when the danger is past they lash you with sharp tongues, covetous of the best (of booty). Such as these have not come to belief. So God nullifies whatever they have done. This is how (the innate law of) God works inevitably.'
TQA3553,QA3553,TLQ01,They think the allied tribes have not withdrawn; and if the allied tribes had advanced they would have wished that they were rather with the Arabs of the desert asking news of you; and had they been among you they would have fought but just a little.
TQA3554,QA3554,TLQ01,'You have indeed a noble paradigm in the Apostle of God for him who fears God and the Day of Resurrection, and remembers God frequently.'
TQA3555,QA3555,TLQ01,'When the faithful saw (the armies of) the allied tribes, they said: This is what God and His Apostle had promised us; and God and His Apostle say the truth;" and this enhanced their faith and obedience.'

text: 'There are men among the faithful who have been true to the covenant they had made with God; and some of them fulfilled their vows (by dying in His cause)
column5: and some still wait (prepared for death)
column6: and stand firm

text: 'That God may recompense the truthful for their truthfulness
column5: and punish the hypocrites or relent towards them
column6: as He will. God is surely forgiving and kind.'

text: 'God drove the unbelievers back in their fury
column5: and they gained no advantage. God was sufficient (to help) the believers in the battle. God is all-powerful and all-mighty.'

text: 'He made those of the people of the Book who had helped (the tribes) descend from their forts
column5: and filled their hearts with dread
column6: so that you killed some and made many captive;'

text: 'And He made you inherit their lands and mansions and wealth
column5: and a country you had not traversed before
column6: for God has power over everything.'

text: 'O Prophet
column5: say to your wives: "In case you desire the life and pomp of this world
column6: come
column7: I will provide you handsomely
column8: and let you go with a grace.'

text: 'But if you desire God
column5: His Apostle
column6: and the joys of life to come
column7: then God has verily set apart for those of you who are good
column8: a great reward."'

text: 'O wives of the Prophet
column5: whosoever of you commits an act of clear shamelessness
column6: her punishment will be doubled. This is how (the innate law of) God works inevitably.'

text: 'But whoever of you is obedient to God and His Apostle
column5: and does the right
column6: will be given a two-fold reward by Us; and We have a rich provision in readiness for her.'

text: 'O wives of the Prophet
column5: you are not like other women. If you are mindful of God
column6: do not be too obliging in your speech
column7: lest some one sick of heart should covet your person; so say only customary things.'

text: 'Stay at home
column5: and do not deck yourselves with ostentation as in the days of paganism; fulfil your devotional obligations
column6: pay the zakat
column7: and obey God and His Apostle. God desires to remove impurities from you
column8: O inmates of this house
column9: and to cleanse and bring out the best in you.'

text: 'Remember God''s revelations and the wisdom that are recited in your homes. God is indeed all perceiving
column5: well-informed.'

text: 'Verily men and women who have come to submission
column5: men and women who are believers
column6: men and women who are devout
column7: truthful men and truthful women
column8: men and women with endurance
column9: men and women who are modest
column10: men and women who give alms
column11: men and women who observe fasting
column12: men and women who guard their private parts
column13: and those men and women who remember God a great deal
column14: for them God has forgiveness and a great reward.'

text: No believing men and women have any choice in a matter after God and His Apostle have decided it. Whoever disobeys God and His Apostle has clearly lost the way and gone astray.
'When you said to him who had been favoured by God and was favoured by you: "Keep your wife to yourself and fear God
column5:
you were hiding something God was about to bring to light, for you had fear of men, though you should fear God more. And when Zaid was through with her, We gave her to you in marriage, so that it may not remain a sin for the faithful (to marry) the wives of their adopted sons when they are through with them. God''s command is to be fulfilled.'
TQA3571,QA3571,TLQ01,'There is no constraint on the Prophet in what God has decreed for him. This has been the way of God with (apostles) who have gone before you, and God''s command is a determined act.'
TQA3572,QA3572,TLQ01,'(For) those who convey the messages of God, and fear Him and no one else, God is sufficient to keep account.'
TQA3573,QA3573,TLQ01,'Muhammad is not the father of any man among you, but a messenger of God, and the seal of the prophets. God has knowledge of everything.'
TQA3574,QA3574,TLQ01,'O you who believe, remember God a great deal,'
TQA3575,QA3575,TLQ01,And sing His praises morning and evening.
TQA3576,QA3576,TLQ01,'It is He who sends His blessings on you, as (do) His angels, that He may lead you out of darkness into light, for He is benevolent to the believers.'
TQA3577,QA3577,TLQ01,Their greeting on the day they meet Him will be: Peace;" and He has a generous reward ready for them.

text: 'O Prophet
column5: We have sent you as a witness and a bearer of happy tidings and an admonisher

text: 'And to call (men) to God by His leave
column5: and as a lamp resplendent.'

text: Give glad tidings to the believers that there is great bounty for them from God.
'Do not listen to the unbelievers and the hypocrites. Ignore what they do to hurt you
column5: and put your trust in God. God is sufficient as protector.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: when you marry believing women then divorce them before having (sexual) contact with them
column6: you have no right to demand observance of the ''waiting period'' of them. But provide suitably for them
column7: and let them go with honour.'

text: 'We have made lawful for you
column5: O Prophet
column6: wives to whom you have given their dower
column7: and God-given maids and captives you have married
column8: and the daughters of your father''s brothers and daughters of your father''s sisters
column9: and daughters of your mother''s brothers and sisters
column10: who migrated with you; and a believing woman who offers herself to the Prophet if the Prophet desires to marry her. This is a privilege only for you and not the other believers. We know what We have ordained for them about their wives and maids they possess
column11: so that you may be free of blame
column12: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'You may defer the turn of any of your wives you like
column5: and may take any other you desire. There is no harm if you take any of those (whose turn) you had deferred. This would be better as it would gladden their hearts and they will not grieve
column6: and each will be happy with what you have given her. God knows what is in your heart
column7: for He is all-wise and benign.'

text: 'No other women are lawful for you after this except those you have married
column5: nor to change your present wives for other women even though their beauty should appeal to you. God is watchful of everything.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not enter the houses of the Prophet for a meal without awaiting the proper time
column6: unless asked
column7: and enter when you are invited
column8: and depart when you have eaten
column9: and do not stay on talking. This puts the Prophet to inconvenience
column10: and he feels embarrassed before you; but God is not embarrassed in (saying) the truth. And when you ask his wife for some thing of utility
column11: ask for it from behind the screen. This is for the purity of your hearts and theirs. It does not behove you to annoy the prophet of God
column12: or to ever marry his wives after him. This would indeed be serious in the sight of God.'

text: 'Whether you discuss a thing or conceal it
column5: surely God has knowledge of everything.'

text: 'There is no harm if they come before their fathers or their sons
column5: or their brothers and their brothers'' and sisters'' sons
column6: or their women folk or captive maids they possess. Follow the commands of God. Verily God is witness to everything.'

text: 'God and His angels shower their blessings on the Prophet. O believers
column5: you should also send your blessings on him
column6: and salute him with a worthy greeting.'

text: Those who offend God and His Prophet will be damned in this world and the next. There is a shameful punishment ready for them.
'Those who slander believing men and women for what they have not done
column5: will bear the burden of calumny and clear iniquity.'

text: 'O Prophet
column5: tell your wives and daughters
column6: and the women of the faithful
column7: to draw their wraps a little over them. They will thus be recognised and no harm will come to them. God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'If the hypocrites and perverts
column5: and the rumour-mongers of Madinah
column6: do not desist even now
column7: We shall rouse you against them
column8: so they would not be able to live but a short time in the city with you.'

text: 'Accursed
column5: they would be seized wherever found
column6: and slain mercilessly.'

text: Such was the law of God among those before you; and you will not find any change in the law of God.
People ask you about the Hour (of the great change). Say: "Only God has knowledge of it. Who knows? The Hour may be close at hand."
'Verily God has cursed the infidels
column5: and prepared a blazing fire for them.'

text: 'They will live in it for ever
column5: and will find no saviour or helper.'

text: 'The day their faces would be turned on the fire (as on a spit)
column5: they will say: "Alas! If only we had obeyed God
column6: and obeyed the Prophet."'

text: 'They will say: "O our Lord
column5: we obeyed our leaders and the elders
column6: but they only led us astray.'

text: 'O Lord
column5: give them a double punishment
column6: and put a grievous curse upon them."'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not be like those who maligned Moses
column6: whilst God cleared him of what they alleged; and he was held in high esteem with God.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: obey the commands of God
column6: and say straightforward things'

text: That He may straighten your affairs for you and forgive your sins; and he who obeys God and His Prophet will be successful.
'We had offered the Trust (of divine responsibilities) to the heavens
column5: the earth
column6: the mountains
column7: but they refrained from bearing the burden and were frightened of it; but man took it on himself. He is a faithless ignoramus.'

text: 'So that God punishes men and women hypocrites
column5: the idolaters and idolatrous women
column6: but He turns to faithful men and women in forgiveness
column7: for God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'ALL PRAISE BE to God to whom belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth
column5: and His the praise in the world to come. He is all-wise and all-knowing.'

text: 'He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatsoever issues from it
column5: whatsoever comes down from the sky
column6: and whatsoever goes up to it. He is all-merciful
column7: all-forgiving.'

text: 'The unbelievers say: "There is no coming of the Hour for us." Say: "Why not? By my Lord
column5: the knower of the unknown
column6: it will certainly come for you. Not even an atom''s weight in the heavens and the earth
column7: or something smaller or greater than it
column8: is hidden from Him
column9: and which is not recorded in the all-too-manifest Book

text: In order that He may recompense those who have believed and done the right. For them will be forgiveness and worthy sustenance.
'As for those who try to subvert Our signs
column5: there is a punishment of painful torment.'

text: 'Those who have been given knowledge realise what has been revealed by the Lord is the truth
column5: and leads to the path of the mighty and praiseworthy (God).'

text: 'The disbelievers say: "Shall we tell you of a man who prophesies that when you are reduced to particles and vanished in the dust
column5: you will become a new creation'

text: 'Has he fabricated a lie about God
column5: or is he possessed?" Not so; but those who believe not in the Hereafter are themselves afflicted and far astray.'

text: 'Do they not see what is before them and what is behind them of the heavens and the earth? We could cleave the earth and sink them
column5: if We pleased
column6: or drop a fragment of the sky upon them. There is surely a sign in this for every penitent creature.'

text: 'We favoured David with excellence
column5: (and commanded): "O Jibal and Tair
column6: glorify the greatness of God with him." And We made iron pliable for him.'

text: '"Make long coats of mail
column5: (We said), and fix their links
column6: and do the right. I surely see whatsoever you do."'

text: 'We (subjugated) the wind to Solomon. Its morning''s journey took one month
column5: and the evening''s one month. We made a spring of molten brass to flow for him; and many jinns laboured for him by the will of his Lord. Anyone of them who turned from Our command was made to taste the torment of blazing fire.'

text: 'They made for him whatever he wished
column5: synagogues and statues
column6: dishes large as water-troughs
column7: and cauldrons firmly fixed (on ovens; and We said): "O House of David
column8: act
column9: and give thanks." But few among My creatures are thankful.'

text: 'When We ordained (Solomon''s) death
column5: none but the weevil
column6: that was eating away his staff (on which he rested)
column7: pointed out to them that he was dead. When he fell down (dead) the jinns realised that if they had knowledge of the Unknown they would never have suffered demeaning labour.'

text: 'There was a sign for the people of Saba in their habitations: Two gardens
column5: on the right and left. (And they were told:) "Eat of what your Lord has given you and be thankful. Fair is your land
column6: and forgiving your Lord."'

text: 'But they turned away. So We let loose on them the inundation of (the dyke of) al-''Arim
column5: replacing their gardens with two other gardens which bore only bitter gourd
column6: and tamarisks and a few sparse lote-trees.'

text: That is how We requited them for their ingratitude. We only punish those who are ungrateful.
'Between them and the cities We had blessed We placed towns along the highway
column5: and made them stages on their journey
column6: (saying): "Travel between them in safety by day or by night."'

text: 'But they said: "O Lord
column5: make the distance between the stages of our journeys longer;" but (by doing so) they wronged themselves. So We turned them into bygone tales
column6: and dispersed them
column7: scattered in all directions. Surely there are signs in this for those who endeavour and are grateful.'

text: Thus Iblis found his supposition about them to be true; and except for a section of believers they follow him.
'He had no authority over them save for the purpose of Our knowing who believed in the world to come
column5: and who doubted it. For your Lord keeps a watch over everything.'

text: 'Say: "Call on those you imagine are gods apart from God. They are not masters even of an atom''s weight in the heavens and the earth
column5: nor do they have a share in them
column6: nor is any one of them a helper (of God).'

text: 'No intercession avails with Him except his He allows
column5: so that when their hearts are freed of fear
column6: they ask (one another): "What did your Lord say?" They will answer: "What is expedient. He is the all-mighty and supreme."'

text: 'Say: "Who gives you food from the heavens and the earth?" Say: "God. Surely either you or we are on guidance
column5: or are lost in clear error."'

text: 'Say: "You will not be questioned about the sins that we have committed
column5: nor shall we be questioned about your deeds."'

text: 'Say: "Our Lord will gather us together and judge between us equitably
column5: for He is the Judge all-knowing."'

text: 'Say: "Just show me those you associate with Him as compeers." No
column5: (you cannot)
column6: for He is God
column7: the all-mighty and all-wise."'

text: We have sent you only as a bearer of good tidings and admonisher for all mankind; yet most people do not understand.
'Instead they say: "When is this promise going to be
column5: if you speak the truth?"'

text: 'Say: "Determined is the day of the promise
column5: which you can neither put back nor advance an hour.'''''

text: 'The unbelievers say: "We do not believe in this Qur''an
column5: nor in what was (sent) before it." If only you could see the sinners when they are made to stand before their Lord
column6: blaming one another! Those who were weak will say to those who were arrogant: "But for you we would have certainly been believers."'

text: The arrogant will say to the weak: "Did we hold you back from guidance after it had come to you? Certainly not. In fact you were yourselves guilty."

But the weak will say to the arrogant: "Not in the least. It was your plotting night and day when you ordered us to disbelieve in God and associate compeers with Him." When they see the punishment they will express repentance. But We shall put iron collars round the necks of infidels. Will they be requited for anything but what they did?
We never sent an admonisher to a habitation but its well-to-do people said: "We do not believe in what you have brought."
'And (further): "We have far more wealth and children (than you)
column5: and we are not the ones to be punished."'

text: Say: "Verily my Lord increases or restricts the provision of whosoever He will;" but most men do not understand.
'It is not your wealth and children that will bring you closer to Us
column5: except those who believe and do the right. These will be given a two-fold reward for their deeds
column6: and will dwell in peace in the high empyrean.'

text: But those who try to subvert Our signs will be given over to punishment
'Say: "Verily my Lord increases or restricts the provision of any of His creatures as He will
column5: and repays whatsoever you spend. He is the best of all providers."'

text: 'The day He will gather all of them together
column5: He will ask the angels: "Did they worship you?"'

text: '"God forbid!" (they will answer). "You are our protector not they. In fact
column5: they worshipped the devils. Most of them believed in them."'

text: That day you will have no power to profit or harm each other; and We shall say to the sinners: "Taste the punishment of Fire which you had denied."
'When Our clear revelations are read out to them
column5: they say: "This is only a man who wants to turn you away from what your fathers used to worship." And they say: "This is nothing but a fabricated lie." And those who do not believe say of the truth when it has reached them: "This is nothing but pure sorcery."'

text: 'We did not give them any scripture to study
column5: nor sent any warner before you.'

text: 'Those before them had also denied
column5: and they could not reach a tenth of (the possibilities) We had given them
column6: and still they called My apostles liars. How great was the change that I wrought in their condition then!'

text: 'Say: "I urge upon you only one thing: Stand up for God two by two or one by one
column5: and think and reflect!" There is no madness about your companion. He is a warner against the dreadful affliction (that awaits).'

text: Say: "The reward I ask is for yourself. My reward is due from none but God; and He is witness over everything."
Say: "My Lord casts the truth: He is the knower of things unknown."
'Say: "The truth has come
column5: and falsehood had neither precedence nor will reappear."'

text: Say: "If I am in error it is to my own loss; if I am on guidance that is so because of what my Lord reveals to me. He is all-hearing and all-too-near."
'If you could see when they are gripped by terror without any escape
column5: and are seized from close at hand'

text: They will say: "We believe in it." How could they reach it from a place of no return?
They had surely denied it before and aimed without seeing from so far away.
'A barrier shall be raised between them and what they desired
column5: as was done with their partisans before. They too were filled with disquieting doubt.'

text: 'ALL PRAISE BE to God
column5: the originator of the heavens and the earth
column6: who appointed angels as His messengers
column7: with wings
column8: two
column9: three and four. He adds what He pleases to His creation. He has certainly power over everything.'

text: There is none who can take away the favours He bestows on man; and there is none apart from Him to restore what He has withheld. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'O you people
column5: remember the favours of God to you. Is there any creator other than God who gives you food from the heavens and the earth? There is no god but He: How then can you turn aside?'

text: 'If they call you a liar
column5: so have other messengers been denied before you. But all things will be brought back to God.'

text: 'O you people
column5: the promise of God is true. So do not let the life of this world delude you
column6: nor let that (arch) deceiver deceive you about God.'

text: 'Satan is certainly your enemy
column5: so hold him as a foe. He only calls his faction to be the residents of Hell.'

text: 'For those who are unbelievers
column5: there is severe punishment; but for those who believe and do the right is forgiveness and a great reward.'

text: 'Can he
column5: the evil of whose deed is made to look attractive to him so that he considers it good
column6: (be like him who is guided)? God leads whosoever He please astray and guides whosoever He will. So do not waste away your self with grief for them. God is indeed cognisant of things they do.'

text: 'It is God who sends the winds that raise the clouds. Then We drive the clouds towards the land that was dead
column5: and restore the earth to life after it had died. So will be the Resurrection.'

text: 'Whosoever desires honour (should remember) that all honour is with God. All good words ascend to Him
column5: and all good deeds He exalts. As for those who are plotting evil
column6: there is severe punishment for them
column7: and their plots will be fruitless.'

text: 'It is God who created you from dust
column5: then from a sperm
column6: then formed you into pairs. Neither does a female conceive nor gives birth without His knowledge; nor do the old grow older or become younger in years but in accordance with the law (of nature). Indeed the law of God works inevitably.'

text: 'Alike are not two bodies of water: This one is sweet and fresh and pleasant to drink
column5: and this one brine and bitter; yet you get fresh meat to eat from both
column6: and take out ornaments to wear. You see how the ships churn through them so that you may seek of His bounty and
column7: perhaps
column8: give thanks.'

text: 'He makes night run into day
column5: the day run into night
column6: and has harnessed the sun and the moon so that each runs to its determined course. This is God your Lord; His is the kingdom; and those you invoke apart from Him are not masters even of the film on a date-palm stone.'

text: 'You pray to them
column5: but they do not hear your call; and even if they heard you
column6: they could not answer your prayer; and on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your having worshipped them. None can acquaint you (with the reality) as He who is informed of everything.'

text: 'O men
column5: it is you who stand in need of God. As for God
column6: He is above all need
column7: worthy of praise.'

text: He could take you away if He pleased and bring a new creation (in your place).
This is well within the power of God.
'No one who carries a burden bears another''s load; and even if the burdened soul cry out for help none will carry the least of its burden
column5: however close a relative it may be. You can only warn those who fear their Lord in secret and fulfil their devotional obligations. Whoever grows in goodness does so for himself. To God is the journeying back.'

text: 'Equal are not the blind and those who can see
'Nor darkness and light
Nor shade and heat of sunshine.
Equal are not the living and the dead. Verily God makes those He will to listen; but you cannot make those hear who are in their graves.
You are only a bearer of warnings.
'We have sent you with the truth
column5: to give glad tidings and to warn. Never has there been a community to which an admonisher was not sent.'

text: 'If they call you a liar
column5: so had those before them called their apostles liars
column6: who had come to them with clear proofs
column7: scriptures and the splendent Book.'

text: So We seized the unbelievers. How great was the change I wrought in their condition then!
'Do you not see how God sends water from the sky
column5: then We produce fruits from it variegated in colour; and on mountains are tracts of red and white
column6: in different shades and raven black.'

text: 'And so are among men
column5: beasts and cattle
column6: different shades. Only those of His creatures fear God who have knowledge. Verily He is all-mighty and forgiving.'

text: 'Surely those who read the Book of God
