text: 'Announcing happy news and warnings. And yet most of them are averse and do not listen
'And say: "Our hearts are immured against what you call us to. There is a deafness in our ears
column5: and a veil lies between us and you. So act (your way)
column6: we are acting (ours)."'

text: 'Say: "I am a man like you
column5: (but) it is revealed to me that your God is one God
column6: so take the straight path to Him
column7: and ask Him to forgive your sins. Woe to the idolaters'

text: 'Who do not give a due share of their wealth for the welfare of others
column5: and do not believe in the Hereafter.'

text: 'But those who believe and do the right
column5: will have a continuing reward.'

text: 'Say: "Do you refuse to believe in Him who created the earth in two spans of time
column5: and set up compeers to Him
column6: the Lord of all the worlds?'

text: 'He placed firm stabilisers rising above its surface
column5: blessed it with plenty and growth
column6: and ingrained the means of growing its food within it
column7: sufficient for all seekers
column8: in four spans.'

text: 'Then He turned to the heavens
column5: and it was smoke. So He said to it and the earth: "Come with willing obedience or perforce." They said: "We come willingly."'

text: 'Then He created several skies in two spans
column5: and ingrained in each sky its function
column6: decking the nearest heaven with lamps
column7: and guarded it. This has been determined by the mighty and all-knowing.'

text: 'If even then they turn away
column5: tell them: "I forewarn you of a terrible punishment like the thunderbolt that fell upon the ''Ad and Thamud."'

text: Their apostles came to them one after the other (saying): "Do not worship any one but God." They said: "If our Lord had pleased He would have sent the angels down. We reject what is sent with you."
'So those who were ''Ad turned insolent unjustly in the land
column5: and said: "Who is stronger than us?" Did they not see that God who created them was greater far in power than they? Yet they refused to believe Our signs.'

text: 'So We let loose on them a violent wind for several days of distress to make them taste a most disgraceful punishment here in this world
column5: and far more shameful will be the punishment in the Hereafter
column6: and there will be no succour for them.'

text: 'As for the (tribe of) Thamud
column5: We tried to guide them
column6: but they preferred blindness to guidance; then they were seized by the torment of a humiliating punishment as requital for their misdeeds;'

text: But We saved those who believed and took heed for themselves.
'The day the enemies of God will be gathered at the Fire and the records of their deeds will be distributed
So that when they reach it their ears and eyes and persons will testify to what they did.
'And they will say to their bodies: "Why did you testify against us?" They will answer: "God
column5: who gave all things power of articulation
column6: made us speak. It is He who created you the first time
column7: and to Him you will return.'

text: You did not hide your (doings) so that your ears or eyes or persons should not testify against you. In fact you thought that God did not know the things you used to do.
'It is this notion you had of your Lord that caused your ruin
column5: and you are lost."'

text: 'Even if they are patient
column5: their abode is Hell; and if they beg for favour
column6: none will favour them.'

text: We had assigned to them close companions who made their past and present look attractive to them; and the fate that had once befallen the communities of jinns and men before them was justified upon them. They were indeed bound to perish.
'The disbelievers say: "Do not listen to this Qur''an
column5: and shout away (its reading); you may haply prevail."'

text: 'We shall make the disbelievers taste the severest punishment
column5: and retribute them for the worst that they had done.'

text: 'This is the requital for God''s enemies: Hell
column5: where they will have their lasting home
column6: as punishment for denying Our revelations.'

text: 'Those who disbelieve will say: "O Lord
column5: show us those among the jinns and men who had led us astray that we may trample them underfoot and make them wholly abject."'

text: 'Surely the angels will come down to those who say
column5: ''Our Lord is God'' and then remain steadfast
column6: saying: "You should have neither fear nor regret
column7: but rejoice in the happy news of Paradise that has been promised you.'

text: 'We are your friends in this life and in the Hereafter where you will get whatever your hearts desire
column5: and have whatsoever you ask for

text: 'As a gift from the forgiving
column5: ever-merciful (God)."'

text: 'Whose word is better than his who calls to God and does the right
column5: and says: "I am of the obedient?"'

text: Good and evil are not alike. Repel evil with what is good. Then you will find your erstwhile enemy like a close. affectionate friend.
'Only they attain it who forbear
column5: and only a man of great good fortune can achieve it.'

text: 'If the Devil incite you to evil
column5: seek refuge in God. He is all-hearing and all-knowing.'

text: 'The night and day and the sun and moon are (only) some of His signs. So do not bow before the sun and the moon
column5: but bow in homage to God who created them
column6: if you truly worship Him.'

text: But if they become haughty (then remember) that those who are close to your Lord sing His praises night and day and do not grow weary of (doing so).

It is among His signs that the earth you see all barren and desolate begins to stir and sprout when We send down rain upon it. Surely He who gives it life will also give life to the dead. Indeed He has power over everything.
'Surely those who slander Our signs are not hidden from Us. Then
column5: is he better who will be cast into Hell
column6: or he who will come out safe on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will
column7: He sees whatsoever you do.'

text: Those who reject the Reminder when it has come to them (should know) that it is a Book inviolate.
'Falsehood cannot enter it from any side: It''s a revelation from the all-wise and praiseworthy (God).'
'Nothing is said to you which had not been said to other apostles before you. Surely your Lord is the lord of forgiveness
column5: but also the lord of severe retribution.'

text: 'If We had made it a discourse in an obscure tongue
column5: they would have said: "Why were its revelations not expounded distinctly? A foreign tongue and an Arab (audience)?" Say: "For those who believe it is a guidance and a healing; but for those who do not believe it is a deafness in the ears
column6: and a blindness. They are those one calls to from far away.'

text: Verily We gave Moses the Book; but they began to differ about it. If the Word of your Lord had not preceded it the matter would have been settled between them. They are still in doubt about it and uneasy.
'Whoever does good does so for himself
column5: and whoever does wrong bears the guilt thereof. Your Lord does no wrong to His creatures.'

text: 'He alone has knowledge of the Hour (of change): No fruit comes Out of its spathe
column5: no female conceives or gives birth
column6: but He has knowledge of it. The day He will call them (and ask): "Where are the compeers (you ascribed to Me)?" They will answer: "We profess to You not one of us can vouch for them."'

text: 'And those they used to worship will leave them in the lurch
column5: and they will realise there is no escape for them.'

text: Man never tires of praying for good; but if evil assails him he begins to despair.
'If We give him a taste of Our favour after some distress he has known
column5: he says: "It was my due. I cannot imagine the Hour will come. And even if I go back to my Lord
column6: there will surely still be the best for me with Him." We shall tell those who do not believe what they used to do
column7: and inflict on them a heavy punishment.'

text: When We show Our favours to man he moves away and turns aside; but when in trouble he prays a great deal.
'Say: "Just think. If this is from God and you deny it
column5: who will be in greater error than he who is in open dissent?"'

text: 'We will show Our signs to them in the horizons of the external world and within themselves
column5: until it becomes clear to them that it''s the truth. Is your Lord not sufficient? He is a witness over all things.'

text: In truth they are in doubt that they will ever face their Lord. Do they not know that He surrounds all things?
HA MIM.
'''Am Sin Qaf.'
'So has God
column5: all-mighty and all-wise
column6: been revealing to you and to others before you.'

text: 'Whatever is in the heavens and the earth
column5: belongs to Him. He is all-high and supreme.'

text: 'The skies are near to bursting asunder above them (for awe of Him)
column5: and the angels sing the praises of their Lord
column6: imploring forgiveness for the dwellers of the earth. Is it not that God is forgiving and merciful?'

text: 'Those who have taken protectors other than Him
column5: are watched over by God. It is not for you to be their guardian.'

text: 'We have
column5: therefore
column6: revealed to you the eloquent Qur''an that you may warn the people of the Metropolis
column7: and those who live around it
column8: of the Day of Gathering
column9: of which there is no doubt
column10: (when mankind would be assembled) some in Heaven
column11: some in Hell.'

text: If God had pleased He would have made them one community of belief; but He admits whom He please to His grace; yet the sinners have neither friend nor helper.
'Have they taken others beside Him as protectors? It is God who protects; it is He who gives life to the dead
column5: for He has power over everything.'

text: 'In whatever matter you disagree the ultimate judgement rests with God. This is God
column5: my Lord; in Him have I placed my trust
column6: if to Him I turn.'

text: 'Originator of the heavens and the earth
column5: He has made your consorts from among you
column6: and made pairs of cattle. He multiplies you in this way. There is no other like Him. He is all-hearing and all-seeing.'

text: He holds the keys of the heavens and the earth. He increases or decreases the provision of any one He will. He has knowledge of everything.
'He has laid down for you the (same) way of life and belief which He had commended to Noah
column5: and which We have enjoined on you
column6: and which We had bequeathed to Abraham
column7: Moses and Jesus
column8: so that they should maintain the order and not be divided among themselves. Heavy is to idolaters what you invite them to. God chooses whom He please for Himself
column9: and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him.'

text: 'Yet they did not differ about it until knowledge came to them
column5: through rivalries among themselves. If the Word of your Lord
column6: (staying) it for a time ordained
column7: had not preceded it
column8: the matter would have been settled among them. But those who came to inherit the Book after them are also in doubt and disturbed about it.'

text: 'Yet to that (law) you should call them
column5: and be constant as commanded. Do not follow their passing whims
column6: but say: "I believe in whatever Scripture God has revealed
column7: and I am commanded to act with equivalence among you. God is our Lord and your Lord. To us our actions
column8: to you your deeds. There is no dispute between you and us. God will gather us all together
column9: and to Him is our returning."'

text: 'As for those who argue in the matter of God after He has been fully acknowledged
column5: their disputing has no force with their Lord. Upon them is (God''s) anger
column6: and the punishment for them will be severe.'

text: 'It is God who has sent down the Book with the truth
column5: and the Balance. How do you know the Hour is not near?'

text: 'Only they who do not believe in it wish to hasten it; but those who believe are in fear of it
column5: for they know it to be true. Surely those who are in doubt about the Hour are wandering far astray.'

text: 'God is gracious to His creatures
column5: and bestows favours on whosoever He will. He is all-powerful and all-mighty.'

text: 'Whoever desires the fruits of the Hereafter
column5: We shall add to his fruit. As for him who desires the fruits of this world
column6: We shall give to him of these
column7: but he will have no share in the Hereafter.'

text: Have they other associates who have prescribed another law for them which has not been dispensed by God? But for the decisive Word (of God) a sentence would have been passed amongst them. Surely there is a grievous punishment for the ungodly.
'You will see the evil-doers full of fear of what they deserve
column5: yet it will come to pass. But those who believe and do the right will be in gardens of Paradise. They will receive what they wish from their Lord; and this will be the greatest favour.'

text: This is the good news that God gives to His creatures who believe and do good. Say: "I ask no recompense of you for it other than obligations of relationship." We shall give more excellence to him who acquires excellence. Surely God forgives and accepts (gratitude).
'Do they say he has fabricated a lie about God? He could have sealed your hearts if He pleased; but God blots out the false and vindicates the truth by His dispensations
column5: for He knows the secrets of the hearts.'

text: 'It is He who accepts repentance from His creatures and forgives their trespasses
column5: for He knows what you do.'

text: 'He answers (the prayers) of those who believe and do good
column5: and gives them more of His bounty. But for the unbelievers there is severe punishment.'

text: If God were to give in abundance to His creatures they would fill the earth with oppression. So He gives according to measure as He will. He knows (what is good for) His creatures. He is all-aware and all-seeing.
'It is He who sends down rain when they had despaired of it
column5: and showers His benevolence. He is the protector worthy of praise.'

text: 'The creation of the heavens and the earth and all the living things dispersed in them
column5: are a sign of His. He has the power to gather them together when He will.'

text: Whatever misfortune befalls you is a consequence of your deeds; yet He forgives much.
'You cannot thwart Him on the earth
column5: and have no friend or helper apart from Him.'

text: Ships sailing in the ocean like ensigns are a sign of His.
'He could stop the wind if He pleased
column5: then they would be stranded on its surface. Surely there are signs in this for every one who perseveres and is grateful.'

text: Or He could wreck them for what they have done; yet there is much that He pardons.
Let those who dispute Our signs know that there is no way of escape for them.
'Whatsoever you have been given is only this life''s merchandise; but what is with God is better and more lasting for those who believe and place their trust in their Lord
'Who avoid the deadly sins
column5: immoral acts
column6: and forgive when they are angered

text: 'Who obey the commands of their Lord and fulfil their devotional obligations
column5: whose affairs are settled by mutual consultation
column6: who spend of what We have given them

text: And those who defend themselves when they are wronged.
The retribution of evil is the equal of evil (done); yet those who forgive and rehabilitate will be rewarded by God. Verily He does not like those who do wrong.
'If one avenges himself after he has been wronged
column5: there is no way of blaming him.'

text: 'Blame lies on those who oppress
column5: and terrorise the land unjustly. For them there is painful punishment.'

text: 'But he who bears with patience and forgives
column5: surely complies with divine resolve.'

text: 'He whom God leads astray has no one except God to protect him. You should see the sinners when they face the punishment. They will say: "Isn''t there a way of going back?"'
'You should see them brought before the Fire
column5: abject in disgrace
column6: looking stealthily. And those who believe will say: "They who forfeit their souls and families on the Day of Resurrection will really be losers." Is it not that sinners will suffer a lasting torment?'

text: They will have no protector to help them other than God. He whom God allows to go astray has no way.
Hearken to your Lord before the Day arrives from God that will not be averted. You will have no place of refuge then nor time for denying.

'If they turn away (you are not responsible); We have not appointed you a warden over them. Your duty is to deliver the message. When We let man taste of Our favours he begins to exult; but if misfortune befalls him
column5: as a consequence of his own deeds
column6: man is surely then ungrateful.'

text: 'To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatsoever He wills
column5: bestows daughters on whosoever He will
column6: and gives sons to whom He choose.'

text: 'On some He bestows both sons and daughters
column5: and some He leaves issueless. He is all-knowing and all-powerful.'

text: 'It is not given to man that God should speak to him except by suggestion or indirectly
column5: or send a messenger to convey by His command whatsoever He please. He is all-high and all-wise.'

text: 'So have We revealed to you the Qur''an by Our command. You did not know what the Scripture was before
column5: nor (the laws of) faith. And We made it a light by which We show the way to those of Our creatures as We please; and you certainly guide them to the right path

text: The path of God to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And will not all things go back to God?
HA MIM.
'I call to witness the lucent Book
'That We made it a distinctly lucid Qur''an that you may understand.'
'It is inscribed in the original Book (of Books) with Us
column5: sublime
column6: dispenser of (all) laws.'

text: Should We have withdrawn the Reminder from you as you are a people who exceed the bounds?
'Many a prophet had We sent to the earlier communities
But never did a prophet come at whom they did not scoff.
So We destroyed far more powerful (nations) than they. The example of earlier people is there.
'If you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will answer: "The Mighty and All-knowing created them
column5:
'
TQA4335,QA4335,TLQ01,'He who made the earth a bed for you, and laid out tracks upon it so that you may find the way;'
TQA4336,QA4336,TLQ01,'Who sent down water in due measure from the sky, then quickened a region that was dead -- So shall We bring you forth --'
TQA4337,QA4337,TLQ01,'He who created pairs of everything, and fashioned for you boats and beasts on which you ride,'
TQA4338,QA4338,TLQ01,'So that when you sit astride of them and think of the bounties of your Lord, you may say: All glory to Him who subjugated these for us. We were incapable of doing so.'

text: Surely we have to go back to our Lord."
Yet they make some of His creatures His offspring! Man is surely most ungrateful.
'Or has He taken from those He has created daughters for Himself
column5: and assigned sons to you?'

text: 'Yet when news of (a daughter) they had reserved for Ar-Rahman comes to one of them
column5: his face is blackened (with shame)
column6: and he grieves in silence inwardly.'

text: Can one who has been raised on ornaments and cannot present her case coolly in a dispute (be associated with God?)
'Yet they have made the angels
column5: who are creatures of Ar-Rahman
column6: females. Did they witness their creation? We shall record their testimony
column7: and they will be interrogated.'

text: Yet they say: "If Ar-Rahman had so pleased we would not have worshipped them." They have no knowledge of it in the least. They only make up lies.
Did We give them a Scripture before this to which they are holding fast?
'In fact they say: "We found our fathers following a certain way
column5: and are guided by their footprints."'

text: 'Thus
column5: We never sent an admonisher to a settlement before you but the decadent among them said. "We found our fathers following this way
column6: and we are walking in their footsteps."'

text: '"Even if I bring you a better guidance
column5: he rejoined, than the one you found your fathers on?" Still they said: "We do not believe in what you have brought."'

text: Then We punished them. So look at the fate of those who denied.
When Abraham said to his father and his people: "I am rid of what you worship
Other than Him who created me. He will show me the right way."
This is the legacy he left to his descendants so that they may turn (to God).
'In fact
column5: I allowed them and their fathers to enjoy this life till the truth
column6: and the apostle preaching it lucidly
column7: came to them.'

text: 'Yet when the truth had come to them
column5: they said: "This is sorcery. We shall never believe in it."'

text: 'They also said: "Why was this Qur''an not sent down to some great man of the two cities?"'
'Are they the ones who dispense the favour of your Lord? It is He who apportions the means of livelihood among them in this world
column5: and raises some in position over the others to make some others submissive. The favours of your Lord are better than what they amass.'

text: 'Had it not been that all people would become one community (of unbelievers)
column5: We might have given those who disbelieve in Ar-Rahman roofs of silver for their dwellings and (silver) stairs for mounting

text: 'And doors (of silver) for their houses
column5: (silver) couches for reclining

text: And ornaments of gold. But all this would have been nothing but the vanity of this world. The Hereafter with your Lord is for those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path.
'We shall attach to him who goes blind to the remembrance of Ar-Rahman a devil as companion
'Surely the (devils) obstruct them from the path
column5: though they think they are rightly guided

text: 'Until when he comes before Us he will say (to the devil): "Would to God there was a distance of the East and West between you and me
column5: for you were an evil companion!"'

text: 'But nothing will avail you on that day
column5: for you were unjust
column6: and you will be partners in the punishment.'

text: 'Can you make the deaf to hear
column5: or show the blind
column6: and those lost in clear error
column7: the way?'

text: 'We shall punish them whether We take you away
Or show you some of what We have promised them. They are certainly well within Our power.
So hold fast to what has been revealed to you. You are truly on the right path.
It is a (source) of greatness for you and your people. You will surely be questioned about it.
Inquire of apostles We had sent before you if We appointed gods to be worshipped other than Ar-Rahman.
We sent Moses with Our signs to the Pharaoh and his nobles. He said: "I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds."
'But when he brought to them Our signs they laughed at them
(Even though) each miracle that We showed them was greater than the other. So We seized them with chastisement so that they may turn back.
'But they said: "O sorcerer
column5: call on your Lord for us in accordance with the compact He has made with you. We shall certainly come to guidance."'

text: Yet no sooner did We take away the affliction from them than they broke their pledge.
'And the Pharaoh said to his people: "O people
column5: is not mine the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers that flow at my feet? Can you still not comprehend?'

text: 'Am I (not) better than him who is contemptible
column5: and cannot even express himself clearly?'

text: 'Why were then no bracelets of gold shed upon him from above
column5: or angels sent down as a retinue with him?"'

text: 'Thus he made light (of the matter) to his people
column5: and they obeyed him. They were certainly wicked.'

text: 'But when they roused Our anger We inflicted retributive punishment and drowned them all
And made them a precedent and example for posterity.
'When the example of Mary''s son is quoted before them
column5: your people cry out at it

text: And say: "Are our deities better or he?" They say this only for disputing. Surely they are a contentious people.
(Jesus) was only a creature whom We favoured and made an example for the children of Israel.
If We pleased We could have put angels in place of you as trustees on the earth.
'He is certainly the sign of the Hour (of change). So have no doubt about it
column5: and listen to me. This is the straight path.'

text: Let not Satan misdirect you. He is your open enemy.
'When Jesus came with the signs
column5: he said: "I have come to you with authority
column6: and to explain some thing about which you are at variance. So fear God
column7: and follow me.'

text: Verily God is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him. This is the straight path."
But the factions differed among themselves. Woe alas to the sinners for the torment of the grievous Day!
'Are they waiting (for any thing) but the Hour (of Doom) which would descend upon them suddenly
column5: and catch them unawares?'

text: 'Friends will turn into enemies on that day
column5: except those who fear and follow the straight path.'

text: 'O My creatures
column5: there will be no fear or regret'

text: For (those of) you on that day who believed in My revelations and submitted.
'(You will) enter the garden
column5: you and your spouses
column6: and be glad."'

text: 'Golden platters and goblets will be passed around
column5: and everything the heart desires and pleases the eye will be there
column6: where you will abide for ever.'

text: This is the Paradise you will inherit (as meed) for your deeds.
You will have fruits in abundance there to eat.
The sinners will certainly dwell for ever in the torment of Hell.
It will not decrease for them; dumb with despair they will stay in it.
'We did not wrong them
column5: they wronged themselves.'

text: 'They will call (to the keeper of Hell-gate): "O Malik
column5: let your Lord decide our fate." He will answer: "You are to stay."'

text: 'We have brought to you the truth
column5: but most of you despise the truth.'

text: Have they settled upon a plan? We shall also settle on one.
'Or do they think We do not hear their secrecies and stealthy consultations? In fact
column5: Our messengers who attend them record everything.'

text: Say: "If Ar-Rahman had a son I would have been the first of worshippers."
'All too glorious is He
column5: Lord of the heavens and the earth
column6: the Lord of all power
column7: for what they ascribe to Him'

text: Leave them to their vain discoursing and horse-play till they come to meet their promised day (of reckoning).
'He is God in heaven and God on earth
column5: and He is all-wise and all-knowing.'

text: 'Blessed be He
column5: who holds the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. He alone has knowledge of the Hour
column6: and to Him will you return.'

text: 'Those they invoke apart from Him have no power of intercession
column5: except those who testify to the truth and have knowledge.'

text: 'If you ask them who created them
column5: they will answer: "God." How then can they turn away?'

text: 'And (the Prophet) will say: "O Lord
column5: these are certainly a people who do not believe."'

text: Turn away from them and say: "Peace." They will come to know soon.
HA MIM.
The perspicuous Book is witness
(That) We sent it down one night of blessing -- so that We could warn --
On which all affairs are sorted out and decided
'As commands from Us. It is indeed We who send (messengers)
'A mercy from your Lord. Verily He is all-hearing and all-knowing
'The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them
column5: if you really do believe.'

text: 'There is no god other than He
column5: who gives you life and death
column6: your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of old.'

text: Yet they are lost in doubt and play.
'So watch for the day when the sky begins to emit clear smoke
Which would envelope mankind. That would be a grievous affliction.
'"O Lord
column5: take away this torment from us
column6: (they will pray); we have come to believe."'

text: 'How can a warning benefit them? The Apostle who explained all things clearly had come to them
'But they turned away from him
column5: and said: "He is well-instructed
column6: (but) possessed."'

text: 'If We remove the torment a little
column5: you revert back (to misdeeds).'

text: 'The day that We shall seize them with a grievous hold
column5: We will indeed castigate them.'

text: We had tried the people of Pharaoh before them. A respected prophet had come to them (saying):

Deliver the creatures of God to me. I am the trusted messenger sent to you.
TQA4433,QA4433,TLQ01,Do not think yourselves to be above God: I have come to you with clear authority.
TQA4434,QA4434,TLQ01,I have taken refuge in my Lord and your Lord against your stoning me to death.
TQA4435,QA4435,TLQ01,'If you do not believe in me, leave me alone.'
Then he called to his Lord: "These are a sinful people."
'"Journey by night with My devotees
column5: (it was said); you will certainly be pursued.'

text: '(Cross and) leave the sea undisturbed. The (pursuing) hosts will surely be drowned
column5:
'
TQA4439,QA4439,TLQ01,'How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind,'
TQA4440,QA4440,TLQ01,'And fields and stately mansions,'
TQA4441,QA4441,TLQ01,And the comfort they enjoyed.
TQA4442,QA4442,TLQ01,Thus it was; and We passed them on to another people.
TQA4443,QA4443,TLQ01,'Neither did the heavens weep for them, nor the earth, nor were they granted respite.'
TQA4444,QA4444,TLQ01,So We saved the children of Israel from degrading suffering

text: 'O YOU WHO believe

text: 'O you who believe

text: 'O you who believe

text: 'O men
column5: We created you from a male and female
