text: 'Just consider (the semen) that you emit
'Do you create it
column5: or We are its creator?'

text: 'We have incorporated death in your constitution
column5: and We shall not be hindered'

text: From replacing you with others or raising you in a way you do not know.
'You have known the first creation
column5: then why do you not reflect?'

text: Just ponder over what you sow:
'Do you give it its increase
column5: or are We the giver?'

text: 'We could turn it
column5: if We pleased
column6: into straw; then you would rue the day

text: (And say:) "We have fallen into debt;
'Indeed
column5: we have been deprived of the fruits of our labour."'

text: Consider the water that you drink.
'Do you send it down from the clouds
column5: or We send it down?'

text: 'We could make it brackish
column5: if We pleased; so why do you not acknowledge thanks?'

text: Consider the fire that you strike (and get by friction).
'Have you raised its tree
column5: or We have raised it?'

text: We have made it as a reminder and convenience for the needy.
'So glorify your Lord
column5: the most supreme.'

text: So I call the placement of the stars to witness --
And this surely is great evidence if you can understand --
'That this is indeed the glorious Qur''an'
(Inscribed) in the well-kept Book.
Only they can reach it who are clean (of mind).
It has been revealed by the Lord of all the worlds.
Then why do you dissimulate this Revelation?
You live by calling it a lie.
'Then how is it that when the (dying) breath is withdrawn into the throat (and rattles)
'And you wait for the moment (of death)
'We are closer to him than you
column5: even though you cannot see?'

text: 'Then why
column5: if you are not indebted (to Us for life)

text: Can you not bring him back? (Answer) if you are truthful
'Then
column5: if he is one of the honoured

text: 'There will be peace and plenty
column5: and gardens of tranquility for him.'

text: 'If he is of those of the right hand
There will be the salutation by those of the right hand: "Peace on you.
'But if he is of the deniers and the errants
The welcome will be boiling water
And the roasting in Hell.
This is indeed the ultimate truth.
'Then praise your Lord
column5: the most supreme.'

text: WHATSOEVER IS IN the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth
column5: He is the giver of life and death
column6: and He has power over everything.'

text: 'He is the first and He the last
column5: the transcendent and the immanent; and He has knowledge of everything.'

text: 'It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six stages
column5: then assumed the throne. He knows whatsoever enters the earth
column6: and whatsoever comes out of it
column7: and what comes down from the sky and what goes up to it; and He is with you wheresoever you may be
column8: and He perceives whatsoever you do.'

text: 'His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth
column5: and all things will go back to Him.'

text: 'He turns night into day
column5: and turns day into night; and He knows whatsoever is in your hearts.'

text: 'Believe in God and His Apostle
column5: and spend of what He has given you as His trustee. And those of you who believe and spend in charity will have a great reward.'

text: 'What has come upon you that you believe not in God
column5: though the Prophet is calling you to believe in your Lord? And He has already taken your pledge
column6: if you are believers.'

text: It is He who sends down splendent revelations to His votary that he may take you out of darkness into light; for surely God is gracious and kind to you.
'What has come upon you that you do not spend in the way of God
column5: when the heritage of the heavens and the earth belongs to God? Those of you who spent before the victory and fought
column6: are not equal (to those who did not). They are higher in position than those who spent after (the victory) and fought. To each one God has made the promise of excellence
column7: for God is aware of all you do.'

text: 'Who will give a goodly loan to God which He will double for him
column5: and be for him a splendid reward?'

text: 'The day you see the believers
column5: men and women
column6: with their light advancing ahead and to the right of them
column7: (they will be told:) "There is good news for you this day
column8: of gardens with rivers flowing by where you will live for ever." This will be the great attainment.'

text: 'The day the hypocrites
column5: men and women
column6: will say to the believers: "Wait for us that we may borrow a little light from your light
column7: they will be told: Go back
column8: and look for your light." A wall shall be raised between them in which there will be a door. Within it will be benevolence and retribution without.'

text: 'They will call to them: "Were we not with you?" They will answer: "Certainly; but then you let yourselves be tempted
column5: and waited in expectation but were suspicious and were deceived by vain desires
column6: till the decree of God came to pass
column7: and the deceiver duped you in respect of God.'

text: 'So no ransom will be accepted of you on this day
column5: or of those who refused to believe. Hell will be your refuge and the only friend -- and how evil a destination!"'

text: 'Has the moment not yet come when the hearts of believers should be moved by the thought of God and the truth that has been sent down
column5: so that they should not be like those who received the Book before them but whose hearts were hardened after a lapse of time
column6: and many of them turned disobedient?'

text: Know that God enlivens the earth even after it has died. We have explained to you clearly Our signs that you may understand.
'Surely the men and women who spend in charity and give a goodly loan to God
column5: will have it doubled for them and will receive a generous reward.'

text: 'Those who believe in God and His apostles are true of word and deed; and by their Lord are considered testifiers of the truth. They have their guerdon and their light. As for those who do not believe and reject Our revelations
column5: are the people of Hell.'

text: 'Know that the life of this world is only a frolic and mummery
column5: an ornamentation
column6: boasting and bragging among yourselves
column7: and lust for multiplying wealth and children. It is like rain so pleasing to the cultivator for his vegetation which sprouts and swells
column8: and then begins to wither
column9: and you see it turn to yellow and reduced to chaff. There is severe punishment in the Hereafter
column10: but also forgiveness from God
column11: and acceptance. As for the life of this world
column12: it is no more than merchandise of vanity.'

text: 'Hasten for the forgiveness of your Lord and Paradise whose expanse is as wide as that of the heavens and the earth
column5: which has been prepared for those who believe in God and His apostles. This is the bounty of God which He bestows on whosoever He please; and the bounty of God is infinite.'

text: There is no calamity that befalls the earth or your own selves but in accordance with the law (of causation) before We make it evident. This is indeed how the law of God works inevitably.
'Lest you grieve for what you missed
column5: or rejoice at what you received. God does not love the egoist and the braggart

text: 'Who hold back what they possess and enjoin stinginess on others. Whoever turns away (from God
column5: should remember) that God is self-sufficient
column6: worthy of praise.'

text: 'We have surely sent apostles with clear signs
column5: and sent with them the Book and the Balance
column6: so that men may stand by justice; and We sent down iron which causes much distress but also has advantages for men
column7: so that God may know who helps Him and His apostles in secret. Verily God is all-powerful and all-mighty.'

text: 'We sent Noah and Abraham
column5: and gave prophethood to their progeny and the Book
column6: and some of them are well-directed
column7: but many of them are disobedient.'

text: 'Then in their train We sent Our apostles
column5: and succeeding them Jesus
column6: son of Mary
column7: and gave him the Gospel
column8: and put into the hearts of his followers compassion and kindness. But they created monasticism which had not been prescribed for them by Us except for seeking the pleasure of God; yet they did not observe it as it should have been rightly observed. So We gave those among them who were believers their reward; but most of them are disobedient.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: have fear of displeasing God
column6: and believe in His Prophet. He will give you twice as much of His bounty and place a light for you to walk in
column7: and forgive you
column8: for God is forgiving and kind;'

text: 'So that the people of the Book may know that they have not the least power over the bounty of God
column5: and that the bounty is wholly in the hands of God to give whosoever He please
column6: for God is the master of infinite bounty.'

text: 'GOD CERTAINLY HEARD what the woman who argued with you about her husband
column5: said
column6: and complained to God; and God heard your interrogation. Verily God hears all
column7: and sees everything.'

text: 'Those of you who divorce your wives by calling them ''mothers
column5: '' cannot (make them) their mothers. Their mothers are only those who gave birth to them. They surely utter what is unseemly and a lie. But God is forbearing and forgiving.'

text: 'Those who call their wives their mothers then revoke what they had said
column5: should free a slave before having physical contact (with them). This is to warn you
column6: as God is aware of what you do.'

text: 'If one does not have the means (of doing so) then he should fast for two months continuously before he has physical contact; but any one who is unable to do so
column5: should feed sixty needy persons. This (is enjoined) so that you may be faithful to God and His Apostle. These are the limits set by God. As for the unbelievers
column6: there is painful punishment for them.'

text: 'Those who oppose God will be disgraced
column5: as those before them were. We have sent down very clear signs. For unbelievers there is a shameful punishment.'

text: 'On the day when God will raise them up together
column5: He will tell them what they did. God takes account of it although they forget
column6: for all things are evident to God.'

text: 'Have you not considered that God knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? No three persons confer secretly but He is the fourth among them
column5: and no five but He is the sixth; and neither fewer nor more but He is with them wheresoever they be. And on the Day of Judgement He will announce their deeds to them. Verily God has knowledge of everything.'

text: 'Have you not considered those who were forbidden to conspire
column5: but reverted after a time to what was forbidden them
column6: and conspired evil
column7: rebellion and disobedience to the Prophet? Yet when they come to you they greet you with a greeting even God does not greet you with; and say to themselves
column8: "Why doesn''t God punish us for what we say?" Hell is sufficient for them
column9: in which they will be burnt: And what an evil consequence!'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: when you converse privately
column6: do not talk of iniquity
column7: rebellion
column8: and disobedience to the Prophet
column9: but talk of goodness and piety
column10: and fear God before whom you will be gathered.'

text: Surely scheming is the work of Satan that he may cause the faithful grief; but he cannot harm them unless God dispense. So in God should the believers place their trust.
'O you who believe
column5: when you are told to make room in the assemblies
column6: then make room; God will give you more room to spread. When you are told to rise
column7: then rise; God will raise those of you who believe
column8: and those who have knowledge
column9: in position. God is aware of what you do.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: if you confer with the Prophet in private
column6: give alms in the name of God before you go to confer. This is better for you and becoming. If you do not have the means
column7: then surely God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Are you afraid of giving alms before confering? Then
column5: if you cannot do this
column6: and God forgives you
column7: be constant in your devotional obligations and pay the due share of your wealth for the welfare of others
column8: and obey God and His Prophet. God is aware of all you do.'

text: 'Have you not seen those who have taken a people who have roused the wrath of God
column5: as friends? They are neither of you nor of them
column6: and swear to a lie
column7: and knowingly.'

text: God has reserved a severe punishment for them. Evil indeed are the things they do!
'They have made their oaths a shield
column5: and obstruct people from the way of God. There is shameful punishment for them.'

text: 'Neither their wealth nor children will avail them against God. They are the people of Hell
column5: and there will abide for ever.'

text: 'On the day that God will raise them together
column5: they will swear before Him as they swear before you
column6: and imagine they are on the right path. Is it not they who are liars?'

text: 'Satan has got the better of them. and made them forget to remember God. Indeed they belong to Satan''s faction. Will not Satan''s faction perish?'
Surely those who oppose God and His Prophet will be among the vilest.
'God has decreed: "I will prevail
column5: I and My apostles." Verily God is powerful and all-mighty.'

text: 'You will not find those who believe in God and the Day of Resurrection
column5: loving those who oppose God and His Prophet
column6: even though they be their fathers
column7: sons
column8: or brothers or their kin. God has inscribed on their hearts belief
column9: and has succoured them with His own grace
column10: and will admit them to gardens with rivers flowing by
column11: where they will abide for ever
column12: God accepting them
column14: happy in the pleasure of God. They are verily the army of God. Will not the army of God be victorious?'

text: WHATEVER IS IN the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'It is He who drove those among the people of the Book who refused to believe
column5: from their homes for the first confrontation. You did not think that they would go away
column6: and they imagined that their forts would protect them against God. But God came upon them from where they did not suspect
column7: and filled their hearts with terror
column8: so that they destroyed their homes with their own hands (or were destroyed) by the hands of believers. So take heed
column9: O men of sight!'

text: 'Had God not decreed the expulsion for them He would have punished them in this world
column5: and in the next the punishment of Hell would have been theirs.'

text: 'For they had opposed God and His Apostle; and whosoever opposes God
column5: then God is severe in retribution.'

text: 'The palm trees that you cut down or left standing intact was by God''s dispensation
column5: so that He might disgrace the transgressors.'

text: 'You did not charge with horse or camel for whatever (spoils) God gave His Apostle from them. In any case
column5: God gives authority to His Apostle over whomsoever He please. God has power over everything.'

text: 'Whatever booty God gives to His Apostle from the people of the cities
column5: is for God and His Apostle
column6: the near relations
column7: the orphans
column8: the needy and wayfarers
column9: so that it does not concentrate in the hands of those who are rich among you. Accept what the Apostle gives you
column10: and refrain from what he forbids
column11: and take heed for yourself and fear God. Surely God is severe of retribution.'

text: 'The spoils are also for the poor emigrants who were deprived of their homes and possessions and are seeking the bounty and protection of God
column5: and are helping God and His Apostle. They are the ones who are true of word and deed.'

text: 'Those who came to the city and to faith before them
column5: love those who take refuge with them
column6: and do not feel for themselves any need for what is given them
column7: and give them preference over themselves even if they are indigent. Whoever preserves himself from his own greed will be prosperous.'

text: '(And the spoils are for) those who came after them
column5: who say: "O Lord
column6: forgive us and our brothers who came to faith before us
column7: and do not put a grudge in our hearts against those who believe O Lord
column8: You are compassionate and kind."'

text: 'Have you never considered the hypocrites? They say to their brethren among the people of the Book who do not believe: "If you are driven out we shall go with you
column5: and will not listen to any one in what concerns you; and if there is war against you
column6: we shall aid you." But God is witness they are liars.'

text: 'If they are driven out
column5: they will not go with them; and if they are attacked
column6: they will not aid them. And even if they aided them
column7: they will turn their backs
column8: then they will not be helped.'

text: 'Surely they have greater fear of you in their hearts than of God
column5: because they do not understand.'

text: 'They will not fight you in a body except in fortified cities
column5: or from behind the walls. Their enmity among themselves is great. You think they are united
column6: but divided are their hearts. That is because these people are devoid of sense

text: Like those who had tasted the gravity of their actions a little before them. There is a grievous punishment for them.
'(They are) like Satan who says to man: "Do not believe;" and when he becomes a disbeliever
column5: he says: "I have nothing to do with you. I fear God
column6: the Lord of all the worlds."'

text: 'Both of them will end up in Hell
column5: where they will abide for ever. This is the punishment for the wicked.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: be fearful of God. Let each soul consider what it has sent (of good deeds) in advance for the morrow
column6: and fear God. Surely God is aware of what you do.'

text: 'And be not like those who have forgotten God
column5: so that God has made them forget themselves. Such are the reprobates.'

text: Alike are not the inmates of Hell and the residents of Paradise. The men of Paradise will be felicitous.
'If We had sent down this Qur''an to a mountain you would have seen it turn desolate and split into two for fear of God. We offer these examples to men that they may think and reflect.'
'He is God; there is no god but He
column5: the knower of the unknown and the known. He is the benevolent
column6: ever-merciful.'

text: 'He is God; there is no god but He
column5: the King
column6: the Holy
column7: the Preserver
column8: Protector
column9: Guardian
column10: the Strong
column11: the Powerful
column12: Omnipotent. Far too exalted is God for what they associate with Him.'

text: 'He is God
column5: the Creator
column6: the Maker
column7: the Fashioner. His are all the names beautiful. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth sings His praises. He is all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'O YOU WHO BELIEVE
column5: do not take My enemies and your enemies as friends. You show kindness to them
column6: but they reject the true way that has come to you. They expelled the Prophet and you
column7: for you believe in God your Lord. If you have come out to struggle in My cause having sought My acceptance
column8: (do not be) friendly with them in secret. I know what you hide and what you disclose. Whoever of you does this will have gone astray from the right path.'

text: 'If they gain ascendancy over you
column5: they will become your enemies
column6: and employ their hands and tongues with evil designs
column7: and wish that you also became disbelievers.'

text: 'Neither your blood relations nor your children will be of any avail to you on the Day of Resurrection. He will judge between you
column5: for God sees what you do.'

text: 'You have an excellent model in Abraham and those who were with him
column5: when he said to his people: "We are through with you
column6: and those you worship other than God. We reject you. Enmity and hate have come between you and us for ever
column7: unless you believe in God the One
column8: -- except for what he said to his father: I shall ask forgiveness for you
column9: but I have no power to prevail with God for you." "O Lord
column10: we place our trust in You
column11: and turn to You in penitence
column12: and to You is our returning.'

text: 'O Lord
column5: make us not an example of punishment for infidels
column6: and forgive us
column7: O Lord. You are all-mighty and all-wise."'

text: 'Those of you who have hope in God and the Last Day have certainly a good example in them. But whosoever turns away
column5: then surely God is above concern
column6: worthy of praise.'

text: 'It maybe that God will create love between you and your enemies. God is all-powerful
column5: and God is forgiving
column6: ever-merciful.'

text: 'God does not forbid you from being kind and acting justly towards those who did not fight over faith with you
column5: nor expelled you from your homes. God indeed loves those who are just.'

text: 'He only forbids you from making friends with those who fought over faith with you and banished you from your homes
column5: and aided in your exile. Whoever makes friends with them is a transgressor.'

text: 'O believers
column5: when believing women come over to you as refugees
column6: then examine them. God alone is cognisant of their faith. If you find that they are believers
column7: do not send them back to unbelievers. They are not lawful for them
column8: nor are infidels lawful for believing women. Give the unbelievers what they have spent on them. There is no sin if you marry them provided you give their dowers to them. Do not retain your (marriage) ties with unbelieving women. Ask for the return of what you have spent (on them); and the unbelievers should ask for the return of what they have spent. This is the judgement of God. He judges between you. God is all-knowing and all-wise.'

text: 'If any of your women go away to the unbelievers
column5: and you succeed in your turn (and have a chance of getting spoils)
column6: then give to those whose wives have so gone away as much as they had spent on them; but take heed and fear God in whom you believe.'

text: 'O Prophet
column5: when believing women come to you and swear on oath that they will not associate anything with God
column6: nor steal
column7: nor fornicate
column8: nor kill their children
column9: nor accuse others for what they have fabricated themselves
column10: nor disobey you in any rightful thing
column11: then you should accept their allegiance
column12: and ask forgiveness of God for them. Certainly God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: do not make friends with those who have suffered the anger of God by having become despondent of the life to come like those unbelievers who are despondent of those who are in the graves.'

text: ALL THAT IS in the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'O you who believe
column5: why do you profess what you do not practise?'

text: Saying what you do not practice is odious to God.
Surely God loves those who fight in His cause in full formations as though they were a compact wall.
'When Moses said to his people: "O my people
column5: why do you afflict me though you know that I have been sent to you by God?" But when they turned aside God made their hearts turn farther away; for God does not show the transgressors the way.'

text: 'And when Jesus
column5: son of Mary
column6: said: "O children of Israel
column7: I am sent to you by God to confirm the Torah (sent) before me
column8: and to give you good tidings of an apostle who will come after me
column9: whose name is Ahmad (the praised one)." Yet when he has come to them with clear proofs
column10: they say: "This is only magic."'

text: Who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against God when he is called to submit? God does not show the evil-doers the way.
'They want to extinguish the light of God by uttering blasphemies. But God wills to perfect His light
column5: however the unbelievers may dislike it.'

text: 'It is He who sent His Apostle with the guidance and the true way to raise it above all faiths
column5: however the idolaters may dislike it.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: may I offer you a bargain which will save you from a painful punishment?'

text: 'Come to believe in God and His Apostle
column5: and struggle in the cause of God
column6: wealth and soul. This will be good for you
column7: if you can understand.'

text: 'He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens with rivers flowing by
column5: and excellent mansions in the garden of Eden. This will be a great fulfilment.'

text: And (He will give you) what is dearest to you -- help from God and early victory. So give good tidings to those who believe.
'O you who believe
column5: be helpers of God
column6: as Jesus
column7: son of Mary
column8: had said to the disciples: "Who will help me in the way of God?" and they had answered: "We are the helpers of God." Then a section among the children of Israel believed
column9: but a section among them did not. So We helped those who believed against their enemies
column10: and they prevailed over them.'

text: 'ALL THAT IS in the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God the King
column5: the Holy
column6: Omnipotent
column7: the Wise.'

text: 'It is He who raised among the gentiles an apostle from amongst them
column5: who recites His revelations to them
column6: reforms them and teaches them the Scripture and the Law
column7: for before him they were clearly in error.'

text: And for others among them who have not joined them yet. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
'This is the bounty of God
column5: He gives whosoever He please. God is master of great bounty.'

text: 'The likeness of those who were charged with (the law of) the Torah which they did not observe
column5: is that of a donkey who carries a load of books (oblivious of what they contain). How wretched the semblance of the people who deny the words of God! God does not show an unjust people the way.'

text: 'Say: "O you Jews
column5: if you claim that you are the favourites of God apart from all men
column6: then wish for death
column7: if you speak the truth.'

text: 'But they will never wish for death because of what they had done in the past
column5: and God knows the sinners well.'

text: 'Tell them: "Death from which you run
column5: will surely come to you. You will then be sent back to Him who knows the unknown and the known
column6: who will tell you what you used to do.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: when the call to prayer is made on the day of congregation
column6: hasten to remember God
column7: putting aside your business. This is better for you if you can understand.'

text: 'And when the service of prayer is over spread out in the land
column5: and look for the bounty of God. and remember God a great deal that you may prosper.'

text: 'Yet when they see some buying and selling
column5: or some sport
column6: they go for it
column7: leaving you standing. Tell them: "What is with God is better than your sport and commerce. And God is the best of providers."'

text: 'WHEN THE HYPOCRITES come to you
column5: they say: "We affirm that you are the Apostle of God." God indeed knows you are His Apostle. God bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.'

text: They have made their oaths a shield in order to obstruct others from the way of God. It is certainly evil what they do.
'That is because they came to believe
column5: and then renounced (their faith). So their hearts were sealed; and now they do not understand.'

text: 'Pleasing seem their persons when you look at them; and when they talk
column5: you listen to their speech. Yet they are like the wooden panelling of a wall. They imagine every rebuke to be directed against them. They are the enemies
column6: beware of them. May God damn them
column7: how pervert are they!'

text: 'When you tell them: "Come
column5: let the Apostle of God ask forgiveness for you
column6:
they turn their heads, and you see them turning away with arrogance.'
TQA5194,QA5194,TLQ01,'Whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask, it is all the same; God will not forgive them. Surely God does not show a disobedient people the way.'
TQA5195,QA5195,TLQ01,They are the ones who say: Do not spend on those who are with the Apostle of God till they break away (from him)." To God belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth; but the hypocrites do not understand.

text: 'They say: "If we now go back to Madina
column5: the stronger will turn the weaker out." But power belongs to God
column6: His Apostle and the faithful
column7: though the hypocrites do not know.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: let not your wealth and children make you negligent of the remembrance of God. Those who do so will be losers.'

text: 'Spend of what We have given you before death comes to one of you
column5: when he will say: "O Lord
column6: why did you not defer my term for a while that I could give alms and be among the doers of good?"'

text: But God does not grant a soul respite once its term has come to end. And God is aware of what you do.
'ALL THAT THERE is in the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. His the sovereignty and His is the praise
column5: and He has power over everything.'

text: 'It is He who created you
column5: though one of you is an infidel and one of you a believer; yet God perceives what you do.'

text: 'He created the heavens and the earth with deliberation
column5: and gave you form
column6: and shaped you well; and to Him is your returning.'

text: 'He knows what is in the heavens and the earth
column5: and knows what you hide and what you disclose; God knows what is in the hearts.'

text: 'Has not the account of those who disbelieved before come to you
column5: who tasted the torment of their action
column6: and for whom is grievous punishment?'

text: 'This was so because their apostles came to them with clear proofs
column5: but they said: "What. Can a mortal show us the way?" And they denied and turned away; but God was unconcerned. God is all-sufficient
column6: worthy of praise.'

text: 'The unbelievers claim that they will not be raised again. Tell them: "Why not? By my Lord
column5: you will certainly be raised again
column6: and then informed of what you had done. That is how the law of God works inevitably."'

text: 'So believe in God
column5: His Apostle and the Light We have sent down. God is well aware of what you do.'

text: 'The day He will gather you together on the Day of Gathering
column5: will be the day of Judgement. He who believed and did the right
column6: will have his evil deeds expunged by God and admitted to gardens with rivers flowing by
column7: and abide there perpetually. This will be the great achievement of success.'

text: 'Those who did not believe and denied Our revelations will be inmates of Hell
column5: where they will abide for ever
column6: and how evil a journey''s end!'

text: No calamity befalls unless God dispenses. He guides the heart of whosoever believes in God; and God has knowledge of everything.
'Obey God and obey His Apostle. If you turn away
column5: the duty of the Apostle is to convey the message clearly.'

text: God: There is no god but He; and in God should believers place their trust.
'O believers
column5: some of your spouses and children are your enemies
column6: so beware of them! Yet if you forbear
column7: overlook
column8: and forgive
column9: God is indeed forgiving and kind.'

text: Your wealth and children are surely meant as trial for you: But with God is the great reward.
'So fear God as much as you can
column5: and listen and obey
column6: and spend in charity for your own good. He who is saved from his own avarice will be successful.'

text: 'If you lend a goodly loan to God
column5: He will double it for you
column6: and forgive you. God knows the worth of good deeds and is clement

text: 'The knower of the unknown and the known
column5: all-mighty and all-wise.'

text: 'O PROPHET WHEN you divorce women
column5: divorce them at their appointed period
column6: and calculate that period
column7: and fear God
column8: your Lord. Do not expel them from their houses
column9: nor should they go away themselves
column10: unless they are openly guilty of adultery. These are the limits set by God. Any one who exceeds the limits set by God sins against his own self. You never know that God may perchance lead to a new situation after this.'

text: 'When they have reached their appointed time
column5: then either keep them lawfully or let them go honourably; but have two witnesses from among you
column6: and give truthful evidence for (being acceptable to) God. This is to warn him who believes in God and the Last Day. God will furnish a way out for him who fears Him

text: And provide for him from where he does not reckon. God is sufficient for him who places his trust in Him. Certainly God fulfills His purpose. God has indeed fixed a measure of everything.
'As for your women who have lost hope of menstruation
column5: and in case you have a doubt
column6: the prescribed period (of waiting) for them is three months
column7: as also for those who have not menstruated yet. As for those who are pregnant
column8: their prescribed period is until the delivery of the child. God will make things easy for him who is mindful of God.'

text: 'This is the commandment of God that is sent down to you. God will forgive the ills of those who fear Him
column5: and increase their reward.'

text: 'House the (divorced) women where you live
column5: according to your means; but do not harass them so as to reduce them to straitened circumstances. If they are pregnant
column6: then spend on them until they give birth to the child. And if they suckle the child for you
column7: then make the due payment to them
column8: and consult each other appropriately. But if you find this difficult
column9: let some other woman suckle (the child) for her.'

text: 'Let the man of means spend according to his means
column5: and he whose means are limited
column6: should spend of what God has given him. God does not burden a soul beyond what He has given him. God will bring ease after hardship.'

text: 'How many habitations rebelled against their Lord''s command and His apostles; but We took them to severe task
column5: and punished them with the harshest punishment.'

text: So they tasted the pain of their actions; and the consequence of their deeds was ruin.
'God has prepared for them severe punishment. So
column5: you men of wisdom
column6: and those who believe
column7: take heed for yourselves and fear God. God has indeed sent down a Reminder for you

text: 'An Apostle who recites before you the explicating revelations of God that He may bring those who believe and do the right out of darkness into light. Whosoever believes in God and does the right
column5: He will admit into gardens with rivers flowing by
column6: where they will abide for ever. How excellent a provision has God made for him'

text: 'It is God who created several skies
column5: and as many earths. The commandment is sent down among them so that you may know that God has power over everything
column6: and everything is held within the knowledge of God.'

text: 'O PROPHET
column5: WHY should you forbid (yourself) what God has made lawful for you
column6: in order to please your wives? Yet God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'Surely God has sanctioned the dissolution of your vows. God is your Lord: He is all-knowing
column5: and all-wise.'

text: 'When the Prophet told one of his wives something in confidence and she disclosed it
column5: God revealed this to him. So he made some of it known to her
column6: and held back some. When
column7: however
column8: he informed her about it
column9: she asked: "Who told you this?" He said: "I was told this by the All-knowing
column10: All-Informed."'

text: 'If both of you two (women) turn to God in penitence (it would be better). Your hearts have been impaired; and if you assist one another against him
column5: then surely his helper is God
column6: and Gabriel and the righteous believers
column7: and
column8: besides them
column9: the angels are his helpers.'

text: 'In case he divorces you
column5: his Lord will give him better wives in return
column6: who will be modest
column7: true believers
column8: obedient to God
column9: repentant
column10: observant of prayer and fasting
column11: both widows and virgins.'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: save yourselves and your families from the Fire whose fuel is men and rocks
column6: over which are appointed angels stern and severe as wardens who never disobey what God commands them
column7: and do what they are commanded;'

text: '(And say:) "O you who do not believe
column5: make no excuses today. You will be requited only for what you had done."'

text: 'O you who believe
column5: turn to God truly in repentance. Perhaps your Lord may forgive your ills and admit you to gardens with rivers flowing by on the day when God will not humiliate the Prophet and those who believe with him. Their light will move in front of them and to their right
column6: and they will say: "O Lord
column7: perfect our light and forgive us. You have power over every thing."'

text: 'O Prophet
column5: fight the unbelievers and the hypocrites
column6: and be severe with them. Their abode is Hell
column7: an evil destination?'

text: 'God advances the example of Noah''s wife and the wife of Lot for those who do not believe. They were married to Our two pious devotees
column5: but they were unfaithful to them
column6: and even (the apostles) could not avail them in the least against God; and it was said to them: "Enter Hell with those (who are condemned) to enter it."'

text: 'And God presents the example of Pharaoh''s wife for those who believe
column5: when she said: "O Lord
column6: build me a house in Paradise
column7: and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds
column8: and save me from a wicked people;"'

text: 'And of Mary
column5: daughter of ''Imran
column6: who guarded her chastity
column7: so that We breathed into her a new life from Us
column8: and she believed the words of her Lord and His Books
column9: and was among the obedient.'

text: 'BLESSED BE HE who holds the (reins of) Kingship in His hand
column5: who has power over everything

text: 'Who created death and life in order to try you to see who of you are best of deed. He is all-mighty and forgiving
Who created the seven skies one above the other. Do you see any disproportion in the creations of Ar-Rahman? Turn your eyes again. Do you see any fissures?
Turn your eyes again and again. Your gaze turns back dazed and tired.
'We have adorned the lowest sky with lamps
column5: and made them missiles against the devils
column6: for whom We have prepared a torment of most intense fire.'

text: For those who believe not in their Lord there is the punishment of Hell; and what a wretched destination
'When they are cast into it
column5: they will hear it roar and raging'

text: 'As though it would burst with fury. Every time a crowd is thrown into it
column5: its wardens will ask: "Did no warner come to you?"'

text: 'And they will answer: "Surely; a warner came to us
column5: but we denied him
column6: and said: ''God did not send down any thing; you are greatly deluded
column7: in fact.''"'

text: 'They will say: "If we had listened and been wise
column5: we would not have been among the inmates of Hell."'

text: So will they confess their guilt. Deprived (of all joys) will be the inmates of Hell.
For those who fear their Lord in secret is forgiveness and a great reward.
'Whether you say a thing secretly or openly
column5: He knows the innermost secrets of your hearts.'

text: 'Can He who has created not know (His creation)? He is all-penetrating
column5: all-aware.'

text: 'It is He who made the earth subservient to you that you may travel all around it
column5: and eat of things He has provided; and to Him will be your resurrection.'

text: 'Are you so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not open up the earth to swallow you
column5: when it will begin to tremble?'

text: Or have you become so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not send a violent wind to shower stones at you? Then you will know the import of My commination!
Those before them had also denied. And how was My punishment then!
Do they not see the birds above them flying wings spread out or folded? Nothing holds them aloft but God. All things are within His purview.
What other army do you have to help you apart from Ar-Rahman? The unbelievers are surely lost in delusion.
Who is there to give you food in case He withholds His bounty? Yet they persist in rebellion and aversion.
'Will he find the way who grovels flat on his face
column5: or he who walks straight on the right path?'

text: Say: "It is He who raised you and gave you ears and eyes and hearts. How little are the thanks you offer!"
'Say: "It is He who dispersed you all over the earth
column5: and to Him you will be gathered."'

text: 'But they say: "When will this promise come to pass
column5: if what you say is true?"'

text: Say: "God alone has knowledge. My duty is only to warn you clearly."
'When they realise it has come upon them
column5: distraught will be the faces of unbelievers. They will be told: "This is what you asked for."'

text: 'Say: "Just think: If God destroys me and those with me
column5: or is benevolent to us
column6: who will then protect the unbelievers from a painful doom?"'

text: 'Say: "He is the benevolent; in Him do we believe
column5: and in Him do we place our trust. You will now realise who is in manifest error."'

text: 'Say: "Just think: If your water were to dry up in the morning who will bring you water from a fresh
column5: flowing stream?"'

text: 'NUN. I CALL to witness the pen and what they inscribe
You are not demented by the grace of your Lord.
'There is surely reward unending for you
For you are verily born of sublime nature.
'So you will see
column5: and they will realise

text: Who is distracted.
'Verily your Lord knows those who have gone astray from His path
column5: and He knows those who are guided on the way.'

text: So do not comply with those who deny:
'They only want that you should relent
column5: so that they may come to terms.'

text: 'Do not heed a contemptible swearer
'Or backbiter
column5: calumniator
column6: slanderer

text: 'Who hinders men from (doing) good
column5: the transgressor
column6: the iniquitous

text: 'Crude
column5: and above all
column6: mean and infamous

text: Simply because he possesses wealth and children.
'When you recite Our revelations to him
column5: he says: "These are fables of long ago."'

text: We shall brand him on the muzzle.
We have tried you as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to gather the fruits in the morning
But did not add: "If God may please."
'Then a calamity from your Lord fell upon it
column5: but they remained fast asleep.'

text: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
At daybreak they called to each other:
'"If you want to gather the fruits
column5: let us go early to the plantation."'

text: 'So they departed
column5: talking in low voices:'

text: Let no needy person come to you within it today.
They left early in the morning bent on this purpose.
When they saw (and did not recognise it) they said: "Surely we have lost the way.
No. In fact we have been deprived of it."
'One who was temperate among them
column5: said: "Did I not say: ''Why don''t you priase God?''"'

text: '"Glory to our Lord
column5: they said; we were really in the wrong.'

text: 'Then they started blaming one another
'Saying: "Alas the woe
column5: we were iniquitous.'

text: Maybe our Lord will give us better than this. We turn to our Lord in supplication."
'Such is Our chastisement; and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater
column5: if only they knew!'

text: For those who fear God there are pleasure gardens with their Lord.
Should We treat those who submit and obey in the same way as those who are culpable?
What has come upon you that you judge in such a wise?
Or have you a Book in which you read
That you can surely have whatever you choose?
'Or have you taken a binding promise from Us which would hold till the Day of Judgement
column5: that you will get whatever you demand?'

text: Ask them: "Which of you is able to vouch for this?"
'Or have they any partners? Let them bring their partners then
column5: if what they say is true.'

text: 'On the day the great calamity befalls
column5: and they are called to bow in homage
column6: they will not be able to do so.'

text: 'Lowered will be their eyes
column5: disgrace overwhelming them. They had indeed been called to bow in homage when they were free of blame.'

text: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me. We shall lead them step by step to (ruin) in a way they will not know.
Yet I will give them respite: Surely My plan is compact.
Do you ask for any compensation from them that they are burdened with want?
Or do they have knowledge of the unknown which they copy down?
'So wait with patience for the judgement of your Lord
column5: and do not be like (onah) of the fish who called (to his Lord) when he was choked with anger.'

text: Had it not been for a favour from his Lord he would have been cast blame-worthy on a barren plain.
Then his Lord chose him and placed him among the upright.
'But the unbelievers would like to stare you out of balance when they hear the warning
column5: and say: "Surely he is possessed;"'

text: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
THE CONCRETE REALITY.
What is the concrete reality?
What do you comprehend by the concrete reality?
'The Thamud and ''Ad denied the consequential calamity.'
So destroyed were the Thamud by a storm of thunder and lightning;
'And the ''Ad were destroyed by the furious cold blast of roaring wind'
Which He sent to assail them for seven nights and eight days running. You should have seen the people prostrate like the decayed trunks of date-palm trees.
Do you see any trace of them?
'Then came the Pharaoh
column5: and those before him whose habitations were overthrown while they were committing crimes.'

text: When they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord He seized them with an overwhelming punishment.
'When the water rose in flood
column5: We bore you in the ark

text: 'In order to make it a warning for you
column5: and that the ear retentive may preserve it.'

text: 'When the single blast is sounded on the trumpet
'And the earth and mountains heaved and crushed to powder with one levelling blow
On that Day will come what is to come.
The sky will cleave asunder on that day and fall to pieces.
'On its fringes will be angels
column5: eight of them
column6: bearing their Lord''s throne aloft.'

text: 'You will then be set before Him
column5: and not one of you will remain unexposed.'

text: 'He who is given his ledger in his right hand
column5: will say: "Here
column6: read my ledger.'

text: 'I was certain I''ll be given my account."'
So he shall have an agreeable life
In high empyrean
'With fruits hanging low within reach
(And told:) "Eat and drink to your fill as reward for (good) deeds you had done in days of yore."
'But whosoever gets his ledger in his left hand
column5: will say: "Would that I were never given my ledger

text: And not known my account!
I wish death had put an end to me.
Of no use was even my wealth.
Vanished has my power from me."
'"Seize him and manacle him
Then cast him to be burnt in Hell;
And string him to a chain seventy cubits long.
'He did not believe in God the supreme
Nor urged others to feed the poor.
'That is why he has no friend today
Nor food other than suppuration (filth)
Which none but the hellish eat."
'So
column5: I call to witness what you see'

text: 'And what you do not see
'That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger
And not the word of a poet. How little is it that you believe!
Nor is it the word of a soothsayer. Little is it that you reflect!
It has been sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.
'Had he attributed falsely any words to Us
'We would have seized him by his right hand
'Then cut off his aorta
And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).
It is really a reminder for those who fear God and follow the straight path.
We certainly know that some among you do deny it.
It is surely the nemesis of unbelievers.
'And He
column5: He is indeed the ultimate Reality.'

text: 'So glorify your Lord
column5: the most supreme.'

text: AN INQUIRER ASKED for the affliction that is to come
Upon the infidels -- which none would be able to repel --
'From God
column5: the Lord of the steps (of progression)

text: 'To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend
column5: whose length is fifty thousand years.'

text: So persevere with becoming patience.
'They surely take it to be far away
But We see it very near.
'The day the sky becomes like molten brass
'The mountains like the tufts of (carded) wool
And no friend inquires after friend
'Though within sight of one another. The sinner would like to ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his sons
'His wife and his brother
'And his family who had stood by him
'And all those who are on the earth
column5: to save himself.'

text: But never. It is pure white flame
That would skin the scalp.
'It will summon whoever turns his back and flees
Who amasses and then hoards.
Surely man is greedy by nature.
If evil befalls him he is perturbed;
'If good comes to him he holds back his hand
'Except those who closely follow (the Book of God)
'Who persevere in devotion
In whose wealth a due share is included
'For the needy and those dispossessed
'And those who believe in the Day of Judgement
'And those who fear the punishment of their Lord
'Surely no one can be secure from the punishment of his Lord
And those who guard their sex except from their wives and women slaves of old
'Are free of blame
But those who seek more than this will be transgressors;
'And those who fulfil their trusts and covenants
'Who uphold their testimonies
And those who are mindful of their moral obligations.
They will live in gardens with honour.
What is the matter with unbelievers that they stare at you with fixed gazes and hasten towards you
'In crowds
column5: right and left?'

text: Does every one of them wish to enter the garden of tranquility?
Never so. We have created them from what they know.
So I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests that We are certainly able
To bring better people than they in their place; and they will not be able to thwart Us.
'So leave them to their vain disputes and amusement till they meet their day (of reckoning) promised them
'The day when they will come out of their graves in all haste as though rushing to their altars
'Eyes lowered
column5: shame attending. That is the day they have been promised!'

text: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.
'He said: "O my people
column5: I warn you clearly'

text: 'That you should worship God and fear Him
column5: and follow me'

text: 'That He may forgive some of your sins and prolong your term till an appointed time. Surely when God''s appointed time is come it will not be put off
column5: if only you knew!'

text: 'He said: "O Lord
column5: I called my people night and day

text: 'But the more I called
column5: they only ran the farther away.'

text: 'And every time I called them that You may forgive them
column5: they thrust their fingers into their ears
column6: and covered themselves with their garments
column7: and became wayward
column8: and behaved with downright insolence.'

text: 'Then I called them loudly and more openly
'And declared to them in public and in private
'And I told them: ''Ask your Lord to forgive you. He is verily forgiving.'
'He will send you abundant rain from the sky
'And will give you increase of wealth and sons
column5: and give you gardens and springs of water.'

text: 'What has come upon you that you do not fear the majesty of God
Knowing that He has created you by various stages?
'Do you not see how God has fashioned seven skies one above the other
'And has placed the moon therein
column5: an illumination
column6: and has placed the sun
column7: a lighted lamp?'

text: God produced you from the earth like a vegetable growth;
'He will then return you back to it
column5: and bring you out again.'

text: 'God has made the earth for you a spreading
'So that you may walk upon its spacious paths.'''
'But they did not listen to me
column5: Noah said, and followed him whose wealth and children only added to his ruin.'

text: 'And they contrived a plot of great magnitude
'And said: ''Do not abandon your gods
column5: and do not abandon Wadda or Suwa''
column6: or Yaghuth
column7: Ya''uq or Nasr.'''

text: And they misled many. So do not give the evil-doers increase but in error.
'They were drowned because of their habitual sinfulness
column5: and sent to Hell
column6: and did not find any helper other than God.'

text: 'Noah said: "O Lord
column5: do not leave a single habitation of unbelievers on the earth.'

text: 'If you leave them
column5: they will lead Your creatures astray
column6: and beget but iniquitous and ungrateful offspring.'

text: 'O Lord
column5: forgive me
column6: my parents
column7: and any one who enters my house as a believer
column8: and all believing men and women
column9: and do not give the evil-doers increase save in ruin.'

text: 'SAY: "I HAVE been informed that a number of jinns had listened; then said: ''We have heard the wondrous Qur''an
'Which guides to the right path; and we have come to believe in it
column5: and will not associate any one with our Lord.'

text: Exalted is the glory of our Lord; He has neither wife nor son.
Certainly the foolish among us say preposterous things of God.
'We had in fact thought that men and jinns would never speak a lie about God
'But some men used to seek refuge with some jinns
column5: and this increased their waywardness;'

text: 'So they began to think
column5: even as you do
column6: that God would not resurrect any one.'

text: 'We sought to pry into the secrets of the heavens
column5: but found it full of fierce guards and shooting flames.'

text: We sat in observatories to listen; but any one who listened found a shooting star in wait for him.
'We do not know if this means ill for the dwellers of the earth
column5: or their Lord wishes guidance for them.'

text: For some of us are upright and some otherwise: Surely we follow different ways.
'We realised that we could not weaken the power of God on earth
column5: nor outpace Him by running away.'

text: So when we heard the guidance we believed in it; and he who believes in his Lord will neither fear loss nor force.
'Some of us have come to submission
column5: and some of us are iniquitous.''" Those who have submitted have taken the right course;'

text: But those who are iniquitous will be fuel for Hell.
(Say): "If they keep to the right path We shall give them water in abundance to drink
'In order to try them through it. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord
column5: will be given increasing torment by Him."'

text: All places of worship are for God; so do not invoke any one with God.
When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
Say: "I call on my Lord alone and I do not associate any one with Him."
Say: "Neither is your loss within my power nor bringing you to guidance."
'Say: "No one can save me from God
column5: nor can I find a place of refuge apart from Him

text: 'Unless I convey from God and deliver His message." For those who disobey God and His Apostle is the fire of Hell
column5: where they will abide for ever;'

text: 'Until they see what they are promised
column5: when they will understand who is weaker in aid and poorer in numbers.'

text: 'Say: "I do not know if what is promised you is near
column5: or if my Lord prolongs its term.'

text: 'He is the knower of the Unknown
column5: and He does not divulge His secret to any one'

text: 'Other than an apostle He has chosen
column5: when He makes a sentinel walk in front of him and a sentinel behind

text: 'So that He may know if they have delivered their Lord''s messages. He comprehends all that has been given them
column5: and keeps count of everything.'

text: 'O YOU ENWRAPPED in the cloak (of Prophethood)
'Keep watch all the night except some
A half of it or a little less
'Or a little more
column5: and recite the Qur''an slowly and distinctly.'

text: We shall soon entrust to you a message heavy (with solemnity).
Surely in the watches of the night the soul is most receptive and words more telling.
Indeed during the day you have a long schedule of occupations.
'But recite the name of your Lord withdrawing yourself from everything
column5: devoting yourself exclusively to Him.'

text: He is the Lord of the East and the West. There is no god but He. So take Him alone as your protector.
'Bear with patience what they say
column5: and gracefully come away from them.'

text: 'Leave those to Me who deny
column5: the lovers of ease and comfort; and bear with them for a while.'

text: 'Verily We shall have fetters with Us
column5: and a roaring furnace

text: 'And food that will stick in the throat
column5: and painful torment'

text: 'On the day the earth and mountains will rock violently
column5: and the mountains turn to a heap of poured-out sand.'

text: 'We have sent an Apostle to you as a witness against you
column5: as We had sent an apostle to the Pharaoh.'

text: But the Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle; so We seized him with a grievous punishment.
'How then
column5: if you disbelieve
column6: will you preserve yourselves on the day which will even turn the children hoary?'

text: The heavens itself will be rent asunder (on that day). His promise is bound to be fulfilled.
Verily this is a reminder. So let him who desires take the way to his Lord.
'Your Lord surely knows that you are occupied with your devotions for nearly two-thirds of the night
column5: or half the night
column6: or one-third of it
column7: as do many others with you. Yet God prescribes the measure of night and day. He knows you cannot calculate it
column8: and so turns to you in benevolence. So recite as much of the Qur''an as you can easily. He knows some among you will be sick
column9: and some will be travelling over the earth in search of the bounty of God
column10: and some fighting in the way of God. So read as much from it as you can easily
column11: and be firm in devotion
column12: pay the zakat
column13: and lend a goodly loan to God. And what you send for yourself of the good
column14: you will find it with God better and greater in reward. So ask for God''s forgiveness. Indeed God is forgiving and kind.'

text: 'O YOU ENFOLDED in your mantle (of reform)
'Arise and warn
'Glorify your Lord
'Purify your inner self
And banish all trepidation.
'Do not bestow favours in expectation of return
And persevere in the way of your Lord.
For when the trumpet blows

But he could not scale the steep ascent.
How will you comprehend what the Steep ascent is? --
'To free a neck (from the burden of debt or slavery)
Or to feed in times of famine
'The orphan near in relationship
Or the poor in distress;
'And to be of those who believe
column5: and urge upon one another to persevere
column6: and urge upon each other to be kind.'

text: They are the people of the right hand (and will succeed).
But those who deny Our revelations are the people of the left hand:
The Fire will vault them over.
'I CALL TO witness the sun and his early morning splendour
'And the moon as she follows in his wake
'The day when it reveals his radiance
'The night when it covers him over
'The heavens and its architecture
'The earth and its spreading out
The soul and how it was integrated
And given the faculty of knowing what is disruptive and what is intrinsic to it.
'He who nourishes it will surely be successful
And he who confines it will surely come to grief.
The Thamud denied (the truth) in their perverseness
'When among them the great wretch arose
'And the apostle of God had to tell them: "This is God''s she-camel
column5: let her drink."'

text: 'But they called him a liar and hamstrung her. So God obliterated them for their crime
column5: and (destroyed) all of them alike.'

text: He does not fear the consequence.
'I CALL THE night to witness when it covers over
'And the day when it shines in all its glory
'And Him who created the male and female
That your endeavour is for different ends.
'Yet he who gives to others and has fear
'And affirms goodness
We shall ease the way of fortune for him.
'But he who does not give and is unconcerned
'And rejects goodness
'For him We shall ease the way of adversity
And his riches will not avail him when he falls headlong (into the Abyss).
'It is indeed for Us to show the way
And to Us belong the End and the Beginning.
'So
column5: I warn you of the blazing Fire.'

text: 'No one will burn in it but the most wretched
Who denied (the truth) and turned away.
But save him who fears
'And gives of his wealth that he may grow in virtue
'And is under no one''s obligation to return his favour
'Other than seeking the glory of his Lord
column5: most high

text: Will surely be gratified.
'I CALL TO witness the early hours of morning
'And the night when dark and still
'Your Lord has neither left you
column5: nor despises you.'

text: What is to come is better for you than what has gone before;
'For your Lord will certainly give you
column5: and you will be content.'

text: Did He not find you an orphan and take care of you?
'Did He not find you perplexed
column5: and show you the way?'

text: Did He not find you poor and enrich you?
'So do not oppress the orphan
'And do not drive the beggar away
And keep recounting the favours of your Lord.
HAVE WE NOT opened up your breast
And removed your burden
'Which had left you devoid of hope
And exalted your fame?
Surely with hardship there is ease.
With hardship indeed there is ease.
'So when you are free work diligently
And turn to your Lord with all your love.
'I CALL TO witness the Fig and the Olive
'The Mount Sinai
'And this Soil Secure
'That We created man of finest possibilities
'Then brought him down to the lowest of the low
'Except those who believe and do the right
column5: for whom there is reward undiminished.'

text: Who should then make you deny the Judgement after this?
Is not God the most equitable of all judges?
'READ IN THE name of your Lord who created
Created man from an embryo;
'Read
column5: for your Lord is most beneficent

text: 'Who taught by the pen
Taught man what he did not know.
'And yet
column5: but yet man is rebellious

text: For he thinks he is sufficient in himself.
Surely your returning is to your Lord.
Have you seen him who restrains
A votary when he turns to his devotions?
'Have you thought
column5: if he had been on guidance'

text: 'Or had enjoined piety
column5: (it would have been better)?'

text: 'Have you thought that if he denies and turns away
Does he not know that God sees?
'And yet indeed if he does not desist We shall drag him by the forelock
'By the lying
column5: the sinful forelock.'

text: 'So let him call his associates
We shall call the guards of Hell.
'Beware! Do not obey him
column5: but bow in adoration and draw near (to your Lord).'

text: TRULY WE REVEALED it on the Night of Determination.
How will you know what the Night of Determination is?
Better is the Night of Determination than a thousand months.
'On (this night) the angels and grace descend by the dispensation of their Lord
column5: for settling all affairs.'

text: It is peace till the dawning of the day.
'THOSE AMONG THE people of the Book who disbelieve
column5: and the idolaters
column6: would not have been freed (from false beliefs) until the clear proof came to them --'

text: 'An Apostle from God
column5: reading out hallowed pages'

text: Containing firm decrees.
The people of the Book were not divided among themselves till after the clear proof had come to them.
'They were commanded only to serve God with all-exclusive faith in Him
column5: to be upright
column6: and to fulfil their devotional obligations
column7: and to give zakat; for this is the even way.'

text: 'Surely the unbelievers among the people of the Book and the idolaters
column5: will abide in the fire of Hell. They are the worst of creatures.'

text: 'But those who believe and do the right are surely the best of created beings
'Whose reward is with their Lord -- gardens of Eden with rivers flowing by
column5: where they will abide for ever
column6: God pleased with their service
column7: they with obedience to Him. This (awaits) him who stands in awe of his Lord.'

text: 'WHEN THE WORLD is shaken up by its cataclysm
'And the earth throws out its burdens
And man enquires: "What has come over it?"
'That day it will narrate its annals
For your Lord will have commanded it.
That day people will proceed separately to be shown their deeds.
'Whosoever has done even an atom''s weight of good will behold it;'
'And whosoever has done even an atom''s weight of evil will behold that.'
'I CALL TO witness the chargers
column5: snorting
column6: rushing to battle before the others

text: 'Then those striking sparks of fire
Then those charging in the morning
'Raising clouds of dust
'Penetrating deep into the armies
That man is ungrateful to his Lord
'And is himself witness to it
And is intractable in his love of worldly goods.
Does he not know when the contents of the graves are laid bare
'And the secrets of the hearts exposed
Surely their Lord will be aware of their (deeds).
THE STARTLING CALAMITY.
What is the startling calamity?
How will you comprehend what the startling calamity is? --
'A Day on which human beings would be like so many scattered moths
The mountains like the tufts of carded wool.
Then he whose deeds shall weigh heavier in the scale
Will have a tranquil life;
But he whose deeds are lighter in the balance
Will have the Abyss for abode.
How will you comprehend what that is?
It is the scorching fire.
THE AVARICE OF plenitude keeps you occupied
Till you reach the grave.
But you will come to know soon; --
Indeed you will come to know soon.
And yet if you knew with positive knowledge
You have indeed to behold Hell;
Then you will see it with the eye of certainty.
Then on that day you will surely be asked about the verity of pleasures.
TIME AND AGE are witness
'Man is certainly loss
'Except those who believe
column5: and do good and enjoin truth on one another
column6: and enjoin one another to bear with fortitude (the trials that befall).'

text: 'WOE TO EVERY slanderer
column5: back-biter

text: Who amasses wealth and hordes it.
Does he think his wealth will abide for ever with him?
By no means. He will be thrown into Hutama.
How will you comprehend what Hutama is?
It is the fire kindled by God
Which penetrates the hearts
(And) vaults them over
In extending columns.
HAVE YOU NOT seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?
'Did He not make their plan go wrong
'And sent hordes of chargers flying against them
'(While) you were pelting them with stones of porphyritic lava
And turned them into pastured fields of corn?
'SINCE THE QURAISH have been united
'United to fit out caravans winter and summer
'Let them worship the Lord of this House
Who provided them against destitution and gave them security against fear.
HAVE YOU SEEN him who denies the Day of Judgement?
'It is he who pushes the orphan away
And does not induce others to feed the needy.
Woe to those who pray
'But who are oblivious of their moral duties
Who dissimulate
And withhold things of common use (from others).
HAVE SURELY given you pre-eminence (in numbers and following);
So serve your Lord with full dedication and sacrifice.
It is surely your opponents whose line will come to end.
'SAY: "O YOU unbelievers
'I do not worship what you worship
'Nor do you worship who I worship
'Nor will I worship what you worship
Nor will you worship who I worship:
'To you your way
column5: to me my way'

text: 'WHEN THE HELP of God arrives and victory
'And you see men enter God''s discipline horde on horde
Then glorify your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Verily He is relenting.
'DESTROYED WILL BE the hands of Abu Lahab
column5: and he himself will perish.'

text: 'Of no avail shall be his wealth
column5: nor what he has acquired.'

text: 'He will be roasted in the fire
'And his wife
column5: the portress of fire wood

text: Will have a strap of fibre rope around her neck.
'SAY: "HE IS God the one the most unique
God the immanently indispensable.
'He has begotten no one
column5: and is begotten of none.'

text: There is no one comparable to Him."
SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of rising day
'From the evil of what He has created
'And the evil of evening darkness when it overspreads
'From the evil of sorceresses who blow incantations on knots
From the evil of the envier when he envies.
'SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of men
'The King of men
'The God of men
'From the evil of him who breathes temptations into the minds of men
Who suggests evil thoughts to the hearts of men --
From among the jinns and men.
